7ORtXvn_fC3_MdOIyHagcg.review_text: We came here for our 2nd anniversary and had a great experience! The waiter was knowledgeable and friendly and slightly gay, though it is SF so this is to be expected. The garlic noodles and calamari were excellent appetizers and the crab stuffed chicken breast was perfect.   The restaurant itself has really dim lights, which adds to the mystique atmosphere of the place. We got a table that looked right out to the bay, so it was really cool to see ships passing by at night.   I think this restaurant really wins it for service - the waiters were all really friendly and towards the end of our meal, the manager came to our table to ask us how our meal was. Overall it was a great experience and we would definitely come back again.  Also, since it was our anniversary, they served us a complimentary coconut ice cream with a candle on top at the end of our meal- definitely the cherry on top.

y0zSd8SH4TJlDafV6UnGIA.review_text: This is a really interesting place to go. The food are "hella" good, but the prices are insane. I'm pretty sure you can go somewhere else for Asian typed of food. That's why I only go there for happy hours it's little cheaper and you get to taste some of their food. Go there if you are a baller status. I heard the owner drives a lambo. Nice! But I ain't hatin. 4 stars for the food, not the price.  The parking isn't so bad you can easily find 2 hours parking space.  The summer times is a little bit harder.

7jiVn2-rZ1DsFdWSMYwRbw.review_text: I hear the po' boys are awesome, but I haven't had them.  I've had their burger twice, at the gushing recommendation of others.  Frankly?  Serving a burger on ciabatta is bad juju, all around.  Only a food 'tard  wants to combine bland, dry, dusty bread meant for cold cuts with a juicy burger.  When did ciabatta become so de rigeur, anyway?  Take it away, garcon!  The meat is good, but it's not as good as the meat across the street at Fog City Diner.  However, this restaurant doesn't charge the egregious 3% extra per bill for employee health insurance.

8Q0xnxT-KrvCl2pQF1qsFQ.review_text: Heard that DJ Apollo spins here every first Saturday of the month so i decided to roll over to this spot for a look-see.  The event is labeled "Love Movement," and being its at pier 33, very easy to find street parking in the cuts across from butterfly.  Got here b4 1130 so only paid 5 bills- yippee!  The area does feel like a hangar and the design is contemporary with hints of fufu-ness, but overall quite spiffy.  2 accessible bars on both sides and the dancefloor in ze middle.  Being this joint is taken over on this night by some local hip-hop show- distortion2static, the crowd was quite yay-area-ish, ghetto, and super hyphy.  I was thinking...how will Apollo- who i always knew as just a sick ass DJ that relishes in reggae-dancehall and 90s hip-hop going to stir up this crowd?  Well, i guess that i don't know shit cause tho i did get to wreck to some nas, groove theory, digable planets, and biggie smalls 4 a bit--the rest of the evening was all about hollering, walk'n it out  and flyin sky-high...i put on my coat and went home to sleep this memory off.

FDlUctt7VKY-v3mNIPiATw.review_text: I actually tried this place more than one year ago, when I was still an "innocent" tourist, but I still remember the marvellous wild mushroom cappuccino that struck both my eyes and my palate. The looks, the consistency, the colour, the foamy top, everything was reminding of a true cappuccino and it tasted wonderfully. Even my gf, who normally doesn't have a culinary memory as strong as mine. still remembers it ... really a good sign, believe me!  The entree was grilled tuna and it was also great but not as memorable as the appetizer.   The ambiance is truly vibrant and the place is suitable for any occasion.

zRU7MOe-x0bC9TNc6aQpGA.review_text: Now given the location you might not expect much, as many places in the area rely on their prime location to attract customers and not worry about repeat business.  However this place seems to care about people returning.  The service was quite good.  The food was suprisingly good.  They have added some minor twists to some normally typical dishes to the point of being interesting and not appearing to just be trying too hard to be different.  I can respect that.  The view of the bay didn't hurt anything either.  All in all a very worthy spot to have a drink and meal.  Did I mention that they have a full bar?  Well they do.  Drink up!

g48G-KZ-o2UYJs-fHBzDeg.review_text: I love this place. The atmosphere is chill, and at night, can be very romantic. There's a great view of the Bay, and when cruise ships are in town, you can see it right outside the window. I've been here many times, and the food has never disappointed me. The Kahlua pig with butter lettuce cups are sooo delicious! And this is coming from someone who rarely eats pork. The chocolate tort with coffee ice cream keeps me coming back. No matter how full you are, you can always make room for it!  The Chef often walks around to check on guests. He's really nice.  The staff is friendly and the drinks are strong (which is definitely a plus)!  The only thing that isn't so great about coming here is the parking. Other than that, I highly recommend it!

UZDRIAdThJzJwW_nzDFyBw.review_text: Great ambiance ! Waterfront table and great appetizers ! Pork lettuce wraps and Duck spring rolls first - was too full to eat an Entree but my "alter ego" had the Bleu cheese  steak and tempura rolls. Delicious!  The tempura roll was very large - could have been smaller and I love mine with soy and wasabi - layer under the roll was bland-should have asked for soy ! I did have the "Minestroe" soup - which was reall ya cioppino type - seafood in a broth -very good but not what I thought the menu descirbed ! No room for dessert but would definitey go back, especially if only for all the appetizers ! The whole fish looked truly amazing and the calmari looked superb !

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: Butterfly is a perfect place to go for dinner during daylight savings. Since its really the bay view and atmosphere that is half the experience, I suggest going while its still a little light out.   Met some friends that were visiting from out of town for dinner. They were running late and they said to wait at the bar they could hold our primo table for a bit (even though they were busy!). At that point it was time to order a cocktail and the honey bourbon drink is the bomb. At $8 they are worth every penny.   We were sat at one of the booths toward the back corners of the restaurant, which are my favorite spots. We ordered about 6 appetizers to share for our table of 4 and it was plenty of food. The highlights were the Kahlua Pig Lettuce Cups and the Ahi Poke Tartar. I love the salmon eggs on top. I was not a huge fan of the Dumplings, the shrimp was flavorless and tasted like it was soaked in water. That was one big misstep.   This restaurant is good for groups with its large tables and perfect for a nice dinner out. Price was about $150 for 4 people including drinks.

sBjvyzr80lp-sxClMqERdQ.review_text: After our Alcatraz tour, my sisters & I stepped into Butterfly for a drink and dessert just to step out of the cold & to pass the time before our car came to pick us up. Little did we know that we were in for a delightful surprise! We loved the ambiance, the friendly staff and the beautiful view of the waterfront. We ordered Bailey's coffees and the banana bread pudding, upon the waiter's suggestion. It was HEAVEN! Although the most fabulous part of our evening was our waiter, Porter. I cannot sing his praises enough! He was truly delightful and the best waiter we've encountered in awhile. He made our evening special and the most enjoyable one yet!

xdhWF6PgngAXER8VwjEtdw.review_text: Came back to Butterfly recently with my man and we were pretty disappointed with our dinner. Our main entree was the Fried Whole Fish which we ordered based on our server's recommendation. It came out artfully presented, but as soon as I stuck my fork in it, I knew it was over-cooked. We had to literally tear the meat off the bone. What a travesty - fish should never taste so dry and chewy! We also chose it because the menu said it would come with Chinese sausage and chow fun noodles. It doesn't count when you put 2 tiny diced pieces of sausage and 3 pieces of noodles at the bottom of the dish. Bu hao!  In addition, when a manager walks around in sweatpants and a baseball cap (seating and serving clientele), it doesn't help their ratings.  The two stars were actually for the bartender and the drinks he poured for us!

UrNZX_VNtxdBa4NczA_zAw.review_text: I am writing this review for my friend. I had given her a voucher for Butterfly and she couldn't have been more pleased with her experienced.   She loved the food. She also mentioned how great the staff was. Even the chef came out to greet her and her boyfriend. Thank you for taking good care of my friend!!!

SIpBqzGhRM7T5cDFiuIryg.review_text: I came here for a business meeting.  The staff, views and food are great. The owner/chef Robert Lam made us a special kobe beef hamburger and a noodle/peanut sauce dish.  The burger was one of the best that I ever had.  Beef was tender and juicy.  Noodles were very tasty...Asian fusion as its best.  Finally, an Asian themed restaurant with an Asian chef/owner.  A great meal.....a great view......

tfTw2QKOa053xcPvCcE6mQ.review_text: I was a little bit scheptical about this place at first.  I had driven past it a million times and had always put it on my list of places to go.  Dine about town just started this weekend and I thought it would be a great time to try this place.  4 of us went and we loved it.  There was a decent crowd which was unexpected due to it being a Sunday and for the location.  The food was amazing.  The duck spring rolls and the hangar steak were to die for.  The service was great and the ambiance and music superb.  The onlly reason I give this place 4 stars is due to the drinks being so pricey.  Martinis were $10.00 which is to be expected but the size of the glass left you wanting and unfortunately ordering more...lots more to the point where drinks cost alot more than all the food you ordered.  I would definately recommend this place to anyone looking for really good tasting food though....

txOz8PIJbMlEdl5CLnpsXA.review_text: The appetizers were good and their duck plate was superb... Altho I really can't justify the drinks... Either I'm an alcoholic or there's no alcohol in their drinks... The ambiance is nice but the rear window to the waters is that of the old pier with algae and bird droppings... Top it off there's a view of a homeless guy to the right changing?

3K7pOd_8rGOr8A3zjDQlJw.review_text: The food here is pretty good, but not a 4 or 5 star by SF standards. I've been to Butterfly a couple of times, once with a big group and a lot of drinks, which was a blast, and once with my parents after coming back from a wedding at Corbel Winery. The lunch was forgettable, but the view was amazing.  The dinner with all my peeps was a blast, and the food was pretty good, but again, that could have been the Dirty Martinis tasting! I would probably come back again, but only for pre-dinner drinks or lunch.  You what I have discovered in most places I visit, that the restaurants with amazing ocean views, are usually either average, sub-par, or down right horrible (see my review for the Poseidon)

NkLi4kRljasqiXOfjBS3FA.review_text: C'mon folks!  $21 for dinner featuring  three full, delicious courses and a water view and competent wait staff in San Francisco!   And, as a bonus, it is quiet enough for normal conversation!!  Seriously, I think some us have become spoiled brats to whine about the QUALITY of a harbor view while dining on eminently decent fare- for twenty-one dollars. The Kahlua pork cups were succulant and more than ample, the NY Steak had a killer sauce, the sizzling snapper was as tasty as advertized and the Lychee ice was absolutely the nicest light but flavorful end-note. We had the tuna sashimi app as well which was wonderful but there was more than enough food in the 3 courses. Only negative is that the bartender is tone deaf on mixed bevs. Two tries and both drinks lacked any sweetness at all- too darn tart and lean.  Otherwise- get on over while they have this deal going and get some good grub in a lovely venue with friendly service.  For 2-1 bucks, only!

6yLyZt24CT1nJ6c6l_arzw.review_text: Love this place. I work near Pier 39 and I am trying out the restaurants nearby. This one is GREAT. I'm vegetarian and love their fusion dishes.   Once I get through some of the other places, I'll go back frequently and definitely take out of town guests there. You might want to make reservations.  Oh, and they give a small dish of edemame as an appetizer while you wait.

YjvieweaEYgdpKbdNGdynw.review_text: I try to pay a visit to this fine establishment every time I'm in the Bay area. Situated at Pier 33 of the Embarcadero, Butterfly offers nouveau-avante-garde (I made that up) fusion cuisine that exhibits subtle Vietnamese nuances. Me likes.  I've had the luxury of trying nearly everything on the menu here so I urge you to be like sheep and follow my instructions on what to order.  You're gonna want to start off with the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups which is fun, playful and delicious. Interactive dishes are always a suitable icebreaker when taking body shots of hennesey isn't an option. Do not however forget to order the Garlic Seared Clams & Mussels. I swear even the sea-creatures prefer to be dead in this broth than alive in the ocean. Go ahead and suck up whatever remaining broth you have with a straw, everyone will understand.  Moving right along, I always order the cowboy ribeye which is sufficient eating for two. I don't know if they still have this on the menu but insist on it vehemently and you will not be disappointed.  The cut is magnificent and Butterfly consistently delivers a tender, perfectly cooked steak. There's something absolutely primal about it and it makes me happy that I'm a meatatarian.  Pair this with a hearty beer like a Chimay or a full bodied red like a Napa cab and rejoice that you are in the land of the living.  I don't pretend to know a lot about food but I know what makes my toes curl with sheer bliss. The view, the food and the service here are all really swell and I've had many happy visits to this little gem on the Embarcadero.

dfhNN5XkixDOEwRSFVlDyg.review_text: Five stars are primarily because the service was above excellent!  Porter, our server, was so nice that we kept saying how great he was, even before we got our main entrees. We finally asked his name, and were all in agreement that the service makes the dining experience so much better.   Now for the food.  Porter explained everything to us, from the differences between the fresh fish, to the suggestions he personally had for us. We ended up ordering four different appetizers:  calamari, duck confit rolls, kailua lettuce wraps, and salmon carpaccio chips.  They were all great. For main courses, we went with Porter's suggestions, and ordered the Cowboy steak, the Peking Duck and the fish of the day.  We asked if ordering family style was okay, and he said that it would be perfect with those dishes. He was right!  It was the perfect amount for the four of us.   Now, dessert...yum!  Again, we asked Porter his opinion, and he steered us towards the chocolate cookie, and offered us an extra scoop of ice cream since we were sharing.  Also, the bread pudding was superb.  More banana than bread, so it was especially creamy and yummy.   At most restaurants, after you pay the bill, the service is over. Not here!  After we paid the bill, Porter kept checking on us to refill our coffees and hot water for our teas.  That was a nice gesture and so unexpected!    Our dining experience here was definitely made better than normal due to the excellent service.

nwKsR5_epCypSzGPsMn0HA.review_text: Came here for my Company Christmas Party.....The restaurant was closed for public and opened just for us that afternoon. The decor was nice with a beautiful view. I think it is a great place for a special occasion because of its very romantic setting.   Since this was a company party, we had unlimited appetizers and open bar (Yeah!). We could choose from salad or soup, one out of three main dishes and one out of three desserts.  For drinks, I did not have the cocktails, all I drank were shots...haha....The shots were OK, not very strong.   For appetizers,   1. Mushroom pizza - nothing memorable. Just normal pizza and cut it into small triangle pieces   2. Duck Confit Spring Rolls - I don't like this one. Too dry inside.   3. Tuna Tartar - the flavor of the tuna tartar was kind of weird, maybe too much sesame oil   4. Salad - nothing special. Tasted boring and not refreshing   For main dish:  I had the ahi tuna for my main dish. The portion was generous. It was beautifully presented on a tempura onion ring filled with scallops. The presentation was definitely better than its tasted. I thought the ahi tuna was cut in slices but it was actually was a big and thick chunk. The tuna was a little bit overcooked. Therefore, I had a hard time to cut and taste the freshness of the fish.   My coworker chose the short rib. She told me the rib was too rough. She couldn't even finish her portion.   For dessert:  Three desserts to choose from: Cream Brulee, Molten Lava Cake with Coffee Ice Cream and the Banana Bread Pudding. Desserts were definitely the best part of the meal. All three desserts were beautifully presented. Hugh portions. I had the Molten Lava Cake with Coffee Ice Cream. The chocolate cake itself was warm and chewy with rich flavors and the ice-cream was refreshing. Good balance of the rich flavors from the cake. YUMMY!   The service was very good. Friendly and attentive. My manager was drunk during the middle of the meal and she kept bother the server. The server was so professional to take all her requests. He even changed her banana pudding to chocolate cake because my manager liked the presentation of the cake more.   Overall, Butterfly is a nice restaurant with such a great location and nice decor but just so-so on food!

Kq83kwN94HiGQcjZ8ZI5Bw.review_text: This is a review for the lounge. The location itself was easy to find if you're looking for it. The sign makes the place look small but when you enter you'll see that it's actually pretty big.  ALL asians is what I noticed (well I am too). The first thing I did when I got here was go to the bathroom. Thank Goodness that I did not REALLY need to go because the line for the ladies room was LONG. As I neared the front of the line it was obvious why the line was so long: TWO stalls and girls who could NOT hold their alcohol.  The DJ was pretty OK and I had room to dance but so many people were wasted and just got out of control (pushing & shoving). People there basically have no regard for others around them.

xP-idRJeocfNTysgRBKtSw.review_text: One of THE best places to eat in San Francisco!  Excellent service, food was out of this world!  The Kailua pork lettuce wraps were amazing, so was the duck!  Beautiful view of the bay and America's cup sailboats!  Definitely check this place out!

OpcsZOoJhL6TNp64T6cTTA.review_text: We had the Caesar and poached pear and endive salads to start- both delicious. The poached pears were soaked in red wine and went well with the blue cheese and walnuts. Yum! The entrees: Yellowtail Tuna with black sticky rice; Braised Short Ribs with rice cakes and veal reduction sauce. Both were beautifully presented. The short ribs were melt in your mouth tender and the tuna was seared just enough to balance the raw. Creme Brûlée for dessert was also delightful. It's easy to burn the sugar on top, but this was nicely caramelized. Also has a great waterfront view.

MxluzI5vFj4f8nB1bPJk_g.review_text: Four stars alone exclusively for the happy hour. For any other meal, I'd pass. Butterfly's location is both a blessing and a curse. A blessing because, um, it's gorgeous? With its high ceilings, faux modern, semi-industrial setting all accompanied by the backdrop of the San Francisco bay, there's not much to complain about. A curse because it happens to be nestled between the Embarcadero/downtown and Fisherman's Wharf, so I'm not sure if the often touristy clientele contributes to their somewhat lackluster food that falls a bit flat (read: Asian fusion that doesn't succeed on any level, except maying appealing to a really broad, bland, safe palate). With that said, what Butterfly does excel in are its the location and the killer happy hour. 1-2 delicious special cocktails that pack a punch are always highlighted at the top, and some yummy cheap items to nosh on: butterflysf.com/menus/Bu… Featuring some tasty items like the always appreciated $1 oysters, duck confit spring rolls, kahlua pig lettuce cups, and if they still have the strawberry salmon rolls (it sounds strange, but is refreshingly complementary and delicious), get it.

BpFdQw8fzv7KPAVDVfWZyA.review_text: Was here last night for a private holiday party.  In spite of some initial hesitation going in, I ended up having a great time!  First of all, it's a really beautiful space.  Located on the Embarcadero at Pier 33, this restaurant has enormous floor-to-ceiling windows that look out onto and give breathtaking views of the Bay.  The party's main event was a "gourmet challenge" cook-off, featuring 8 excellent local chefs (including Butterfly's own Rob Lam).  The theme was Dungeness & Maryland Blue Crab.  Each of the chefs prepared an appetizer using this "secret ingredient" and the appetizers were numbered from 1-8.  Here's the best part... the party attendees sampled the chefs' creations and then voted for our favorite!  While I can't speak for their regular entrees, all of the dishes I tasted last night were delicious.  Mad props go out to the bartenders who were manning an open bar for not one, but TWO private parties.  The drinks were inventive, refreshing and delicious.  Our servers, too, deserve major credit for delivering impeccable service throughout the evening.

2Ogd4LLHoSrqJuMEYbPAaw.review_text: My friend and I went there on a Tuesday for their 25 prix fixe dinner ( only 5 to 7 tuesday & thursday onlu) and had a reservation at 5 45pm The interior of "papillon" is really sleek and the lighting perfect. We arrived around sunset time and it was beautiful w the contrast of the water and the pier.  I spotted the booth and the hostess accommodated us and sat us there. I was surprised they gave us only the "a la carte" menu and didn't provide us w the prix fixe menu. I asked our waiter he said that "it was on request" I found it a little weird. Like a secret menu? Or is it because it s way cheaper than their a la carte and they want to keep it undercover !??  Anyhow we had calamari and smoked salmon for appetizers which were both fresh and tasty. Then snapper and beef noodles which I thought were both good. Then we both had the Creme Brule which were really big and delicious. Overall it's a great deal for the food and the ambiance, I will recommend this place an make sure to make a reservation. And ask their special menu it's worth it.

Rx6HDpRbx4ve-IuVer5p_Q.review_text: What can I say, HELEN, the manager was ridiculously awesome. I called to confirm my reservation and asked for a favor. Could they help write Marry Me when dessert came out. She said they would try but couldn't guarantee. When I arrived she made sure to attend to us personally, sat us and even served us our food.  I'll get back to Helen...  Food was delish. Our salmon rolls were so refreshing. Very much like the Viet spring rolls. Our mains were just as good. My baby had the hanger steak and I had the gnocchi. Both good and flavorful.   So, Helen was able to get Marry Me on the dessert.  Butterfly and Helen made tonight even more special than expected. : )

6iNfBVcjiZMAlrpe27th8A.review_text: We made reservations for three on Saturday for dinner and was told the only space available was 4pm or 9:30. The maitre'd said they were fully booked, not even 4:30 was available. When we showed up at 4:10, delayed by road closures, we were seated promptly. Note 1 - the place was empty except for 3 tables and 2 customers at the bar.  We ordered 1 appetizer - shanghai garlic noodles and 3 entrees - sesame seared ahi tuna, Peking ducks breast and flank steak. The noodles arrived within 10 minutes, and were simply cooked yet very flavorful and done just right- not too soft and not too Al dente. Then comes the super long wait for the entrees - 45 minutes later, still no entree. Finally they showed up. Note 2- the food was cold. Ahi tuna was bland, the flank steak had good flavor, but it had texture like rubber, even though we ordered medium, the insides were pretty much rare. The duck was well flavored as well, but it was obvious the dish had been sitting for a while before being brought to the table. Both the flank steak and duck would have been much better if served warm.   By this time it was close to 5:30 PM, and the place was just about 20% filled. We finished 'dinner' at about 6 PM and walked out at 6:15 after paying. The place was maybe 25% filled, just about 7-8 tables were occupied. It's aggravating to know our party have been falsely lead to believe that they were fully booked when it was obvious that was not the truth! For the life of me,I can not understand why they would not take the reservation of 6:30 PM as requested.   Bottom line - food was served cold even though it was flavorful, I would give it 2 stars. Reservation service is the pits for lying, it deserves no stars at all.   It's too bad because I recall dining there a few years back and it was a wonderful experience. The restaurant has regressed since. Not even worth the effort of finding parking, which was tough as well since they don't offer valet.

NxxmeuEYqOp6459O6WmauQ.review_text: I went here when there was a clubbing-type event ... actually went several times. The location is great. It's right on the water. There's a balcony outside which is kinda cool to go out and get some air and fun to socialize when it gets crowded especially.  The inside is spacious and makes a great dance floor.   House music + this space makes you feel like you're somewhere in the Mediterranean. Highly recommended for events.  I know this is a restaurant. I am sure it's a great restaurant also, but see when you go there when it's a restaurant, you probably don't get to enjoy as many aspects of the space;)

YJak39yan9myMNsv54-u6A.review_text: Not only have I been to Butterfly several times, they also catered my wedding.  I have never had a bad experience at Butterfly. The food is always good and the people are very nice.  The sofa area is really really nice! As for the catering... All of my guests told me that they have never had such great food at a wedding and that was including their own weddings, so that should tell you something! This will always be one of my favorite places!

rmjuUY08Ecb8Rm2i_Uuj8Q.review_text: Food: We had a few small plates since neither of us was particularly hungry.  We still ended up taking a bit home, since the portions are pretty generous. Garlic noodles: very good Kahlua cups: very good  Calamari: very good Duck confit spring rolls: not recommended (although if you DO get it, watch out for that sauce if you're not a horseradish fan).  Service: We sat at the bar, since it was PACKED (no prior reservation area).  The service was pretty slow at the beginning, in that it was difficult to get anyone to clean the spot & take our orders, but the manager pitched in to do that (very pleasant man indeed), and things were on track after that.    The location can't be beat, really... all in all, a good spot to bring anyone.

hCZdgEtmgOgvfltaARQrFA.review_text: My wife and I dined at Butterfly last night. The decor is very cool, great views and most importantly, food and service were spot on. My wife runs a kitchen and we both cook and try a lot of SF restaurants, cocktail lounges etc. Staff was very friendly, had a sense of humor and was very conscientious. The chef made a point of checking in with diners himself to see how we liked the food.... rare these days. Our waiter (I believe his name was Porter) was enthusiastic, funny and helpful throughout the night. Another server, Sam humored us by complying with our request to describe the dishes in his native French once we caught the accent. He was also knowledgeable, professional and fun. Signature cocktails were great-- Sidecar had a nice twist w/ candied ginger rim and my rum drink was solid as well. Ah.. the food. We split a calamari appetizer- crisp, well seasoned, great presentation Short Ribs entree- succulent, creative design over veggies and what seemed like a homemade sticky rice concoction. The beef was extremely tender, delicious and cooked just right ..   Chocolate dessert was decadent to top things off. I noticed there were some 1 star reviews a few mos back. If there were some issues before, looks like they're really paying close attention to food quality and great service. We'll be back.

y4ULuS_wBCj1K8dT8IiRDw.review_text: Finally tried Butterfly for DAT two years after I heard about this restaurant. When I first heard about this place the food was labeled as Asian Fusion, but I think now its labeled as Californian. Butterfly is both Asian Fusion and Californian for two reasons: 1) an obvious Asian influence with the ingredients in the food and 2) the preparation, presentation, and freshness makes this place Californian! The flavors come together so well like House on Grant Ave.   For whatever reason I have this idea in my head that "Asian Fusion" is not a good thing, and 90% of the time I am wrong! The level of service and presentation of the food is 5 stars!   Food:  * Mushroom Cappuccino Soup - creamy Buttered Hon Shiimenji Mushrooms with White Truffle Oil and dusted with Porcini Powder is served in a cappuccino cup and it is the BEST mushroom soup I've ever had!!! I'm still dreaming about it :D  * Flat Iron Skirt Steak for DAT - came with Potabella Mushroom, Snow Peas, and Greasy Potato Gratin. The steak was perfectly cooked rear!  * Lemon Grass Snapper for DAT - Served sizzling on an iron skillet and comes with cold vermicelli noodles and lettuce to wrap everything together. YUM  * Banana Lumpia for DAT - served w. Vanilla Ice Cream, the Caramel Sauce made this too sweet!  * Creme Brulee - Creamy and dense!   Drinks:  * Summojito - very drinkable   Space:  Love the high ceilings, table and chairs are very industrial modern home, and the large hanging uni sculptures are fun! The large wall windows that look over the bay isn't bad... lol  Come here, take your time, enjoy the food, and you wont go home hungry!

R_E1c9mHOIvZT0DFnOSoxg.review_text: The view is spectacular (we sat at the upper level).  I forgot what I ate...so I guess it wasn't good enough to associate my taste buds to a memory of this place.  The food and service was okay, nothing to rave about.

4w1Qbp-21HP6MgkMSzXk7g.review_text: A lot of mixed reviews on this place made me a bit hesitant, however, after always seeing it when traveling on the F-line and scoring a $50 restaurant.com g/c, I figured it is worth a shot. Atmosphere: Nice and dark. Large windows overlooking the bay, though at nice not much to see, but you can still see the lights. The space is a bit small and the bar is right upon entrance. Made a reservation and hostess wanted a party of 3 to sit at a round table meant for 2 (with 2 people sharing the banquet side...odd?!). Requested a table window and got it. Food: Nice selection, but I can see how it would be limiting to some. They offer a kid's menu, though the portion was very small, yet fries that came with it were Yum! Ordered oysters (small, but tasty sauces), poached pear salad (good), fried whole fish (Thai snapper - delish), sesame crusted ahi (perfectly cooked - rare!), banana lumpia (tasty, but melted the ice cream too much). The edamame brought out was tasty too. Drinks: Reasonable and a unique selection. Lycheetini was good and not too sweet. Service: Friendly and efficient. Water never went empty; plates cleared promptly (server even knew we had the g/c and it didn't affect service; not that it should, but you never know...). In the end, the bill came and the server did not put on the automatic 18%, which is a term of using the g/c. In a way it was good that she didn't because we left a full 20% of the pre-discount amount. I will definitely go back and maybe for happy hour.

qFdDfUyfpCsUL3Wb1KAvWg.review_text: I was impressed.  The service and dinner selection brilliant.  The drinks were well made.  The social environment very chilled and relaxed.  Not to mention the added bonus of being on the Bay, especially to walk along it after dinner, lovely.  If you don't mind going all out, even if you desire something close enough to a romantic evening out (although, in reality it comes down to you that can only achieve most of that), I highly recommend this place.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Nice atmosphere and bay view with a wide array of different tastes. I enjoyed pretty much everything: the oysters, mushroom bruscetta, tuna, pork lettuce wrap, duck spring roll, fried calamari, etc etc.

Fn5tCTyNNmvkUzfR_h3K2w.review_text: If I could give no star I would. Not much to say. I went with a friend of mine and honestly the bill was super expensive and the food was too bad. no flavor, ultra small, my beef was over cooked, etc... on top of it, very bad service and they seated us in the worst table ever next to a group of 12 ladies screaming out loud.

M9CX3ibQgGbmxPets1mdDQ.review_text: service can be pretty slow, but other than that the food is great! came here with a friend for dine about town, and the portions were surprisingly huge! we had the duck spring rolls and pork lettuce wraps to start, and both dishes were large enough for 2-4 people to share. my grilled snapper and her short ribs were also really good. creme brulee and lychee shaved ice were, again, also really good. happy hour lasts until 7, so we each had a couple of $5 lemon drops ;) i will be sure to return soon just for their happy hour, which also includes an extensive food menu at reasonable prices.

RndtjBHm41mIisU-oGeV1A.review_text: The service was decent. the food was decent. the cocktails were decent. I don't remember anything special about the edible things here.   HOWEVER... i do remember clubbing here a few years back and i loved it! =P

DqWBqOESCQ-vDTtqwuj0sg.review_text: The food is so delicious!  Everything we ordered was perfectly cooked, seasoned and mouth watering good.  My favorite was the blue cheese macadamia crusted filet mignon.  AMAZING.  We went for our anniversary last year and we will definitely be returning sometime soon.  The restaurant is also in a convenient location, just a few minutes walk from Pier 39 where there is ample parking.

204pVFDT04PJyU8NgXhsQA.review_text: Through lots of hype via articles and TV show review I went with my partner for Happy Hour for drinks and appetizers.   We had just one cocktail (Vodka/Soda with a splash of cranberry), which was the cocktail special of the day and often what we drink anyway.  The cocktails was made well with sufficient amount of liquor.  We normally would have had more then just the one but it lasted a long time do to the distractions of the wonderful looking dishes that arrived promptly at our table.  We ordered an array of appetizers off the Happy Hour Menu and were not disappointed with any off them.  Edamame seasoned with some oily garlic and such is placed on the table as if bread at an Italian restaurant.  Calamari was first, which was served with toasted garlic, ponzu marinated cucumbers,and a tabasco remoulade, was good and brilliantly presented.  Oyster Shooters are very tasty in their bloody mary sauce, garlic and cilantro gremolata go down well tasting the oyster but without that "fishy taste".   Next came the Duck Cofit Spring Rolls (6 bite size per order) that were were served with a chinese hot mustard and honey dipping sauce.  These by far were my favorite.  We got two orders of these.   Last but not least fell in the Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic Noodles.  I'm not usually a "noodle guy" but these were delicious.  We also added an extra order of these to the tab.    I initially had a little bit of reservations going to a place down on the waterfront a hop skip and stumble from Pier 39.  We usually avoid "main stream", and especially tourist traps like the plague.  ButterFly however did not give that vibe (at least on a Thursday) at all and the room had an inviting atmosphere with a beautiful view of the bay.  We will be back.

sfVO0HotcXCdLOYuxok9tw.review_text: Since I had such a great experience in 2011 we decided to take a friend here.  To be quite frank this place missed the mark on so many levels.  Service was probably the worst! Everything came out really slow. We arrived at 7:45 and left at 10 pm.  Our server forgot to order one of our appetizers so we decided not to get it.  My husband ordered a non alcoholic lychee drink and they served him the one with alcohol. This was bad because he has liver problems.  Tip to them: do not serve customers alcohol when it was listed under non alcoholic!  The tuna tar tar was not fresh and tasted old.  The only food things we had were the wagu burger and creme brûlée.  I would not come here again nor would I recommend this place to anyone!

aqe7rmvuQNjBGwamaOiHTg.review_text: I had been wanting to come here since 05' but never got around to it. Luckily a couple months back I finally did!  Stopped in at the tail end of happy hour.  Ordered a cherry martini type drink for my guest and I went with a lemon sake drink I believe. Both drink were not to my liking. Shot down a couple oyster shooters that weren't my type either. I ended up sliding everything to the other side of the table to be devoured by another...The fire fried calamari was delicious and flavorful. I really enjoyed the appetizer, and instead of a meal I went with the wild mushroom cappuccino soup. It was soooooo warming and hearty. Such a good combo of flavors. Although it was a bit sandy which I believe to be due to the porcini powder, the flavor was spot on! We were also seated on the side of the bar facing the water which was a nice view, and at first entry we were the only ones there. Towards the very end of our meal the chef came out and was greeting the dining guests. He stopped by our table to ask how the meal was and if we were enjoying ourselves. I like when chef's do that. Overall I enjoyed my meal minus the bar drinks, and the shooters. Although honestly they were my first shooters, and I don't really care for bloody mary sauce. (DOH!) Nice little afternoon meal with a great view & food - can't beat that!

LdY6fw1VZaXfZzFuHSRBYw.review_text: A fine place to have a couple cocktails after a lloonngg day of sight seeing in San Francisco, Rob Lam treated us outstanding as well as Bartender Laurn and hostess Daryah. Although we Addis not eat there the menu looked to be reasonable in price and quantity. This will definitely be a go to place next time we are in town.

yiRZCGwzebRM5mnLpYfFqA.review_text: their large table in the back provides a great view and daylighting! i love the design of that table along with the wall decor. back to the food, we came for brunch and was pleasantly surprised with the deliciousness of the food. the service was just AMAZING and the eggs were cooked to perfection!

snDjs1hdh7JOWv4jjbXPDw.review_text: I thought the restaurant was an overall 3 but the food which is what I really care about was a solid 4  The service was a little busted, I love it when the busboy is more attentive than the person who is supposed to be the face of your experience, so lame. We should have just tipped him and the rest of the support staff.  Anyway the yellow tail duo was a nice dish, not the most amazing yellow tail but it was good and the portion was insanely big. I also had the whole fried fish of the day which was a thai snapper. It was yummy, cooked perfectly, not a bit oily and so delicious, best of all piping hot.  I would go back as it was a really good value and food. Oh and the cocktails were good.I had the bourbon thingy. honey something, blah blah, I don't know but it was good too!

fLKbns1B_8AnbRqHFloALw.review_text: Purchased and used a Living Social deal for them and I was very excited that everything turned out really well.  My peeps and I ordered the cherry blossom drinks which was EXCELLENT! The ginger cyclo side car, sliders, wings, mussels (which I didn't eat), Kalua pig and shanghai noodles...animal style.  I loved all of it except for the mussels and the shanghai noodles...animal style.  The veggie shanghai noodles were the BOMB!!!!!  Total damage for 4 = $170.74 (w/o coupon)

DTEa4cIRdr6T4jaIw1xubg.review_text: MY 100TH REVIEW HAD TO GO TO ONE OF MY FAVORITEEEE RESTAURANTS!  There once was a restaurant called, "Dragonfly" in San Jose a couple of years ago, which unfortunately didn't survive. I was so bummed because I've had several special occasions there and loved most of their signature dishes. A few months later, I heard from a friend that "Butterfly" in SF had similar items and that was music to my ears. A couple of my girlfriends and I made a trip to the city to try this place out for dinner. Right when you walk in, it's wide, nice decor which made it very lively. It was nicely dim and the view outside the window was stunning. We got a table for four next to the window.   The item that I came here for was the 'hoisin glazed bbq baby back ribs'. You have to try it! Simply finger-lickin' good. The rest of the girls ordered 'wok seared shanghai garlic noodles, kalua pig with butter lettuce cups, and garlic seared clams and mussels.' Everything was delishh. Service was attentive and made sure we got what we needed. This place is great for any occasion.

Tu_GW8SDqTMm5i3A_9u9XQ.review_text: i had the great privilege of dining here for lunch during the dine about town.  i chose this restaurant for my friends and myself for their unique prixe fixe menu.  it wasn't the typical salad followed by some sandwich and then expected sweet dessert.  the selections were unique.    i started off w/ eggrolls, which i had to admit was small in portion.  however, it's sf!  everything's smaller and more expensive!  my friends ordered calamari, which was much bigger.  so i suppose my choice happened to be the smaller selection.  the eggrolls were so tasty that i almost ate the bamboo container!  my entree was a smoked salmon asparagus scrambled eggs with texas toast.   it was SO tasty!  i typically hate toast, because they're so dry.  however, this thick toast was full of flavor 'n moist.  it just had that right amount of chewiness.  yum!  my dessert was creme brulee.  okay, so this one may be more expected.  however, the presentation was different than @ a french restaurant.  creme brulee was served in a short but wide pastry dish, which gave it more surface area of hard caramelized sugar top.  it was delicious!  i was starving that day 'n ate everything until i hit creme brulee.  i had leftovers 'n finally hit the wall.  the ambiance is beautiful with the view overlooking the piers 'n water.  we sat in the middle of the room, but we were able to see the view regardless.  service was great and caring.  she checked up on us often, which i appreciated.  now the bad part.  we ran 1 hr late into our schedule, because of traffic coming up from the south bay.  it took us 1 hr to get to sf 'n then another 30-45 mins to find parking.  it was saturday for lunch, so i understood that it can be crowded.  however, the area was packed that particular sat!  my friend who was driving was going insane.  her insanity made me go insane!  we parked far... by pier 39.  we walked for 15 minutes.  my heart was pounding, because i wasn't sure if they had given up our table.  now with us being  behind schedule w/ unexpected traffic, i had called the restaurant 5 minutes before our reservation to let them know of our situation.  he understood and told us that something's going on around that area that's increasing the traffic flow.  i felt relieved that he understood 'n that we should be fine.  i gave him my name to make sure that he holds our table.  when we got there, he had given up the table 'n asked why i hadn't called in to hold the table.  i told him that i did.  i think he forgot 'n was trying to cover his tracks.  however, i forgave him when he did locate a table for us.  there seem to be a lot of walk-ins at this restaurant.  i think because of the parking situation, they may have problems getting patrons.  besides this little skirmish, my friends and i had a great time.  we relaxed as we sat down, enjoyed the view, and had a great conversation over delicious lunch.  we all agreed that we would return.  but i think next time, we'll leave for sf 2 hrs before our reservation time!

S4tmzTV-GMVTAs17G_BZ4Q.review_text: Butterfly is located right on the Embarcadero, with a great view of the bay.  I went to on a Friday night for my friend's going away party.  We were a large group of 15 people so I naturally expected for there to be a few glitches, however, I was pleasantly surprised at how smoothly everything went.    We sat at the bar for about 30 minutes and drank large glasses of $5 wine, (which tasted more expensive) while waiting for some of our party to arrive. We ordered from a 3 course menu and everyone enjoyed their selections.    I started off with the strawberry and smoked salmon rolls with a dipping sauce. My main course was grilled hanger steak, and I polished that all off with their creme brulee.     The best part of the night was when they moved all the tables so the restaurant could be transformed into a dance club. I loved the music, but the DJ had something against finishing an entire song, so just when I was getting into the music he would switch it up.  I'd definitely go back, it was a nice crowd and good service.

hKQNCf3zmtWEYgMw-4y9LQ.review_text: Went to Butterfly for the last weekend of Dining About Town and was not disappointed. Saturday PM, didn't think we stood a chance of finding cheap parking. We actually found free street parking less than a block up Bay St!     As requested at reservation call we were shown to a bay-side (interior) table. The DAT menu was varied and generous. Lettuce leaves with pork were juicy and delicious. The smoked salmon Benedict was beautifully sauced and when I broke the egg it became perfect. This dish could easily satisfy 2 people with an appetizer. There was something wonderful about the fries in that they were soft and fluffy (don't ask me how) and just right for gathering up the sauce. Also had one of the best Manhattans I have ever sipped.       Friends said their shaking beef Cobb salad and wild mushroom scramble were just right also.       The view is both pretty, lots of sail boats, tugs and even a commercial vessel, and gritty, in a picturesque way (the piers).       I would probably never give 5 stars anyway but when I called B. that AM to ask about parking I was told that there was usually space at the meters out front and ,if not, the lot across Embarcadero would be no more than $8 or maybe $10. Well, all the meters in front had cardboard City signs saying no parking and that lot is wayyy expensive!       But we did luck out on the parking score. I recommend Butterfly highly.

6E-SrlAW1gBhk84H6T7RBg.review_text: Love the decor, location (waterfront seating), service, food and prices. We just came back from Paris and the food matches their local bistros.    Plus live music!

9JOJrhUaf3RyrWD8YWEhjw.review_text: Mmm, with tender black cod that falls apart at the touch of a fork and then melts in your mouth, the only think that could have made this place better was the view.  The view out of the floor to ceiling window was of the water, boats and stars.  What a sight.  The view inside the restaurant was a conversation piece too, with large glass/metal sculptures hanging from the ceiling.  This restaurant does quality cuts well, without overpowering the meat/fish with intense flavors.  The portion size is filling, almost on the larger side.  Appetizers can be shared.   The service was wonderful.  Even though we were there when they prepared for a private party, we weren't rushed.  This is a great place to come for a celebration or on a date.

9W14rJypwfE4PvBNIZKPqA.review_text: The view was not as spectacular as I expected, but the decor was fancier than my expectation. It is a good place to hang out and make sure you get the sofa table. Food was pricey just because it doesn't taste that great. Compared to other Asian fusion dining, Butterfly kinda fails.  Thankfully I have a discount coupon so I didn't feel too ripped off.

b0lXNnfnZpKPv7xNwpG3Ig.review_text: I totally recommend Butterfly for happy hour.  But don't all go at once so there is still space for me there =).  I had a huge group of people coming for happy hour and called ahead and they were nice enough to reserve this nice corner area facing the water.  It was one of those gorgeous SF days so looking out was perfect. The space was nice and service was relatively good.  We had a couple people help us and the waitress with the blondish hair was awesome.  Brownish hair waitress tried to shush us a couple times which is kind of rude, we really weren't that loud!  The happy hour drinks are strong and the happy hour food is pretty darn tasty and prices are pretty reasonable. We ended up taking over the whole bar area and I think everyone had a great time.  One bad thing about this place for happy hour though is that there isn't good cheap Mexican or Chinese that can accommodate a huge hungry group close by.  I guess you can't have everything.

9c8_ei4F4tSgWcjSJXhGSA.review_text: The food was excellent! For my entree I had the pork meatballs which were great! And the pomegranate spritzer was a nice touch and a thirst quencher, especially after so much walking the Golden Gate Bridge.  Alcatraz cruises is right next door so from the restaurant. We had our tour at 2 and we were seated at 1:15. We let our waitress know we had the tour to go to, as we worried about time, and she was glad to make it a speedy lunch for us and closed our tab right after we ordered our entrees. All in all, the food and service were great. And we made it in time for our tour to Alcatraz!  Great location next to Alcatraz ferry and pier 39.

0s7x6iXviZTBDHPSfxF-4A.review_text: WOW WOW WOW.....................   There are 3 key reasons why this place is so great:   1. Owner (Rob) really cares about the customer. My wife talked me into giving the place a second shot. I thought on our first visit the customer service was lacking. Well---was I surprised !!!! The owner really stepped up the game----the place now has superior service------so I have to hand it to Rob for listening to the customer (man is that rare these days !!!!!).   2. The bar service rocks. Our Server "Trevor" was simply the best. I am serious---this guy makes the best drinks in San Francisco !!!! He took the time to listen to my likes---as far as liquor, and then made drink after drink. Combine his superior service with the awesome value of the Happy Hour menu---and you have a kicking place to hang. Oh---the new bartender named Rachael was the sweetest person on the planet. We met her on her first night.   3. Food. What else is there in life? Well if you want good food---look no further. The Kobe Burger is awesome. The Garlic noodles are to die for. The calamari perfect-----I mean perfect. Seriously---I can't even remember all the food I have had there---but I know this one thing---I have always had an awesome meal---every time---without fail.   So----I say support local places that cater to the customer-----and this establishment  places the customer where we should be---on top---valued---and catered to.......................

RUMwNN5U7RRPsEOmeAdBDQ.review_text: After realizing that the tickets for Alcatraz were sold out for today, I told him I felt like having another drink or two (I was already hopped up with a double shot margarita at the prior restaurant). He said, "ok." We were about to walk by this venue that was labeled, "Butterfly" and I asked, "you think they have a bar inside?" And he replied with a great assurance, "yeah!" So in we go.  Right when I open the heavy glass door, my first glance inside make me complimented underneath my breath, "it looks expensive in here." We went inside anyways. I figure, this would've been our last spot before we head back home so I thought to myself, "lets go balls out or not at all."  "We maneuvered ourselves to the bar, which was conveniently located right in front of the entrance.  The hostess offered to help us but I asked her, "is it okay if we sit at the bar?" "Yeah sure! No problem!"  The bartender, whom ended up serving us the rest of the time we were there, signed us off on our first drink. The Boyfriend helped himself on "ginger cyclo 'side car'" and I with "honey bourbon sour". Which I had to say, the drinks was exquisitely made and prepared. It was so good that I had to have one shot with the bartender.  I asked her, "are you allowed to drink?" "Yes." "Have a shot with us, on me. Kamikaze. Lets start lite." "Sure, I like your style." After our shot, I found out that her name was Lauren. It's been awhile since I met a female bartender I really liked. Most are pretty snotty and most seems like they're hating life behind the bar. This particular one, I really liked.  I was still hungry prior to our last stop so I decided to order something for me to munch on while we sat there and chat. I ordered Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic Noodles. I guess the name of the entree reminded me of Fahrenheit Ultra Lounge (San Jose, CA) WokTok Garlic Noodles. Result: noodles were fantastic! I didn't request it with chicken or shrimp or anything. Just simple as is. It still tasted spectacular.  Overall: Yes, I would come back here again. Yes, I would recommend this spot to others. Yes, the drinks and food is fantastic. Yes, the service was excellent too... at least with Lauren it was =] Yes, the view from the dining was gorgeous. The interior had a relaxing and mature ambiance. I like =]  (For someone who only started working there for 2 months, I say Lauren is a keeper =] Genuine, polite, professional and an awesome hospitality.)

ZU1r6vjFExKQRcp1cLpF5w.review_text: I bought a deal on livingsocial.com for $50 worth of food for $25!!! Who can say no to that!! We made reservations for dinner and we arrived a little earlier than our reservations, but they had no problem finding us a table asap. The restaurant is beautiful with a view of the ocean ( so romantic). The decor and ambiance is really artistic and chic. For appetizer we ordered the fried calamari and pulled pork. Oh pulled pork! you are to die for!!! Delis!!! Melts in your mouth goodness! The friend calamari tasted fresh and not rubbery like other restaurants. I love the sauce with the calamari and the fresh spring veggies on the side. For the main course, we ordered the Pork Porterhouse, which we thought was a little bit too salty, and filet Mignon with blue cheese and macadamia crust, which I devoured. This is one of the restaurants I will definitely go back to. The prices was surprisingly not as expensive as I've expected. Fine dinning at an affordable price!

TNuFIk1Z4JeJjK9WKZAfTA.review_text: Made reservations and was seated promptly at a table with a couch. We sat side by side facing the bay! Had the kalua pork with butter cup lettuce, duck confit spring rolls, shrimp mango salad, poke over crisp rice, and the hanger steak entree. Best appetizer was the poke. The other ones were good too. The spring rolls were okay. Hanger steak was done medium rare and was perfectly done. Very tender! Will go again!

An77lsFUZebsqbeELGGatA.review_text: A note of caution: this review is based on a single dish. I dined here with the Queen of the Netherlands (on a Groupon coupon which we exceeded) and ordered the Peking Duck. The portions were small, but the flavor was as rich as the prices, and that's the way I like my ducks in a roll!

QRp4HVfci_OzYuyVW2P8qw.review_text: This restaurant made me want to start writing reviews on yelp because it made me love food all over again. I went for lunch and I got the Shaken Beef Cobb Salad and it was the best salad I ever had in my life. I'm a pretty hardcore carnivore, so I was blown away by the fact that a salad could give me such a mouthgasm. The dressing was just right in flavor and amount, the bacon was perfect, the prosciutto was a great match for all elements of the salad, the red and yellow grape tomatoes were delicious and made the presentation of the plate beautiful and flawless.  I had some of my friend's french fries as well, and they were just damn good. It's like the chefs actually tasted their food before they served it, which seems obvious, but doesn't always seem to be the case in a lot of the restaurants I've tried.   And another thing, the service was ridiculously fast. I got my salad and my friend got his Kobe Beef Burger about 4 minutes after ordering. wtf? It must be magic. I'm definitely going back again.

MsFtB0A9VsOg3h0m-FoNIw.review_text: A girlfriend and I went here last night so I could use a LivingSocial coupon before it expired. The reviews I read previously are all pretty good but I wasn't expecting too much since most of the restaurants on the Embarcadero are overpriced and mediocre. I was pleasantly surprised by this place in terms of good food and service.  It was a Friday night and we didn't make a reservation (when I called 10 minutes prior they said they were all booked up) but luckily we were able to get a table immediately. The host/manager Johnny was really friendly and we told him we had just had a horrible day and needed a drink. The drinks didn't disappoint! I got the fig punch (seasonal) and it was amazing! Later tried the margarita and it was good too, made with just tequila, agave, and lime, how a real margarita should be.  We wanted a lighter meal so just ordered some appetizers - Ahi Tempura Rolls, Shanghai Garlic Noodles, Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups, and the Duck Confit Spring Rolls. These appetizers are huge! We were totally stuffed and even had some leftovers.   For dessert we ordered the Banana Bread Pudding which was to die for. Johnny must have told the waitress that we said we were having a bad day because she brought over a creme brulee on the house, as well as a dessert wine apertif. Lovely people.  Overall a great dining experience and I'd definitely go back! 4 stars only because I give out 5 stars sparingly.

hR662pdd6p3Zh0NLQbl9pw.review_text: Service was excellent and food was great. We even met the owner and he was really friendly. We had a view of the bay from our table by the windows - beautiful. "Peking duck" dish was delicious and the crepe that came with it = amazing; kalua pig in butter lettuce was great, as was the warm chocolate torte (dessert - like a molten cake).  The hanger steak was good but not fantastic - maybe should have gone with the cowboy steak instead, though I liked the bacon with the nian gao.  Overall very happy with this restaurant :)

21pUKCLPrwH_VekYmM4rUg.review_text: I'm always a little skeptical about Asian Fusion.....wanna be fancy asian food, but this restaurant really surprised me.  A great restaurant to dine for a special occassion,,,,it's very ROMANTIC setting and great service too!  Definitely would come back!  We ordered:  Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups - GOOD Garlic Seared Clams & Mussels - YOU MUST ORDER, VERY YUMMY!! Fire Fried Calamari - GOOD Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna - VERY YUMMY TOO!!

W0zLORZm8vYe8nvwophPXw.review_text: Went for dinner.  Excellent quality for food and services.  Interesting presentation and creative fusion.  Definitely friendly with a jazz duo for entertainment.  Kind of pricey but will go back.

Mj3QuKqCQIvAtfHJaNQEJQ.review_text: If you want to know how it's like to be treated like a Princess, dine here at Butterfly.  It was happenstance that I found out about this place.  My girlfriend and I have been planning to get together and I needed to find a place by the Embarcadero because my husband and I booked a Twilight Cruise and didn't really want to drive elsewhere for dinner.  So when a LivingSocial deal became available online, I grabbed it.  Let me be honest with you - I did not expect much!  I was not even hungry when I came here but my girlfriend was.  Porter, our waiter, has been very helpful with our food selection.  If there is such a thing as an "ideal man", then Porter is the "ideal server".  He out-shined the service provided by any of  the 5-star restaurants that I've been too.    He recommended we started with the oyster shots- turned out to be a good call!   Then he brought us some edamame on the house - another good one!  Then came the mussels - the broth rocked my whole world entirely.  It is definitely a must try.  For dinner, we shared the garlic noodles (which is plenty for 2 people but yummy) and the duck.  The duck is definitely the best.  Not sure really what part of duck it was but it was very lean, tender and very meaty.  It was marinated and very tasty.  I thought I had an orgasm when I bit into it and I am not kidding you.  It was delicious.  I don't drink but I was told that their gimlets are pretty good too.  I had the non-alcoholic lycheetini and it was delicious - not too sweet and just perfect for my taste buds.    They were closing when my husband caught up with us and even if the kitchen was already closed, Porter was so kind to get the kitchen to prepare something delicious and fast for my hungry husband.    I can't wait til my next birthday because I will definitely celebrate it over here at Butterfly!  Kudos to Porter.  You earned it!

7DmUbNOJgTMYOX_Ap_Ja_w.review_text: Good concepts, but poorly executed sums up Butterfly.  It's at Pier 33, which is a short walk down from Pier 39.  However, I never would have known it was there if it was not for a Living Social deal of $25 for $50 worth of food.  The four of us ordered:  Calamari-Great tasting calamari, but the temperature was too cold.  Shouldn't calamari be hot if it just came out of the fryer?  Strawberry/Smoked Salmon Spring Rolls-  Good general concept, but the vermicelli noodles and rice paper wrap were both really hard, as if it was premade and then refrigerated.    Duck Confit Eggrolls-  When I think "confit"...I think slow cooked, melt in your mouth tender.  The Duck Confit here was on the dry side, and tough to chew through.  More like a poorly made pulled pork than duck confit.  Papaya Salad-  The shrimp on here was AMAZING.  Best flavored shrimp I've had in a while.  The papaya salad's flavors were a bit too toned down for me.  But I'm Vietnamese, so I can drink fish sauce....maybe this is Papaya Salad light, for the non-Vietnamese people.    Macadamia encrusted steak-  There was nothing spectacular about this dish.  Even the mashed potatoes were too grainy/starchy.    Along with corkage for 2 bottles of wine, total for the bill was $90.  Not bad for the location/view.  Only if the quality of the food was better. :(

-uUKRIY5_xMPLM6_T_vjyQ.review_text: I am totally baffled by those hating on the food--the food was DELICIOUS!!! We ordered pretty much everything on the appetizer menu: salmon carpaccio, duck confit spring rolls, shrimp dumplings, hoisin spare ribs, garlic noodles, clams/mussels, calamari, ahi tempura roll, kalua lettuce cups-- since we ordered so much, they brought things out a couple courses at a time.  It felt very tapas-like, which was more fun than ordering one entree/person.  By the 5th appetizer, we were about to burst and we still had the Loco Moco Burger and dessert to go! Everything was AMAZING, but the ones that really stood out were the spare ribs (meat fell off the bone), ahi tempura roll (like a sushi with toppings of black rice and salad), calamari (i don't even like calamari, but this one was SO good--maybe it was the sauce..), and the garlic noodles.  We barely touched the only entree we ordered--the Loco Moco Burger--it was like 6 inches high!  Needless to say, we had a lot of leftovers that we took home.   We used a Restaurant.com coupon, which made our meal VERY affordable.  The service was good and the place was beautiful--huge lit wreaths, pretty lighting, tall windows with a view of the water--a good choice to spend a special occasion :)

yV1PN-KG7vMKV9xyM4JToQ.review_text: Great service but sadly, I did not really enjoy their food. Tasted like overpriced Chinese food to me. I most certainly will not pay $11 for a bowl of supposed garlic chow mein...ever again!   3 stars for our server which was exceptional.

ijpRP-xcbAtzE-Y-EVjEhg.review_text: Reviewing this place as a night club.  After we got there in a bootleg way (taken by our roommate's friend, a chef, through the kitchen), and actually having 50% of a drinks for free, it did leave  an impression of unexpected joy and fun.  About the actual dancing experience: music IS right, crowd WAS diverse, a bit on the younger side, but still cool and hip.  The final head shot was the sea-side exit - pier, where you can enjoy the view of the water while sipping on a long-iceland....

QVAmRIrCxhYLqh7wl4Vlog.review_text: I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner, and with both experiences I was pleased. (especially with dinner!)  LUNCH: As one would expect, lunch at Butterfly is a lot more casual than dining there at night. You'll have lower prices, short wait times, and less fancy fare. (A lot more sandwiches and salads appear on this menu.) I ordered the Kobe Beef Burger and, well... it tasted like a good hamburger. Nothing really to complain or rave about there. My friend got the wok-seared garlic noodles with chicken breast, and that was simply "good" as well.   The service was a little lax, but it was mostly because there was a pair of honeymooners that the waiter was focused on. I guess I didn't really mind since it was the special time, and the view of the water along with the ambiance kept me pleasantly distracted during downtime.   ------------------------- DINNER: Dinner here is ideal for a date, in my opinion. A lot of the tables are configured so that they seat two people, with the couple sitting side by side either looking out at the water or with the water behind them. The food and the drinks were all very good. We had a reservation at 8:30pm and weren't seated until 9, which was a little annoying since we had plans after, but the hostess gave us a round of drinks or appetizer on the house to make up for it, which was a nice gesture. I ordered the white sake sangria which was very tasty.   For dinner I had the macadamia and bleu cheese encrusted filet mignon. It was VERY DELICIOUS. It was served with mashed potatoes and other vegetables like asparagus, garlic, etc, but wow was that steak good. I wished that the portions were larger because it was so amazingly tasty. The bleu cheese wasn't overpowering and the sauce on it was so good that I wanted to lick my plate clean of it. I probably should have since the lighting in the restaurant was so dim. Drat.   For dessert we ordered something akin to BJ's Pizookie: A big cookie with ice cream on it. Eh, this was just mediocre. The cookie tasted uncooked and was very, very grainy. It felt like chewing on crunchy flour and whole sugar granules.   The bill was around $80 bucks for the two of us before they took off the two drinks for the long wait, and it was worth it because we had a really good time. I would seriously go back here for the delicious food if I had the money!

5F4h38XhqL3qQzB_hJ1x1A.review_text: I dined here Saturday night 7:45pm, the place wasn't that busy, maybe half full.  The food was delicious, but portion size was small, but we shared our dishes. They didn't have the claypot I came for because they ran out of chicken.  I recommend the garlic noodles and the rice crackers that came with the shortrib.  The service was attentive and friendly from everyone else except our server Kate, who seemed to of disappeared after she took our order.  We had to try to flag her down when we needed something, but she never looked over so the other friendly staff helped us.  When she finally realized we were done, she placed dessert menus in front of us without saying a word.  15 minutes later she came by and we asked for our check and she just grabbed our dessert menus.    I wouldn't of been pleased with our dining experience there because of Kate, but the chef came out twice to ask us how our meal was, this definately made up for her.   Yes, she was helping others as well, but again the place wasn't full at all so this doesn't excuse her.   -1 stars for Kate 5 stars for food and great service from the other staff

2ZCASyHp7_Y85DMb2-5ExA.review_text: I went to Butterfly for a lunch meeting because my boss loves the fries here and we had some from the takeout section once.  We had been waiting to eat here again and this past week, it happened.  I wasn't sure what I wanted to get because the menu is a bit overwhelming and I didn't have time to look at it.  I saw a dish on a neighboring table that looked tasty, so I ordered the same...the lemongrass and coconut curry chicken.  This was delicious.  The flavor was great and they served it with a sourdough roll which complimented it perfectly.  The chicken was very moist too.  I was very impressed with Butterfly.  I had only been here for parties before and once for takeout.  Now, I'm hoping to stop by and grab lunch more often.

FEuUKUx6OlbKJ0QYoXoloQ.review_text: I'm writing this from the bathroom--as this is where I've been three times since going to Butterfly. Don't get the kobe beef burger; as everyone in our party who had it felt the aftermath for the remainder of the day.

0mSHHkvQDQfvotATzYF8AA.review_text: came with my mom with a livingsocial voucher. didn't get the stank eye from any of my servers or hostess, thumbs up. great ocean front view and interior decor, thumbs up. yummy complimentary soy beans, thumbs way up. my only complaint...food was on the salty side. had to refill my cup of water a few times over during the meal. overall, a great spot to hang out and unwind from a long day's work with some good food and fun company.

Ta5bnoe0PlyidllnRVYF5Q.review_text: Did I eat at the same place as everyone below me?!?!?  The plus.  Service was great, the free edamame was yummy and the presentation was good.  The negative.  The food was horrible.  I tried the salmon carpaccio, fried calamari, garlic noodles and Hoisin ribs.  All simple dishes to make.  But none of them had flavor!  I mean I looked through the plate of garlic noodles and there was not a bit of garlic in them!  So will never recommend this place to anyone nor ever step foot in the establishment again....

subHZkQ1jkJBTUAoPHdqEA.review_text: Food and wine were very good, so was the service. A bit pricey but will be back.

Nza9TrumxVALFOc3zpPxDg.review_text: My boyfriend and I decided to have our farewell to summer dinner at Butterfly. From all of my fellow yelper's reviews, I knew what to expect. Great view, check. Great food, check. Great environment, check.   So what went wrong for it to only receive three stars? Let's just recap all the events of the evening.  1.  Once I walked into Butterfly, I realized I was over dressed. My impression of this place before I went in was that it was a causal chic place but I was disappointed to find it a very casual jeans kind of place.  2. Our hostess led us to this small table right by the window with a fabulous view of the bay.. but the booth was unfortunately facing inwards. As my boyfriend and I flipped through the menu awkwardly, we felt all eyes glued onto us. You see, not only was the table faced the wrong way , but it so happened to be right in the middle too. Later we asked to switch tables and our waiter told us that the booths were put in earlier that day. Why would someone want to put a booth facing inwards? Not only does it create such an awkward eating space but it takes away the entire view of the bay!  3. After our table frenzy, we decided to order some drinks and appetizer. I ordered the pom cosmo. I don't know why I bother to order drinks at all, they never taste good. Seriously, no matter how mouth watering they sound on paper, they never turn out good. Along with our drinks, we also opted for the duck eggrolls. They were a-mazing! The sauce that accompanies it -- some sort of sesame wasabi sauce (?) -- was also very good. If I had to rate the food alone, this place would get 5 stars for sure.  4. Now the real show starts. My boyfriend ordered the fillet mignon and I ordered the Ahi Tuna. The fillet was good -- very tender and very tasteful. But the real wow factor was the Ahi Tuna. I ordered it raw and it was exactly that. The sauce is a bit spicy but it was SO GOOD. My boyfriend, who usually HATES fish, loved it and couldn't get enough!  5. Dessert was ok. We decided on the Creme brulee and the Banana Lumpia. The Creme Brulee didn't taste too fresh and the Banana Lumpia was nothing too special. It was only $6 a piece -- pretty good deal!  6. And here is why it lost a star. When we got the check, I put down my usual Discover card. Well the waiter then asked me if I had another card because THEY DON'T TAKE DISCOVER. Now, I can expect that at a place in Chinatown. But a restaurant like Butterfly?? I was pretty surprised. I guess it's really not that big of a deal but I just felt it was pretty inconvenient.   Over all, the restaurant is good. If you want good food with a good view, definitely go here. Make sure you're not going to pay with a Discover card though!  Update:  I also forgot to mention that we were seated next to a table full of kids. The kids were running around which really irritated me. Parents should really keep tabs on their kids at restaurants! I don't mind sitting next to kids, but they definitely should not be running around and screaming in a restaurant!

j9cLSQ6220oAqx8M8KrdNg.review_text: I saw this place on a TV so we went for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The view was very nice. The decor was very trendy. I think it probably looks better at night when the sea urchin lamps are on.   The Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce cups were delicious!! The pork melted in your mouth and the hoisin sauce gave it just enough extra flavor. I had the Kobe Beef burger and my boyfriend had the duo of the chowders. The presentation was fancy. Taste wise, they were good but i expected it to be a little better. For dessert we had the Banana Bread Pudding. That was Yummy!! The coconut ice cream it came with went well with it.   Service was good. Our waiter was very knowledgeable.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Butterfly is one of those restaurants that's been around so long that you sometimes forget how good it is. I remember going here almost ten years ago, and in San Francisco terms, that's some pretty impressive staying power.   Chef Rob Lam mixes his Vietnamese heritage with modern flavors to bring a series of dishes that perform culinary magic in your mouth: the wok-seared garlic noodles (get them with Kalua pig!), the smoked salmon and strawberry salad rolls (a tasty juxtaposition), or the turmeric grilled snapper (my favorite). For dessert, I'd trade any decadence for Butterfly's lychee shaved ice.  Outside of the food, the restaurant still boasts one of the more dramatic atmospheres in town. The setting is modern and sleek, and set against the water with floor-to-ceiling windows, well it's hard to find a better view of the Bay from a restaurant. Except on sunny days, that is, when their outdoor deck opens up, becoming the perfect perch to idle away a few hours.

tcDJKyjsngZf0d99rGBCFQ.review_text: I work in SF and my bus passes Butterfly every day and I've always wanted to stop in and give it a try.  Well yesterday I did and I can honestly say that I will never be back.  Service was SLOW and the service staff were nearly incompetent.  (e.g. spilling water on my cell phone while refilling my glass and dumping "Nuoc Cham" sauce on my daughter when picking up the dishes)   As for the food, the calamari was fine as were the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups but nothing special.  I ordered the Wasabi Bloody Mary that was decent but there wasn't even a hint of wasabi flavor.   When our main dishes arrived my family seemed to enjoy them.  I had the Duo of chowders and I would definitely never repeat the experience.  They both tasted a bit off, almost like they had started to go bad and had just been reheated for service.  Needless to say, I didn't finish the chowders and spent the rest of the evening in close proximity to a toilet.  (I was the only one in my family to have issues so I'm sure it was either the bloody mary or the chowders.)  The final frustration was the bill.  I'm sure the server realized that she wasn't doing well because our bill came with an 18% gratuity included.  Yes, their menu does indicate they could add it automatically, but you don't expect it with a party of 4.  When I asked, the server indicated that it was automatic which means they should really change their menu to indicate they add it every time instead of saying they may add it. (assuming the server was telling the truth)   I normally tip 20-25% and any time a restaurant automatically adds a tip it really makes me angry so I NEVER tip more or go back to that restaurant.  FYI, our server missed out on another $5 of tip--even with the below average performance.  Needless to say, I will never be back.

YZ-sVHwTTgSsDy9qaH4WdQ.review_text: I have been here tree times, once for dinner, once for lunch, and once for a happy hour event. The atmosphere here is cool and stylish, and sits right on the water. The place is a little loud based on the design. The best thing about this place is the drinks. The servers are nice and knowledgeable. The food is severed stylish. But too be honest the food is okay but not majorly impressive. Lunch is not impressive, but the dinner menu had a few goods ones. It was about six months ago I was there for dinner but the duck was very good. The service here is also really slow. So just depends on what kind of meal experience you are looking for. The food takes forever to come to the table. I would go back for drinks and apps but not a meal.

z0V1nV5pEHO-Zs6DedVulA.review_text: Just had dinner at Butterfly and as in the past, had a remarkable meal. My partner and I shared the calamari and it was remarkably tender, not chewy like some places. Our entries were also outstanding despite the rather lengthy time. We mentioned the time wait to Porter, out server,  but we were enjoying our time despite it.   Speaking of Porter, I don't think I've had a server so passionately describe the dishes in my life.  He did a fantastic job and was very personable too.  Thank you Porter. Even after noting the seemingly long time for our entries, he was gracious and even offered to make it right but that certainly wasn't necessary.  How nice that he cared enough to offer though!     Great place, great food,  very recommended. Its our favorite 'nice' night out spot!  We'll be back!
