Iovy9ItislQQuQQVYHR1ng.review_text: My boyfriend will probably disagree with me, but I thought Butterfly was good, but not great.  Ambiance:4*- It's a fun location. The restaurant has HUGE bay windows that over look, what else.....the Bay. It's a cross between a warehouse and a loft. I'm sure at night this place would be lots of fun.  Food:3*- The food was good, but like I mentioned earlier not great. We came for the DAT lunch and personally I didn't really feel that any part of that menu was Asian Fusion. I started with the Tuna Carpaccio, which was really good. I'm not a fan of horseradish or wasabi so I didn't really eat any of the creme fraiche. Main meal was the Shaking Beef Cobb salad, AKA a Cobb salad. I didn't taste any Asian flavors in the meat, and the salad certainly didn't have any Asian flare. Lastly the Creme brule. Now this I'll admit was mighty tasty! I would return to have the creme brule again.   Service:3*- Very friendly wait staff. Our waitress was very apologetic when she brought out a wrong dish by mistake.   All in all I would return for dinner and I definitely want to try something that has more of the Asian fusion flare that they advertise this restaurant is.

6xH5ZQ80KWAJk81lLRI3HA.review_text: Went here with a high school friend and I was quite surprised. From the outside it looks like an ordinary restaurant.....but when you enter it is amazing. The servers are friendly but come by not as often as they should. the choices of food are mainly about 8 entrees. I got the scallops and she got the filet Mignon. the filet was very good in terms of tenderness and the scallops were seasoned just right. The appetizer was amazing. A bloody mary oyster......talk about the best of two worlds....I could have easily had 3-4 of these they were so good. Then came dessert which was just as nice. I will definitely be back for more bloody mary oyster shots!!!!

tRRcuNcY6jaYEo82l1Ojdg.review_text: honestly, i'm not usually a big fan of "Asian-fusion" places because that usually means American-style Oriental food. however, this place kept most of the integrity of their dishes' origination.  the 6 of us primarily went to fill our bellies after happy hour, but it felt like we were celebrating some sort of craziness and sat in the nice big booth by the window that looks out to the water.  thank you Kim for being quite the Butterfly advocate and taking care of the dining decisions!   i was pleasantly surprised.

JWi5vzqPsK6I9XAebiGk1w.review_text: I came here for HH.....and I regret doing so simply because what they offered was very minimal and left me with an "OK" experience. All I had was the duck confit spring rolls, calamari, and kahlua pig with lettuce cups. I do have to admit that their $1 oyster shooters are divine.....I had like 4 only because HH ended otherwise I could've had 3 more....Yea Butterfly  is a nice restaurant since it's located right on the embarcadero, but that's the only thing I'll ever remember about this place....that and it's oyster shooters.....

GwnTHubny3NcG-VGoPwTcg.review_text: Loved it! Cute. Clean. Excellent food. Great atmosphere. Right on the water & a bit more calm than Pier 39. Ask for Porter & you'll be in good hands. Order the ginger Caipirinha... not exactly Brazilian, but SoOOO SoOOO good! This is a good fusion restaurant, which can be hard to pull off.

hlHCmXVpSTGQ9S7t1YoKpQ.review_text: Great food, with exception service.  Restaurant sits facing a view of the Bay.  Make reservation as restaurant fills up fast.    Love the Asian fusion.  Enjoyed snacking on Edamame while we awaited our food.

eIRTLKosC_PclSbp3Fz3MA.review_text: Two stars because the food was okay even though everything else was bizarre.  A friend and I wanted to eat before going on an Alcatraz tour.  We walked into Butterfly and three separate people asked us if we had reservations, with us replying no each time.  The restaurant was empty but as the server took us to a table she informed us that we could not stay more than an hour.  Fine by us! At that point we just wanted to eat and get out.  In all my travels, I don't think I've ever been to a more strangely pretentious restaurant.  It wasn't the finest restaurant I've ever been to, just the most pretentious.  Highlight of the meal: Random dude coming to the table while I'm sitting there alone, picking up my friend's napkin which she had left on her chair, folding it and putting it back on the table.  Also moving the water pitcher less than an inch because apparently it wasn't in exactly the right spot.  And not a word to me.  All just very strange.

H0oAAaBOHJtlRbLcfxpxMw.review_text: Disappointed!  Although the bay view and bar is cool!  First of all,  I went there for lunch and ended up with a rude waiter.  He was not very friendly and threw our to go boxes at us and scampered away.  We ordered the fried calamari and duck confit spring rolls.  The spring rolls were good - it was described as SPICY!!!  But I found no such luck.  The calamari had no taste - I've had better at a sports bar.  Or maybe I should say, you would expect calamari like this at a sports bar.  I ordered the Vietnamese fried snapper sandwich.  The snapper itself was great but too much bun accompanied it and the cilantros and jalapenos just didn't do it unless you take off the bun.  A $2.95 Banh Mi is so much better than this $12 miss.  I was hoping for a fresh twist such as what you would find at the Slanted Door.  The sandwich was accompanied by these huge fries which were good.  My friend had the chicken salad sandwich which was huge - they use Texas Toast for the bread!  Too big!  If you want a lot of mediocre food for your money at a great location, this is it.    I would go here for the bar atmosphere.  They make great drinks that goes well with the great view.  Too bad their food does not rate.

ZvwBpMxJZi9sWiSlFuPtWQ.review_text: HMMM where to start???  I came here for a quick yummy lunch. All I actually got out of it was a quick lunch, not really satisfying though.  The hostess asked us if we had a reservation and we were like "uuuu no" yet she still said it was no problem and gave us a booth with a fantastic view of the bay.  I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and ended up removing the chicken salad and the soggy bread under it because it was drenched in mayo and some Definitely think the bill was mostly for the ambiance and the view, not the food.

On2bcCpZ5YINf-_ng9-Dgg.review_text: Ambience is nice....still waiting on food  My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday and it was an enjoyable one. I liked the atmosphere, though a little on the darker side as far as lighting...the view, visible from almost anywhere in the restaurant was nice. They had the nice big windows to see water outside, since you are on the pier.   Food was nice and the staff was friendly and attentive. We even had a nice quick hello from one of the chef, which made it even more pleasant. My steak was cooked nicely, medium rare and the meat was tender. Everything we ordered was plated quite nicely.  We ended the dinner with a delectable dessert. I love chocolate and what we ordered was a great balance of sweetness (not too sweet) and the perfect size.   Overall, I would probably come back for a special occasion.

exygIMUwWiMg8HU4L_lNIw.review_text: Highly mediocre. Seems like it is trying to be a high-end asian fusion restaurant. Several hot and cold appetizers with about 6-7 main course choices.  The service was good and the decor was ok. None of the dishes were especially memorable, though I admit there was nothing wrong with any of them either.  I had the hangar steak and it was tasty and properly cooked, however, not interesting or worth coming back for.   Either way, a forgettable culinary experience.

-BLCnU5DzxeXUOFo9_diNg.review_text: Ordered the Vietnamese Fried Fish sandwich and it was pretty decent for its portion and flavor! Came with a side of fries, but I wonder if it would be better with tartar sauce. For $14, it might be a tad steep for a fish sandwich.

f2tS08C8InH7XUpPhzNYKA.review_text: I went here for date night with 2 other couples.  I like the place, but I give it 3 stars for telling me what the special was which was ahi tuna with black rice and scallops and mushrooms.    what came out was something totally different and I ordered the special b/c the waiter said there were scallops.. when it came out.. no scallops to be found... all they did was apologize for their mix up.. and they still charged me full price for a special that I didn't even get!   ugh!    if i were to go back i'd probably get that big steak that my friend's husband ordered... looked delicious.. i was jealous b/c i would've ordered that one..   i love their sake sangria.

HaoPeg2ySVEbQKN3gySxHQ.review_text: The Butterfly Affect. My brother made reservations for Thanksgiving dinner.  Since my mother and I were on vacation, we thought we'd let someone else do the cooking this year.   I found the pre-fixe menu and other information regarding the restaurant at: butterflysf.com SETTING:  Located along the Embarcadero, Butterfly is spacious and welcoming.  Floor to ceiling windows over look the nearby Pier 39. FOOD: 1.  Amuse:  A Trio of the following-- -House Smoked King Salmon, Whipped Horseradish, Wasabi Cracker -Cha Siu Bacon, Hachiya Persimmon, Malted Sesame -Oyster Duo, Bloody Mary Shooter, Champagne Mignonette, Gremolata As they saying goes, things usually come in "3's".  And certainly this amuse-bouche trio was a delectable beginning to our meal.  My favorite was the cha siu bacon, with the oyster shooter a close second.  Simply delicious. 2.  First Course:  Our group of 4 all chose the soup-- Curried Pumpkin Soup with caramelized shiitake mushrooms, ginger cream, fried pumpkin seeds, and cilantro. The warm soup was definitely a comfort to help combat the chilly weather that night.  Good portion with a hint of spice.  A delightful part of the meal. 3.  Entree:  Salt baked turkey breast accompanied with turkey leg confit and sweet potato hash.  Also included on the entree were scallion and goat cheese popover, twice baked butterball potato, lop cheong fried brown sticky rice, ginger and cranberry relish, and truffled mushroom sauce. The entree was quite appetizing and very filling.  I personally wanted to save room for dessert so I didn't want to indulge too much.  The turkey was prepared well and I finished the entire portion given.  I didn't care for the popover that much, but did finish most of the baked potato.  The lop cheong sticky rice was something different, but since this restaurant is Asian fusion cuisine, it wasn't surprising to see some Asian influence included on the menu.  Overall, our group was satisfied with the entree. 4.  Dessert:  Pumpkin pie (of course!) a la mode. No Thanksgiving meal would be complete without the traditional pumpkin pie.  Originally this was supposed to be served with whipped cream, but our server kindly granted our "wishes" and substituted vanilla bean ice cream instead.  A perfect ending to a wonderful meal. SERVICE:   Good.  It could have been slightly better perhaps, but the restaurant was extremely busy that night.  Our reservation was for 600pm, but we were seated closer to 630pm.  To pass the time we enjoyed some drinks at the bar and discussed the other places we were going to visit on our trip.  The server was friendly as well as polite, and did his very best to attend to our table and others he was responsible for.  We were all thankful that he complied with our request for ice cream to be served with dessert instead of whipped cream.   After our meal was nearly done, the chef himself came by to see how we were all doing and how we liked the food.  I thought this was very gracious of him, and he actually did chat with my brother for a few minutes.  He then wished us a Happy Thanksgiving and went on to greet the other diners. BOTTOM LINE:  Satisfactory dining experience.  Good service.  Though there was a shaky start, the meal finished superbly as the food had a great affect on us:  A delicious Thanksgiving dinner overall.

ZVw_GCsssQU8G2JI_K2Uqw.review_text: I went here with my family for the mother's day brunch a couple of years ago (it just seemed like a mother's day kind of place).  The food was really great and i tried octopus for the first time (had a fusion take on a cioppino) There was also a really great lamb and grape skewered appetizer that sticks in my head.

saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q.review_text: Having dined many moons ago at the original location in the Mission, I purchased a couple of coupons on Amazon prompting two spaced visits here.  The earlier one was before daylight savings time so it was already dark here and the crowd was already settled in; the atmosphere was more romantic under these conditions.  On our recent stop here, it was a bright, sunny, breezy day and the scenery shines more when the dining room is bright.  Our waiter quickly brought us water and the menus.   After some deliberation, here's what I had: Appetizers (shared) 1) Ahi Poke with croquettes (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) - Moderately flavored, the tuna pieces were tender and fresh.  The rice croquettes were a good twist.   2) Chicken Wings (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) - Not a big blue cheese fan, I still enjoyed this.  Ten unseparated wings that were crispy with a sweet and sour tang. Entrée 3) Hangar Steak, medium rare (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) - Perfectly cooked to a reddish pink, the teriyaki sauce stood out as a contrast to the creamy potatoes and crunchy snap peas.  Please bear in mind that this cut is on the chewy side. Dessert (shared) 4) Warm Chocolate cake (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) - Cooked warm, the lava literally flowed towards the melting ice cream.  Just a notch below Roy's. As I played with my phone, the owner/chef saw me and jokingly mentioned Yelping the restaurant.  Unlike many old school chefs, he complimented the virtues of the reviews and values the comments made.  We noticed that he walked the entire dining to gauge reactions, talk about a hands-on business.   I was impressed with the food, vibe, and service.  My friend's only criticism was a lack of bread service.  Used Living Social coupons on both visits.  Will be back!

S0Pji5ZPQwlolC7vlq1lug.review_text: My older sister, 5yo nephew, and I came here for the last day of DAT and to celebrate my birthday last month.  We had 11:30AM reservations and arrived right on time, even though we took the F car (for the first time) and discovered it is the slowest street car EVER.  The space is really nice.  I like that it's right on the water.  We thought we got an excellent table.  It was straight back and around the corner.  Private and a bench seat so all three of us could look right out the window.  All the other window seats, you're seated facing the door.  What's the point of having a window seat if you have to twist your head/body in order to take a peek out the window?  We really liked those spiky blowfish lights.  Appetizer:  I had the Fire Fried Calamari, which I thought was pretty good.  Not spectacular, but pretty good.  The nephew really liked them as well, but only the ones without the sauce because he thought the sauce was spicy.  My sister had the Duck Confit Spring Rolls.  Also, pretty good, but not spectacular.    Entree: I had the Shaking Beef Cobb Salad, which was soooo GOOD.  The poached egg on top was different and definitely added a little extra something to the salad.  I'd go back to have the salad.  My sister had the Chicken Salad Club Sandwich, which was gigantic.  She didn't say how it was, but she was only able to eat half.  The nephew ordered off the Kids Menu (yes, they have a Kids Menu) and got Cheese Pizza with Fries.  Dessert: I had the Warm Chocolate Torte, which was good.  They even put a candle on top of it for my birthday.  My sister had the Creme Brulee, which was a normal creme brulee.  The nephew had a fruit cup.  He loved it.  Service:  We were seated right away.  Our server was friendly and came to check on us often.  I have to say service was a tad bit slow.  We were there for a couple of hours.  It took forever between the appetizer and entree, but that might have been because our server was waiting for me to finish my appetizer before she brought out the entree.  I was kind of grazing because I was saving it for the nephew.  She finally came over and asked if it would be okay for her to bring out the entree.  So to sum it up.  Food is good, but not spectacular.  Love the space and the view is pretty nice.  I'd go back just for the Shaking Beef Cobb Salad.

VcPj1gchy48KWnMk4kMI-A.review_text: this place was okay.  there was this salad we got was okay.  the steak was okay.  the garlic nooodles were okay.  the skillet cookie was okay.  okay?  okay?  okay?  okay?

FY0xR5Q5JCUJO7Wk8Icvyg.review_text: Parking was super easy but it was a Wednesday night or something. My friend and I gorged on four or five appetizers and two desserts and a bottle of Pinot Grigio (not really doing anything to help the muffin top sitch but oh well) but left more than satisfied and wanting to come back again soon.  One dish that stood out from the rest were the Smoked Salmon and Strawberry Salad Rolls - so delish! We'll be back soon, I'm sure.

js2q5tpghfmsqnZrGk_AtQ.review_text: Had dinner here with my wife on a resent trip to the city. We normally do not eat on Embarcadero as the places tend to be more flash than flavor. What a surprise this place was, great small bar with very good drinks. A very nice staff that really enjoy food and drink (foodies) and great food. The steak was great but oh my try the Kalua Pig Butter Lettuce Cups. I dream about those Butter Lettuce Cups. The place has a great view on top of it all. Do not miss this place.

lQ86cFpq8EnK_C81c8COXw.review_text: I came here for a OneVietnam event.  They served appetizer samplers and some drinks.  The drinks here are quite delicious!  I'm a fan of fruity alcoholic drinks and they aways serve a good mix.  From what I've had on the samplers, the food is also delicious.  It has the view of the water and the decoration is nice and modern.  The wait staff were quite attentive and pleasant to deal with, even when the place was packed full of unpaying guests.  It's a sign of excellent service should you chose to come here for dinner.  Also good for a social event.

pb7j5AnxTwBVYYtN_A0Ixw.review_text: This place made my birthday an immediate hit. Not only did they accommodate my party of twelve, they took the time out to print and bind my prefixed birthday menu which they also added a personalized touch to: my name BOLDLY printed at the top of all twelve menus. They went out of their way to make sure my birthday dinner was a special one. The food was delicious and unique. The bartender (mixologist) at the bar was great with both the specialty drinks and the usual classic bar drinks we are all used to. The decor of the place was modern and upscale. I would definitely recommend this place and patronize there again. I will admit that this review is really late (my birthday is in November); I know, I know. I have no excuse, lol!!!

8ZWYZwYjO9vrfmdhDLc4TA.review_text: Even though we came here with a DAT group, my gf and I decided to order off of the regular menu, because it looked so good.  The drinks were great and we were seated in a corner, water front table.  Which would normally sound great, but the tables are so big, you could've cooked hibachi on it, thus conversation was a little difficult to make.  Asian fusion places are usually hit or miss, but this one was somewhere in the middle.  Their take on french onion soup was very tasty and so was the mushroom cappuccino soup.  The short ribs would have been good if it were 5-spices or just a little milder.  It was just over spiced and salty to the point that I couldn't even taste the meat.  The duck was also an interesting take...interesting good or bad is yet to be determined, but we've definitely had better elsewhere.  The service was impeccable, but eh food was just average.  At least we didn't get charged above average prices, however I think one could categorize this place as a typical restaurant on the Embarcadero - good view, average food.  If I could, I'd give 3.5 stars.

a5QS6g30nM4q2XFGP6Po9g.review_text: I'll preface this by saying that we had a bloomspot deal, $30 for $60, no restrictions on ordering. I thought that was a pretty sweet deal. If not for the bloomspot deal I probably would not come back.  Butterfly was an interesting dining experience. I came here after hiking with MP at Rodeo Beach and I was HUNGRY. We were seated immediately at a table by the floor to ceiling window...but our backs were to it. Weird. There was an enormous and grand cruise ship behind us ... but our backs were to it. I did crane my head around to enjoy the view once in a while but it got too tiring after a while. The interior felt more like a club than a restaurant. Modern and sleek and very dark. Reminded me of EN brasserie in NYC.  We tried the kahlua pig with butter lettuce cups, garlic noodles with shaking beef, and duck confit spring rolls for starters. For the entree we shared the fried whole fish with spicy sausage and flat rice cakes. The best dish was by far the kahlua pig. I thought that was a truly creative and actually interesting Asian fusion twist on a classic Chinese dish. Everything else tasted like Chinese food that was spruced up and verrrryy expensive. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but it was just jazzed up Chinese food. The garlic noodles tasted like lo mein. The fried fish was a little tough, but I did appreciate the presentation and how the chef scored the fish meat so I could eat it easily right off the bone. I was too full for dessert.  Our server was really sweet and friendly and he made our meal experience very enjoyable. The non alcoholic beverages sounded tasty too. Overall, would come here only with a bloomspot deal but even then there are other tastier options in the city.

umi1oAyUZoEU2Gv9gLJ7iw.review_text: A dear friend suggested we meet here because we hadn't seen each other in a while  and  we should get together.  She watches the TV show, called Check please. She said the place great ratings,  so we tried it.  The show was correct. The restaurant is right on the water so you have nice view basically throughout the place. One  full  wall is glass.  We had the an appetizer to share that 3 of us were able to do with out any problems. Our wine to start  was nice also.  I had a great Riesling.. It was all very delicious The main courses were all great and plentiful. Mine was a sandwich which if i ate the bread too ,i would have been filled in a second.  It was very plentiful and good!  We all  tried different things and everyone of the dishes were great and presented beautifully.  I   am not telling you what to order  because everything was good.  Also our waiter  Ross was very helpful and very friendly. I will definitely go again.Already i am thinking of some out of town guest who i know i will take there.  Enjoy

pr15bCVYIz01lqNiuSxCOQ.review_text: The host at our B&B suggested we try Butterfly since we could not find anywhere that sounded decent after a bus tour. We enjoyed the food, service was fine and as we were going to Alcatraz right after our lunch it was a perfect location.

idSLEy-1dNlMthmbiMaMJQ.review_text: A great find and what a place to rest your feet from walking along the pier and grab a couple of drinks. If you sit around the corner from the bar you can look out to the bay, there are giant windows and its nice to just relax and enjoy your food.  The staff is friendly and their drinks are really good, and made just right. I had ordered the Caipirinhas and it was great, refreshing just what I needed. The Buddha's hand which my friend ordered is a bit stronger so if you're looking for something strong I recommend the Buddha's hand.   We had their chicken wings and calamari. The calamari was lightly breaded but served on a rectangular plate. Even though the food was good the portions were far too small. If the prices weren't so steep for such small portions I'd want to come back again and again. It's worth another visit for the drinks.  Overall good food and drinks along with good service.

YFNAYiWUDuNqv57VS5tXPg.review_text: I like this restaurant for the convience. It's really close to my job. They had the most amazing shimp dumplings, but since they change there menu seasonally it hasn't been on there for a while. Dishes are well prepared. But for some reason whenever I go I feel like the selection of dishes is too small. Not that they should add more, but instead ensure the ratio of meat:fish:poulty is right.

7W10ai9wXpjeV5IElzq3bg.review_text: Love this place. Everything from the drinks to the desserts are masterfully made. If you are looking for food with flare and flavor this is the place. Make sure to do some appetizers as well, great choices to go with the chefs custom drinks. Only reason it doesnt get 5 stars is the prices are a bit high. However, this does make it a nice special occasion restaurant.

jQ07bfxL882j0y9iCKGMUQ.review_text: We will certainly be back to Butterfly. We waited outside on a nippy Sunday and the hostess let us in right at 11 am when they opened the door. We were greeted with a welcoming smile and were promptly seated at a table by the window facing the bay. Our waiter gave us a good description of the Dine About Town menu. We ordered the Fried Calamari and the Kahlua Pig for the appetizer selections. The Fried Calamari was fantastic, crispy light and tender with a wonderful sprinkling of herbs and a rich creamy aioli topping. The warm Kahlua Pig was sweet succulent and smokey, accompanied by butter lettuce and a small dish of Hoisin sauce. For our breakfast entree we ordered the Smoked Salmon Benedicts. The smoked salmon was divine and the tobiko garnish on top was exquisite. And it came with nice thick cut fries anda bowl of fresh mixed fruit that gave a nice refreshing ending to the meal. And to top off the wonderful meal we had the bottomless Bloody Mary cocktail that our waiter made sure to keep refilled for us.

dLuNvprTH04p6ZNCyjIq9g.review_text: 270 reviews! San Francisco yelpers are so on it.  Ate here with a huge party of family members for a graduation event.  Location and service are  both four stars- the cavernous waterfront locale reminded both wife and I of a recent meal at John Malkovich's restaurant in Lisbon (but with a better view.)  We had two waiters and numerous servers for our party of 15+- I thought they did a great job- it was just about as well paced as you could expect for a meal that extended over three hours.  Alas, the I found the food to be uninspired.  The ingiedients were fresh enough but I found the combinations uninspired.

akmzZ87dhGitfq_c600cQw.review_text: Came here for dinner with the hubby the other night. He's been wanting to try this place for a while so why the heck not.   Duck confit spring rolls - very tasty fried rolls,  very delicate skins so it was easier to pick it up with fingers than a fork  Fried calamari - delicately served on a long appetizer platter. Not a whole lot of calamari for the price and seasoning was ho hum.   Garlic noodles with beef - the garlic noodles was a steal for the price! Huge portion, comes with veggies by default. The beef was extra but it wasn't a whole lot of beef for $8.   Wagyu cheeseburger - excellent burger for $16. Fries were tasty and hearty.   All in all, nice ambiance, good date night place, and good food. Entrees are a bit pricey but you can get full on the appetizers too.

2L-6qfJoScdRUoG6UDBJ-w.review_text: We came across this restaurant because we were looking for a great lunch while waiting for the boat to Alcatraz. The back wall is one huge window overlooking the ocean. We were given a small edamame dish. Edamame had sesame oil and seeds and was the best I've tasted. To drink I had the virgin version of the kiwi cucumber beverage. It was made of muddled kiwi and cucumber, soda water, and agave nectar. It was surprisingly tart and tasty and very refeshing. For lunch I ordered the Vietnamese Fried Fish Sandwich. The fish was delicately fried, so it wasn't greasy. It had fresh cucumbers and carrots and great, thick bread. French fries were thick and also lightly fried, not greasy. I would go here again in a heartbeat!

62__mf_8FFpMpZ4m9U-n2w.review_text: Went for our 10 year anniversary dinner. First time here. Beautiful restaurant, was pretty excited.  Drinks: Ordered the Apple Cider cocktail. It was definitely Apple Cider served warm with some alcohol in it. Interesting but I will not order it again.   Super dark, too dark to take food photos (My favorite thing to do), and had to use a flash which was not working out very well....  Apps: 1. Shiso Leaf Wrap... What the hell is this? NOT GOOD at ALL, complete waste of money!!! I love Shiso, but this dish was like, JUST eating the leaf and nothing else. Please do not order this.... Wish someone told us not to order this... 2. Duck Confit Spring Rolls. Pretty good. I hate wasabi and the dipping sauce had wasabi in it. Killed my taste buds. Asked for soy sauce, much better. This is a good App.  Entree: I had the Macadamia and Blue Cheese Crusted Filet Mignon which comes with Wasabi Mashed Potatoes, Shimeji Mushrooms, Baby Carrots and Turnips, Red Miso Jus de Veau. As I said, I hate Wasabi. Switched it to Brown rice, much better. Steak was perfectly medium rare. BUT the vegetables were STRAIGHT UP RAW. Just so you know, RAW turnips taste like raw potatoes and it was SO BAD. My boyfriend ordered Five Spice Braised Beef Short Ribs. Not that good, have had much better at multiple restaurants. Sad.  Was too scared to order dessert. And I love dessert...  On our way out the hostess said "happy anniversary". Thanks for acknowledging it on our way out.

IRGb3l6aKQJ47NGK3zi7Lg.review_text: Love, love, love Butterfly Restaurant.   I saw a "Check, Please" episode about it and for some reason it's one of the few restaurants that my mother actually remembered from that show. I saw it, too, and thought, "I'll have to check it out."  So Mother's Day rolls around and I decide to treat my mom to Butterfly. The online reservation process was seamless and I didn't feel like there was going to be some major mishap about whether or not they had the reservation.  Seamless reservation and check in process.  Granted, the menu was prix-fixe because of Mother's Day, so I can only review what was eaten from that menu. Judging from what we had --which I speculate is pretty indicative to the general menu-- was basically a sampling of their popular items with a main entree and dessert.   The seafood options they had were spectacularly fresh and tasty. I had an opportunity to try the sea urchin on my sample plate and I'm glad I had it because I know that I will never order it in a restaurant. It wasn't that it wasn't fresh, briny and fatty (it was), it was just that I couldn't get the image of an actual sea urchin out of my head. I freaked myself out so much that the only thing I could imagine was something similar to the blob sitting on my tongue ...but with a heartbeat. Whether urchins have hearts or a circulatory system, that's not my purview, but I will say that I woman-ed up and tasted it. I'm sure that people who like urchin will think it's the best in the west, but I'm just not that girl. Same with oysters. People rave about Butterfly's oyster shots which come in a (wait for it...) shot glass. Same thing for me, I can't reconcile a wad of slime sitting in a glass waiting for me to eat it. Passed.  The cocktails were phenomenal as was our wait person. I have to give the waiter credit as he was informal, approachable, but not irreverent to the point of being obnoxious. He was mannered and cordial and attentive. Anywho, my mother ordered a Bloody Mary which looked like tomato stew there was so much produce in it. She loved it! (Let me see if I can remember what was in it: pickles, onion, celery, olives, and hot sauce.)  I ordered my usual gin and tonic which you can't really mess up, but it was good.  My mother had the Hangar steak which usually comes rare to med-rare. I had to convince her that it was similar in cooking technique to a flank steak (high heat and not cooked to death) and she relented and got it med-rare. She loved it. It was a pretty big hunk of meat, too. I tasted it and it was fantastic. (For an omnivore, nothing beats a good piece of steak.)  I had the Kalua Pork which was good, but I wasn't floored. Apparently it's standard on the menu in lettuce cups, but this time it was served differently and the taste combination was a bit off for me. (Don't get me wrong the pork was tender and delicious, it was just some kind of spice combination that wasn't great for me.)  The desserts were decadent and delicious.  Overall the experience was great. I didn't give it five stars because the staff was definitely overwhelmed on Mother's Day, but the highlight was that the chef came to our table and personally shared (in a humorous way) that the kitchen was "going down fast" and they were trying their best to make sure everyone was happy and pleased. That made the wait "funner", but it really wasn't that long for us. I felt sorry for some of the patrons who came in later --including the non-American tourists who apparently had no clue that it was Mother's Day-- because they had to wait much longer than we did. But then again, that's where making a reservation and planning well comes in.  All in all, courteous and attentive staff, great bar staff and cocktails, diverse and good looking, mixed age clientele (yup, that's more important than you think), magnificent view of the bay (you can even go outside for a bit of briny air), personable chef, and outstanding food. I would definitely go back again as I've heard they have a happy hour AND a jazz band.   Awesome place.

JaZJd0RuXNHDWoH4kL3pvA.review_text: I came here with some friends for Dine About Town for lunch. We made a reservation 2 days in advance. The woman who seated us told us the selections they had on the Dine About Town menu were their most popular items. We were pretty excited.  The appetizers were superb. The Kahlua pig lettuce wraps were nothing short of amazing. The meat was smoky and the hoisin that came with it gave it a sweet little tang that went nicely with the crunchy lettuce. The portion size was also very generous. The calamari was good. In addition to the regular sort of aioli sauce most calamari comes with, it came on top of some cucumbers and soy sauce, which was a nice touch. The smoked salmon and strawberry rolls sounded like they'd taste really odd, but the dish pulled together really well. I really liked that each of the appetizers 'worked,' and were very well thought-out. The one thing I'd note is that the portions for the calamari and strawberry rolls seemed considerably smaller than the portion for the lettuce wraps.  The mains we ordered weren't as good as the appetizers, but they were still satisfying. The garlic noodles were simple and savory. They had little bits of shiitake mushroom in them, which I think really added depth to the dish. The fried snapper sandwich was basically fish, and heat (in the roll there was a piece of fried fish and half a whole chili [and a tiny bit of cabbage I think but definitely not enough]). The shaking beef Cobb salad I had had its ups and downs. The highlight of the dish would be the greens. They were really fresh, and dressed very well, and the quality of the avocado was divine. The beef and bacon were both just fine. The egg it came with however was a bit too raw to be very nice, and they were a bit aggressive with the amount and size of the individual blue cheese chunks.  Everything else-- the service was somewhat slow, and our waiter seemed to have no real time for us. The decor was pretty enough, and the bathrooms were clean. None of these small details detracted from or added to our lunch experience. I'd be really interested in coming back for the food, especially for events like Dine About Town, when the prices are low.

OdIaJyiXXDUd0E19RL5Ncg.review_text: Decided to have an intimate and mellow GNO/Birthday Celebration at Butterfly for my 25th which was almost 3 years ago. They treated us like royalty and spoiled us good. We sat all the way in the corner next to the window overlooking the ocean..it was beautiful. The food was excellent, everyone was super friendly, it was like they closed the place down just for us. I loved every minute of it. Definitely worth coming back. =)

TQUOZpNh7QudizPOEbf6YA.review_text: Quite an enjoyable visit and absolutely no complaints. We arrived at a time that allowed us to choose from a few choice window locations overlooking the bay, which got the evening off to a nice start. Our waiter was timely throughout the evening and didn't miss a beat.   A really nice sized salad and some fresh home made dinner rolls got our dining off to a nice start and a really tasty Mango Colada went down quite easily.  For our main courses we decided to share the Wood Oven Roasted Peking Duck along with the Ahi Poke entree. Definitely great decisions with no buyers remorse !  We definitely plan to return in the not too distant future.

sDS2DFgAapj7gJ83P425Fg.review_text: Dine Around Town . . .  Saturday brunches are bomb!  Bottomless B. Mary or Bottomless Mimosa  fried calamari duck confit rolls wild mushroom cream of  Shaking beef salad Chicken salad sandwich Salmon benedict  -especially on a bright sunny Embarcadero day!  E-normous cruise ship docked at this pier, tickling our fancies!

UWzAJf1CxoE8UE6i4wmR2A.review_text: Came here for lunch with my cousin in November 2008, yes a totally overdue review.  The decor and view (we got a seat by the windows overlooking the bay) are gorgeous! We started off with a round of drinks. My cosmo arrived with an eyelash in it, so we sent it back. Shame that they didn't comp my drink.   Anyways, the french onion soup was quite delish but felt out of place at an asian fusion place (isn't that what they bill themselves as?)  I was looking forward to the kobe beef burgers, which were good, but not as great as I was expecting.   Oh well, service was good. Decor/view is awesome. Location worked well too since we were starving after returning from The Rock.

UNuSYxqFWaheQ1_GlrnBog.review_text: 5 stars location  , 4 stars for ambiance and neatness, 4 stars for quality of food, 4 stars for price (very good @ location )3.5 stars for friendliness and attentiveness of server.Definitely will come back and would try their other dishes.

awitT3Yhi9FY2Fx8-qzUFw.review_text: Solid.  Friendly staff, perfect filet minon with a great view.  Yum.  Happy.

CXzCtsukXp4znTbXIizzmg.review_text: I would drive by this restaurant every single time I'd come down the Embarcadero and always told myself how much I wanted to go eat there. Knowing damn well that any schintzy looking restaurant on the Embarcadero (with the exception of Palomino's) would probably charge an arm and a leg for a meal, I figured I'd save it for a special occasion. And, what better special occasion to go there than grabbing a Livingsocial deal I found in my inbox!? The voucher was $25 for $50 worth of food and drinks, and while some other people depicted having less than mediocre experiences at Butterfly, I had a great night and found that my money was well spent.  Even if I hadn't checked Yelp beforehand (which is something I recommend that everybody do before purchasing a deal on Groupon/Livingsocial/what have you), I would have been more than satisfied with the recommendations I received from our super friendly, patient, and knowledgeable waiter. He recommended we get the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups, the Pan Seared King Salmon, and the Grilled Hanger Steak "Kalbi Style." To drink, we got The Daly Palmer Iced Tea and the Kumquat Margarita. Hands down, everything was DELICIOUS. All three dishes had the most savory, succulent, and moist meat, and the best combination of flavors and textures. Even the drinks well complemented our meal. While there was more to the Daly Palmer Iced Tea, the kumquat margarita was just as good.   I never used to be a huge fan of Asian fusion, but Butterfly made me into a follower! The service was great, the view of the Bay is beautiful, and the venue is nice and cozy with a modern twist. I will definitely be coming back here again.

rtTpEZSTIDSurdw12xZK1Q.review_text: Butterfly is a really nice place to go for a weekend night out.  Its on Pier 33 and has a beautiful view.  The decor is really hip and pretty.  Interesting martinis on the drink list.  The food we had was really good too! nothing to complain about at all, but just not exceptional where it'll get five stars.  The appetizers we got was pretty big! We got the garlic noodle.. not very garlicy.. not as tasty as Crustaceans..but not bad.  That can be an entree but its listed as an appetizers.  The oysters were REALLY good..we got TWO plates of half dozens and there's only four of us! We also had the clam and mussel appetizer... the sauce was so yummy we cleaned that dish out soup and everything! then we shared the lamb which was cooked VERY well... and the crab stuffed chicken.. the chicken breast was a little dry so that was jsut ok.  will definitely come back!

qacsmIcFzSFknjf3TWoTRw.review_text: I was so surprised, not only at how nice our seat was facing the water on a beautiful night, but also how incredible the food was. We started with the calamari - the presentation was amazing and so was the light, airy breading and sauce. I had the Ahi and he had the crab stuffed chicken, which he is still talking about to this day and ate as a cold leftover from a man who does not eat leftovers. Our waiter was also spectacular - overall a great date night.

yyVp6FljqMBAoN9GQ-D-fQ.review_text: Stopped by for a drink with a view. The bar was a great place for this. Bartenders were quite friendly, service good, and crowd seemed fun. Didn't try any food (other plans for dinner).

X62Mnr3egMpL_0Lrhbed_Q.review_text: Went into the city for a comedy show at the Punch Line. Last minute decided to have dinner close by. Read the reviews about Butterfly.  Sounded different. Always in for an adventure in dining. It was an adventure for sure. Made on line reservation. Walked in and half the restaurant was empty. Kind of surprised based on the reviews. Sat down ordered drinks. Were okay. Nothing special. Instead of going with the entrees, went with appetizers and starters. To make a long story short that sums up the dining experience. Do NOT call Egg Rolls something else. Do NOT switch out Chicken with Pork wrapped in lettuce cups. DO NOT call Chow Mien "Garlic Noodles". DO NOT  put  "Fresh" Dungeons Crab in a Tub of Curry and most of ALL, DO NOT ever cover Ahi Tuna with Parmesan Cheese. Comedic sense of Fusion...Sorry. Not going back.

bb8zWroORnHJI9SfPF0qIQ.review_text: I came here for a Dine About Town and I had a really great time! We made a reservation and arrived late (it's farther from Embarcadero Bart Station than I thought), but were seated immediately with no problem. There's a tiny nook around the restaurant that has a small bench/booth that seats two side by side facing the ocean and it was a really gorgeous view of the water.  The food was also delicious! We purposely ordered something different off the Dine About Town menu so that we could try more things, and everything I ate was great. The portions were also decent, in my opinion, and I was definitely full by the end of the night. My favorite was probably the salmon and strawberry spring rolls, but everything tasted good and overall I had a really good experience here.  In addition, the wait staff was really nice and courteous. I've had some experiences with Restaurant Week, Dine About Town, and the like in places where the waiters can get snooty with you because you're there for a deal, but I did not have that experience here. Definitely make a visit, especially during Dine About Town!

nfIXitXhfIuATNdeH3BYpA.review_text: The location and decor are the best features of Butterfly.  The food was okay, nothing memorable.   Started with the ceasar salad, which was on point.  Had a glass of pinot noir that went well with my steak and the chicken clay pot looked savory; however, I wouldn't go out of my way to try this restaurant again.  Dessert was my favorite part of the meal, and that's because you can't go wrong with classic creme brulee.  The warm chocolate torte was very rich and creamy :) Perfect if you're in the San Francisco area and want to experience a chic restaurant on the Embarcadero.

SH51C12DD1ZexSU3FwCzuA.review_text: Well, to be fair, I'd give it 3 1/2 if I had the option.  I've gone to Butterfly a couple times for parties but never got a chance to dine there until recently when I went with a couple of my girlfriends. Didn't hear much about it so had no expectations about the place, and it turned out pretty good!  We ordered and shared a couple dishes, including the following: - Fire Fried Calamari (standard) - Big Sammy's Poke Tartar (tasty!) - Shrimp Bisque in Puff Pastry (not as rich as some other bisque I've had but still rich) - Soy and Mirin Glazed Black Cod (I've had better)  With dessert and drinks, the total bill came out to around $45 per person. It was good but more on the expensive side. I like the venue, and the service was great (the chef-owner Rob Lam even stopped by our table to introduce himself and see how our food was, which was nice!). Last-minute reservations were pretty easy to make which is nice for the indecisive. I wouldn't mind going back whenever I get the chance ...

7CWRoP0f4TLwRkYR5syiqQ.review_text: My sister and I came here to eat for Thanksgiving dinner. The atmosphere and service was amazing! However, I have to knock it way down to two stars for two reasons: hair #1 in my food and hair #2 in my desert. I don't think I need to say anything else to justify this review.

S9UzNHQieeZxa5EyGOakLw.review_text: My mom and I came to Butterfly on Thanksgiving since we were in SF from out of town. From the moment we stepped in the door, the service was fantastic. We were early so had a drink at the bar first (great cocktails) and then moved to a cozy booth for the prix fixe menu. The chef came over to greet us, and then stopped by later (remembering both our names and where we live) to see what we thought of the food. The servers were all on point, and even suggested other sights to see while we were in town.    The menu was a perfect blend of traditional thanksgiving foods we were craving (turkey breast, twice baked potato, gingered cranberries, apple pie), plus a few items that added their own twist like fried sticky rice and curried pumpkin soup with shitake mushrooms. Everything was delicious and we left just as stuffed as if we had been at grandma's house -- if grandma's house was swanky and well decorated with someone else to do the dishes.  Bottom line, we spent less than a lot of other places offering Thanksgiving prix fixe menus and left completely happy with both food and service. I would definitely come back again on our next trip to SF.

N0EECzLG5irkUP9OQrNugg.review_text: Came with 5 4 ordered steak amd eggd. eggs were raw on all 4 dishes chef would not cook them any longer. Server afraid to take food back BC chef would be mad. Steak was worse steak we ever had. Don't eat here !!

yLrCWhs-NotimHLBF08ltQ.review_text: 2 stars says "Meh. Iv'e experinced better"  To save time you can stop reading here.   I was not woWwed in any way. I wanted to be... I treated my step mom to dinner at the Pier. When we walked in at 7pm, of course no tables were available because I forgot to book reservations. (Oppsies!) That was ok because we snagged seats at the bar.  The interior is beautiful, the view is awesome... but my beef is with the food. I get the whole fine dining, fusion, small taster portions but that is if the food is rich and tasty.  -_- I ordered the Roasted "Peking" Duck w/ duck confit crepe, kumquat confit and hoisin cream sauce. When it came the presentation of the plate was clean and pretty.  BUT I believe that any interpretation of "Peking" at the very least, should have crispy skin and  peking spices. I do not think that the duck breast was properly rendered and chewy fat is not appeasing. It  was lacking in flavor overall.  I completely expected more of an rich umami taste when it came to the duck confit. I mean for $28 I was looking for rich, well balanced flavors.  My step mom ordered the Grilled Hanger Steak "Kalbi Style" w/ seared rice cake, asparagus, and sweet carrots.The hanger steak was cooked to her liking, the sauce was ok (I believe is was a veal jus) and the rice cake was interesting. To my this was a steak for $24. I guess we paid for the technique they used to cook it, "Kalbi" which is like Korean grilling.  We both had cocktails that were not overly sweet, which I can appreciate.  Overall, I was disappointed because I expected more. For me, I'm on to the next...

qQ5NOCTQhVVfKHLTtC5kJg.review_text: I'm always iffy when I go to place that has "Asian Fusion" cuisine, but fortunately this place gets it right.  The decor is hip and trendy and is located right on Pier 33... the place might seem pretentious when you walk i but I didn't experience that at all with the service.   The food was awesome, especially the the Korean steak.  The owner and chef there, I believe his name is Robert Lam, even came up to our table asked us how our steak was.  He explained explained it was a new menu item and had been marinating for 36 years..... sweet!  It was really kool of him to come talk to us.   If I had to be nitpicky, I did not like the dipping sauce for our duck confit rolls.  The dipping sauce was basically all hot Chinese mustard, and was definitely overwhelming.  Please change the dipping sauce Chef if you're reading this. However, I absolutely loved their banana bread pudding.  I'm a sucker for banana bread and this was one of the best I've had.   Overall, I had a great experience and l look forward to coming back again.

p9OUxMKlyRkOueYAeHuXig.review_text: so it's been awhile since I visited this place. sisters and I were looking for late happy hour and since I've tried their food here before I brought them here. crowded for Friday night but we got seats at the bar. $5 apps and $6 drinks were awesome. we ordered garlic noodles- good, calamari- really good, pork wrap- uh okay, used to be good. d bartenders were very nice.  this place had always treated me good.

45iBeVQvKyGp0gt1YzmAKg.review_text: Had a hot date.  We came here.  5 stars for interior space- post and beam, exposed brick, huge windows overlooking the bay.  5 stars for impeccable service- attentive and conscientious without pretense .  1 star for food.  Calamari was tough, cold, and deeeeeeep fried.  Aside from that, the flavors were oddly paired- imagine the baby of vietnamese (cucumber, bean sprouts, cilantro) and trashy Italian restaurant calamari (you know- frozen, deeply breaded, deeply fried, deeply greasy).  Next:  salads.  My green salad was fine, except for the manchego.  They placed a deli slice on the bottom of the plate and built the salad over it.  It fused to the plate and I had to scrape it off to get a piece.  Unfortunate.  Finally- dinner.  Duck.  The breast was delicious, perfectly cooked.  The confit leg was so hard and dry that I could not eat it.  yuck.    All and all, a romantic space- but the food is way off the mark.  Good place for a drink, but don't waste your time and money on dinner.

-CtvpMAL4-GRWfTdMbIcZw.review_text: Went w a girlfriend and they sat as at the wrong table, then they offered to pay for first drink on the house when we were asked to switch seats, which is nice.  I had the farmers Bellini, Pecking duck and lychee shaved ice which were All so delicious!   After dinner, the chef came out and asked if we like the food and apologized for making us switching tables.   I would say this was def one of the few restaurants by embarcadero that I will ve back again :)

-nCRHb6EPGABooYtHsEjPA.review_text: read the reviews and got the impression the portions were small  - so either Butterfly increased the portion sizes or other reviewers have unreasonable appetites!  Food was delicious - I had the tuna, sweet and tender, cooked as ordered and accoutrements were sensational. My wife had the mushroom sandwich, trés bon there, and mom went for the Noodle bowl with Kahlua Pig.   Nice decor, friendly staff  -I'd go back.

5hZbH0ExGi_NBvlkgFsMvg.review_text: Saw this place on KQED's 'Check, please' program and have wanted to check it out so for an early birthday celebration, my sister made brunch reservations for today! 6 of us were seated in a far corner that over looked the water and the pier next door. The view is not spectacular as this restaurant is located in between two piers but you do get some of the water views but that's it. The ceiling is very high and the decor is quite interesting with a contemporary Asian flair to it. The lighting must be very beautiful in the evening. Our table was a U shaped booth which was comfortable but the seats were a bit low for us Asians. Our waiter was excellent! He recommended special cocktails, appetizers, etc. All throughout the meal, he checked on us with fresh water, clearing any dishes.  My Dsis ordered three appetizers: the duck spring rolls (nice, flaky wrap!), calamari (beautiful presentation and the ponzu cucumbers underneath...yum!) and kalua pork with butter lettuce wrap (fresh crisp lettuce with a flavorful bowl of shredded pork and sauce!) As for the entrees, two in our party ordered the brunch house smoked salmon egg benedict (the fresh orange egg yolk oozed out perfectly when cut into! Came with a mini pail of buttery steak fries and bowl of fresh fruit!) My Dsis and our other friend ordered the wagyu cheeseburger (they said it was delicious with the milk bun and large patty of meat. Came with all the fixings) My mom had the ahi sashimi salad (she was impressed with thick, large slices of ahi tuna. Did not care too much for the Thai black rice but did enjoy the sauce that went over the entire dish!)  I had the sizzling turmeric snapper (and it did come sizzling away in a mini iron flat fry pan! Seasoned just enough but not too much. The snapper was moist and firm...perfect! It comes with a side plate of Vietnamese rice noodles and butter lettuce to do some more wrapping but I enjoyed it all separately!) The portions are very decent and our Dmom mentioned how each and every sauce was distinct and delicious! Instead of ordering from the dessert menu (which I had studied before arrival!), my Dsis had surprised me with a custom cake she had brought into tthe restaurant before we got there!  Our waiter presented the cake with a single, classy candle (thank God...did not want to burn the place down!) After all the oohs and aahs, he took the entire cake back to cut into individual slices. The entire experience was awesome!! Since none of us had ever been there before, we did not know what to expect but I can speak for everyone and say that we were all pleasantly impressed!! The icing on the cake was when Butterfly's chef/owner came by to each and every table...he visited us twice and chatted about his restaurants (he has another one in the city!) and our NIners, etc! Very nice guy!!  The price of everything was very reasonable (according to my Dsis!) Though the dinner entrees are quite a bit more in $, we would love to go check it out!

s7QJnmwdQCIRrMV-N3oDQQ.review_text: Ate here the other night for Dine About Town. The chef was super nice and friendly! He came around to each table to check on our meals, and after telling him a couple of our dishes were a bit subpar, he gave us a free dessert.  The views of the bay seem like they would be nice during the day. There are cute two-seater booths along the windows.  I recommend the short ribs -- the meat was tender and the sauce was a nice accompaniment to the crispy rice cakes. The duck confit rolls and the kalua pork lettuce cups were okay. The lychee shaved ice was pretty delish, but the banana bread pudding was amazing!

JwQ8oI5iXKaqfBgZSpm19Q.review_text: Loved the mirrors & the sea urchin light fixture. Food was pretty good. Came here for my 21st birthday dinner last year. Pretty friendly staff.

Bg38DLPNAkIBXG-d3vtQRg.review_text: This place was great. Atmosphere nice on the water. Food was excellent. Try the lettuce wraps, kobe burger, chicken salad sandwich, red snapped sandwich and the garlic noodles. All were very tasty and the Asian twist was yum. I would come back again.

eFEJQDvrtvOaENYak4Mf4g.review_text: If you're looking for a reasonably priced Asian Fusion restaurant, then give Butterfly a try.  We dined on an early Thursday evening.  It was slow at first, but the restaurant floor soon filled up.    I started out with one of their drink specials, a honey bourbon sour which was tart and a hint of honey.   Served shaken and up it was a refreshing opener to the meal.  For appetizers we started with calamari and the kahlua lettuce cups.  The calamari was lightly battered and seasoned with five spice and garlic.  Nice rendition and not greasy at all.  The kahlua pork with the lettuce cups was smoky, but not overwhelming.  Both of these dishes were enjoyable.    For entrees, I had the whole deep fried fish.  It was snapper this night.  It was presented on a bed of rice cake and black bean sauce with Chinese  sausage.  It was perfectly fried and the fish was presented vertically curled around a small mound of kimchee.  Delicious, but I will warn you that this was the highest priced entree on the menu.  My wife had the clay pot chicken roulade while my daughter had the Mirin glazed black cod.  They enjoyed both of their entrees.    We did share a couple of desserts: the banana lumpias and the bread pudding.  The bread pudding was excellent.  The lumpias were good, perhaps the portion could've been larger.    Overall the service was good although our waiter started off slow, but warmed up as the evening progressed.    I thought the prices for the meal and drinks reasonable for the city.  Portions were not huge, but comensurate with the price range.  Although it's near Pier 39, Butterfly is a great alternative to all the schlock nearby.  If you're looking for a multi cultural Asian meal, then stop by Butterfly.

_owMBYfzT9dO7FXGXXzXqA.review_text: Butterfly... You have never given me butterflies. I love your bay view, floor-to-ceiling windows, and local artwork (especially the huge sea urchin-like overhead lights), but the food! It leaves so much to be desired--like a money back guarantee.  I chose Butterfly as the site of this year's Thanksgiving dinner with my friends, and I'm still slightly embarrassed for it. Besides the dessert of pumpkin tart and apple turnover, there wasn't anything that was memorable or that justified the $45 per person.   The curry in the curried pumpkin soup overpowered everything that was in there. The wood oven roasted diestel turkey breast was dry, tough, and just terrible--I would've rather eaten a $5 rotisserie chicken from Costco on Thanksgiving. No joke.  As if this wasn't disastrous already, the entree didn't come with fried sticky rice, buttered green beans, and truffled shiitake mushroom sauce as promised on the menu. This is INEXCUSABLE and not to mention, false advertisement.  I also came here for lunch during the summer (thankfully not on my dime). I had the caramelized Maui onion soup and fried snapper sandwich (the latter admittedly tasted good). The soup had about a cup of cheese and what seemed like 1000 calories, though. I can afford 1000 calories, but do I want to use it on this peasant soup?  This just goes to show that everything named butterfly sucks (e.g. Mariah Carey's album, the swimming stroke that I could never master)... And why the butterfly was never a marshmellow in Lucky Charms. It's true.

1UQSkpDqMx0Dp3SYvZ3WNw.review_text: So here's the skinny my friend and I both bought the living socials for here so the first time we arrived we jumped on the happy hour before or reservation. Awesome drinks. I strongly recommend the Cherry Blossom. Are bartender Lindsey (I think) was super friendly and made some super sweet suggestions. She knows her stuff. And when we came back she actually remembered us. I work in the service industry and it's really hard to recall who I waited on a day ago let alone weeks later.  Now that's good customer service she's a gem.  My carnivorous friends loved the food but as a vegan they couldn't offer me much, however they tried their best and where super nice about it. The overall feel of the place is super chill and comfy. I will definitely come back here at least for the happy hour

sqERehdfEuWE9iKyGcKmQw.review_text: We went to this restaurant on Sunday of the Fleet Week. I was shocked... Extremely dirty women's bathroom: one stall broken, no toilet paper, soap dispenser broken. Speaking to women who were waiting in line, several of them were there earlier in the day and the same problems were there hours ago. Management did nothing to address these issues in several hours that they had. I had personally spoken with the host and raised the health hazard concern and he said they knew about the issues, but were "too busy" to address it. That is considering that there were only 3 full tables when we walked in.

SXfvHWScLghzoTSBqb_e6w.review_text: FYL, butterfly. this is a perfect example of why you ALWAYS trust your instincts.   the first time i came here was senior prom [omg, horrific memories..]. we found this place as a last minute dinner spot, and made a reservation for 18 or so. this is where the ridiculous-assness begins. first, they make you sign a contract.   yes. a contract. to eat there.   when i called the restaurant, the woman over the phone told me SEVERAL times that tax and tip are included in the prix fixe prices, of course i was making damned sure because it was high school and we were NOT ballin'. so the day of prom, we arrive late because of crazy traffic and end up just eating our appetizers and having to take the rest of the food to go. then the bill comes, and guess what's tacked on there? TAX AND TIP. i talked to the manager and informed them THEIR employee told me SEVERAL TIMES this was included in the prix fixe price, and he basically said nope, you're shit out of luck, it's in the contract you signed. so yeah, we all had to pony up more cash and it ended up being damned near 82$ each person. strike one. oh yeah, the food sucked balls and was not worth the insane prices. strike two.   fast forward a couple of years, my friend's celebrating her 21st birthday here. she tells us guestlist is open all night, 5$ cover. i shit you not, there are a good 40 of us waiting in line to get in. then around 11 45 the bouncers start yelling that guestlist is over, and we tell them we're here for the birthday party and her guestlist is open all night. "GUEST LIST IS OVER. PAY 25$ OR GET OUT OF LINE!"   uhh, what the fuck. 25$ cover? to get into that tiny ass space? hell no. my friends ask about bottle service, they say some shit about it being 230$ for every 5 people, i don't even know. some of the birthday party come out to try to talk to the dick ass bouncers, it's a no go. strike 3.   never, everrrr again--these folks at butterfly are ripping people off. there are so many better places in the city.

58VeQ6Lfyl7MEQTYE8CkkQ.review_text: 3.5 stars. Stumbled upon the tail end of DAT (dine about town) at Butterfly for weekend brunch. We were actually considering this location as a wedding reception, and with the floor to ceiling windows facing the bay, it definitely would've been a great option if we had a smaller party. It can only accommodate 125 people.  Nevertheless we decided to try a few items on the menu. For $18 on the DAT menu, you get a 2-course lunch. We chose the Kalua Pork Butter Lettuce Wraps as the appetizer and the Tumeric Grilled Snapper as the main. Both were quite delicious.  The Kalua Pork was very very tender as you would expected from slow roasted pork. They cooked theirs in a wood oven rather than a traditional Hawaiian pit. But they do wrap the meat in banana leaves to impart the flavor. Served with cute fluffy butter lettuce leaves, you form your own wrap - lettuce, vermicelli noodles, some sweet sauce and then the pork. Watch out for the juicy dribble that inevitably trickles down the open end of the wrap. The portion is big enough to share with 2 people.  The Snapper was also quite good. Served on a sizzling skillet, the fish had a nice grilled taste. Similar to the Kalua Pork, you also wrap the fish in lettuce, noodles, and sauce. Very fresh and light tasting.  I also ordered the Crab Cake Eggs Benedict ($14). The eggs were perfectly poached (yolk still running but gently firm whites), and the crab cake was full of chunks of crab. Not overly fried, breaded for crisp texture. The hollandaise sauce while creamy wasn't overly thick. The total dish is quite rich, but really well executed. The accompanying fruit salad was a nice sweet break from the savory as well.  Overall, beautiful atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, good food. Butterfly is solid in my book.

3uHtK34U8eP1m9if8nNeiw.review_text: Took hubby there for his birthday over the weekend. We had a such a nice relaxing wonderful dining experience, we'll for sure be heading back.  Drinks were good and different, and the food was amazing! Our waiter was really attentive and friendly, and the place wasn't too loud. We had a table overlooking the water, and not once did we feel rushed.  We started the french onion soup and the lettuce wraps, each were very good. The soup came out piking hot, and the lettuce wraps were delicious. For our entree, we had the hoison glazed ribs and the duck confit. The ribs came with spam brown fried rice, which to our surprised was really really good! We're both not a fan of brown rice or spam too much, but they really knew how to do it right!! The duck confit was cooked perfectly as well.  Thought it was a nice touch that the owner/chef came out and greeted each table. He chatted with us for a bit and wished my hubby a happy birthday. Don't really get that kind of personal service in too many restaurants nowadays.

48m8eDAukj4CqaH_6UyL_Q.review_text: The animal style garlic noodles are always pretty good & the Bloody Mary oyster shooters were yummy too. 2 stars because the strawberry on my drink was moldy. And the lychees on the martinis tasted rotten.

mP2M0FX5orefzux8BboYCg.review_text: After visiting Alcatraz, my wife and I went to Butterfly for a drink... and we stayed for hours. This is a really nice place, great decor and a wonderful view of the bay. We had excellent Dirty Martinis and succulent Bloody Mary Oyster Shooter (the best I've ever had)  We'll be back for sure!

k63XGNVfcHneWn_DF4lRsQ.review_text: Good ambiance.  View of the bay is great !!!  Customer Service is excellent.  Weekend brunch is yummy.  Eggs with Crab Cakes is  suggested. I wasn't too sold on my Chicken Salad Sandwich though =(.

wWfKWkwW4K3QfxzKapu1eg.review_text: Second visit - as good as the first - had the lamb, very tender.  We had a vegetarian with us and she had the black sticky rice, amazing.  Drinks, as always, were beyond perfection.  This is a perfect spot to entertain, ask for Table 29, it is in the back in the corner.  John our host, was perfectly attentive.  Their staff could benefit from a little more wine training, but as we had a sommelier with us, we were okay.  Excellent evening.

DCkdxv7ixqvj85RjY6Lsrw.review_text: Best Fillet mignon recipe iv'e ever tasted in my life!  Bluecheese macadamia Fillet mignon!!!!!!!!   OHM!!!!! -Ambience is awesome! the view from the window is very relaxing and maybe.. romantic!!! LOL -Good drinks from the bar -this place was packed! (coz its awesome duh) -Host was very Nice!  -Chef was really nice! going around and talking to guests.  This place is definitely awesome! bring a date!

JxNuHm-7cSOTyelrktrLcQ.review_text: I've been here a few times. Once for happy hour, and a few times for lunch.  My favorite thing hands down is the steak fries. They're big and they're crispy on the outside, nice and potato-y on the inside. Delicious!  For appetizers I've tried the Garlic Seared Clams/Muscles, Duck Confit Spring Rolls, Fire Fried Calamari, and Shanghai Garlic Noodles. My two favorites were the noodles and the calamari. The calamari is just classic but done up with some delicious cilantro, cucumbers, and tabasco remoulade. Perfect combo of hot, spicy, fresh, and fried. Very fun.  For entrees I've tried the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna, Mushroom Dip Sandwich, and Kobe Beef burger.   The Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna was AMAZING. The black rice and wasabi cream were perfect. All topped with some fresh sashimi tuna. TOO GOOD. It's a small portion, but perfectly delicious. Can't wait to have it again.  The Mushroom dip sandwich was pretty good. Great big chunks of meaty delicious mushrooms paired with the comforting chewiness of melted mozzarella. The macadamia pesto was a nice touch too. Of course the steak fries were perfect as always. The only gripe I have with this dish is the au jus. It was very interesting and had some flavors of sesame oil and green scallions in it. Had a nice Asian twist, but in the end it was too salty. I hate hate hate salty food.   The Kobe Beef Burger was by far the most disappointing dish. Maybe I've changed personal taste preferences, but the Plant Burger down on Pier 3 is so much better than this beefy monster. I've had Kobe Beef burgers at other places, but I can't put my finger on why this one in particular wasn't that good... There is something missing and this dish can definitely be improved. Rather forgettable compared to the other dishes.  Ambience is very nice. Casual and unpretentious. The staff is friendly and professional, but never stuffy. The decor is decent and makes sense with the modern, casual, and slightly east asian vibe. The view is very pretty as well. It's right along the water and even during a gloomy day it's beautiful to see the sea lions or a docked cruise liner right at eye level. During the evening, the view isn't much to look at, but during lunch it's wonderful just to stare out there sometimes.  Chill place. I approve.

WNahjlQlnO2fDkafCbBlHA.review_text: I went here on April 20, 2013 with a large group of friends. One of my friends' friends selected this place. I should have known better. This guy is a mentally-challenged individual. Whoever allowed him to pick the place for our birthday dinner needs to be barred from making decisions in the future.  Let's start with the decor, I have no complaints here. It's got a full bar and barflies to boot. Lots of semi-attractive looking folks hovering the bar. The dining area seating looks like a lounge. It's spread out and part of it is against the wall..which are where the choice seating arrangements are. (in my opinion)   We sat way in the back..by the window which allowed us a nice view of the bay and the adjacent piers next to us. We started with drinks and appetizers. I have to say the appetizers were decent. We had some chicken wings which were large individual portions. Quite tasty.  Everything was cool like Fonzi until the main courses came out.  I ordered a steak and others ordered fish. When my steak came out I was anticipating something good..in light of the appetizers that we had. I thought it would be marvelous. Turns out it was anything but. The quality of the meat was iffy and the entire dinner once we started the main course was horrible. What could go so wrong within a short period of time? I guess anything is possible right? Life is unpredictable.   I try making good choices but seriously. The food was really off. My friends order the fish which came curved on a plate. It was deep fried and curved like they tried to make it into a Michelangelo work of art. The thing looked hideous and tasted like bones. Of course my friends were too gracious to say anything.   As the night wore on, I noticed the place was noticeably empty besides the couple next to us making out. It was disgusting really, there was this ape-like man gigolo with this clammy paws all over this Asian woman who looked like she's been through the wringer. Her face was peeling as her old face betrayed the amount of caked make up on her face. I kept doing double takes because she looked like she was a prostitute. I felt like I was in a bar in Thailand or something. It was seriously awful.    There wasn't much going on..it really gave me the impression that this place is about to shut down at moment's notice. Seriously did. I wouldn't be surprised. I heard from another friend of mine that her uncle works there and told her it was struggling.   Like every restaurant in San Francisco, the food wasn't cheap. But there was a disconnect between the value of the meal we had to the cost of the meal. Hate to complain but it's really one of those places you should probably avoid.  I'm justifying paying the high cost of the meal based upon the decent service we got. The wait staff was good but I keep going back to the food (main course) which was less than zero.

en7_chwI0ELyUFFSJovfKA.review_text: I went to Butterfly many many years ago (prob close to 8 yrs ago) and really loved their food.  Well time passed & today, I finally made it to Butterfly again w/ my husband.   And boy was I disappointed!!    The food was yucky.  The shrimp bisque we ordered was SALTY, SALTY, SALTY.  The calarmi was BLAND BLAND BLAND.    The first time I went to Butterly I had their steak. It was so memorable that everytime I ate steak elsewhere, I would always conclude that the steak I had at Butterfly was still the best. So needless to say, when I came here today, I HAD to order the 22oz steak. It is a big steak, which is meant to be shared.  So we did just that - shared the $40 22-oz steak.  And the verdict : FATTY, FATTY, FATTY.  I don't ever remember eating a steak that is that Fatty.  I was disgusted.  I felt sick and wanted to barf.  :(  Really sad that my previous impression of the best steak-in-town and  Butterfly has gone down the drain... and so far down that it's a point of no return.  What a shame.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: I came here for their Dine About Town this evening and was quite impressed. For $36.95, you get an appetizer, entree, and dessert. The only other time I've been here was when it was turned into a club at night a few years ago. Here's the rundown:  1. Service: I made 6:15pm reservations via OpenTable and we had no trouble getting a window seat for my sister and I. It was kind of awkward that the booth faced the restaurant and NOT the beautiful view, though. Our waiter was very attentive and paced the meal perfectly.  2: Food: I ordered the smoked salmon and strawberry salad roll with nuoc cham sauce for my appetizer and was glad I did! All the components complemented each other perfectly. The smoked salmon and strawberry combination was heavenly and the nuoc cham sauce added that extra subtle punch that amazed me. Five sushi-size pieces had me full right then and there. Next up was the young tumeric grilled snapper, caramelized onions, rice noodles, and nuoc cham dipping sauce. So, the menu failed to mention that these were served as lettuce wraps, which is why it caught me off guard when it was delivered to our table. Side note to those on a date or wanting to impress a fellow diner: don't order this! It can be quite messy trying to hold everything in a lettuce wrap. Everything was presented nicely, but I wasn't too impressed with the snapper. The seasoning didn't have me wanting more, but that nuoc cham sauce got me again and was the saving grace of this dish. Finally, for dessert I ordered the banana bread pudding with Mitchell's macapuno ice cream and banana brûlée. According to their online menu, the options for dessert were supposed to include a warm chocolate torte and creme brûlée, but I'm glad the banana bread pudding was on there instead because it was really good. The melted macapuno ice cream and the warm banana bread pudding was heavenly in my mouth. It's also a good enough portion to share. My sister ordered the warm chocolate torte with Mitchell's coffee ice cream, so I was able to try a bite. It was definitely a rich chocolate dessert!... Maybe even a bit too rich for my taste!  3. Drinks: My sister ordered the kiwi and cucumber gimlet. I tried a sip and it was pretty good. Nice and refreshing for a warm SF evening.  Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with Butterfly. I saw some other food floating around the restaurant like the fried whole fish and the fried calamari that looked pretty good. I'm not sure if I'll be back any time soon just because it is quite pricey, but if you're curious, it's worth a try and just be sure to order the smoke salmon and strawberry salad roll appetizer!

8qpFUPR1wd3uz8N1QaWj_A.review_text: Butterfly is located on Pier 33 along the Embarcadero, relatively close to Pier 39.  Upon arriving and checking in with the hostess, she walked us to our window table with a view looking out to Pier 33.  There was a Princess cruise ship that was preparing to embark, which provided an exciting view from our table.  With our water, we were provided a cup edaname as a mini-starter.  We placed our orders, which we were:  Appetizer:   Caramelized Shrimp and Green Papaya Salad, which consisted of Asian pear and mango, carrot and Srircha Coulis, micro Cilantro.  This was a very refreshing and salad and the ingredients complemented each other.  The six prawns were perfectly cooked.   Very unique and delicious.  Entrée: Sizzling Cowboy Steak, which was a 22oz Rib-eye over Chorizo and tomatoes, caramelized onions and jalapeno, and topped with a ball of green peppercorn butter that's served on a sizzling iron platter.  You also get steak fries that are served in a cup.  A steak made more delicious with the complements that were under it.    Dessert: Banana Lumpia Rolls with warm banana's Foster and a scoop of coconut ice cream.  This was delicious, just wished it was bigger.  The waiter and servers were very friendly and attentive with filling our water glasses and clearing dishes.    Also, Butterfly has a great Happy Hour.  Overall, very good food in a nice scenic setting.

CP7ECIG5MXbZ18LKN2mzrA.review_text: Uncle Mike and I used to come here pretty frequently.  Food was decent and it was nice eating on the water.  There are better restaurants along the piers now but back then this was the place to be.

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: Butterfly is a decent spot located right on the water close to the Alcatraz Ferry pier pick-up.  The food is a little high-priced but being located in this heavily tourist-populated area I can't blame them.  The drinks are good mixtures of alcohol and flavor with something for everyone in the drinking spectrum. Caipirinhas will cool you off while honey-burbon sours will keep you warm and puckered up for a night out.  Grab a drink and head to the next destination is my recommendation.

CP2CzCYK6VmMVN1zOGfzHg.review_text: Came here from San Diego about a week ago with my living social deal. And what a treat it was! Our server Porter was awesome!! Very sweet and extremely helpful. Not to mention the food was out of this world too!! One must try the peking duck, super yum. Needless to say its a great spot, especially for a turo like me :)
