When one of my friends asked about it he became very rude, said that he did it because large parties usually stiff him, and ended up tearing up my friend's check and throwing it at her (after she pointed out that he had accidentally charged her $43 when her total was $15). However the management was patient and kind and resolved the issue with my friend. Other than that, the ambiance was nice, the setting was modern and very clean and tasteful and the view was pretty good. Every table was given edadame with sesame seeds on the house and it was probably the best part of the meal. The clam chowder ($14), which claimed to come in two bread bowls on the menu, came in two glass bowls with a small piece of baguette in one of the bowls. Other than the burgers the portions were pretty small and only of average taste other than a bloody mary ($9) which was excellent and spicy.

xyqnCAQsARyayfkl0dSNKg.review_text: No good views, terrible service. Ignore any other reviews that say otherwise. Or perhaps customers were too intoxicated to know any better. The cocktails looked quite fresh and creative, which may have been the redeeming factor that skewed the other Yelp reviews. We came here for a birthday brunch on a Saturday morning, and we were hoping for a special experience.   Yes, the restaurant looks out into the Bay, but you can't see much except for some murky green water. The restaurant is surrounded on either side by piers, which blocks the view of any land or points of interest. You can barely see to the other side, so it's really just a narrow body of murky water extending out into the distance. We especially requested a window seat, but this wasn't really necessary. // TIP: Check out Cliff House or Caprice for amazing views.//  Yes, we ordered the usual suspects -- duck confit spring rolls, kalua pork lettuce wraps, kalua pig-in-a-hole, and garlic noodles with fried calamari. The duck confit spring rolls were probably the best -- nice and hot and crispy. The lettuce wraps were nothing much. The pork was quite watery for some reason, and the sauces were nothing to be wowed about. The pig-in-a-hole was essentially a heavy and buttered up sandwich. The garlic noodles were not very garlicky at all. The fried calamari in the noodles also wasn't crispy anymore :[ // TIP: Check out Perilla or PPQ for the *real* garlic noodles.//  There was no free desserts or special attention for the birthday customer -- even when we notified them ahead of time. I guess the economy has taken a hit...The waiter was also very curt with us and didn't give us much attention at all. He put the food down quite carelessly (even spilling some of the sauce) and didn't take the time to explain any of the dishes. They also didn't refill our water glasses until we asked, even though the restaurant wasn't very crowded at all. These were all fairly basic expectations for service.   The food is also really not worth the prices they charge here. Definitely wait for a LivingSocial or Groupon deal before you eat here. There are so many great restaurants in SF that unless you're craving Hawaiian fusion, you should save yourself the time and money here and try something else.

KBHmakVoGEMmr7HApROSrg.review_text: We had brunch here with friends from out of town yesterday. We started with a few appetizers, such as the calamari, spring rolls and buttercup lettuce and minced pork. The latter was simply mouth-watering and you cannot get to have enough of it. As for our entrees, they have a wide variety of Asian fusion meals. Because it was brunch, they had more sandwiches and salads on the menu - I had their vietnamese fried snapper and despite of it being fried, I actually liked the flavor and taste of the sandwich. It came in a baguette and personally, I find it hard to sometimes consume a sandwich that comes on a baguette. Other folks had their burgers and based on their remarks about how tasty and delicious their burgers were, I would definitely come back to try it. What was amazing was that somebody ordered their loco moco burger and it came out as this towering burger, with two huge beef patties and egg with all the fixins. The chef stopped by our table to see whether the person who ordered the loco moco burger finished his order. It was so huge that he had to take half of it home. I highly recommend this restaurant if you happen to  be in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Plus, it also helps that they were featured on Check Please, Bay Area.

0W0TzfO6lnPGHw3iWGOfJw.review_text: Came here last weekend for Dine About Town and did brunch. I had never been here before and thought it was really cool decor and the service was good. I had the calamari starter which was DELICIOUS. loved the sauce! Then, I had the chicken sandwhich whic was TOO MUCH. Too big! But still really yummy. My friend and I shared the cobbler dessert (not off the DAT menu) which was really good also. I'd like to come back for dinner and order off the menu. Also, I'd say, bring a sweater...we sat next to the window and it was COLD!

cqCbKnOiYdY3DEEJykzy8g.review_text: Duck confit spring rolls were delicious, they carry 4stars.  Don't try to fool me with the Asian fusion theme and decor if you're going to serve my family tough over-cooked kobe burgers served to the wrong person. I asked for malt vinegar for their fancy fries and got soy sauce.  The Vietnamese Snapper sandwich wasn't very exotic. It was a good fish sandwich with a big slice of cucumber in it.  The martini was small. Maybe they thought we were tourists since we were dressed nice and we had our kids with us. I don't care, I like to be taken seriously.

KAcDjzHu6oL7hisNhGoXxg.review_text: I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area. We went there  expecting the same old sea food menu by the piers but instead a great menu of excellent tasting food. They had good music as well as good atmosphere.

D7JUkHPLskVqZqseDZo65w.review_text: Went here for Livingsocial. Seeing it 3.5 star on yelp, didn't expect much. When I ordered the Kalua lettuce cup, didn't expect much either, thinking how good can it be? but NO was I wrong about both! I have NO CLUE why this place has 3.5 star. The food was AMAZING and the waiter was SUPER nice (unlike some vendors who are grouchy with deals).   Had Kalua pig lettuce cup (5 star) Duck Confitt Roll (3 star) Crab Stuffed Chicken (5 star) and finished off with Molten chocolate cake with Mitchell's coffee ice cream.   Will definitely be back for more!

6YZ0Chq4l2Dtt-sQOQ6pOQ.review_text: Recently went to Butterfly during Dine About Town and had an amazing meal!  We also ordered a few additional items beyond the 2-course $17.95 meal.  The food is delicious, the service always attentive, and the SF Bay views fabulous. We had Fried Calamari, Duck Confit Spring Rolls, Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups, Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herbs, and the Shaking Beef Cobb Salad. I started with the Lycheetini and we ended with the most yummy, Iron Skillet Chocolate Cookie with Mitchell's Mint chocolate chip Ice cream.  The quantity of food is very generous too.  Yes, I have seen some tourists there given the location, but the food, service and views more than make up for the tourist traffic! I highly recommend Butterfly!

MJ4i0xz2gIZj-Uz1QzEuCw.review_text: I discovered Butterfly about a year ago and have been back many times since. Primarily there for dinner and the occasional brunch--it is my favorite SF waterfront restaurant. It's a great space with French style (side-by-side) seating at some of the waterfront tables  which make for a romantic date night. The service is great with friendly hostesses and bar tenders and some of their servers such as Porter (you can read his accolades in other yelp reviews) make for a great experience. But ultimately for me it's all about the food. The food and drink menu changes every few months which can be frustrating when you find a dish you really love, but it's nice that there is always something new and delicious to try. The Cowboy Steak is to die for and don't miss out on the Duck Confit Spring Rolls! My only request: bring back the "Buddha's Hand"--best cocktail ever! Lastly, Chef Rob Lam is a real sweetheart. He's seemingly there all the time and loves circulate around the restaurant to interact with his diners. It's a touch of class that keeps me coming back.

5r9vc1tpt-NCjDXltMrDJA.review_text: We were a party of 6, each one ordered a different item. We all thought that what we just ate was crap!

FVPk2YC8q7bic3CtZiWbwg.review_text: The best parts of this restaurant are the creative food combos, delicious flavorings, and the service. I came here for a DAT dinner, and the menu was just scrumptious - I wanted multiple of the offerings. Great calamari and creme brulee in particular. The chef also came out twice during the meal to talk with us, asked our feedback, and sent a specialty dessert on the house - all of which were tremendous touches.   In terms of ambiance, the views are very pretty - a great setting especially at night. My only drawback is that it can be a bit noisy (very high ceilings) and I felt that the meal as a whole was a bit salty. But, I will definitely be back again.

KXVuEmLdmw5Hr_HNIkTcZw.review_text: Went there for a double date during the SF Dine About Town.  Made a reservation for a Saturday night. I was glad to read my friend Viennelyn C.'s review beforehand and found out that they did not have valet parking. Luckily there's a parking lot across the street from the restaurant, cost about $10 for the night.   Everyone there was very welcome, the interior of the restaurant is very nice as well. I wish we had gone there during the day to see the beautiful view of the bay. Unfortunately our reservation was at 7:30pm. :(  We ordered the calamari, kalau pork lettuce wrap and the cappucino mushroom soup. For main dish, we had the snapper, shaking beef and the vegetarian bento box. Dessert (I thought was the best part), we had the creme brulee and the banana egg rolls with ice cream. My experience there was pretty decent, food was ok, nothing too special about it, therefore I give it a 4 star.

lucIbk6WeQ6Nq0Zr5jrSBA.review_text: Made reservations here on Open Table to get the 1,000 points. The location of the restaurant is a bit off the way or unnoticeable for most tourists.  --FOOD--  --Drinks 01. Lychee martini ($11) -- meh, vodka and lychee juice not proportional, TAO's in Vegas is good 02. Riesling ($7)  --Appetizer 03. Kobe and foie puffs ($15) - fun to eat, small skewers  04. Hamchi sashimi ($15) --good, nice chill sashimi, with an interesting twist of using fish sauce  --Entree 05. Roasted Sonoma Liberty Duck "Peking style" ($32) Pan roasted duck breast, seared duck leg confit, green onion and brown butter crepes, orange segment, and daikon sprouts salad and hoisin cream sauce  --Dessert 06. Vanilla bean creme brulee ($7) topped w/fresh berries & an almond cookie -- custard was light and fluffy, would have thought it'd be thicker, but good 07. Apple and ginger cobbler ($7) topped w/vanilla ice cream (from Michell's... yum) and caramel sauce  Total with tax is $101.99   --OVERALL-- The vibe here is very local, the chef mingles with everyone, and the view is nice. The food is average, not spectacular for SF standards.

7Mt-DvvF8nofWHSfZZcKSA.review_text: Over-rated and over-priced.  You are better-off going to Straits or House where they do fusion right!  Caramelized Maui Onion Soup was disgusting.  It had a thick layer of poorly melted cheese that was cold.  The pairing of flavors was just awful. Garlic noodles were ok. Main dishes... can't recall what we had... yes that memorable.  I asked to take the leftover garlic noodles home but the they threw it away and had to remake it for us.

78C6Unw6FsFN0HGIGEcv7w.review_text: I went to Butterfly for Bruch yesterday. I made a reservation via opentable.com and Butterfly gave us the ge us the best table of the house; everything was great; Bloody Mary with Wasabi...Cordon Rouge Champagne and White wine..The Kalua Pig eggs benedicte, duck confit Spring ROlls, Seared Clams and Mussels... The ONLY negative side was our dear waitress, who had an awsome service, eared my family and I speaking French, and decided to immediatly charged us a 18% service...which was supposed to only apply if party over 6...I talked to her, she felt bad..and me too cuz we did not appreciate it at all..he food is great, view amazing..so Ill go back and I beleive that she learned her lesson.... and BUT, it was our second experience there and ill be back....

mzvvT4sv0rZa7qxzyCDBYA.review_text: we were seated in front of a broken window, at night, in the San Francisco Bay. The cold win was terrible. we asked to be moved to a different table, which they comply hastily. After that, our waiter disappeared. Just showed up to take the order and bring the bill. No questions about the food or more drinks...nothing. Will I return to this place? of course not. The food did not help at all. The prices were to be expected, but nothing good to write about

ioMpTUdOFxr305ojmgvFZQ.review_text: Muhammed Ali, the American heavyweight boxing champion, once said, "I float like a butterfly and sting like a bee."  Butterfly restaurant didn't float, but stung like a bee.  It wasn't fight night, but a work function, with our spouses.  The twenty of us dinned family style on the appetizers and had our own main dish.  This is the first place where I had dinner where the wines were the stars.    The three appetizers of duck breast egg roll, deep fried calamari and luau pork lettuce wraps came out.  The egg roll was crunchy and the duck was blandly seasoned.  The sweet sauce that accompanied the rolls was ok at best, runny and not thick.  The calamari was lightly seasoned and chewy, though it was crunchy on the outside.  I passed on the pork wraps.    The mixed green salad, piled high was lightly dressed. I could almost taste the vinaigrette upon the leaves.  The gold and red beets were diced nicely and barely made my taste bud radar.    It was well worth the wait for the server to bring out the wine we selected.  But while we waited, the mains came out.  The New York Strip with mushrooms came out medium-rare exactly to my liking.  I searched with my fork for the mushrooms, and found one slice, yes A slice.  The mashed potato was diluted...almost watery.  The toasted macadamia nut and blue cheese topping were a nice surprise.  It was very creative.    The bottle of Shafer 06 Merlot was the highlight of the meal.  It was very bold for a merlot and pleasingly smooth, berries forward and medium finish, not too short of a finish as merlots, to me, tend to be.  The wine had a deep aubergine color.  The nose was that of a new car, with leather seating.  You know, that deep breath of soft supple leather, ahhhh!    The  1/2 bottle of Duckhorn 06 Merlot had its own notes.  At first sniff, it wasn't not very delightful, but the first sip, smooth, berries-forward and a hint of oak.  It had a nice medium ruby red color.   Butterfly is touristy.  Is it Asian or Californian cuisine? Fusion perhaps?  The dishes didn't appear to commit one way or the other.  The caterpillar should've stayed in the cocoon until it finds it's identity.  Not a butterfly now, but maybe a moth?  I would return if the favors popped and it finds its indentity.  I want to taste the sweet, sour, salt and savory.   Make my taste buds float like a butterfly.

Kl9-VA0M5YObB7i4IpDkPQ.review_text: Got to go here for dine about town with a bunch of my friends.    I got to order duck confiet springrolls, chicken salad sandwich with bacon and french fries, and a creme brulee for dessert.  In retrospect, I'd give the meal a solid B.  the springrolls were disappointing and even worse the creme brulee.  However my chicken salad was HUGE and delish, and my friend's calamari was out of this world!  I would go back again to order from the menu.  Plus the drinks there were innovative and very refreshing.

8pJiotOeaJ1sEKcOgZMtvw.review_text: In the bay area, you would expect that a fusion restaurant would be better than this.  Especially for the price of food they are asking.  Happy hour is good.  And their after hour parties do well.  But for main dinner, you might want to go elsewhere.

6rKCymYaUjirqAjx2iDCrQ.review_text: Was all hyped to go to Alcatraz, we get there and the guy comes on the PA saying the weather is too bad and the tour has been cancelled, huh? So we disembark and start walking when I see people hanging outside of this door munching on fresh buns with meat oozing out of them. Thats all it took. Ordered a chicken sano, wife gets terry bowl with egg and son gets the same. We walk a block and find some shade and throw down our food.  This was the take out side of the restaurant. The only down side is having to find a place to eat, perhaps some chairs somewhere??

vcudFvE9T6_wV-2zEA9-iw.review_text: I had a great Dine About Town experience at Butterfly - ignore the bad reviews below, most of them are about getting charged for a Diet Coke refill and from silly tourists. We got the duck spring rolls, the calamari, the steak entree and the creme brulee desert. Service was a little slow (-1 star), but that wasn't a major issue for us since we were having a nice ladies night and gorging ourselves with 3 courses so the time to digest was appreciated. Everything was delicious, if I do come again I'll probably order apps and drinks, though the steak was really good,  it was pretty rich and we probably could have split it.

clkXCHfnAiFsjwU5rnUuxg.review_text: Only stopped in for a cocktail on my walk down to fisherman's wharf. I am an extremely big fan of mojitos and have had them all over the world. As I was sitting down at the bar I heard a customer thank the bartender for the great mojito on his way out, so of course, I had to try it.....and YEP it was probably on my top 3 list of best mojitos EVER!! As far as food, it looked good but didn't get a chance to taste it and just a lil set back was it kind of smelled a little funny in there. Don't know if that was a 1 time deal or what but all in all it was cool.

9RkL3lRhtAkPUIVyB8_07Q.review_text: My friends and I found this place walking to Pier 23.  We decided to just check it out for drinks and ended up staying for lunch.  We sat out on the pier and enjoyed the view of the bay and warm breezes. The best part is that there was not a ton of tourists running around...which was surprising given the area. The food, at least for lunch, was good and reasonably priced.  The menu was pretty interesting too with not the usual "asian fusion" dominating the selections. Check this place out for lunch at least.  It looks like some people have varying opinions for dinner...so proceed with caution after 5:00pm. Sunny D travelswithsunnyd.com

eUdIwZeXq6eYfrTiqcaF_A.review_text: Fun atmosphere, very accommodating staff, and delicious food.  Only 3 stars because my girlfriend and I had a very upset stomach after dinner.  Maybe it was just too rich for us?  Not sure.  I'd go again but next time I'll be more cautious.

tIRh_AmxJhUgzoHUBMPnlA.review_text: Per fellow yelp member suggestion.  We had a girls nite out past Saturday. This is our first time actually dining here at Butterfly. We've been here before but only for after party.  It seems that nite eventhough it was raining, Bacholerrette and bday party full of girls were the theme. Oh I didn't expect to bumped into my Chief of Medicine at Butterfly that night.   Ryan (I think he's part owner of Butterfly) was very gracious and gave us a great table. While were waiting for the table, he bought us  rounds of mojito, w/c by the way - taste delicious. It was 45 mins later than our reservation & he felt bad coz the other party decided to chill while we were waiting for them to pay.  Our bartender named Jeff were great. He made our drinks all night.  Our food took while, so Ryan once again decided to buy us rounds of drinks, 5 girls decided to have cranvodka, 1 Whiskey & coke and the rest of the girls opted for free desserts.  Our food once it arrive was delicious except for the sauce on the egg roll (it's too mustardy). The chef decided to go over our table and asked how was the food, we answered great except for the egg roll. He then gave us free spring roll, w/c is yummy (I'm going by my friends answer who happens to be Vietnamese). ^_^ Our server memorize 11 girls orders and she too was good.  We had such a great time, we were treated like VIP. Were coming back.

eXM67alQxlrA_hMCQ3S0qQ.review_text: You tricked me Butterfly! With your fancy decor and yummy sounding food.  2.5 stars.  We went here on the first day of Dine about Town. Half of my party went with the DAT and the other half decided to order stuff straight from the regular menu.  DAT was a good deal if you get the right items. Don't go for the vegetarian bento box for DAT, you're better off just ordering it off the regular menu.  DAT: Calamari- good. the sauce had a good kick Kalua pig- nicely seasoned and tender...kalua pig should be even more flavorful and tender though.  Hanger Steak- the hubby didn't find it anything special Grilled Snapper- fish was yummy but the build your own set up with the lettuce wrap and noodles and fish sauce became annoying after a while.  Banana Lumpia- tasted good but I've had better. Plus the ice cream underneath was melted within seconds from having the hot lumpia on top. The bowl set up doesn't work well. Creme Brulee- solid  Regular menu: Baby back ribs- my friend was quite disappointed. Flavor was good but the meat didn't fall off the bone. Also, he said the meat tasted gamey. That's just weird for pork. Crispy Fried Fish- my friends loved it. said it was one of the best fish dishes they've had.  The food was a hit or a miss. The service however was a MISS.  Our server was a nice guy but slow. And the restuarant was only 1/3 full so we expected the service to great.  The planning of when food came out was all off. After our appetizers, we just waited for the entrees. Luckily we were having a great conversation to mind it as much but still...the timing could have been A LOT better.

8qo_WtzUDkM7QisAhUM4Gw.review_text: Sweeping bay views, upscale décor, uniquely outstanding Asian Fusion cuisine, and Master Chef Robert Lam are just a few thoughts that jump into my mind when I think about my dining experience at Butterfly. After tearing my eyes away from the breathtaking views of the sunlight dancing on the water through the floor-to-ceiling windows, I started my meal with the Sesame Edamame, Bloody Mary Oyster Shooter, Fried Calimari, and the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups. I must admit that all of these appetizers were quite delectable, but my hands-down favorite was the Kalua Pig. This dish was presented with a small mound of succulent shredded pork, pepper brunoise, toasted cashews, minced green onions, and tantalizing hoisen barbeque sauce, and crisp butter lettuce leaves, all waiting to be assembled into a perfect small bite. Now I love shredded pork, but when combined with all of these unique flavors and textures, I was tempted to make this my main course...it was that good! Luckily, I did save room after the appetizers for my main course. The Macadamia and Blue Cheese Crusted Filet Mignon seemed to be calling me as I perused the various choices on the eclectic menu. Let me just say that the filet mignon was absolutely superb. Each tender bite released the rich, deep, flavor of the meat in the port wine demi-glace. The filet mignon was nestled in a bed of whipped potatoes that was bathed in a mushroom jus de veau. Asparagus and carrots completed this amazing dish, by adding freshness, color, and texture. I ate every last bite and enjoyed every minute doing so. So what would you pair with these two stellar dishes, the Kalua Pig appetizer and the Macademia and Blue Cheese Crusted Filet Mignon? Well, to answer this question I went directly to Chef Robert Lam, who was named 1 of 6 "Rising Star Chefs" by the San Francisco Chronicle. He recommended a Chimay Blue Belgian Ale or a Honey Bourbon Sour with the Kalua Pig. For the filet, he suggested a glass of Reverie Cabernet Franc or Falcor Sangiovese, as well as the Cherry Blossom cocktail. Don't miss out on a chance to dine at Butterfly. Not only will you fall in love with the view and ambience, but you will also get to experience the culinary vision and expertise of Master Chef and owner Robert Lam. Featured in my Bin On the Town editorial in the latest issue of Beverage Industry News mag: facebook.com/pages/BIN-M…

ykbPOAib9gRcxnxHBQbs1g.review_text: Interesting food.  A little expensive but great location.

TLUtNZomMJrRANnWSy4o3Q.review_text: Got a fish sandwich for lunch, Fish was great, but bread was very  Big and toasted very hard, had to take Off the top piece , just to be able to eat  It, which made it not worth the price Nice restaurant , nice service, not my type  Of food

owpZQcA90evLn9twKo_1kQ.review_text: First off, gorgeous setting, pretty interior, nice ambience.  Yeah, yeah, "Asian Fusion" is never a good sign, my fiance reminds me. I remind him of the strip mall back home with the wonderful Asian Fusion menu. He reminds me that it's not Asian Fusion, but a place that has several different kinds of Asian cuisine on the same menu.  Anyway, Butterfly doesn't just have Asian fusion, it's got whatever fusion on the menu. I started with a "spicy Caiparinha" drink, which is a well known (almost mojito-like) Brazilian cocktail. The spicy was obtained by infusing the alcohol with fresh jalapeno! Well, then, it was "interesting." Not sure I'll seek it out again.  But here's my complaint: there's a "Vietnamese sandwich" on the menu with fried snapper on the menu. You read the description and if you're like me, say to yourself "Fish Banh Mi, awesome, I'll take it!".   It's not a fish banh mi or any other kind.  Mind you, if you like fried fish sandwiches, you might like this. It's got a bit of shredded pickled carrot and daikon. A bit. The baguette is not fresh. There's plenty of fresh jalapeno and a bit of cucumber. But there's none of the other goodness that goes into a proper banh mi. So you have a fried fish sandwich with some salt and spice and no sweetness that you can taste. So I'm not sure anyone who's tasted a real Vietnamese sandwich has created this thing or tasted his/her creation in a while. Which annoys me.  Fiance had some sort of 12,000 calorie cobb salad fusion thingie which tasted OK to me, but I didn't taste the blue cheese which he said didn't go with the rest of the flavors at all. He liked his Anchor Steam, however.

9wJR0HuU6AWSaUD7OujbLg.review_text: Decent food, good service. Fantastic drinks! And such a  view!

LOx6CIKwtHocXSBazG3aCw.review_text: nothing in this club resembles or reminds me of a butterfly. nothing flying around. no butterfly effect. no wings.  1 star for misrepresentation.

TeBkVYLv_tN0uFyudi-QAQ.review_text: I wouldn't hurry back.  The food was okay, but not great.  Some was conceptually interesting (the duck confit spring rolls) but didn't deliver.  The onion soup the a few of my co-diners got looked awesome, with about a cup of cheese.  I had the turmeric snapper, served with cold noodles and lettuce for wrapping.  It tasted good, but didn't wow me.

UYZaM86Jfj9Zdmnad_aJ8A.review_text: I've been here for lunch a few times and I can't believe that this place is not over-crowded with Fidi peeps or any SF'ers for that matter. I think the food is delicious and reasonably priced. It's definitely asian fusion with most of its dishes taken from Vietnamese cuisine. The portion size varies from dish to dish. For the most part, I think the sizes are perfect.  Here are the dishes that I've tried on my visits.  EDAMAME - This is complimentary and its deliciously different. It tastes like its soaked in sesame seed oil and the finest salt. MMmm.  FIRE FRIED CALAMARI ($9) - Generous portion of calamari with a twist. It is seasoned with garlic and accented by marinated cucumbers and bell peppers. LOVE THIS!!  KALUA PIG WITH BUTTER LETTUCE CUPS ($11) - My friends ordered this and I would describe it as "hiding the delicious fatty goodness". My friends really loved it.  FRIED RED SNAPPER SANDWICH WITH FRIES ($10) - The sandwich was delicious. I really liked the spicy chili and garlic rouille that flavored it. The fries were thin and seasoned with pepper and some other spice? Anyways, DELICIOUS!  SHAKING BEEF COBB SALAD ($12) - OH MY GOD! I don't normally eat beef. Someone told me this was absolutely delicious, so I tried it. Yum, yum, yum...  SASHIMI TRIO SALAD ($15) - My friend had this and really enjoyed it, however, he said the portion was small and was hungry after.   COCONUT CURRY CHICKEN AND SATAY ($12) - My friend had this and she thought it was good. However, she said the portion was small and had better for less.  TURMERIC GRILLED SNAPPER WITH SIZZLING ONIONS AND HERBS ($15) - Four of my friends tried this and all of them were equally satisfied. They really enjoyed the turmeric seasoned fish.   AMBIANCE - The other great thing about this place is that it faces the waterfront. The side facing the waterfront has floor to ceiling window all the way across. The view is beautiful and peaceful.  SERVICE - The staff was friendly and attentive. My drinks were replenished without asking and they already made sure we had everything we needed.

3Mz8KKBGcKesPpeE8-L8VQ.review_text: Lovely meal with a friend who had seen Butterfly reviewed on Check Please some time ago.   Surprisingly easy parking, very attentive service, and delicious food.  Great view!  A little noisy, but that is because of the configuarion of the building.  What do you expect with concrete floors!  Did not feel that we were easdropping on someone elses converstaion and vice versa.  A lovely dining experience and just may stop in for lunch.  LOVED the duck spring rolls.

fesVmoka_Voo5fUpGOMdfA.review_text: New York kalbi is from another planet.   Unbelievable taste. Great service and amazon location is a bonus.   Better book in advance for the summer because this place will be packed during America's Cup.

n2UsVjISE1nOow63cm3auQ.review_text: Every lengthy business trip should end the way mine did yesterday: with a luxurious, relaxed meal in a classy restaurant. Exhausted from a week-long drive up the California coast, my two co-workers and I drove into San Francisco for lunch before our late-afternoon flight home. We caught a glimpse of Butterfly as we drove down the Embarcadero and decided to hop across the street and give it a try. The interior of the restaurant alone took my breath away, though I don't have much to compare it to. (It's the only SF restaurant I've been to since I was about 8.) The frames of every streetside window are painted bright red, and despite the high ceilings and crisp white tablecloths, something about how the room is situated saves it from feeling remote and overly spacious.   We were seated at a table right by the waterside windows, per our request (what tourists). To start, our server brought us chilled edamame dressed with olive oil, black sesame and pink sea salt, a fantastic alternative to the cliched bread and olive oil you come to expect from restaurants today. We quickly decided on our meals, one shrimp with green papayas and two chicken skewers with curry, and waited patiently for the food to arrive. We certainly weren't disappointed. I can speak only for my curry, but it was lovely. The dish was a little different than I imagined, served in a white coffee cup with a perfectly spicy yellow curry "soup" with lemongrass, onions, tomatoes and potatoes. Topped off with a warm, crusty roll and some chilled butter, it was the best way I can think of to fill my stomach before the long flight home.  The view across the water showed the backside of some of the piers, and compared to the guys eating their bag lunches with their legs hanging off toward the water, I'd say we did all right for ourselves.

64U_zdf8wtqkbXcuinug2A.review_text: food was great, will go back again

jCLG0K5ygx1n4r4jSWGkuQ.review_text: Don't order seared tuna dish, then you will be fine. I had Kalua Pig With Butter Lettuce Cups and Sonoma Liberty Duck Confit Spring Rolls  for an appetizer and it was great. my main dish was boring. Tuna was not the best quarity. But my friend ordered Five Spice Braised English Short Rib and said it was great. I think I should have ordered that instead. Good ambiance and good services.  I heard that there are good happy hour deal.

AVSylpAISyFs1cDryDpskQ.review_text: A little off the beaten path, Butterfly had friendly service and generous portions.  The duck spring rolls were delicious!   I loved the smoke salmon benedict -- the smoke salmon had a great texture (tender and no hint of slime). The accompanying french fries were addictive.  The Pig in the Hole was also good, though lost out in the competition for stomach space to the above.

WXRNzCFPKkUM5iCQLz-qXA.review_text: Didn't enjoy the food too much, but over all everything was ok. The one thing I really enjoyed was the ocean views.

355W7iKObLwu3greKAJcqQ.review_text: Tear. So, I used to live a few blocks from Butterfly, and it was my go to for happy hour and brunches.  I loved Kimmy, the sweet bartender, who like myself, moved away to NYC.  Sadly, upon my last visit, I was sadden to see that my old go to has declined so drastically - or at least the bar service has.  We arrived mid afternoon on a Saturday, around 3-4 pm, so the place was pretty vacant.  I ordered a bloody mary and my boyfriend ordered their take on the mojito, with sake.  As a bloody aficionado, its rare that I LOVE a bloody (zuni!), but also rare that i despise one.  This bloody, was truly AWFUL.  As in the lady next to me wasn't drinking hers at all (arrived before we did), and eventually ordered a water to chase the bloody with.  We asked the super unfriendly bartender if they changed up the mix and it was no longer homemade...he bluntly said it's still homemade, and whats the problem, is it too spicy? I replied that i LOVE spicy bloodies, but there's something like an overwhelming celery taste to it (i believe mucho celery salt), which he basically said no, and awkwardly stood there, aware that it was undrinkable, yet not bothering to do anything about it.  Essentially, as my boyfriends drink wasn't great and the rest of the menu options left much to be desired, i tried to chug my bloody (making faces of anguish at every sip, unintentionally), so we could get the f out of there.  Left it half full.    Horribly rude bartender (he also looked a bit sloppy, not in attire, but in general physical maintenance) + undrinkable bloody = won't miss living a few blocks away from anymore.

c6WaUvt42r-s70VSXZa5Ow.review_text: Dear Yelp,  Oh dine about town, or DAT as I like to call it, as in DAT time of year when my friends are willing to fork out some cash for a semi expensive meal.  Of course, as we all know, DAT merely creates the illusion of a good deal.  The portions on the DAT menu always seem smaller than usual, and I sure as heck don't need a dessert, so I always choose to order something off the regular menu.  Anyway, where to begin with Butterfly?  I guess I'll start with the service, since I didn't even get to eat any food.  I ordered the Ahi Tuna, because our server personally recommended it.  As with any Ahi Tuna dish, you gots to order that shit as rare as possible, which I did.  I was feeling pretty jovial that night, so I ordered the table a nice (ie: expensive) bottle of wine.  I mean, what are friends for right?  So our server friend opens the wine and begins to pour.  Strangely enough, he poured some of this nice wine into my friend's glass, which already had some other wine in it.  Strike 1.  I let the wine incident slide; chalk it up to inexperience.  Plus, it turns out that the mixture didn't taste so bad.  Then my Ahi Tuna comes out, except it isn't rare.  In fact, it isn't even red, it's white.  I call our server buddy over and tell him that he must have grabbed the wrong fish.  He informs me that they were out of the Ahi Tuna, but what I got was good also.  So just to clarify, this guy recommends that I order the Ahi Tuna, asks me how I want it cooked, and then waits until the food is ready to tell me that they're out of it.  Got it?  Strike 2.  Our server chum gives me two options at this point: either keep the dish he gave me (on the house) or order something new, which I would have to pay for.  Let me get this straight, I either get the shit I didn't order for free, or pay for an entirely new entree?  Yeah, okay.  Seeing as my friends had pretty much finished their meals, I told him to take the food away and forget about it.  It was at this point that he started calling me "bro."  Strike 3.  Here's a tip for all you servers out there: when you continually fuck up a customer's dinner, under no circumstance should you call him "bro," no matter how young he might appear.  Especially if this customer just bought a $100 bottle of wine.  I give Butterfly a fantastic score of 0 out of 5 stars (Yelp really needs to let its users give out 0 stars).  Love, James

eyOPuZ8DgdpTuX9PzwsZWw.review_text: Had a great evening here.  Service was rushed at the entrance.  One minute my wife was with me, the next minute she was sitting at a table...what about me??  From there things were outstanding.  Our waiter was super attentive without being obtrusive.  He made great wine recommendations.  Appetizers were duck rolls and kalua pork.  Both were wonderful.  Braised short ribs had delicate flavors and were outstanding.  Cowboy steak was positively huge!  Interesting as the steak was a bone-in ribeye laid over house made chorizo and onions.  Nobody rushed us and we enjoyed our meal for 3 hours.  Get the shaved Lychee ice for dessert.  Fantastic!

ztMm3F1NFsDXyEPTKvsB3A.review_text: I think this is turning out to be one of my favorite restaurants. Chicken wing, duck spring roll, and Kalua pig lettuce cup appetizers are awesome. I've also had shaking beef salad with a soft cooked egg. Yum. Hanger steak was delicious. I've been there for lunch and dinner and each time was seated with a view from the bay. Service is wonderful.

vD65y5E3Az3bFc6UW4G1eA.review_text: I made reservations three weeks in advance to ensure that we would have a place to eat on Easter Sunday.  The reservations were made, confirmed, and we were ready to have brunch on the water.  When we arrived, our plans for a beautiful brunch were spoiled.  Upon check in, the lady said,  "We have your reservation, but due to the holiday, you can only have the table for 45 minutes."   I responded, "I would rather sit at the bar, if you plan to kick us out of the table that we reserved."  "No. We won't actually kick you out. But you can only have the table 45 minutes. I just need to let you know, prior to seating you."  As expected, that really irritated me.  To my very obvious frustration, I said, "No thank you, and we'll sit at the bar, if you plan to kick us out."   As we sat down at the bar, and ordered drinks, the lady came back and offered us a table, that "we could have longer than 45 minutes."  We sat down and attempted to enjoy a mediocre meal as we witnessed an abundance of empty tables that sat much longer vacant for 45 minutes.  All in all, I was here for a legal function happy hour a couple years ago, and enjoyed the atmosphere and crowd.  But after coming here for brunch in the daylight, this restaurant may need additional training for the front end of their house.

eqOr3xmIefiFPEhRFmandQ.review_text: This was my first trip to San Francisco and we ended up at this restaurant mostly by chance (right place at the right time).  I was a little nervous when we walked in because it was dark and swanky, but as soon as the hostess opened her mouth my fears were dissuaded.  Everyone was so nice, our waitress was so patient, and the food was fantastic.  Definitely try the garlic noodles, YUMMY!  I

A37BRSnxp6FimXOnJKwlzw.review_text: Yelp or owner of the restaurant:  You should break out the business into two categories or business on Yelp so users can review Butterfly the restaurant and Butterfly the club.  This benifits Yelp users and the owners of the restaurant.  The one star reviews from club goers whining about standing in line for too long are not helping your restaurant business. I say this because I had a great dinner last week and Butterfly is better than the current 3.5 rating.    The location and view are great.  There aren't many restaurants in SF that have that type of view.  The service the entire night was spot on from the hostess, bussers and server.  The wine list is above average:  Flowers Pinot!  The food is fresh and well thought out.  We had the lettuce cups, sea bass, filet and banana bread pudding.  All were cooked perfectly and well executed.  The bread pudding was one of the best deserts that I've had in a while.  The pricing is quite reasonable for the quality and waterfront dinning.  On top of this all.  The owner/chef, Robert makes his rounds to all of the tables to make sure everyone was satisfied.  He genuinely cares and strives to make sure you had an enjoyable time.  Something that you rarely see in S.F.  4.5 rounded up to 5.  Filter out the 1-2 star reviews about the club or the anything that doesn't relate to the dining experience.  As I mention, this place is much better than the current 3.5 rating.

9YzE6ybg4Trnsd4kkXWEnQ.review_text: I really like this place!  Beautiful view of the water, tasteful decor inside, good service, and great menu.  I have tried several of the things on the menu over several occasions and always been impressed with the creativity and quality.  Granted, I had some comments for the chefs on one of the dishes that I thought could have been prepared a little differently, still 5 stars.  It's a cool spot - casual and yet swanky - good for business meetings, birthdays, touristy meal after Alcatraz, anniversaries, first dates, etc.  Great for brunch/lunch as well as dinner.  And great dessert menu!  I wouldn't recommend coming here in your tuxedo or prom dress, but it's definitely more upscale than people think it is.  I come here during the work day in my business suit, and I see many others in suits also.  However, there are casual tourists that drop in also.  It's a mix of people.  I have had the Baby Fields Green Salad twice now.  It has Manchego Cheese, "Nuoc Cham" Vinaigrette, Oranges, and carmelized Cashew Nuts.  It is really light, refreshing, and the dressing is great.  I never knew that Nuoc Cham could be so tasty on lettuce! I normally don't like cashews, but I found myself eating every single one on the plate.    My friends say that the Duck Confit Spring Rolls are divine, but I can't handle spicy food, so I have never tried it.  Apparently they are SUPER spicy (in a good way).    The Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic noodles with minced scallions and toasted garlic is awesome.  It's like ultimate hangover/drunk food, but it is great sober too.  Granted, the dish is a little pricy I guess because it's $10 just for the noodles and then if you want to add stuff, it's even more.  Chicken is $5, shrimp is $7, kalua pig is $5, calamari is $5, and shaking beef is $6.    A new menu item is the Carmelized Shrimp and Green Papaya salad with Mango, Micro Cilantro, Carrot and Siracho Coulis, Toasted Shallots.  Huge strips of papaya with fresh juicy mango and perfectly prepared shrimp.  It's a filling salad too.  Definitely doable as an entree if you're not super hungry.  $11 is reasonable for the size of this salad.     Another new menu item is the Ahi Tuna Tempura Roll with Thai Black Sticky Rice, Wasabi Coulis, Ginger Crème Fraiche.  There's a lot going in in this roll and when I tried it, it was like the first week that they were debuting it.  I think that they are still changing it around a little, but HUGE rolls and really filling.    My friend had the House Smoked Salmon and Strawberry Salad Rolls with Spicy Garlic and Ginger Dipping Sauce.  I'm not a huge smoked salmon fan, so I didn't try this one, but the rolls were HUGE.  My friend was really into them though and devoured them exclaiming "omg sooo good!"  As for entrees, I have tried the Mushroom DIp Sandwich with Toasted Sweet French Baguette, Macadamia Pesto, Mozzarella Cheese, and Soy Au Jus (a bit too much dipping sauce for me).  I have also tried the Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herbs.  This dish comes with Cold Rice Noodles, Vietnamese Herbs Salad, and "Nuoc Cham" Dipping Sauce.  You get big buttercup lettuce leaves and wrap the snapper in the lettuce with the noodles and dipping sauce.  It was delicious but really messy!  The lettuce kept splitting in half with the weight of the snapper, so it would be great if this dish had the thin rice paper that you dip in water to make rolls....more structure to the rolls to make it less messy maybe.  However, it was tasty so I didn't mind too much about it being a messy dish.   If you like seafood and Asian cuisine, definitely try the Lemongrass Seafood Minestrone with Thai Basil and Cashew Nut Pesto, Israeli Toasted Couscous, Parmesan.  This didn't sound appealing, but it's GOOD!  Tons of seafood, great flavor, and a new twist on minestrone.    Dessert was a memorable part of the meal.  So much that I would recommend even coming here just for dessert.  As a banana lover, I absolutely loved the Banana Bread Pudding with Mitchell's Macapuno Ice Cream and Banana Brulee.  Omg...seriously banana heaven.  Perfectly baked in the oven with the right amount of bread pudding....and can't go wrong with some ice cream from Mitchell's on the side!  Perfectly ripe bananas too.  I also love the Iron Skillet Chocolate Chip Cookie with Mitchell's mint chocolate chip ice cream.  The cookie is HUGE!  Please see my picture for a size reference....seriously bigger than my hand.    Overall, great experiences at Butterfly and I will be returning.

B4hUusu6xi0fVml3HwYo1g.review_text: Dinner with Living Social deal, party of 2.  Based on other Yelpers' suggestions,we had for appetizers:  = Duck confit spring rolls. These were great, nicely crispy and not greasy. Great mustard sauce with it too. = Kalua pork lettuce cups - also very good. Huge portion, and nicely accompanied by the butter lettuce wraps.  For entrees, we got:  = The Shanghai garlic noodles animal style (with shrimp, pork and beef). This dish was in a huge bowl, and could easily have fed both of us. This dish was very good, nice amount of meat, and the beef was nicely cooked - not overcooked. Shrimp was nicely done, not overdone, and tasty. Pork was good as well. Slightly oily, as others had mentioned, but not bad.  = Turmeric catfish, served with rice vermicelli and butter lettuce to wrap. I was disappointed in this dish. The fish was nicely done, but I really didn't taste any turmeric at all.  Dessert - we split a creme brulee. As others had mentioned, the sugar crust was sort of thick and hard, but it was ok with me. The custard was soft, and not too firm. It was an ok brulee, not the absolute best I've had, but nothing close to the worst.  The price was ok, but glad we had the Living Social deal.  Pretty inside, with cool decor. We sat under a light fixture/sculpture that looked like a huge sea urchin.  And regarding what others said about not being able to see outside, despite being on the water - come on, if there aren't any lights outside, how could you see anyway? (We sat by the windows, and were able to see the bay ferries when they passed by.)

Kv8URxIr7_cL0ItdATToMw.review_text: I went there for dinner on a Friday night. It was extremely loud. I could barely hear the person sitting next to me. The food was alright. I had the ahi tuna. I had it rare and my table mate had it supposedly medium rare. Hers came back well done. I actually though she had ordered the steak?The edamame appetizers were disgusting!   It had some sesame oil/sauce on it. The view of the bay was OK since you can't really see much in the dark. It is a bit pricey but you're in a restaurant in SF and along the bay?

elS2lEZV63V7uypJ7Z5cOg.review_text: A lot of great review on yelp, this was one of the main reason why we decided to come here to celebrate NYE. We had a pretty big party too, about 15+ of us...Tickets close to $100. Ok, must be worth it, looks like a great location, nice place......open bar starting at 9:30pm.....we just wanted a GREAT TIME.....HA I was there early because I didn't want to wait in the cold, I wanted to get in ASAP. NOPE. BECAUSE OF THE DAMN DINNING CUSTOMERS, we did not get in til 11something PM. OMFG. piss? YES. will I ever come back for NYE.....haha NOPE. You know it's NYE, you open your venue up for a NYE event....people paid $100+ to get in to enjoy the night, why didn't you plan and organize dinner much more efficiently!?!?!? Haven't ate here yet, but bc of the NYE event, I'm pretty iffy about coming near here.  oh, didn't see the fireworks either. no view of it what so ever. so if u plan to come here for nye thinking u may be able to see anything....think again because you can't. waste of my count down. money. and time. prob have more fun roaming around the pier with my friends.  ***OH BTW GIRLS, beware of the floor if you're wearing heels...I almost slipped right when I walked in, and I actually fell later on the night because a girl in front of me slipped and she held on to me and I slipped with her, note I was not drunk yet. Pretty bad condition for a club event with floors like that.

sVpvJCZsLzoyBlwK5X_yhw.review_text: Butterfly is an exceptional restaurant with fantastic food and wonderful service by a professional yet friendly staff.  I've been dining at Butterfly for the past 9 years (at their former and now current location) and I have never once been disappointed.    Although, I think I've tried everything on their menu at least once (or had a bite of it off someone else's plate, here are a few of my tried and true favs:  - Shanghai garlic noodles - Kahlua pig - Mussels & Clams in coconut curry - Salmon and strawberry spring rolls - Mixed green salad - Cesar salad - Cowboy steak - Hangar steak and, drum roll please.... - Banana Bread Pudding w/Coconut ice cream (to die for!)

icGEmAPhj2pIyXe8maV6WQ.review_text: I had heard of this chef inspired by his mom to experiment with Asian Fusion.  I'd say he's done a fairly good job taking typical Asian dishes, and melding them with an atypical preparation method.  Now, by no means am I a food connoisseur, but I do know what traditional Asian food tastes like.  We ordered the shiu mai appetizer, which was quite tasty, though nothing extraordinary.  The main-entrees of duck and spare-ribs were delectable.  I would describe them as "fall-off-the-bone" good.  Afterward, we made the mistake of ordering separate desserts (peach cobbler and banana cake), which both tasted amazing, but were too filling.  I had absolutely no complaints with the food, as the entire meal was delicious.    The interior decor had very avant garde features, sporting sea-urchin resembling light fixtures, with a combination of dim-red / baby blue lighting on a predominantly black background.  The noise ambiance at Butterfly is very conducive for conversation, and the wait-staff are very friendly.    What kept me from giving this place the 5-star rating was that though the food tasted wonderful, it didn't seem to strike me as anything extraordinary.  Though the melange of atypical preparation method with typical Asian dishes were refreshing, it didn't strike me as "WOW-worthy."    Nevertheless, I would highly recommend a dining experience at Butterfly because the food really is delicious, the ambiance is nice, and its location at Pier 33 makes it a nice option for both lunch and dinner.

jxJZbcUfWHITb_g51BwDkg.review_text: We saw this place featured on a television  program. On a day trip to San Francisco we decided to give it a try. Upon entering the restaurant, the hostess was deeply engaged in her cellphone and the bartender just glanced at us and walked away. No greeting, no smile, nothing. We stood there while the other diners looked at us with scrunched faces. When the hostess finally out her phone down and asked us if we'd like to join her for a table, we were seated at an awkwardly situated table against a column. The decor is a little dated and mismatched. Our server came for our drink order and we ordered our apps at the same time.  We started with the Salt and Pepper Calimari and the Duck Confit Spring Rolls. Much to my disappointment the calimari was over fried and bland. No savory flavor at all. The dipping sauce was an odd soy sauced aioli, and the micro greens on top were completely useless. The duck confit spring rolls were another disappointment. They were also over fried, loosely wrapped, and soggy in the middle. The filling was mostly softened onions and red bell peppers, with a layer of extremely salty shredded duck. There was a mysterious paper like strip of what I though was onion. It turned out to be a piece of plastic! I flagged down the nearest server and brought it to her attention. She apologized immediately and whisked the plate away to have another order made. Then someone who I think was the manager stopped by our table to follow up on the situation and offer another apology along with an explanation. According to the manager there are lots of menu items that are made in advance and wrapped in plastic to retain freshness. I can understand prepping certain items in advance, but the explanation doesn't resolve how the plastic ended up inside of the spring roll. Anyhow a new plate of spring rolls landed on our table and they were in worse condition than the first order minus the plastic. Loosely wrapped, soggy, full of onions, and a thick wad of salty duck meat. There was also a dipping sauce that didn't really have much personality to add.  Our server was great. I appreciated the way they handled the plastic incident quickly and without any issues. I doubt we will return to Butterfly on any of our next visits to San Francisco. I had high hopes after reading so many great reviews, but I guess to each his own.

WgvLQRHs7XgNy89KNCEA0Q.review_text: Came here with a few coworkers after a meeting nearby. This place has the ambiance and the food is excellent. There're already tons of reviews here, so I wont have to get into the details. I ordered two appetizers instead of one entrees. I had the kalua pork lettuce cups and the mussels and clams appetizers. I loved the lettuce cups, but the sauce they gave us was a bbq mixed with hoisin sauce. I'd much rather dial down the bbq flavor myself, but it was still very good. The mussels and clams were a bit fishy, and one of the mussels was barely open---I wouldn't havev served that one mussel if I were the chef.  But overall, very pleasant experience. We saw a sea lion swimming by.. the cutest thing it was! Oh, and we asked them to doggie bag our leftovers to take with us, but they forgot to give them to us. :( That was a bummer cuz by the time we remembered we were already a block away in our car.   So 4 stars instead of 5 because for the prices they charge, I would expect it much closer to perfection, and the lil dink in the service and the not so good mussel made me feel like it deserves only 4. Though I'd definitely recommend this place to my friends.

aZsplPA5l8nAPswWOyN1Yw.review_text: Good view and service,  steak still had  the marks from the jockey.  I wouldn't order the chicken either.   Maybe just get a drink and appetizer.

EV4lrYaVff6QYrj_AXBY0g.review_text: Went for happy hour and pleasantly surprised.  Interior of restaurant was great and the view was even better.  Service was friendly and efficient.  It was not very busy 5-7 on a Tuesday night.  They have $5.00 drinks specials and special appetizers.  Drinks were good but definitely not strong enough for this trio of 'just off the job' clients.  But we really liked the place.    We had 6 drinks and 3 appetizers (calamari was great) for about $50.  So the $5.00 drinks make your cash go a bit further.  Didn't do dinner but the waitress walked by with this slab of meat that was breathtaking and I believe one of my friends stopped mid-sentence to watch the plate go by.  And I think I saw a tear...it looked and smelled that good.  We'll definitely come back.

BWReaf8eDVX9E03vEV7fRQ.review_text: I would give this restaurant 0 stars if I could.  After a long walk, we decided to find a place to sit and eat lunch.  We were seated right away. Being tired and dehydrated, we ordered drinks. I got a diet coke and my girlfriend got a coke. As soon as we got our drinks I finished my glass and then noticed that unlike my glass of fountain soda, they had given her a bottle of coke. Since we were thirsty we asked if she could get a coke from the fountain rather than bottle. Turns out that they do not do free refills from the fountain and they didn't mention it! Worst part is that glass of diet coke cost me $4!!! This place is overpriced to say the least.  After sharing our two appetizers and entree  and spending what we felt to be too much money, we went on our way.   Later that night, we were both struck with terrible food poisoning. Diners beware.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: For a girls night out dinner we decided to go to Butterfly for dinner. My gf and I arrived an hour early and the hostess still sat us anyway. Check plus. My friend ordered the cucumber gimlet while I ordered the lychee martini. The lychee was excellent. We ordered the calamari appetizer which was not bad at all. For dinner, we ordered the blue cheese encrusted filet, the pork and the duck. My friend asked for medium rare for her steak and it definitely was a little over cooked yet still red. I think it was the quality of the beef that made it seem that way. She had to send it back and asked for it to be more rarer. My duck was amazing. 5 stars and the pork was also excellent. For dessert we had the chocolate chip cookie, the banana lumpia and the creme brule, compliments from the chef. They were all amazing. My favorite was the lumpia. Yum.   Service was attentive and quite excellent. The owner/chef came out a few times to check on us and make sure everything was okay.

sh9oeW3jHYROOzTyqRwLLw.review_text: This is my new favorite restaurant. My husband and I are big foodies from Napa Valley and this place topped the charts on several levels. First, the atmosphere is incredible - spacious, inviting, with beautiful ocean views; second, the menu had numerous intriguing meals - tough to choose but the sashimi salad exceeded expectations (you should like a bit of wasabi heat); but best of all, our daughter, age 9, tired from running around the city, let out a stream of tears when she saw that her chicken tenders were not breaded. The wonderful waitress took note, served her pasta instead, and SF Chronicle-loved chef, Robert Lam, came out to check on her and our table. Butterfly is unbelievable - wonderful food, atmosphere and service along with a large side dish of heart.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: Another one of those places back in the day, were progressive, but sort have gotten passed by. It however still chugs along. Many events and bday parties have  I attended here. Like Ana Mandara, Butterfly used to sport the Asian Fusion bent but they did know how to cook meat well and had a solid cocktail program. Good drinks and a waterfront location however rarely go out of style

jgPOl8penY4km_zdEYRAhg.review_text: I must admit, I was a little nervous about this place.  My husband & I just finished a tour of Alcatraz and we were hungry.  We saw unlimited bloody mary and mimosas for $18 and thought "Score!"  The food turned out to be amazing.  We both had the duo of chowders.  We got a bowl of red & white chowder as well as crab louie stuffed romaine hearts.  Oh man the white chowder was some of the best chowder I have ever tasted.  It was beyond yummy.    Our waiter was super nice and let us switch between bloody marys and mimosas.  My mimosa glass was never empty as he was constantly filling it.  He brought the dessert menu and asked what brought us to town. We told him we were celebrating our anniversary.  When he brought us our desserts he told us "On the house, happy anniversary!"  That was so nice.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: I love being on the water, and the wall of windows flanking Pier 33 from inside this restaurant provides a nice atmosphere -- despite the giant Phyllis Diller wig homage fixtures dangling above. However, I couldn't help wishing they had more extensive outdoor seating available. There is a narrow strip of two-tops, but it just seems a shame that they don't construct a more substantial terrace section. Anyway, Butterfly's brunch menu is surprisingly diverse for an Asian-fusion place, so don't discount them if you're the type who craves egg dishes with your Bloody's. Food was decent; service was attentive. There was a moment waiting for my party when the self-righteous manager dork chose to spout condescension towards the bartender right in front of me. I most certainly did not appreciate such rudeness. Jennifer Aniston agrees that it was very "un-cool."

EX4f2BTBpeGmsgr-bRfdTQ.review_text: Great service and food here. Bonus view of the water. Had the burger and the steak salad. Both were very good and generous portions. Cocktails at night are a treat too. Service was outstanding. Price is a little spendy, but in line for the location. If the fusion style isn't your thing, Hillstone is across the street, and it's excellent as well with a more traditional steakhouse menu.  Loses one star because I felt the food was a bit over seasoned - a little too salty.

Ra9okAwkTjYxuYJNwmspJg.review_text: There food here is good and the presentation is great. But $25 for decent chicken is not ok in my book. I tried onion soup for the first time here and it was absolutely amazing. The deserts here are certainly very good and well worth it. I recommend the bread pudding.  The service as also great. Just what seemed to be a bit over priced for what you get. It is worth a try.

T1wfUuq_TJQRtLcKC3IivQ.review_text: Located in one of the most inaccessible parts of the city for driving, Butterfly offers a quiet refuge from the chaos of the Embarcadero and nearby Pier 39.  We went for a Saturday brunch, with the first reservation of the day. We were treated to a wonderful bay view, fantastic wasabi Bloody Mary, and Chimay Grand Reserve (bottled). The oyster shooters were great, an the Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict was fantastic.  Take Muni if you go.

aikP02DBxGBjr0i883eQYw.review_text: The food is pretty good.  Bar/Happy Hour menu has $1 oyster shooters.  Expensive.  I used to work across the street from this place.  We got take out orders for the office from time to time and anything I tasted was pretty good.  A few days before I left my job, my friend and I stopped in to order lunch (to go) and the bartender was cute and friendly.  So, I thought I might as well celebrate my last day at the job getting drunk at Butterfly's happy hour.  We got there early (4pm) and I'm pretty sure we were the only customers there.  Our service was...  well... What service, exactly?  The wait staff pretty much ignored us.  We would have sat at the bar but our group was too large (yes, seating for 4 at the bar was impossible in the nearly empty restaurant).  The duck spring rolls were ok...    I feel under-appreciated as a customer.  I feel like my friends and I would have stayed for an hour longer, generating a massive bill based on alcohol purchases, but because we were ignored... we decided to move on and continued to celebrate (drink) at every bar we passed.  Dear Butterfly, Thank you for making my last day of work so forgettable. XO, Lauren  P.S. We left a good tip anyways... You didn't really deserve it.

HorQ90eiUPfnesQlIraaJA.review_text: We had a $50 to spend on a Groupon (warning they add the tip 18%) to the bill automatically when you use one.  Good news about Happy Hour. until 7pm, there are many cocktails for $5. wine, bloody mary, any well cocktail, and a quite a variety of apps for $5-7. While we could not partake of the special apps with our Groupon, we could enjoy the lower price cocktails.  The service was great and the room is pretty cool, they have these amazing sea urchin chandeliers, we went during winter so it was dark, but I can imagine this room is amazing during the summer with the incredible bay views.  Because the entrees are kinda pricy (upwards of $27) we decided to spend our money on 4 appetizers to share.  The duck egg rolls, the garlic noodles with added beef, the orange/bacon/avocado salad, and the Pork in lettuce cups. They were all good, my favorite was the interesting salad, the others were good, not amazing.  The service was great, refilling waters, making sure everything was good, anything else we needed.  I have been here before with a client many years ago for lunch and remembered it being good. And the brunch menu looks great (and you could enjoy the water view).

BVv2Yt-aHI_9-SR6Eu9EfA.review_text: Butterfly really surprised me. I have to be honest, this is my first time back after about four years. The food this time really impressed me and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends.  Food and drinks were great and inventive. You have to try the mushroom soup. It blew my mind!

KxrKVxdXGkfMJ9XwJZzoLQ.review_text: This place is along the water in the middle of nowhere, which happens to be a good pit stop if you need a drink while walking from Pier 39 to Bart or you need to go to the bathroom.  I liked the interior, but the seating setup was a little odd b/c the tables didn't face the water.

bM3JbHc9Xpu3Ru7SPSFivQ.review_text: This place is located at pier 33 and has a great view facing the ocean.  We came for their dine about town menu and was not disappointed.  The duck spring rolls was my favorite part of the meal - it was delicious!  Great food with great service and a beautiful view.  I would definitely come back.

vbp4OuULvBkW4mx0T6CPNA.review_text: Loves: Kalua Pig Butter Lettuce Wraps, Caramelized Shrimp/Mango Salad, Garlic Noodles  Service: I have been there several times and hands down the waiter name Porter is the best! One time after shopping, he even offered to help me call for a cab and bring my shopping bags out!  What a gent! Another time when my lil bro had his drink delayed, the Chef/Owner personally came to apologize and offered a complimentary dish...Now that's GREAT SERVICE!  Ambiance: Popular for dates, but also family friends, i would't recommend kicking and screaming children though...let's keep it classy folks.   Parking is easy to find too, but it kinda sucks now that the meter ends later at 7pm.   I would definitely come back again if my wallet allows me to...trying to hold my title as duchess here but it can a financial challenge. Maybe I'll stick with just HH here for now...lol  Feeling adventurous? Try the friend whole fish with Kim Chee...you'll have all heads turning your way, including the fish's...

kKy2XrlFbQxtbukkFYMiPA.review_text: Honestly, I have my priorities straight so I didn't eat (I just drank). I went with two friends (actually, I was the third wheel as always) and they ate along with their drinks (poons).  We sat at the bar. The two bartenders were very helpful. One of the bartenders was obv drunk, and the other seemed like he had his stuff together, but nonetheless they were both great bartenders that knew their menu/drinks.  We all started with specialty cocktails by the bartenders' reference (I think it was the cherry blossom... sooo Aaaaasian). It was okay. The girl liked it. I thought it was too sweet tasting, but then again I don't have a vag.  My friends didn't know what to order, so the bartender suggested the Kalua pig with butter lettuce cups and crab stuff fried chicken breast. I didn't have any of it because eating is cheating. My friends thought the two dishes were really good. Bravo to the bartender with the good call.  Her boyfriend and I moved onto Scotch soon after. He chose a few different Scotch's and they were all on point. One of the bartenders also selected a few Scotch's for us to try and those were all on point as well. We then moved onto shots and who knows what happened after.  Long story short: We got really drunk and blacked out. I woke up with the worst hangover. I told myself I wasn't going to drink again, but then I realized my parents didn't raise a quitter and went right back to the bottle for Halloween weekend.

Kk2nWFDl8P1O4PdjwTUozQ.review_text: This was a pleasant experience that I didn't expect. First I would like to that the food was great but what I didn't expect was how our waiter named Potter was exceptional without a doubt. Potter didn't just serve my wife and I but was very personal and attentive. It was my wife's birthday and we were looking forward to a special night out. One dish was not really to our liking and he sensed that. He immediately took charge and was willing to replace it with another dish to make sure we were satisfied with our meal being very insistent. On top of that we were surprised with dessert!!! the creme bruele and warm chocolate lava cake capped off the night for us. Thanks to Potter we had one of the best dining experiences we've had in a long time. Butterfly is lucky to have someone that cares about where he works, how little things make a difference and stands by the old tradition of a happy customer is a repeat customer. We will be back and will pass along our experience to all our fellow foodies.

u0Z-7DAQP-Oe2yg3avSXiw.review_text: Purely mediocre for really expensive food!

1iZC05-dZUMel_bstcuC9g.review_text: Went there last night for thanksgiving dinner and I was really impressed. Service was great. Atmosphere was unique and the food (fixed menu) was excellent. Portion size was good too. I will be returning on a normal menu night.

P9wKXDWk4lpXUob1oSnNkw.review_text: Great food, great atmosphere plus the executive chef came to our table to ask about our meal! Definitely will be back :) great service + great food = great experience. Check it out!

m6p5knAyIS79s6WNbeIdGw.review_text: This review is for happy hour: Walked into the place and immediately noticed some weird funk of a smell. Despite the smell we still sat down at the bar and waited...and waited...and waited, while the bartender just ignored us. Not only did he ignore us, he was sweating buckets...yuck. Once he finally acknowledged out presence he gave us the happy hour menu and painfully answered our questions. We each had a speciality happy hour cocktail and then wine and beer. I was really in the mood for oysters so we each ordered an oyster shooter. This oyster shooter should have been on the deadliest catch. My friend actually cried. It was way too spicy. It was literally death in a shot glass....Overall this place has a great view?!?! Eh...I don't think I will be returning.

RdGgH2C655oklnPT3oZJ0A.review_text: Came here for dinner as I wanted to try something new and was in the mood for some kind of Asian food.  The place was pretty dim, but I did like their light fixtures that looked like uni and the big mirror on the wall.  It turns out they had a Dine About Town menu so my husband and I both chose off the menu.  It was appetizer, main, and dessert for $35.  For starters, I had the Kalua Pig Butter Lettuce Cups.  It was pretty good, but the most messiest food I've eaten at a restaurant!  The butter lettuce was still wet so when I added the meat and the hoisin sauce, the sauce constantly dripped out after every bite that I ended up staining my sweater and my hands were all sticky.  After eating this appetizer, my napkin was pretty much dirty.  I think it would have been better if they had patted the lettuce dry before they brought it out.  For dinner, I had the grilled snapper which came with rice noodles, lettuce, basil, and fish sauce.  It was pretty much the Vietnamese cold vermicelli bowls.  The way it came out, I didn't know how to eat it as everything came on a separate dish, but luckily, our friendly server explained to me.  I ended up just putting everything in a bowl and pouring the sauce on top.  It was okay.  Nothing too fabulous.  My husband's hangar steak with crispy noodles was lacking some flavor.  For dessert, I had the creme brulee, which was by far the best part!  I'm giving this place 3 star for the excellent server we had and the fantastic creme brulee as those were the only highlights for me, unfortunately.

LkeBDA4OKEEPOZXTgUZezA.review_text: A great happy hour and decent dinner menu. Appetizers are fantastic. Great dinner service from our server Porter! He was very attentive and made the evening special for our dinner party.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: I went expecting a good view, but apparently you can't see much at night.  Staring out into the ocean is like staring into darkness.  No thanks.  The 1/2 Dozen Beausoleil Oysters with a Bloody Mary Oyster Shooter was very interesting.  Too bad there was only one shooter, so I had to man up and handle it.  The Northern California Heirloom Tomato Risotto was amazing.  I love heirloom tomatoes, and I love risotto.  It was a match made in heaven.  I don't understand how our bill came out to about $150 (3 people, no alcohol).  My wallet is complaining, but my mouth isn't.

USUwr9Q-8HQhcRTr-UJqCA.review_text: I chose this as my destination to party on Halloween, because it was free before 10pm for ladies with a costume. We got there around 9:15, right after the doors opened and stood in line patiently.  Eventually it became obvious that there was some issue at the door as some of the ladies in front of us started getting pissed off and arguing with the doormen. Turns out that the guys at the door tried saying that the free before 10pm was a typo and that you could only get in if you had a ticket. Well, as you can imagine that did not go over well. Finally they called for all girls in costumes to stand in a different line and we got in free, as advertised. Duh!  The club was alright, it's smaller than I expected and I think they let in too many people because it turned into this crazy mass of people and you couldn't even move. That's just asking for fights, which I almost got in because some girl shoved me in the back, and drinks getting spilled on people. Booo!!!  Next year I think I'll skip Halloween partying or pay the ridiculous ticket price for a well organized party.

kfPDm4dyLIKX-1cgZDNfqQ.review_text: The Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups are TO DIE FOR!!!  I go there just for that! Okay, and I like the onion soup!

Cuk2vdOMwTz71NjBuCF0Mg.review_text: I have eaten here several times and the service was very poor. But I took a client to lunch yesterday and the entire wait staff was on point! Our server was prompt which was a giant leap from my previous visit.  We ordered several appetizers so we could all share.  #1 Strawberry/samon spring rolls- FANTASTIC!! #2 Kalua Pig with lettus cups-SOOO GOOD! #3 Mussles in curry sauce-SUCCULENT! #4 Calamari-BETTER THAN MOST  Overall I was very impressed! I definately recommend if you are looking for a great place to take a client to lunch or even a first date. I heard they have a good happy hour as well.

v2c5AXW7DqlOGtrqJhDG2Q.review_text: We live in the city and have always passed this by because it is near the tourist spots.  But we tried it and the food is excellent. The service was too notch.  Of course the price is a little steep but you have an awesome view of the bay.  We will definitely be back.

7VPpXrIuRUId_4t3x2rGYQ.review_text: Ahhh I can't wait to go back here. First off, amazing ambiance right on the water, not a bad seat in the house, cute little bar top, amazing specialty cocktails--definite "mixologist" style drinks which is a plus in my book as a booze-snob. beautiful presentation, modern, asian inspired, very well-rounded appetizer and entree menu...didn't have room for dessert but golly they all sounded great. I had a kobe burger which was off the chain--I want to try their fish sandwich (can't remember the name) and their strawberry salmon spring roll appetizers blew my mind. perfect service, very informative, helpful, can't remember his name but he rocked. next trip out to the city, this place is on my agenda!

gpyyyWqrR4BhhM2xkBrOyw.review_text: I came here last July for my anniversary dinner and I feel horrible that I just now am writing my review:(   Though it was nearly a year ago I can still taste the gnocchi with fried squash blossoms, along with the salmon/strawberry rolls, duck confit spring rolls, kalua pork lettuce cups, and even the tiniest bite my boyfriend let me have of his cowboy angus steak.  So obviously we ate like Kings that night but it was worth every penny. I wish I could describe every dish mentioned but there is no way my words would capture how fresh, and flavorful every single dish was.  And while the food was the highlight the service was a close second. As a server I can be pretty nitpicky (thought I keep my judgements in my head), but I can honestly say I was blown away. The managers/owners, Mike and Rob,  found out it was our anniversary and they both came over to congratulate us. Little things like that definitely put restaurants over the top for me.   I can't believe its almost been a year but we will definitely be back again ASAP! Oh and the view, priceless.

KDTjKFZ_ROYqMFgn23QFxg.review_text: I came here tonight because I was originally looking for NYE venues and this menu was by far the best. On the way here we said the menu looked like a 9.5, but within 5 minutes of sitting down I was so impressed I went straight back to the hostess Christine and said that this was already my best Asian restaurant experience in years. The service was extremely attentive, timely, and considerate. When I informed The hostess how impressed I was, she even said she would be squeeze me in for NYE special seating. The most impressive service, food, and ambiance in memory. 9.8 out of 10. They even called me the following morning to confirm that I was in their system. So Professional.

AOCn-YsKpM3vnpP2RKQwDQ.review_text: Plus: Location Good Food Fun menu choices  Minus: Pricey (try to come during happy hour)  My friend made reservations for 5 pm on a week day and the restaurant was not crowded. We got a great table right next to the window with a view of the water. There are small tables outside for the hearty or for the few warm evenings in SF.  From the happy hour menu, we ordered the Duck Spring Rolls ($5) and Kahlua Pig with Butter Lettuce cups ($8). Both came with their own sauce and were delicious. You roll your own lettuce "burrito", so it is a little messy. From the regular appetizer menu, we  ordered the Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic Noodles with Shrimp ($19!!! for an appetizer). These were fat noodles with lots of cut up vegetables and quite a few shrimp. We shared everything and that was fun. We had room for dessert and tried the banana lumpia rolls ($8). Perfect amount to share with two (or even 3) people. It was wonderfully sweet with a lot of bananas inside and out. There was shredded coconut inside the roll and it was served with coconut ice cream.  I really like that there are non-alcoholic choices on the drink menu. I tried the kiwi cucumber crush. It was sparkling and refreshing. Not too sweet. The kiwi was cut small and floating amoung the ice. It was a fun drink.  This is good food and a nice location. I recommend coming during happy hour to take advantage of the less pricey menu.
