Nuk54dt8Osk8ghUhpuNxqQ.review_text: I wanted to try Butterfly for years, but never got around to it until I snagged a LivingSocial. There's nothing like a great discount to spur some motivation! Since then, I had scored another deal and went back a second time, and both times I had an overall great dining experience!   The Asian-fusion menu is seasonal and boasts many tantalizing finds with appetizers and cocktails around $10 and main entrees ranging from $20-$48. The first time I was here I had the Cara Cara Orange Salad and it was easily one of the most beautiful salads I've ever eaten. It had a unique  and tasty combination of ingredients with char siu pork, oranges, yuzu, and ricotta. It was a super small portion though so don't expect to get your veggies in with any of their salads.   My favorite appetizer by far are the Duck Confit Spring Rolls. They're fried, flavorful, and finger-lickin' good!  love the spicy kick from the Chinese hot mustard and honey dipping sauce. Another notable mention is the House Smoked Salmon Carpaccio. The thinly sliced smoked salmon on hefty triangles of Texas toast, creme fraiche horseradish, and tobiko was a familiar, but creative mix.   Entree wise, I would skip the Five Spice Braised English Short Ribs. They left much to be desired in terms of flavor and the rice cakes underneath were an odd combination. The Teriyaki Grilled Hanger Steak with the potato/leek gratin is delicious though and the Market Fish of the day always has an impressive presentation and is well-prepared.   The restaurant has ample seating and is very spacious, complete with high ceilings and beautiful, intimate decor. Butterfly has a gorgeous bay view, but at night it's hard to see anything. To fully appreciate the scene, lunch would probably be a better option! It's pretty easy to get a reservation here and the service is very friendly, although a tad slow at times. Without a deal, the food isn't quite enough to make me come back and pay regular price for everything, but with it, I think the meal and experience are more than worth it. So if you see a deal, scoop it up!

AXeEdqeZxnVXM203h_XYHg.review_text: Nice atmosphere. Cant see the view at night but I'm sure it's beautiful during the day. Garlic seared clams and muscles were delicious and flavorful, the fried rice on this dish was more like puffed rice and soaked up the broth nicely. Peking duck was tender and overall a well rounded dish. The short ribs were outstanding, and so tender. They blew everything else we ate away. The rest of the dish was a bit under salted but because the meat was so amazing we were not disappointed.  Our server Thomas was lovely, knowledgeable and made a wonderful wine recommendation. All plates had nice, modern presentation.

WtnW-0d2MepBmsqxmtxfMg.review_text: I went here with my boyfriend several months ago on a random Sunday afternoon when we were playing in the city. We went right after the lunch rush and there was maybe 4 other people in the place so due to that we got great service. We order a few appetizers to share and they were delicious - we ordered the clams, calamari, and something else (can't remember), what I do remember is we did not have a complaint about the place!!! I wish we could have ordered everything on the menu because it all sounded great! THe inside of the restaurant is gorgeous and excellently decorated accompanied by a great view of the water!

P8v_MGYPJTYMTc8n6EuqMw.review_text: Butterfly was good, but just too expensive and not that special.  The wine by glass selection is small and between $11 and $17, just too much for an average wine! The whole fish was excellent. The lamb special, spring rolls, and lettuce cups were ok. The service was very food and restaurant was nice. I would like to give brunch a try for the view.

Qq42NgNY4ZmOrFGvoStZXw.review_text: Love this restaurant. Food, service, location, aptmosphere, drinks.....you will not be disappointed. And this place throws thee best New Years Eve party in the Bay!!! I guarantee you will love this restaurant.

REnNjuMJ-Pl1bweebFLbNg.review_text: We came here for the very first time on Valentine's day. Well i must say the drinks were so delicious, whoever the bartender was made them well. The food was surprisingly superb. The chef even came out to greet us and asked how was everything.... Very nice ocean view, music was nice. The servers defiantly get a 10.  We highly recommend this restaurant whether you are a local or just visiting.

LRTC_Gl63vsOjnhJtPyZXQ.review_text: Food is ok.  Tasty but not special or fancy.    Our family of four went to Butterfly for Sunday brunch after visiting Alcatraz.  It was a rainy Sunday.  The place was half full.  Service was excellent.  Deco and view is great.  Kids had the kid's meals - pizza and satay chicken skewer.  We had onion soup, duck spring roll, salmon and scramble egg, and a fried fish sandwich. Onion soup was excellent, especially on a cold rainy day.  The sauce of the duck spring roll was good but a bit over powering.  The scramble egg with smoked salmon was tasty but nothing special.  The fried catfish sandwich was like a cross between Cajun catfish and Vietnamese sandwich.   Kinda interesting but I probably would order that again.    All in all, the price is reasonable, food is good, service is good and the atmosphere  and deco is nice.  I would definitely consider coming back if I am in the area again.

XZeFJAOFwmkw9rCeu-R4Gw.review_text: Four stars for the appetizers (duck spring rolls and fire fried calamari). 2 stars for my entree (a very sad garlic noodle dish that was . . . droopy). Service was great. Location was fun. Price is reasonable, all things considered.

RR8WmI4aN5EWWWXX_5WSgw.review_text: The best restaurant experience in San Francisco. Fabulous food and service. The chef is there all the time cooking and talking with customers, unlike all other high end restaurants here.  Skip all the new comers and go there for an experience that is worth the money.

QUiEPHClIuOylnxq114P3Q.review_text: Can't tell y'all how sad it makes me that the Yelp Elite event at Butterfly is scheduled for when I'm going to be away with the gf for a wedding!  Chef Rob is a rock star and Butterfly is all that. Period. Exclamation Point.  Staff is off the chart cool.  The sunset views of the Bay are arguably SF's best.  Much cocktail creativity at the bar. Ladies, thank me after you have your Cherrrrrrry Blossom, 'K?! Wine list is value-loaded with 4-star and 5-star fireworks at 2-star prices...  Can we talk about food now? This is a pay-attention-to-the-details menu, which my brotha, tha CIA-trained chef, Rob Lam has turned out.  It starts with the Vietnamese flavors he picked up in his mother's restaurant, and crosses pretty much all the Asian borders.  No dumb ass, you can not do this in your kitchen at home...  My favorites are the figs & brie appetizer and the King Salmon entree with cous cous and tapioca risotto.  Are you paying attention?!  Good.  The Heirloom Tomato Salad with pizetta pieces and pepperoncini is THA BOMB.  The pork with the glazed cherries on top will rock your world.  If you're ready to expand your mind, get the whole fish.  'Nuff said... Did I mention the great wine list, with absurdly low prices for some top wines?!  Two words for you:Whetstone Pinot...  If you're just coming for drinks, your loss foodwise, but there's an excellent bar scene with some chill view space on the big-window side to compensate.  At the end of the night, they clear out tables and the dance music gets cranked up - tasteful, funky grooves, natch'.  Cocktail list, please! - my fave is the Pom Cosmo, Yo.  Though, if you've never been to Hong Kong, their Lycheetini is strong enough to let you pretend, oh so tasty and dignified...  Rob is all that.  Talk to him about 100% blue agave, dig?  He's way beyond CIA, but he is part of that mafia.  This joint reflects his style - check the new bamboo installations and fine-ass chairs. The tunes are serious groove.  Butterfly was always hip when it was in the Mission, but Rob's taken it to another level.    Hey Hipster! - get your grub on!...and learn how to appreciate multiple amuse bouche... You can not beat this as a date spot, even amateurs should be able to score here.

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: Went here for a company lunch once. Upon entering the front door we were overwhelmed with the odor of stinky fish and incense. I personally believe that a restaurant should never use incense, the food ought to be providing a lovely bouquet on it's own. If you are covering up the smell of something bad I'm going to walk out. Unfortunately we couldn't leave since we had reservations for a large group and it was a company event, so we sat on the patio and sucked it up with plenty of wine. The food was overpriced and left me hungry.

bl8a3z3VW2BoqU7x4G8xEw.review_text: pricy asian fusion restaurant. good for dates, but be sure to reserve or get there early if you want waterfront seating. i love their garlic noodles! if you are driving, i suggest you look on Bay Street for free parking. it's a block away.

uRfWbvmAN7qUVJhPxV7QYw.review_text: I've been twice now and really enjoy this place, and more than Slanted Door I believe.  Really the only thing I'd change is the location, but I suppose it does produce nice views.  I've eaten dinner twice with groups of four on Friday or Saturday nights.  We've all shared dishes and drinks and everything has been delicious.  The food isn't cheap, but I do think the portions are more substantial than similarly priced restaurants.  Last night, the pork porterhouse, sesame tuna, chicken stuffed with crab, and salmon were all wonderful, as were the kiwi gimlet, kumquat margarita, honey bourbon sour, sumojito, and ginger sidecar.  They also gave us two of our drinks for free since they took a little longer than expected to come out (although I'm really very pleased with the service).  So, considering that it's not hard to get a table for the most part (and if it is, the bar is sweet), it's worth going---especially when you can get a Livingsocial deal or something to put towards dinner (I used one my second time eating there).

9GildLUYQRFJvK-ENn7Z_A.review_text: I had a living social for this place that expired a WHILE ago.  Once we got off the cruise from Alcatraz (because it is literally next door) I realized I had $25 worth of credit towards this place so why not pop in for a drink and some light lunch? We got a cozy table around the corner overlooking the water.  It was spectacular and peaceful and absolutely perfect.  And just because we were around the corner did not mean we were forgotten, which can tend to happen. Going by the yelp favorites, we went with the pork lettuce wraps and banana pudding.  We also got a margarita, Baileys and coffee, the chicken salad sandwich and the Creme Brulee (a obvious choice as we're on a quest to find the world's best creme brulee). The drinks were great.  Excellent, not-straight-out-of-a-bottle margarita, and the coffee was warm and had a yummy layer of cream on top. The lettuce wraps were by far the best thing.  Super tender, sweet bbq sauce, and perfectly portioned.  The lettuce cups were slightly smaller than most lettuce wraps that I'm used to and it made them into two bite bits of heaven. The chicken sandwich had A LOT of things on it.  Pickles, onions, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and then the chicken salad.  It was good but a little overkill. The banana budding was very good, including the carmelized bananas on the side.  I wish it was served warm.  We did eat it second and the ice cream barely melted and the inside was pretty cold so I don't think it was warm to begin with. The service was great.  The busser kept out plates cleared and our drinks refilled.  OUr bill was presented in a timely manner, but they were closing for in between lunch and dinner and we didn't feel rushed to get out of there which was nice. They say it's kind of pricy, which I guess it could be, but I wasn't sticker shocked. Now for the Creme Brulee - Look - 3...fairly plain with a bit of mint leaf on top.  Especially compared to the amazingness of the banana pudding aesthetic. Shell Crack-tisity - 5...rock hard but perfect to crack. Texture - 3...Slightly runny.  Good when mixed with the thick layer of hard sugar on top. Taste - 3...nothing special, but very yummy never the less. Overall Score - 14 out of 20.  We'll be back I hope.

9eIKuOKmWJrgtXtrdRv2YQ.review_text: This place could have gotten a higher rating but the manager on duty was in some type of mood. I had a surprise party here this past weekend the 13th my partner had been planning for months. He was not certain of the total amount of people that were coming so he reserved for 12  so 8 people showed up. Do u know he was charged for the 4 people that did not come. A little over$150 I feel bad because I gushed about this place for months and the other manager he did the reservation with told him it was not an issue if everyone did not show up. Well it was. I doubt I will be back. When u make a deal u hold to it. I was a fan until I found that out. Not cool people hard earned money should not go to waste like that.

4WfUHNfYKG1HjcrEege4aQ.review_text: Great ambiance and also next to the pier. Don't be fooled by the food pics! Great food layouts but doesn't taste like what it looks. The main course not so so good. I don't recommend and would not come back. ;((( Spend your $ somewhere else.

-l--qgRkn5edWBuL4x1IUA.review_text: My boyfriend and I came here for our 2 Year Anniversary. We chose this restaurant because the menu looked good and my friend worked here as the hostess. She was able to hook us up with a booth by the window. However, when we got there, my friend wasn't working yet and this other girl was there. She said our booth wasn't ready yet. The party before us were late and they were not done with their meal yet. So we just ended up getting seated at another table for 2, which wasn't a huge deal.  So we ordered calamari, 1/2 dozen oysters, hamachi sashimi and poke, filet mignon, pork porterhouse, warm chocolate torte, and creme brulee.  The Calamari was pretty good. The crust was light and crisp and not oily. There was a nice sauce that came on top of it which gave it a nice kick.  The 1/2 dozen oysters were pretty good. Tasted fresh. And the different cocktail sauces was a nice variety.  The Hamachi sashimi and poke was deeeelicious! One of the better sashimi's that I've had. Fresh and just melted in my mouth.  The filet mignon was pretty good. It had alot of flavor and was made to my liking. Not too chewy.  The Chocolate torte was pretty good with the coffee ice cream. Good combo!  The Creme Brulee was a good portion size. The sugar crust was good.  The overall experience was nice. Even the owner came over and asked how everything was going.

Uov7Jwfq0YBhBqeZ2-7SuA.review_text: I went to Butterfly with a large group for a friend's birthday. It just so happened to fall on a Mother's Day so they had a 4-course special going on or something. I HATE seafood. I was really disappointed most of the dishes on the menu were seafoody, but hey, it's right next to the wharf so I don't blame 'em.  Each time a dish came to us I was impressed at the presentation, the fact that I had the balls to even taste the stuff, even more so the fact that I fell completely in love with seafood since that day. Okay, so maybe just that day. But really. The more outspoken ones in the group, including myself, were raving about the food. It was delicious.  Our waiter was suuuuper nice and helpful, I actually felt kind of bad because we were kind of all over the place. The chef took the time to ask us how everything was and told us a bit about the owner and the inspiration of the restaurant. Super duper plus. Will visit many more times, for sure.

VnfPGPzHjI1p-xjKSUa97w.review_text: First trip to Butterfly this week.    Lovely setting right on the water.  You can't see the whole bay, but you can see a wide expanse of bay through the pier buildings to the left and right.  They even have a few outdoor barista-style table and tall chairs for good weather.  (It is on Embarcadero just before you get to Pier 39, so you do have a lot of tourists wandering around in front; but they didn't seem to come inside).  Small than I thought it would be; looked really big on "Check Please".  Nice warm, somewhat hip interior.  Fair sized bar - probably seats 10?  All different kinds of seating, so it's good for an individual, a couple, small or large groups.  Fun, yummy selection of classic and new cocktails.  Bartender was very helpful and consultative.  Our waiter, Porter, was charming and attentive.  Over all service atmosphere was casual, relaxed and friendly.  Food was quite good, not great.  Garlic noodles and calamari quite yummy.  Pork in lettuce cups tasted pretty good but had a weird cat food like texture.   Discovered they have a three course $25 dinner on Tues, Wed, and Thurs, 5-7pm.  We will definitely be back for that.  (The snapper looked and smelled fabulous).  Only BIG negative was no WiFi service.  We really wanted to post on Foodspotter, facebook and Foursquare but couldn't get a connection.  Not wasting my data minutes, should have WiFi.

sZFI8uqZI-fU8TiM43Dn0w.review_text: I have been to Butterfly a few times and always have a great time. Despite being next to Alcatraz landing, this place does cater to locals and tourists alike. The decor is chic without being overdone, with a distinct Asian & oceanic vibe. (For example the ceiling lights resemble of sea urchins!)   The cocktails unique and well done (my favorite is the Cherry Blossom, my boyfriends is the Cucumber Gin & Tonic) as is the menu itself. I recommend eating tapas style and splitting appetizers, which are definitely the highlight of the show.   I would not miss the tuna tempura rolls, or the calamari. The edamame is also differently done than most places, using a lot of black pepper and sesame. I am usually not one for deserts, but there is a great selection here which makes it a great place for birthday parties. Again, sharing is probably the best bet because all of the options super rich and hard to eat alone.  I think you will not be disappointed if you give this a try.

-M4ZqHZDsA9vOt7UscVRpQ.review_text: Want to give 3.5 stars but I'll round up.   I didn't love the specialty cocktail selection but i managed to find something tasty to drink. I ended having a pomegranate spritzer.   We shared a bunch of apps and then each got a main course and a dessert.   Apps: I really enjoyed the Kalua pork butter lettuce cups and the calamari. The duck confit spring roll wasn't bad but I didn't find it to be special. Lastly there was a salmon and strawberry spring roll which I didn't try but everyone seemed to like.   For my main I had the chicken stuffed with crab and marscapone. The breading was slightly salty but otherwise, the dish was crunchy and the portion was more than generous.   My dessert was a flour less chocolate torte with Mitchells ice cream. Most excellent!   I'd definitely come back. The atmosphere was cute and the food was a nice sized portion, and tasty. It's a nice place to go for both a night out with friends or date night.

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: I've always passed this place and have always heard about it, but have never bothered to stop in.  So finally recently the ladies of Butterfly decided to treat me on a nice night out for dinner.    The interior of the place is nice and the dim lighting is a good touch.  We had a window seat overlooking the water which also kicked up the ambiance.    To start we had the calamari, i was also hoping for a bottle of white zin but they didnt have it so we went with pinot grigio.  Calamari was good and plenty for the five of us, and our wine was good as well.  For my entree i ordered the swordfish in a cream sauce w/ clams & shrimp.  It was really good and really tasty.  The sauce got to be a little rich after awhile, but it didnt over-power the dish.  I was pleased.  I had a taste of the scallops too and it was equally tasty.   For dessert we split the chocolate torte, lychee shaved ice and creme brulee.  Sad to say, we finished every last bite.  They were all delicious.  Its amazing we all can keep such slim figures.  I'm not sure how nights are on the weekends, but the night we came it was quiet and relaxing so it made dinner that much more enjoyable and intimate.  Prices were reasonable and they have some good items to choose from on their menu, but the list for entrees is a little limited.  What i really enjoyed was the live band playing jazz.

u8ki1gcxHchMs3T5VJtFdQ.review_text: Decent food, great space and great bartender!  We celebrated my friend's Birthday here.    We had the Kalua Pig Lettuce cups (great), garlic noodles (good) & Calamari (great) as appetizers.   To be honest, we were full after the appetizers and could have gone without dinner.      I had the vegetarian bento box for dinner.  It was pretty good.  I thought the service was good, they also gave us a great table for the celebration.  But, it was a little cold in the restaurant.  The corkage was $20.00 and the wine list was just ok--but hey, who needs wine when they serve great drinks!  I loved the sour cherry martini.

1ASe0kmRUTPOgWxJUG2Avg.review_text: This was not my first time dinning at Butterfly but it would def. be the last.  The service was terrible, starting with the waiter and finishing with the manager in charge.   The whole experience was awful and I will not come back to this restaurant

vOlY1wfmMghhYGBPdtfpgQ.review_text: CLUB SCENE @ BUTTERFLY On 9/10/2012 ======================== Came here for the first time because my friends decided to throw their birthdays together.   I'm disappointed at the bartenders. Not just bad customer service skills but also very limited mixing skills. Unfortunately, The drinks I requested failed. Here's a few examples.   Grasshopper - Fail They can't make it and gave me non-reasonable answer. "because I cant hear you," with an attitude then turn his head to the next customer or "sorry, I only know how to mix with just vodka."   Tokyo Ice Tea - Fail Basically something that tasted just alcohol with almost no taste of melon, sours, or lime soda. Friend's face had a constipated look of  "oh god wth is this?"  Vodka & Cranberry - Fail There was no harmony in that glass, just tasted like cranberry won the  war over Vodka... Or it was just Over Kill in sweetness  The place looks nice but its like any other club. There are no seats unless you have bottle service. There's a nice smoking area with a nice view of the water, when the clouds are not blocking the moon light. Although, the rest of the night did not dazzle me to come back but surely dazzled me into writing this review.  Me and my friends wanted decent drinks to enjoy the night but the "professionalism" will be keeping me away.

V5WrOWuL2UGGBiv5a5O27w.review_text: We were in town on business from Connecticut and wanted to eat somewhere highly recommended.  Well, the food was phenomenal !! Drink specials are delish!

t3c3KbUwz5Z9NVb0w9zkjQ.review_text: I was really hesitant about coming here because of a bad review I had read. But I'm glad my friends pushed into coming anyways just to try it out. We came with a big party so we got to try a lot of the menu. The wings are amazing! I'm not a fan of blue cheese but it was just a touch so I was able to eat all of it! We also tried the calamari and clam chowder (good but not your typical chowder experience) which was also delicious and ordered several sandwiches to split among our group. Here's what we ordered: chicken salad club, mushroom au jus, cheeseburger, pork katsu, and chicken teriyaki. All of which were great! My favorites were definitely the chicken salad and the pork katsu though.   The location is so pretty, right on the water. I came during lunch but for dinner you can tell it is definitely more of a romantic, intimate setting. If you're planning on going for date night, make sure to make a reservation with a seat by the water!

5EiZIsTu_-Izn5ucT7Ef7g.review_text: Filet Mignon mediocre. Peking Duck yummy (I asked for the duck to be cooked medium well as opposed to the default medium rare, and my picky toddler loved it). Creme Brûlée to die for. Super kid friendly with a kids menu under $10. View of pier to go with the meal priceless.

6DQSY_Nw4gavZg8NCb2hQA.review_text: A restaurant & bar by the water but no views ...it would turn to be a night club on some weekends. Foods & ambiance, service etc are all so so ...

CBwF2a2qEXpiHulN7MjCyQ.review_text: I like this place though there are people I've talked to who are not fans at all.  We were here 1.5 years ago and I'm mad at myself for not reviewing sooner.  I think the food is good.  Generous portions for this type of restaurants and very flavorful.  I remember loving both our appetizers and was digging into my date's entree.  We started with the Hamachi Sashimi which was to die for, I can eat that all night long and be happy!  And we also loved the Kalua Pig Butter Lettuce Cups which was almost as delicious.  We cleaned off both plates, that's how much we liked them.    For entree he had the salmon (which I don't see on their menu anymore) and I had the Peking Duck.  I liked mine but I loved his.  We were pretty full half way through the entrees and ended up doggie-bagging the rest home.    I don't love the view but its decent.  The decor is fun and interesting to stare at.   I can't wait to come again!

mUGl4Sei7OtlZjHr38W7TA.review_text: Just came here for drinks but the hostess, manager, and waiter were really nice, helpful and fun. The cucumber and kiwi was DELICIOUS

rC6wWWFJyuvChCutO5LZgw.review_text: I can't say I'm crazy about this place, but the restaurant itself is nice...there is a bar in the restaurant, which is always a plus.  It comes in handy too, because the service is SERIOUSLY slow, and not very polite either.    I am never rude to people serving me food unless the situation really calls for it, but I waitressed all through high school and I know it isn't that hard to SMILE and be polite to a customer, especially when that is your job.  Anyway, that was a side note.  The edamame is good, but I personally prefer plain edamame, because they put too much salt and sesame oil or whatever it is on it.  The food is overpriced and the portions are small, but it was good...I tried the pork chop, filet mignon, and scallops (eating off everyone's plate...classy I know).  And I got really drunk...REALLY drunk at dinner, which was slightly embarrassing, and the staff kept giving my whole table strange looks.  The one nice thing was that the manager came over to the table to tell us about a special smoking area through the kitchen right on the water, so we did not have to go out front.  Also, they offered to turn on heat lamps for us when we were smoking, which was really nice considering smokers are usually treated like lepers.  Anyway, I'm really hung over still from the wine (that was followed up by more wine) so I can't imagine this review makes a lot of sense.  But I hope its helpful.  UPDATE!!!! I just remembered, and this is two days later, but they have THE BEST creme brulee I have ever tasted.  I was just so drunk at that point I almost forgot.  But even in a drunk haze I can confirm that it is seriously splendid.

pC_PwF3RTWaqyoluvA1SXg.review_text: I had a great time here with friends..Eating Flavorful dishes and drinking champagne. It was their treat and butterfly held up with its food and ambiance.  3 stars because its Pricey for the Small Portions and there are no taxis around---luckily we found a stand by limo and a tricyclist...Crazy night...With all the food and drinks....we went from being a cacoon to a butterfly...  Maybe its late at night, and my reviews are getting weird...  Try Butterfly, Something different than the Usual Thai, My oh My I no Lie, Just dont get any dessert pie. goodnight I'm feeling High...j/k :P just had to rhyme.  3 stars for butterfly. Food was good and Safe. Ambiance was trendy and hip, but parking will be difficult and taxis are no where around.

OLysz4xEEC5j1Foxs4zVfg.review_text: a great restaurant to bring a date- very romantic by the water, dim lights and comfy couches. perfect to watch the sky change colors as the day turns to night. we had a few appetizers with cocktails- everything was very flavorful- highlight of the night was the tuna tartar, with nori and rice tater tots.... I didn't want to share the plate!   Rob the chef came out a few times to present the dishes himself and encouraged feedback which was really refreshing. by the time out evening was over, we felt like old friends. the staff were super nice, although a little enthusiastic when clearing our table- felt a little rushed as the evening progressed while I was trying to savour the ambiance-we were barely finished with a plate and it would be cleared away!  this is definelty a good date spot. even with a mix crowd of families, couples, friends catching up- it did not seem too loud or intimidating.  am going to dream about that tuna tartar and tater tots tonight!

d5IXMuFIZHBpTe20jmYJmQ.review_text: My husband and I sat at the bar while we waited for our Alcatraz tour.  The bartender was very friendly.  He also made some great drinks!!  I had the sailor's punch and it was so refreshing.   It was rum, shishito pepper, lime and agave nectar.  It was smooth with great flavor from the pepper.    We also shared the salt and pepper calamari.  It was full of flavor and very fresh.  My husband had a bloody mary oyster shooter and said it was very good.

Afq57_KYVBBJlSj1X5-4xQ.review_text: Took my lovely clinic manager to toast her birthday. As i'm the luckiest boss around (the quality of her work has spoiled me for a lifetime..), transplanting her from peninsula to sf is a favorite hobby. Gives an unhurried moment to hear of her world and nosh together on beautiful food. Butterfly did well as a setting. Sat in a cosy demi-booth which looked out on the bay: sailboats in full sway on clear day. Service prompt, and menu offered fresh idea. Execution fine, not stellar-- i had Sashimi Salad which might've been great, but dressing was too heavy to let fat of fish shine. A good idea nonetheless (an attempted re-creation at home not out of the question..) She had a chicken club sandwich, recommended for sheer volume, and report was a thumbs up.  Overall, a nice to take it sf, though with quality eateries dusting our fine city, i'm unlikely to rush back. Still, enjoyed my favorite of employees and no regrets on the visit.

6K7j8OiLChFflIrh95Pn4A.review_text: I was driving with my family by the Embarcadero and we decided to try Butterfly on a whim since we had never heard of it.  It looked so cute with its little delivery golf cart parked by the front!  It took us over 20 minutes to find parking for the car and we were already impatient and hungry.  Add to that the fact that I had looked up Butterfly on Yelp via my Sidekick and wasn't very impressed by the reviews...I was preparing for the worst.  BUT WOW, this place was lovely!  We went in for a late "lunch" (we really just picked three things off the appetizer menu) and all of us were very happy and content. I was really caught off guard by all of the negative reviews.  1)  The atmosphere.  Butterfly kept the original wood skeleton of the building and just spruced it up with a few added colors here and there.  Very lovely mix of modern and classic.  There were couches in the corner where a few twenty-something women and their children were enjoying tea and watching the television.  It wasn't too busy and it wasn't too empty.  Our waitress was busy with our table and another family, but was very attentive, friendly, talkative, and helpful.  My mother was also impressed with the flower arrangements, since she enjoys ikebana.  it's always a plus when my critical mother is happy!  There is a lovely waterfront view with a large floor to ceiling window on one wall.  Really, my only concern would be the white tablecloths.  The rule of thumb is that white = dressy but that isn't the case at Butterfly.  Everyone was very casually dressed.  2)  The food.  Honestly, this place is very affordable!  I'm not sure why people think this place is expensive...the menu is only moderately priced.  Since it was really only 4 PM, the four of us ordered three things from the appetizers menu to share, making it VERY CHEAP.  This was a suggestion by our waitress, and a very helpful one at that!  All of us were happy with the items we picked.  We ordered pan fried garlic noodles -- delicious.  Noodles were consistent too!  And the chunks of garlic were excellent!  Lettuce pork rolls -- incredible.  My dad is on a carb diet and eats a lot of lettuce rolls (usually with chicken) and he loved these!  The sauce was perfect.  All the lettuce leaves were perfect too (crisp, green, and fresh).  Calamari -- loved it!!  Usually, a calamari appetizer tastes and looks like something you'd get a fish and chips shack.  NOT SO AT BUTTERFLY.  it wasn't greasy and it was very light.  Overall, we got a lot of food for super cheap!  And it was expertly made and extremely delicious.  We definitely would have been happy paying more since the food was of such wonderful quality.  3) The drinks.  I don't drink and I've never had a cocktail, so I can't dispute or corroborate the varied opinions surrounding their cocktails.  Really, the only downside I can think of is that Butterfly offers nothing on tap.  That disappointed my father.  He says it never tastes as good coming out of a can or bottle.  Furthermore, the drinks were about twice as expensive as expected.  We didn't notice this until we looked at the check.  My sister and I always get mixed soda beverages (like a Shirley Temple) and they were priced the same as my father's alcohol.  Every time we asked for another, we were charged again.  So that was a bit unexpected, but it just taught us to ask in the future if in doubt!  Sorry, I know I type a lot and this has become a long review.  The point is the my family and I enjoyed the decor and the welcoming atmosphere.  The food was an awesome deal for the great quality!  Every item was wonderful.  The drinks were more overpriced than usual and the dress code is more casual despite the white tablecloths, but that's about it.  I will definitely come here again!  I'm very pleased that we discovered this place and that we decided to try it out despite all the negative reviews I had previously read.

a8LyrHfE53qtrxdFSTmv1A.review_text: This was our (party of 5) first time visit here and we found this restaurant to be excellent.    First of all, the hostess was friendly, welcoming, and accommodating.  Secondly, our waiter was very personable, helpful, and efficient; the other workers (bus, helpers, etc.) were also friendly and welcoming.   And most of all, the food was excellent: well prepared, tasty, attractive presentation, and reasonably priced.    We had the hoisin baby back  ribs, Kalua pig with lettuce cups, fried calamari, Koby beef sliders, and Duck confit spring rolls.....all were excellent.    If you are there between 4-7pm ask for the Happy Hour menu...it's a great deal.  In fact, having several items off this menu makes for a very nice dinner.  We came with a coupon that essentially gave us half off......but we would return anytime, even without a discount coupon.

VhbAKBGltxbdKOS6ZraZFg.review_text: Good food, great service, beautiful views. Definitely a date place. The prices do get a little expensive though, but if you have a passport card like I do, it's buy one get one free entree! My friend and I split the duck confit spring rolls per everyone's recommendation, and it met the high expectations. For the main course, I got the dungeness stuffed chicken breast, it was aite. Nothing special.   Storytime: My friend got the Mesquite grilled pork porterhouse and asked for it to be done medium well. It came well done, and she said it was really hard to chew. So she told the manager, and he said he would gladly make a new one for her that's more on the medium side, but my friend declined because we were in a slight rush. So instead they gave us free dessert! :D That's good service. They were so kind about it. The banana lumpia dessert was REALLY good, get that one! It's basically banana eggrolls, coconut ice cream, and slices of banana on top. We also had the mint chocolate chip/ice cream dessert, but the lumpia dessert beat this one hands down.  Would come here again for the atmosphere and great service!

l5R9eYl4p0_62KvmKqXRMg.review_text: Nice view but noisy inside. Nice to hang out with friends but not the best place for a romantic date or when u just want to have a peaceful dinner. Seems like u are in the middle if a melting pot of waiters, food and Vietnamese spices! We had smocked salmon w/ strawberries (yak!), kalua pig and peking duck were delicious though. The cocktails were so strong... Omg! Be careful!

CHV3OXUzMbMDZ5A07UGO5A.review_text: Now I realized why my friend drank up the last little bit of the Mussel/Clam sauce the last time I was here.  It was D-E-licious!  This time we saved the sauce for another meal at home with pasta! We were seated near the window.  The servers were so good and were pros!  The waiter even explained that Frog Hollow salad does not have frogs, but the term described a place near Bakersfield.  When we told him we were going to share everything, the pear salad came separated, one portion for me and another portion for my friend. The Blue Cheese muffin is to die for (maybe too dramatic).  You really got to love blue cheese. It was D-E-licious with sweet beets and just the right acidity of dressing, not too sour and not too sweet.  The calamari was a bit overdone. My friend mentioned how fresh the mussels were, tender, perfectly done, not rubbery.  We picked all appetizers and the hamburger.  The hamburger was very tender and the fries were big chunks, crunchy outside and inside soft!  I wish they would provide like an alternative to ketchup, like inventing a signature Aioli or even their own Wasabi/Garlic sauce for the fries (hint, hint).  I like their sign outside:  Kids Menu.  This is one of the nicest places to take a child.  Everyone was so well behaved!  It's nice for families to be together in such a nice place!  Hard to see "Kid Friendly" place.  Bartender was non-stop.  Drinks looked really good.  DAT is a good deal and you can order one and shared for two!  Their dishes are really good portions.

ZtmeHAQyNFku338dJMIfTg.review_text: Hey this place is a lot cooler than I expected.  We live a few blocks away in North Beach and for whatever reason, never checked Butterfly out.  I really like the space.. the windows, the high ceiling, the colorfulness..  the edamame standard starter is a cool and welcomed touch.  I had the blue cheese filet - while the cook recommends medium rare, I asked for medium, no problems.  It was medium spot on.  Very delicious with yummy whipped potatoes and vegetables.  The highlight of my night was the warm chocolate torte... simply delicous.  I absolutely love warm gooey chocolate desserts and this is one of the best.  I would recommend checking out the menu before you go though... not sure if this place is for everyone.

E64y6JubxrDdMeQfQRFSJg.review_text: I came here for there Thanksgiving special.   It was nice that we were served each course with some time in between, and the service was pretty good. I have to say that the bar tender made me a delicious mojito!   The food was pretty good, although I'm not a fan of too much meat, and there was a lot of meat in everything. I definitely could not finish my entire meal! By the time dessert came around, I could barely eat that!   The decor is pretty nice, and the food is pretty good, but it's definitely a bit over priced.

fvNmwPu0RU7Wcr1Z6gFhrQ.review_text: I met up with a friend here for lunch, it was a journey to get here since there was a Pro-Life March taking place along the Embarcadero, but I wasn't disappointed once lunch was served.  We stuck to the Dine about Town menu and were happily impressed by the food.  For appetizer I had the duck confit spring rolls, on its own it lacked a lot of flavor, however once you added the honey and chinese mustard sauce,  it became tasty.  The spring rolls weren't greasy, and the sauce had a bit of a kick to it and cleared my nasal passages but I liked it.  For our entree we both got the shaking beef cobb salad, it was really good.  I didn't expect the poached egg on top of the salad, but my egg was perfectly cooked not too hard, but also not too runny.  The bacon and the prosciutto brought a great flavor to the salad and the lettuce was well dressed and the beef was an added treat seeing how flavorful it was.  Desert was a warm chocolate torte with coffee ice cream and raspberries and I couldn't get enough of it.    Overall we had great conversation and good food.  The food wasn't heavy so I left feeling comfortably full.  Not to mention we got a great view of the water while we ate.

gVaFXfqESHZ651BBvvltMA.review_text: Came here last night for Dine About Town.  We had looked at the DAT menu online before, but when we got there it was different.  The actual appetizer choices were smoked salmon strawberry spring rolls, calamari, and seafood minestrone.  We were kind of bummed, because we had really wanted to try the duck confit spring rolls and the kalua pig lettuce wraps.  We ended up ordering the salmon strawberry rolls and the calamari.  Both were delicious and presented nicely.  For our main course, I ordered the snapper, which was served with lettuce cups, rice noodles, and a sweetened fish sauce.  I really enjoyed that the fish was served on a hot stone and remained hot during my entire meal.  Fiance ordered the kalbi steak which was seasoned well, but kind of small for an entree portion.  For dessert we had the chocolate torte and the banana bread pudding.  We LOVED the banana bread pudding!  It was served with vanilla ice cream and a few caramelized bananas on the side.  Overall the food was delicious, but a little pricey.  I would come back for another dinner special, but probably not at the regular price.

RjzR_i_cshg4meEjOvv1Xw.review_text: I was so starving after my husband and I spent 5 hours on Alcatraz, skipping breakfast, that we decided to not try to walk around forever and stopped here. Butterfly is located just a few buildings down from the dock area. The decor is nice, and we were seated right away by a window looking over the bay. However, the bench seat was up against the window making it only possible to see the view if you looked behind you, otherwise, we were facing all the other diners, looking towards us and out the window! The lunch menu is much smaller then the dinner menu, and the selections didn't look as appealing. My husband ordered the Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herbs. The dish was difficult to eat, and he said the snapper was pretty bland, but otherwise an ok dish. I ordered the Kobe burger with steak fries. The patty was way too large, and the bun was of poor quality (think safeway brand buns.) and not proportionate to the size of the patty, making it very soggy and impossible to eat picking it up. The fries were huge, and unfortunately were not cooked through. Nothing worse then undercooked fries!  The beer selection was very minimal, none on tap, five bottle offerings and they were out of the first 2 my husband requested.  The service was friendly and efficient, the main plus to our visit there, but not enough to make us want to return.

8_QXVI6hlXRTZJQ9MVPKTw.review_text: Great food, great drinks, superb services!

CO3V-Hv7xoyBvjriZ_q_Wg.review_text: Another asian fusion place that did not disappoint.  I'm always hesitant about paying so much for asian food... but this one was good.  We were about 15 minutes late for reservation because of damn parking around there is ridiculous during the day.. most meters are 7days/week!  LAME.  Regardless of our tardiness, they still gave us a good seat with a nice view of the bay (with green murky water =P ).    It took a while for our waitress to come to us, but in between, we got our water promptly, and a plate of sesame edame.  We initially decided to come here for DAT, but they took off the one thing I wanted from the menu --the grilled snapper lettuce wraps.  So, we both decided to get the grilled snapper lettuce wraps and one calamari.  The calamari had an asian taste to it with sesame sauce and cucumbers on the bottom of the plate. The calamari was ok... there wasn't much substance other than the batter.  I didn't really feel like I was eating any squid at all.  The grilled snapper came out sizzling on a clay iron pan on a bed of basil leaves and caramelized onions.  We also got a separate plate with our noodles and lettuce wraps.  Good thing I'm Vietnamese, otherwise I may not have known how to make the wraps. =P  The fish was cooked well and wasn't dry.  They don't give you much lettuce, but a good amount of fish... so I just ended up eating the rest of my fish with my noodles and the fish sauce.    The decor of the restaurant is nice and comtemporary.  I liked their 2 seater booths, but too bad they weren't facing the ocean.  The total bill was $45 for 2 people-- 1 appetizer and 2 entrees.  A bit pricey for lunch, but it was still satisfying.  I don't think I would drive all the way out here again for the food, but it's good to try once.

g2hQYumU1nGsneneavMA1g.review_text: I didn't eat here.  This is a review for the lounge.  It was a Saturday night.  After a nice dinner in Sausalito, my friends and I were late to Butterfly Lounge.  We got there just before midnight and the promoter gave away our table because we were late.  I think it was Asian night.  Let's just say the crowd was on the younger side and there were a lot of people who could not hold their alcohol.  Several drunk, young kids were pretty rude about bumping into my friends and I.  They just shoved their way through the crowd without any apologies.  There are only two stalls in the women's restroom.  This made things difficult as one girl locked herself in one of the stalls and puked her brains out.    It was a good thing I came with my friends who made it a more enjoyable night.

KvZgnqm2ykEZ2YZHailGyA.review_text: AWFUL time. My husband and I stopped for lunch while on our honeymoon and had theeeee worst experience. Food was ok, this review is about the poor service we had. Everyone else around, before, during, and after our meal were treated to edamame, while we were ignored. Would have been ok if this was it, but it took over 10 minutes to have someone check and refill our soda during our meal. Another 10 minutes to bring our check after we asked for it. Over 8 minutes to bring our check and card back. Alllll of this would of been forgiven if we were treated with the same peppy and courteous  service everyone else around us received. I really hope in this day and age, and especially in SF we weren't disrespected because of us being ethnic.....but it sure did feel like it. FYI not to be prude but we spent the previous night at Gary Danko and were treated like royalty! Dropped more then few hundred $ and have no problem with tipping since my husband is in the business. But this was just a moment that ruined the day on our last day in the city on our precious honeymoon........

5StNJhHuPAFS0FoBOxO0qg.review_text: This place is great, food ambience and service. Chef Lam and his crew know what thei are doing. The people that do no enjoy it need to go back to their Applebees in Hayward or wherever.

7i2JyM5gVZnXtsgb7zCdtg.review_text: The night started out with me finding a parking space right in front.  I thought was hot sh**. You know, VIP parking!  Then I found out we were going to Butterfly and not Bubble Lounge. Noooo..pwned.  This review is for the club venue.   Must have been Filipino night. Crowd was 98% Filipino. Not that I cared.   We were told earlier that day that any persons name on the guestlist can bring 5 additional guests. Apparently not! First of all, half of the names that were suppose to be on the list were not. Second, those who were on the list were not allowed to bring any guest. What kind of bs is that? They wanted each non-listed person to pay $20 cover. Umm nooo..   After much debate and negotiation, we got the cover down to $5. Much more manageble, but still.. : [  First thought: This place stinks. Literally. Smelled like the sewers. Mainly because it is on the pier next to the water.   Dance floor: Really spacious. One of the biggest I've experienced.   Music: 5/10. Wasn't really feeling it. A collection of old mainstream hits. Mainly hip hop.   Drinks: 3 wisemen, Jager bomb both $10 a piece. Also had Patron courtesy of Rite Aid :D  Bathroom: Pretty clean. No line. No annoying cologne, mint, towel guy. I was happy. :)   Coat check is $5. I rather freeze a little.   Parking: Bay st.  Highlight: The outdoor smoking area is on top of the water. Pretty cool, but smells. Maybe someone will get drunk enough and jump in. JK. :p  Will I return? Nahh..

uaQW0HU1MV2jJ7rdl9vYqQ.review_text: Butterfly is a beautiful dining destination located on the Embarcadero, prime SF real estate.  The dining room is large, and lush.   The thing I remember the most about Butterfly, is the amazing food!  I stopped by the bar before, during, and after dinner so some things are a bit hazy but how can I forget the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups!  Incredible!  We also splurged on the Oysters with a Bloody Mary Oyster Shooter, yummy and super fresh.  For dinner we feasted on 4 different entrees that were passed around.  At this point my memory starts to fade a bit so I'll sum up that everything I tasted was just getting better by the bite.  Knowing the chef helps a bit because he sent over 4 different desserts  to try .. the presentation was as decadent as the flavors.  The happy ending was staying till close taking shots with the chef.

m9WSWhMGhPK_x3ML2M-eFw.review_text: Hostess was incredibly rude. Tons of open tables but turned us away at 5:45 saying that all tables were reserved..... Was it the stroller??? Loved this place but will never come back to be treated that way! Who in sf eats dinner that early other than senior citizens or families... Please!!

jKJPREWQEOw-LHYQiurk2A.review_text: The food is good enough at DAT prices but we probably won't come back.  Here's what we ordered:  Salmon Carpaccio - Excellent salmon; the crunchy stuff was too heavy for me; never a fan of alfalfa but I liked it Churrizo Scrambled Eggs - Pretty tasty, but the senoras at my office's humble cafeteria do better Duck Confit Eggroll - Didn't taste much duck; well, I have a pretty high standard for duck Shaking Beef Cobb Salad - It was a little strange but it had meat in it so I wouldn't complain; I liked the poached egg, it was interesting Creme Brulee - Pretty run of the mill; didn't really need the cookie Chocolate Tarte w/ Coffee Ice-cream - Good, but you can't really mess up pre-packaged cake and ice-cream Lychee-tini Lime-nade - Really good flavor and I don't even drink [much]!

gruFpAi3i00fyHOqu0GyeQ.review_text: I came to this restaurant with my mom and boyfriend and we were a little ambitious as we wanted to use my $50 restaurant.com certificate. You basically had to spend $100+ to get $50 taken off your tab. Even with main course dishes around the $25 mark, we still had work to do. Here's the showdown Appetizers: 1.) Spring Rolls: fried eggrolls with duck. These tasted wonderful by themselves, but they were served with a mustard/wasabi sauce which was really overpowered by the wasabi's strength. Go VERY easy on the sauce. 2.) Calamari: Lightly battered and crispy calamari served with a light drizzle of sauce (I forget what). I have a bad habit of dunking my food in sauce but this plate kind of didn't let you do that. 3.) Sashimi: This was my favorite. Four large slices of sashimi plated with slices of blood oranges, oranges, and other tangy things. Once we finished this plate, I was using the citrus juice left over in the plate to dip my calamari in. Main Courses 1.) NY Steak: My boyfriend ordered this dish and the steak was very good on its own without the need of any sauce or salt or pepper. As it should be. 2.) Duck: I ordered this plate. The duck was cooked wonderfully (med rare) but it did feel rubbery at some points. Served with a green onion crepe. 3.) Seared Ahi Tuna: My mom ordered this. Generous pieces of seared tuna served on a bed or red sticky rice. It was alright. Dessert 1.) Creme Brulee: the description said "served with seasonal berries" but all that it was topped with was a quarter of a strawberry. This dish was heavenly. Other 1.) Lycheetini: Probably not that strong because my mom gets chatty after one good drink. Grand total? $106, with gratuity included. Overally, the portions at this restaurant do not disappoint. Service was spectacular, food was ALMOST there. I actually enjoyed the appetizers a lot more than the main dishes and if I do come back it'll probably be for drinks and appetizers.

-hSLnGKUJtshbOw7CUXJ-Q.review_text: Butterfly is a cozy, upscale-looking Asian fusion restaurant that would be perfect for dates, especially if you get a waterfront table. I imagine it to be rather romantic and puts you in the mood for a glass of wine if you're watching the sun set over the pier with your hubs.   Though when we went, there was a huge family of literally 20 with the parents socializing and talking among themselves while the kids had their own designated table (didn't you hate being shunned from the adult table as a kid?). Because of that, the ambiance was a little interesting. The orders were also a little slow coming out because the big party had to be served, but overall service was very attentive.  The food: Good - Duck spring rolls - everyone raves about it in their review here and it's delicious. Fried to a crisp, so they're crunchy and piping hot. The duck filling has a slight soy sauce flavor and is shredded with an assortment of other veggie ingredients. Each one is kind of small but it's a good portion to share between 2 people. Just watch out for the dipping sauce which is VERY wasabi-heavy. If you don't enjoy wasabi do remember to ask for an alternative. The sauce is premade so unfortunately the wasabi cannot be excluded. - Cod - it came swimming (not live =P) in a seafood broth that tasted super light yet savory, if that makes sense. An interesting dish, as it was definitely a marine protein dish yet there was a soup element to it. The shrimp that came with it definitely had an Asian influence to it, but the dough it was wrapped over tasted a bit chewy and the flavor of the shrimp itself was unmemorable. Ok - New York steak - this is what my sister ordered and it was cooked the way she specified. Not much to say about this entree. You can't go wrong with and you'd probably enjoy it, but it wouldn't amaze you.  The menu has a handful of entrees - not too many, but enough to choose from. Their items are more specialized and intricate which probably explains the limit of the number of entrees.   Food was good, but without the Bloomspot deal I think I wouldn't have found the full-price value worthy. I enjoyed my experience at Butterfly, but I also think there are many unique and colorful restaurants in the city that are worth trying, whether you're looking for a date night spot or trying to bring everyone in your extended family to dinner.

S62YEa0KUoxw86fYa3brnw.review_text: Mad props to the l'il bro for suggesting this place.    The two of us and two dear friends from college headed here for the Sunday brunch on a breezy, sunny day.  After hopping off the F, we waltzed in and had a really great dining experience.  After nibbling on the sesame and salt covered edamame, we ordered the duck rolls with wasabi sauce for the table.  I had the fantastic poached eggs with salmon, avocado and hollandaise sauce, which basically was eggs Benedict with salmon and avocado.  It was...man, it was pretty amazing.  And really, really filling!  It came with a small bowl of fresh fruit which included raspberries, kiwi, lychee, pineapple and other fruit. Sampled some of my brother's crab/eggs Benedict.  That was good too.  We all split the chocolate torte at the end, I could only handle one bite because I was pretty stuffed.    The restaurant includes a full bar, really nice decor, and an excellent view of the Bay, since it sits off of Pier 33.  It really was the highlight of our day, and I plan on heading back.

POmyqedLjt06Gfajf1of5Q.review_text: great place for dinner if you are on the embarcadero.  started out the the duck confit spring rolls-- very tasty and they are not kidding, the mustard has a spicy kick  I had the fillet Mignon and bf had the porter house pork  Both were very filing, I actually liked the pork better with the peaches and bacon pieces on top and it was very juicy. we were too full to try the desserts but they looked tasty too.  Very beautiful restaurant right on the water.  A bit pricey but a very nice place for dinner.

sN1lNwR5J_P0k83f-5IOsg.review_text: Things ordered: Duck Confit Spring Rolls Grilled Hanger Steak Grilled Pork Porterhouse Banana Bread Pudding  Duck Confit Spring Rolls: They were served with a Chinese honey mustard sauce and I didn't think worked very well. The spring rolls themselves were very bland without the sauce and the duck was a bit dry. I'm not sure what all the rave about this appetizer is, but I was really disappointed.  Grilled Hanger Steak: This was really good and cooked perfectly. It was served with some sliced rice cake rolls, which had a nice panfried crispiness. I liked the asian fusion sauce they had going on this dish.  Grilled Pork Porterhouse: I really liked the vegetables/garnish on this dish. I ate all the vegetables! The pork itself tasted too much like a cut of ham to me, and I was just not into it, although it was cooked nicely.  Banana Bread Pudding: This was the star of the meal, my favorite dish all night. It was just soooooooooooooo good I cannot do it justice describing it. It was moist, soft, and had the perfect mix of banana, ice cream, and cinnamon. It even came garnished with little pieces of bruleed bananas. It was cute!  Service: Our server was awesome. He also reminded me of Veronica Mars' dad, which made it more awesome. I dunno.

JGpN481RghhrmVH9dKotXg.review_text: This place is almost hidden away on Embarcadero but the large lighted sign helps finding it. My date and I were able to get seated by the window, which is probably the nicer seating area in the restaurant. I ordered the yellow fin tuna. It tasted great - fresh, flavorful, with some mushrooms on the side. One could argue it was simply an overpriced Tuna Sashimi, but the ambience is awesome for a date. The dim red lights above the tables illuminate the tables perfectly.

oAR34UNeA8lPQB1enl2U_Q.review_text: The food and atmosphere at Butterfly were great. And our server, Porter, was amazing. He had such great energy. He was also very knowledgable about the menu, and made great recommendations for what wines to pair with our meals. The next time I go to Butterfly, I will definitely request him as my server again!

xdavkX57NzkwLGqe_2fwsw.review_text: Tiffany, Tiffany.... Let's hope you are able to keep this gig, because.... you will never find another job elsewhere with that personality.  As a food service veteran, you know what to expect.  Let's just say, expectations were grossly under met at Butterfly yesterday for an "un" Happy Hour.    Met up with my girls here.  We decided on Butterfly because of the good happy hour specials.  Great bargains for drink and appetizer specials.  Kudos to you.  That's why you get a whopping 2 stars.    Now, let's get to the nitty gritty.  SERVICE WAS APPAULING.  Our bartender (by the way... her name is Tiffany), decided to put everyone's order onto ONE tab because we "sat next to each other".  Sorry, but when you're at a bar meeting up with friends and order SEPARATELY throughout the evening, the bartender is supposed to ask "start a tab or close it out".  Yeah, there were people that I was sitting next to that I didn't even know, friends of friends.  Why don't you just throw that other guys tab on to it as well.  Go for it Tiff!    Anywhoo... so she definitely caught a major tude when we asked to separate the tab.  Don't know why, because I didn't even so much as frown when you spilled half of my martini on my leather bag.  (I sure as hell did though when you didn't even comp it!).  So as we were leaving, some potential customers outside asked us how it was.  We said the food is ok, service sucked.  They opted out... karma is a bitch.  Or maybe capitalism wins again!  Try harder Butterfly.

pmKnNkGVgzhMkwJaTU5apA.review_text: Been wanting to try this place saw a groupon and decided to buy one! When the groupon was about to expire, decided to come here for my mom's birthday dinner. I had really high expectations for this place.   I was really excited to try this place, but ultimately was disappointed. There weren't  many menu options to choose from and the portions were too small. It didn't correlate with the extreme pricing! We started off with the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups. The taste was sweet and reminded me of pulled pork. The lettuce cups itself looked really fresh and had such a pretty color green to it!   I ordered the Roasted "Peking" Duck. It was really tasty but wow 3 pieces? I saw other yelp photos with 4 BIG pieces, and I got baby pieces! The crepe that came with it was savory. My mom got the Grilled Hanger Steak "Kalbi" Style. That I liked! It is just, there aren't any carbs on the plate, so the meat itself is way too overpowering and needs something to tone it down. Hence, the Wok Seared Garlic Noodles we had to get as a side. These tasted pretty normal. Nothing exquisite or unique about it! Tasted like what's offered at regular fusion restaurants. My dad's dish was beautifully placed! I really enjoyed looking at it. He got the Roasted Chicken Roulade. Sadly, it didn't taste as good as it looked! It was really bland and plain! The rice with a poached egg was probably better than the chicken.   Before I forget, they gave complimentary edamame too! Nicely seasoned with tons of flavor!   Though the food was not as tasty as I expected we did have a good experience. The reason being is the owner came out to greet everyone! He is a chef and was extremely friendly. He started speaking to my parents in Vietnamese so I thought that was really cool. I felt that he really appreciated his culture and upbringing in the US when he came as a baby, and really worked hard to fuse the two cultures together in his foods! This aspect of my dining experience definitely gives this place another +.5 stars.   So I'd give this place an overall 3.5 stars. It is conveniently located by the pier, so depending on where you sit in the restaurant, you might be near the waters! If you're not, the restaurant is nicely decorated anyway so any where you sit offers a pleasant view.

LQ3wuja7RygHk8eoDlfrSQ.review_text: Sorry my friends, but Butterfly misses the mark.  It's OK at best.  On our visit, the waitress brought me the wrong wine, didn't ask how I liked my meat, and the food (which looked very promising) was just meh.   Butterfly serves their food in a gorgeous room with an impressive-looking menu, so my hopes were very high.  But getting a medium-well steak that was burnt on the outside was, for me, $30 of very unappetizing.  I also ordered a glass of red wine and was brought champagne.  The sides were yummy and my boyfriend's food was alright.  I sent mine back --and I rarely do that.  Come'on Butterfly!  I wanted you to be SO good and if you tightened your act up just a little bit, it would take you a very long way.  I can make much better food at home.

0lDl1Jg1Qz2KhvkfJKk6fw.review_text: I wanted to like this place more than I did. The taxi driver was excited for me when I told him where I was going which was the pinnacle of the evening.  High points: The rib appetizer was fantastic. Sweet and sticky, with bleu cheese sprinkled on top. Flavorful to the point that I stopped being polite about it and just scooped them on to my plate. Also, the complimentary endeme beans were great. We had a group of 12 and our server was attentive even as the place got jammed later.  Low points: What is that smell right when you walk in the door? A rancid, greasy odor is not a good thing to get the evening started. Others have mentioned the decor. Eh. Ikea meets Pier One, The bar could use a refinishing. I like bars made of wood that looks like it's 'lived a little' but this one just looked dingy. Beware of places that have quotes of reviews on the exterior of the restaurant. I wasn't bowled over by the wine list as the blaring advertisement inferred that I might be. The 'by the glass' list could use a revamp. Other than the ribs and beans, the rest of the food was not terrible but not great.  No points: The view is OK...not breathtaking for an 'on the water' place. Bartender was OK but a smile would be nice.  You could do worse than Butterfly but you could do much, much better.  Note: I've been informed by the establishment that I know nothing about wine and that I should have indeed been bowled over by the wine list. Over 400 Yelp reviews and this is the first time I've had a place seek me out to specifically insult me.

cUzVHypDhj0EL87TuvtwoA.review_text: I wanted to like this place but for the money spent, it definitely wasn't worth the time nor the effort.   The decor of the establishment was nice, definitely an upscale sort of restaurant with a surreal sort of theme. The service was okay as well since my water glass was tended to in a somewhat timely manner(I drink a lot of water...) . I do not drink alcoholic beverages so I wouldn't know how their drinks/bar fares in the perspective of a liquor connoisseur although members of the party I was with commented that the drinks they ordered were very slow to come out. So at this point of the review, I would have rated the restaurant 3 stars...but due to the quality of food served I lowered it to one star if anything to dissuade people from coming here for the food.  The onion soup was terrible. I don't know exactly what the chef or cooking crew threw in there but it seemed almost as if they looked around the kitchen, found whatever was close to expiration or had expired and tossed it in the soup. Then after doing that, mask the flavor with something sour like lemon/lime juice and/or vinegar and then put cheese on top because everyone likes cheese?? Am I right? Other people in my party opted for the salad, which in hindsight seemed like the safe choice, you can't mess up salad unless the dressing is just disgusting.   Next up is the Ahi tuna I had as my main entree. It was definitely overcooked but edible. It tasted like canned tuna though...I like canned tuna but not when I have to pay a super premium for it. I didn't want to send it back as I was afraid of something 'special' in the return dish plus after the onion soup fiasco I pretty much knew how the meal was going to turn out. I think if they had just sent the tuna out raw without their pitiful attempt at cooking it, I would have liked it better. I love sushi! Too bad it wasn't a sushi place, but maybe that's a good thing. I don't think I would like to suffer from dysentery for a couple days. Other people in my party had some sort of braised short rib with risotto? They were commenting on how the risotto was undercooked. I don't think any one of us had anything good to say about their entree.  For dessert, I had the creme brulee. Most of the other people in my party opted for this as well. What was somewhat unusual is that the dessert was served to us chilled, as if it came directly from the freezer. I don't really have anything against it chilled however, and seemed okay to me. I have a sweet tooth so anything sweet regardless of temperature would taste okay to me.   I know that this is a scathing review of the food served here. Maybe the onion soup was supposed to taste the way it tasted considering this is a restaurant whose cuisine is that of 'fusion'. Maybe the tuna was supposed to be served rare or medium rare and I should have sent my plate back for the 'just right' one at the risk of possibly getting a little something 'extra special' on the side. Maybe it was just a tragic set of of circumstances that led me to order whatever I ordered and that in a parallel dimension my otherworldly self may have decided upon an entirely different choice of food and as a consequence enjoyed the meal. Alas, this does not seem to be the case for my present self and I hope beyond hope that I never find myself eating at this establishment ever again.   As an aside,  I stopped by my local Nation's Hamburgers around 1 or 2am since it is open late on Fri/Weekends and I grabbed a grilled chicken sandwich with a milk shake. That tasted much better than what I had at Butterfly plus filled me up because obviously I didn't get full eating at Butterfly.

UK7zwAPY29WnlD-ig-v3CQ.review_text: The abstract: Food 3.5-4 stars; Service 5 stars; ambiance 4-5 stars  We had family visiting and they were hungry and wanted to eat after their day on Alcatraz so I searched yelp for restaurants near the ferry terminal. We made very last minute reservations for our large (11 people) group, and they graciously accommodated us. I was a little nervous about it, since I had to choose the place for for a group of international foodies. The problem with  restaurants in touristy areas like this is that they don't HAVE to be great to stay in business. They can be mediocre and still keep going just because the clientele changes daily. I was very relieved--pleasantly surprised, even--by our dining experience at Butterfly.  Our waiter Porter was off the charts amazing. He gave us very detailed descriptions of any dish we asked about, and offered accurate and candid personal opinions about what was good and what was not so. Which is nice. I don't like when wait-staff claim everything is amazing, because realistically, unless you are at the French Laundry, it ain't. Anyway, everything he recommended was spot on. He was super personable and told me the ricotta cheese on my entree was made from milk he brought in from his sister's cow from a farm in Marin. My most favorite thing was when he took the children's orders directly from them. Being experienced little foodies, they all knew exactly what they wanted and were able to order on their own (even the 3 year old.) I love when people treat my children like the competent individuals they are.   The menu was one of the more interesting ones I've seen lately. We ended up trying the majority of the menu and it was all really good. Maybe not great, but certainly not disappointing. My husband thought his hangar steak was just ok--I tried it and liked it quite a lot. I had the tempura-fried squash blossoms. They were a fun, novel choice. Not something I'll crave or anything, but I enjoyed the dish and ate it all up. The potato gnocchi served with them were wonderful and I don't typically like gnocchi. The kids' meals were good too...no reheated sysco chicken nuggets...real food. At $10 per kid, I would hope for that.  Anyway, bottom line, we enjoyed our meal here very much. It was the perfect place to meet up in the tourist area, but not feel like you were IN a tourist attraction. No one even seemed bothered that we hung out awhile after we paid and just visited, which was really nice since our party consisted of family who live in Hong Kong, Taiwan, So Cal, Mo, and here. It was a rare convergence for us and I am glad we were able to spend some of our time together in such a pleasant, welcoming establishment.

CMQ_rgY7GUzw8-LeaPoGsw.review_text: We had an EARLY dinner (6pm)... We ended up having to pay $12 bucks for parking across the street - lame.  The restaurant is pretty cool, but I felt like it needed some updating (seemed kind of 80's to me) and I felt like they needed a few more selections on the menu.  The staff was awesome! - they were friendly, on their game, & knew just the right amount to be involved.  They actually had a DJ, too - I think he showed up around 7pm-ish & played some cool ambient/loungey type grooves.  Awesome views of the water & boats - since it was still light out.   Awesome starter of perfectly cooked & seasoned, fresh edamame with sesame seeds & Hawaiian red salt!  Dude had a Chimay, and I had their Bulleit Manhattan with orange - it was excellent!   We split the "Vietnamese Caramelized Shrimp and Green Papaya Salad" appetizer and the "Sonoma Liberty Duck Confit Spring Rolls" appetizer - both EXCELLENT - very yummy!!  and they were pretty nice-sized portions, too!  (probably shouldn't have ordered two)  For our entrees, Dude got the "Sweet Soy Glazed Natural Pork Chop", and I had a glass of Prosecco and the "Orange & Curry Spiced Maine Day Boat Scallops" - both were VERY good!!  (although, I didn't detect much of a curry flavor) Our entrees were cooked PERFECTLY, and everything was VERY fresh & flavorful.   We ended up getting double espressos, and split the molten chocolate cake with java ice cream & raspberries for dessert as a rare splurge.  YUM-O!  We WILL be back...

dbh_9Xy5-jSJ5aXNOzHonQ.review_text: I went to a company party here and I'd have to say that I had a pretty good time. It was def better than what I had expected. It was open bar, I didn't have any alcoholic drinks (yeah I'm so lame. But I'm not about to get butt crazy drunk in front of the execs.) but everyone else seemed to def take advantage of that, but since it was open bar, the bartenders (2 or 3 people), took their sweet time when I came to making the drinks, b/c what's their hurry right?   They  had little appetizers going around which was probably my favorite part of the night, we had oyster shooters (GOOD), tuna pokie (VERY GOOD), and lettuce wraps (kinda fussy to eat since you have to use your hands), sushi (it was alright), and some others, but there was a nice array of choices, but my two favs were the oysters and pokie.  Appetizer we had the choice of a creamy ceasar salad, or French onion soup, there wasn't anything special about the salad, it was your typical ceasar with chicken, the French onion soup was pretty typical, but I liked it, it wasn't super salty or anything and there was TONS of stretchy cheese on top.  Entre, we had the choice of the veggie option, filet mignon, and something else that I don't remember, all the filet mignons were cooked medium to medium rare which was perfect. I had no complaints about this dish. But please remember this was all on my company's tab, so for free, all of this was pretty good, I'd have to say I'd pay no more than $28 for this entre personally....  Dessert we had the choice of lava flow cake, which I didn't choose b/c it was too chocolately, def someone who LOVES super sweet and gooey. I chose to have the crme brulee. It was huge, and very good. Ate the whole thing.   Service was pretty good, the servers pretty much stayed out of our way and let us do our own thing. There was a little bit of a dance floor to the side of all the tables that were lined up, probably had about 100 people or so at the company party, good sized venue for a group like that, but any bigger it would have been annoying.   Bathroom was alright, sort of on the clean side, but was kinda dirty... the trash needed to be taken out. I was a little surprised that it was like that when they knew they had a private party to host...  They also had coat check which was nice.    The overall layout of the place was nice, the bar is pretty big and nice, good view of the water, you can go outside for air or smoke too.

0p4lR1qeT9ZG2Rb5DjjTZg.review_text: Negative infinity stars. This place sucks. Bought $100 tix for new years and we're still standing in line at 11. Got in line at 930. Total waste of money. Don't waste your time ever coming here. Again, for lack of a more eloquent term: this place SUCKS!

K0ijOKoV3wTlgFZKlRMrhg.review_text: A couple of friends and I had dinner on Tuesday evening this week.  We were in the area and based on my past experience, I thought it would be a good idea.  Being Tuesday, there wasn't much of a crowd.  We were seated quickly and ordered in a reasonable time frame.  However, after our appetizer was served, we waited for 20 to 30 minutes for our entrees.  One of which was ordered well done and it came medium rare and had to be sent back.  The two others of us had to eat first lest our food would have gotten cold (and yes the inside of the restaurant had cool down quite a bit during our stay).  10 minutes later our friend finally got his food.  Food was okay, but the service was lousy. All in all a crappy experience on the light traffic night.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: I thought this would be a cool place to stop by for a drink and maybe some apps with hubby but that was not the case.  The place just doesn't feel inviting and the waiting area is somewhat awkward.  The worst part is the place feels dirty - the black floor, tables...just show every speck of crumbs, dirt and not sure when was the last time it got a good mop?  Even the wait staff's black outfits are spotty - that includes the bartender with stuff all over her tank top.  Anyway, we had:  kiwi and cucumber gimlet - $9 - tanqueray gin, muddled kiwi and cucumber, soda, lime - it tasted funny  sumojito - $9 - bacardi silver rum, sake, lime, mint - this was bitter  Forget the app - we couldn't leave fast enough.

GHZdMggvuYk1fsVWcyy0JQ.review_text: Oh Dine About Town, I love you and your ability to make trying new restaurants relatively cheap and guilt-free!  I went here for lunch during the June DAT. The strawberry salmon salad rolls were delicious. Something about the saltiness of the smoked salmon and the sweetness of the strawberries... it was addictive. The shaking beef cobb salad and the creme brulee were quite tasty.  The view of the water is spectacular (almost breathtaking enough to make you forget the tourists surrounding you). The decor is very posh modern, but in a warm inviting way.  My only complaint was that the second half of our meal the service took a dramatic nose dive. However, our server explained that our original server hadn't been feeling well and had left. He ended up having to cover half the dining room by himself. It was a weekend and it was DAT so I guess they were busier than normal the hostess and the manager were also serving/refilling water. So I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt on the service rating.
