Ez7XEsjavOv1IeL73znofg.review_text: I'm very skeptical about restaurants on the waterfront because majority of the people go there for the view.  I came here last night to try the Dungeness Crab Tasting menu for Lunar New Year Special and I was delightfully impressed.  Here is the 5 course menu:  Crab and Sea Urchin Hand Rolls, Yuzu Kosho Vinaigrette, Toasted Nori Crab Roe and Soft Tofu "Ma Po Style", Poached Egg, Tofu Crackers Salt and Red Chili Crab, Crab Fried Black Rice, Buddha's Hand Hollandaise Long Life Noodles, Brown Butter Crab, Caramelized Daikon, Lime Leaf Mandarin Orange Shaved Ice, Almond Tofu, Candied Kumquat $59 per person  Executive Chef Robby came out after each course checking on us to make sure that we were enjoying the meal.  The ways that he highlighted the crab was delicious.  This menu is very limited so call ahead and let them know that you want this tasting menu.  The last day for the menu is on Friday, February 17.

WwB6wB0ad3s-WJc9p7gfVQ.review_text: Came here with friends for DAT In Jan.  we shared some of our foods.  Appetizer: fried calamari - average; duck spring rolls - average; Kalua pig with lettuce - above average. Main course: shirt ribs - yum; hanger steak - good; grilled snapper - yum!  Dessert: lychee shaved ice - good; crime brûlée - yum (a but on the sweeter side but I have a sweet tooth) All in all, pretty good meal. The 5 of us each got a drink, hubby got 2 total. Grand total was 65-70 each. The food is pretty good but you are definitely paying for the location and atomsphere. We would prob come back again if it's DAT.

L-RyP9gsSWXMv8eFsTWNRw.review_text: The food's good -- nothing revolutionary -- and the place has a nice ambiance to it. Unlike most restaurants with comparable food, this place isn't stiff -- there's a younger crowd and vibe, and they have a DJ that plays good hip hop music in the background (but it's not so loud that you can't hear anything).  Tip: Ask for a table by the water, makes for a cool, somewhat scary view at night :D

DodFQgkojJ2hCXuI85RR3A.review_text: Food:  4****Stars Service:  1.5 * 1/2*  Stars Design of the window seating:  0 stars (it was designed backwards) w/o views of the water.  I went after I saw the promo. on Check Please Bay Area.  I was excited to go but we had some issues from the get go.  We made reservations during a week day around 11:30 a.m. When we arrived we told the greeter we had lunch reservations (the place had only about 10 people there) for a quiet area.  She sat us right next the the bar area in a movable table that faces the bar.  Their website ad says "breathtaking views."  BS.  All the booths that  are along the bay-side window are facing to the interior of the restaurant.  You have to turn around and mess your neck up to see the view.  In any event, we called the greeter and told her we wanted to move to the table and chair seating that was on the opposite end of the window area next to a larger rounded booth.  That was better, so we could at least face the water seated at a nice table for two.    Ok, now comes the wait staff:  They were understaffed even with 10 people eating.  The service was slow, yet professional.  Our server was as nice as he could be, but everything was in SLOW motion.  We sat there a long long time before the water person came over to get up water.  I had to ask the waiter two to have the water person bring water.  The waiter ended up bringing the water and shortly afterward the water person finally showed up, but he was no longer needed.  I ordered the turmeric red snapper with the onions.  IT was well prepared and loved the onions.  I can't remember what my guest ordered, but was happy with it.    After we ordered, our food, we waited and waited for the server to show up to see if we wanted anything else or just wanted our check.  We were ready to go at that point, we were on a lunch schedule and did not have all day to sit and wait for service.  At that time, more tourists started rolling in (about 12:45 ish) but I did not not notice more staffing to pick up on the slack.  hmmm  When we were about to leave, Chef Robert Lam came over to our table to chat us up about the food.  Of course the food was great and we did  tell him that.  Everything was prepared perfectly.  I looked around to see if he went to other tables, but he just went back to the kitchen.  So, I wondered by he just stopped by our table?  In any event, we enjoyed the special treatment given that the service was off.  If you want a view, don't make a reservation for the window booths. There is only one small table for 2-3 that you can turn to face the water.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: A girl friend and I went here for happy hour one time last year when she used to live off Lombard and so it was only walking distance from her place. We met Chef Rob Lam who was gracious enough to comp us free desserts and drinks towards the end of our visit. I haven't been back since hanging out with Chef Rob after the SF Chefs 2010 event. The food's pretty innovative and delicious.

t1vm6Nx_vyd1oQXoFqL_PA.review_text: There is a reason this restaurant is always empty. We live in north beach and have tried to support any halfway decent restaurant that would make the embacadero waterfront more legit than a pure tourist trap of aggressively bad chain restaurants. We've eaten there twice for lunch and dinner, quickly reminded of the mediocrity and disappointment each time (including the overrated kahlua pig lettuce cups). Our last experience sealed the deal with service being terrible, a completely flustered crew with less than 10% of the restaurant occupied. San Francisco locals beware!

KFVS2CXSXFMawdBGzP5bBw.review_text: Bought a voucher from LivingSocial so I decided to take my mom out for dinner at Butterfly.   Made reservations for 6:00 and were promptly seated. Our table was right next to the window so the view was pretty awesome. Only problem was the seats faced AWAY from the window so we were staring at the couple at the bar the entire night instead of out at the ocean... Poor design/planning?   We ordered the following:   Kalua Pig with Butter Cup Lettuce -  Delicious! The shredded pork was so juicy and soft and flavorful. The lettuce was crisp and tender. What an awesome combo. Beware: It can get messy as the juices from the pork drips everywhere.   Lemongrass Seafood Minestrone -  Bleh. Didn't like this soup at all. I would rather have a can of Progresso minestrone soup than the one served here.  Macadamia and Blue Cheese Crusted Filet Mignon -  I ordered it medium done and the meat was perfect. Pink on the inside and still tender and juicy. The blue cheese was a little overpowering for me as I usually prefer milder cheeses, but blue cheese lovers may really enjoy this combo. The mashed potatoes that came with the dish weren't completely mashed up... tsk tsk.   Grilled Pork Porterhouse -  Tried a piece of my mom's entree and I was quite surprised at how delicious it was. What I liked about it the most was the fact that it wasn't accompanied by any sauces so that I could really taste the natural flavor of the meat. Two thumbs up for that one.   Chocolate Torte with Coffee Ice Cream -  The chocolate torte was so, sooooo good! The outer cake part was alright, kind of dry and flavorless actually. But when I cut into the inside, the hot melted chocolate was heavenly. And the combo of cold coffee ice cream with the chocolate was to die for. Loved it.  Classic Creme Brulee -  Also delicious. It's just your basic creme brulee but done extremely well.  Overall, I would give the appetizers and entrees three stars. However, the dessert was so phenomenal that I decided to add an extra star :]

9_XVtOi6QHd39HK7-9v2mw.review_text: Came here for lunch - the menu looked delicious and made me wish I was hungrier!  They start you off with complimentary edamame with sesame seeds and vinegar - a nice, different touch.  We just had a couple appetizers - the Kalua Pig with Butter lettuce cups was so tasty as were the garlic seared mussels and clams.  Portions were quite large, we couldn't even finish all the Kalua Pig (which was a shame).  Atmosphere was chic and it has lovely views of the bay.  Service was friendly and fast.  I imagine it would be a great place for dinner.

0jQDOstEQECkL9ylX4bwDA.review_text: Last night Beth and I decided that we needed to catch up over dinner. And inspired by "Dine About Town," we chose Butterfly. I got to the restaurant early and there wasn't a soul there! Which didn't discourage me from saddling up to the bar and getting in a few drink orders before the end of Happy Hour. Butterfly has a great happy hour - $5 selective cocktails, beer, and appetizers. It's a deal at twice the price, and after Happy Hour that is exactly what you'll pay...  Although, I do have to rib the bartender a bit since he damn near knocked over Beth's drink into her lap when he put down our starter place mat. Beth's cat like reflexes saved her from a soggy lap. Smooth move bar tender. Hahaha...no big thang!  I ordered a $5 Cherry Blossom which was really good, and so I ordered another! A super light vodka cocktail with a fruity twist - but not sweet fruity. Very mellow! I dig it. We also ordered the Duck Confit Spring Rolls which are served with a spicy mustard sauce - what a tasty starter!  When we were finally ready to be seated for dinner I took a look around the place. I LOVE the look of Butterfly! The lamps, the edgy wall hangings, the full wall of windows looking out across the Bay onto the glittering lights of the East Bay...I love the atmosphere. My favorite part of the décor are the giant puffer fish (ish) black spiky lights with red bulbs. So cool. You feel like you are dinning under a black widow puffer fish! We were seated in a booth, which is mentionable because their booths are SO roomy and comfortable. We sat back and chatted, but I could equally see getting cozy with a date as well!  I ordered the Cesar Salad (always - God I love me some Cesar Salad) and I loved their fresh, not overly smothered in dressing Cesar. The croutons were super tasty as well. Kudos! For my main dish I ordered the Hanger Steak which is served with potatoes au gratin and sautéed Portobello mushrooms. This entree was really really really good, and I don't just think that because I have been on a diet of non fat cottage cheese and carrot sticks for three weeks. The beef was expertly and perfectly cook exactly how I requested it. So tender, it practically chewed itself.  I can't wait to go back for Happy Hour!

YsPeUn3iIgSISkz4g8eCBA.review_text: My DH & I came here for a late lunch (Sun. 2:00) after seeing his parents off on a cruise at the pier next door. It was lovely to sit at one of their few outside tables and ogle the Queen Victoria floating so close, even if a bit chilly.  I had the lycheetini, which I planned to order non-alcoholic but didn't  - it's 5 o'clock somewhere right? Very good, tho the lychee is overpowered by the vodka.  The duck spring rolls were wonderful, served with a sweet/hot mustard sauce.  We shared the vietnamese fish sandwich which was wonderful, and my DH must have mentioned at least 3 times during the trip home how yummy our lunch was :-)  I wish we'd have had room for dessert, but we had dessert first, visiting Smitten for ice cream with Mum & Dad before bidding them "bon voyage".  Reading through some of the other reviews, maybe we just got lucky, but the food was delish, and our server attentive and pleasant, and the day was beautiful, can't ask for much more than that!

LxaNILaDWb1HWFP0s_SCLw.review_text: interesting but i am not convinced yet

kepqZPSeGh0Ns1zfOgL-zg.review_text: This is a good place to go if you like asian fusion. I have been here a few times with my friends. I was just here last  during my trip to S.F.  We stopped by for lunch.  We just ordered a couple of dishes. We had the kulua pork with lettuce and also the garlic pan seared clams and mussels.  Both dishes were good. The broth for the clams and mussels were just a bit salty but the overall dish was good.  The broth was curry flavored which made the dish interesting. The kulua pork with lettuce was GOOD!  They also have a full bar and a good selection of wine.  We went with a nice bottle of wine with our meal. The staff was friendly and nice. The decor is pretty cool inside too.

X63qh9pJRPsSRKmd_A8q8A.review_text: Had the pleasure of eating at Butterfly before leaving for an evening tour of Alcatraz (The boarding area for the tour boats is a very easy walking distance away).  The decor inside is trendy and gives the customer an appropriate idea of the asian fusion food experience they are about to experience.  Butterfly is located between Pier 35 and 33 and looks out onto the water between the two piers.  Several of the table are set up by the window for couples to have a romantic setting with a nice view in the background.     On this visit, we started off with a cocktail and a few appetizers.  The cocktail I ordered was called a  Cherry Blossom, black cherry infused vodka, cranberry, lime and ?.  If you are a cosmo type of cocktail drinker, order this drink, it's fantastic.  For appetizers we ordered the Calamari and  Hoison Glazed BBQ Ribs which were both memorable.  The aioli drizzled over the calamari was perfect and, though I never believed it was possible, the rib appetizer was better than the version I've eaten many times at Roy's in Kahana, Maui.     For dinner, I decided to try another appetizer, the Garlic Seared Clams and Mussles in a Lemongrass-Curry Broth, while another guest ordered the Wood-Oven Roasted Sizzling Cowboy Steak.  The steak was cooked perfectly and was large enough to easily split between two people, which is a good idea considering the price of the steak ($38.00).  My dinner was even better than I'd imagined.   The  broth was delicious and the clams and mussels were a perfect compliment.  So glad it was served with a spoon and 2 slices of crostini to help soak up all that flavorful broth.  The other guest also loved her steak and ended up having to taking home half, which she enjoyed the next day too!  Too full for dessert this time, but the coffee was very good.    Overall, I found this to be a very enjoyable Asian-Fusion type restaurant.  The menu offered some very clever and intriguing menu options, and I can't wait to come back again to try more.  Oh, and have another Cherry Blossom, or two

VjRv_B2txbUHzO7HDm3FrQ.review_text: Neat place. They describe themselves as Asian Fusion. Most of the menu items had different little twists to them. We stayed pretty safe and ordered garlic noodles and calamari. Food was really tasty. The also served very generous portions. They had different portions for many of the dishes as far as cooking style and protein choices. All in all a good choice!

VscmKvwdzy21Diqv2LjQ0Q.review_text: There is never a disappointment when dining here. There always seems to be a Living Social deal ($25 for $50) and the food is simply amazing to come back to time and time again. The oyster shooters are always a great way to start the meal and although the entree items can be pricey, the appetizers are a great deal. My girlfriend and I have come here so many times (due to the Living Social deal) and will continue to come. We always end up just having a cocktail or two and them ordering a few appetizers for the table. I find their apps to be better than their entrees. Overall, an outstanding place with great food and a good location.

UA5-e4_EQ2T2ieKaq7c9jA.review_text: I love coming to Butterfly! And I love their food! Hold on, let me rephrase that. I love their set menus during special occasions where you choose one amuse, one first course, one entree and one dessert. The first time we came here was for Valendoom's Day back in 2009 and since then, we've tried their set menus for Mother's Day brunch, Christmas and New Year's as well.  Most recently, we came here 3 days ago with some friends who were on vacation from Oz and tried their à la carte dinner menu. Everything was great - service...appetizers....soup (OMG the Mushroom Cappuccino Soup is the BOMB!!)....everyone else' entrees. All except for mine. I had ordered the Free Range Chicken Clay Pot, consisting of chicken breast, chinese sausage sticky rice, a poached egg and braised cabbage. The chicken was dry and bland tasting and the sticky rice was soaking in oil! The only thing cooked perfectly was the egg so I just ate that and maybe 3 tiny pieces of chinese sausage.  When the waiter came by towards the end of the meal to check in on us, I had to tell him nicely that my dish sucked and that they should consider removing it from their menu :0) He was so awesome about my complaint and even told me they appreciate feedback like that so they can improve on their menu. He offered to have the kitchen make me something but I didn't want anything else so they were nice enough to take mine off the final bill. The manager even came to apologize personally and said both he and the chef agreed the chicken was very dry and that the dish just wasn't up to par.  Still love this place!

_Rn6-H5xG_-uxXr08avUCA.review_text: This place is pretty awesome.  Loved funky decor inside and warm atmosphere. I started out with the Lychee Martini. It was delicious and I loved that there was lots of lychee juice. The food was simply amazing. Loved the fried calamari that had a touch of cream sauce. The oyster shooters had just enough spice and left an amazing taste in your mouth.  We also tried the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups.  The pork was so flavorful and when you wrap it into the lettuce, it was so refreshing. For dinner my husband and I shared the Sizzling Cowboy Steak 22oz.  It came with Chorizo Sausage and Tomatoes, Caramelized Onions and Jalapeno, Foie Gras Butter, and Steak Fries. What a unique combination. It was really delicious.  Finally, the waitress was pleasant as well and that's always an added bonus.

2ReIK14NZX-_VWIgjnLRAQ.review_text: So I'm pretty surprised that this place gets an average of 3.5 stars.  Went here with a group of coworkers.  The food was decent but definitely not exciting or anything.  My issues are twofold:  1) We had a larger group and a few of us got the seared tuna.  Now the seared tuna is seared rare but a couple of people wanted it cooked a bit more, don't ask me why.  Eventually, I was given one of the dishes that was cooked a bit more and assured it was mine.  I took a bite.  Great.  Overcooked tuna...fun.  2)  Server realized his mistake and that my dish was given to someone else.  Instead of fixing it, he goes "well you already dug into yours so you'll have to keep that and we'll cook the other one more for the other person."  REALLY?  You admit it's your mistake but won't fix it.  In summary, food isn't amazing and the service was pretty crap.  Two stars.

6I_vZ-DzDshlL7tP_cjEVg.review_text: Came here after the Alcatraz tour without reservations and were quickly seated to the "communal table," but no one else ended up sitting next to us, it was great.  Good ambiance, excellent customer service. The pre-fixe menu was to die for: mushroom cappuccino sounded horrible, but it was a mushroom bisque with a foam served in a coffee cup and it was amazing! The calamari was the best I've ever had. I was on my honeymoon, and they served us complementary dessert wine (tokaj) and the waiter was very knowledgeable about it.  Definitely recommended.

0HsleTo2dcYugbhu_1TWDw.review_text: by far the worst dining experience ever.  for nye i had made reservations for 5, but ended up only having a party of 3 which was no problem for them. we got there on time and were immediately seated. after being seated it took them 15 minutes just to bring us a glass of water. mind you this is nye and we were on a time crunch as they were too since there was a party going on afterwards.   after they brought us water 15 minutes after being seated we noticed that it was a pre-fixe menu. i had booked my reservation through open table and on there was no indication that it was a pre fixe menu for the night. the waiter explained to us and we agreed and decided to order as one person and share everything. we told the waiter and he took our order plus drinks.   35 minutes have gone by since we arrived and here comes the wait staff manger or whatever his role was. he then comes to our table sweating profusely, dripping sweat on our table, and tell us that we arent allowed to order just one meal and they "generally dont seat people for drinks" okay so your going to tell us this 30 minutes into our dinner and we haven't even received our drinks!? so we tell him to get his owner..  he then attempts to get the owner and the owner doesn't come out, so he then tells us again that he will have to charge us for 3 people! bull crap. we told him that this was the worst dining experience ever and that we have nowhere to go since its nye and we are on a time crunch and we haven't eaten.   they refused to serve us anything and had everyone staring at us as we walked out. it was so embarrassing and by far the worst dining experience ever. i will never set foot in this establishment again.  please do not ever come here, the wait staff is rude, the owner is rude, the hostess is rude, and the vibe and energy in this place is awful.  thumbs down to this rotten butterfly.

t9n_IfSRPuQWaqDxPq_1WQ.review_text: I give Butterfly a 5+!  Simply put, everything on that menu is amazing!

B8ZhQFlKfoJpxL9XKTybCA.review_text: We actually didn't sit down and eat at the restaurant. We were short on time so we just ordered to go. I ordered the ceasar salad and Kobe burger. The burger was very good. Very flavorful and juicy. The ceasar was just ceasar salad. I'll have to give this place another try. Dine in.

QocBlTr2yzZd6IjJMPo0Cg.review_text: I tried this place with my BFFL on a Saturday night. I made reservations on OpenTable.com the night before, and was pleasantly surprised when I got a call from the restaurant confirming my reservation. I really like the interior design on the restaurant, especially the booths. Very modern. It wasn't very busy around 7, and they seated us right by the windows (but there's actually not much a view). I ordered the roasted duck peking style, while my BFFL ordered the crispy chicken stuffed with crab and cheese. She absolutely loved her dish, although she couldn't finish it. The thing was really huge! As for my dish, it came with scallion crepes and a hoisin cream sauce. It was deeeeliiisssh. A contemporary take on the traditional chinese peking duck. I cleared my whole plate. We also used a $25 restaurant.com gift certificate, so we did save some moolah. Probably wouldn't eat there without it since the prices aren't college student friendly. But you could always order appetizers  instead of the full on entrees.

EpJMKlxPPs63wiavBHELXw.review_text: Came here for a triple threat party on a Saturday and the bouncer greeted us with something along the lines of "its a classy club until they have 'rap' nights like this one." BOO!!!!  Can we go back and throw him over the bay?  He probably has to wait another week before getting his e-supply on 3rd trance Saturdays or something....  One star for the djs who made my night somewhat bearable after that...

LuO3Bn4f3rlhyHIaNfTlnA.review_text: Is it possible that I have grown tired of Asian fusion cuisine?  Maybe.    This would explain why I was not overly impressed with this restaurant.  View?  What view?  It was effing dark outside so all I saw were walls lining the water.  The food was okay.  We started off with appetizers ordering the Poke tartar and the fried calamari.  In my experience Poke tartar is supposed to be cold and not lukewarm so that was unsettling.  The fried calamari was well, fried.  Yeah.  We skipped the salad course.  My friend ordered the salmon and it came in a broth mixture that made it taste very salty.  Is salmon supposed to taste like a saltlick?  I think not.  I ordered the short ribs.  Why?  Answer: because I've had my fill of asian fusion for a while.  The dish was very good, the meat was tender and well seasoned.  We ended on a high note, ordering the creme brulee with fresh berries.  The dessert portion was huge.  We barely finished half of it.  I have to admit that I don't normally like creme brulee but this was one of the best I have ever had, thus the addition of a star to a 2-star restaurant.    So as not to cloud my perception of this restaurant, I will revisit it when I am in the mood for asian fusion and give it a second crack at impressing me.

rj1agvmVA92-Rslnk89JLg.review_text: The only downfall of this place is its misleading outside menu. It is about 3 times the size of the actual menu once you sit down to order. They need to replace it ASAP. the location is great if you are looking for a semi dressy restaurant in the Pier area. Rib appetizer was great as was the friendly service. We had an "off menu" Kobe burger which happens to be listed on the outside menu. The restaurant itself is nicely designed and the restroom was clean and nicely decorated.

QidfNDjuy_lpX89Xm5S8DA.review_text: This is my new favorite restaurant in the city!! Butterfly has outstanding food with an amazing view of the water and not to mention the great staff! I highly recommend the caramelized onion with papaya or the refreshing smoked salmon strawberry rolls as an appetizer. The grilled snapper is an absoloutely delicious combination of flavors. Its a perfect light lunch to have with a glass of wine! Their prices are great for the quality of the food and they also have a great happy hour from 330-6!!! I'll definitely be back!!

mS-4O56dx6wt5fWxbbx-LQ.review_text: Butterfly is the epitome of a restaurant that aims to be considered in the fine dining category but fails short in the delivery.   The only reason I'd recommend people to check out this place is the ambiance and nice views of the water. But do not come here for the food. You'll be paying the prices of restaurants in this category but will be receiving sub par and lackluster quality.  We tried almost everything on the menu and were collectively disappointed with how every dish was consistently substandard. The salt and pepper calamari was flavorless, the duck confit spring rolls felt wet, the shanghai garlic noodles were too chewy (they were moderately salvaged by the shaking beef but still had such a difficult texture), the ahi tuna was too hard, and the house-specialty kalua pig did not move the needle favorbly... it was a bit too dry.   The reason this receives 3 stars is because we had a friendly waitress and we did enjoy the waterfront. But unfortunately that's about all that we enjoyed.

a_zQFTuOMmhcwjmeExRsWA.review_text: This is a romantic, fun, and beautiful restaurant.  I loved that I was able to sit near the window and feel like I was on top of water because the restaurant is literally set over the pier.  Everything was delicious, from the appetizers, to the mini desserts at the end. I came in during non-peak hours so it was nice to have the place all to myself.  I came in for a 3 course lunch and I left happy.  I want to come back and try more!

w0uDU7dMDV9PcRn-qZu7uw.review_text: I have taken large and small groups here- it is really expensive, it takes a very long time, but the food is decent. And it's loud and boring.  If you have a few hours to spend, this may be your bet. And if you don't care about being bored, it's ON.  If you are looking for a fenominal experience, this is not it.  Butterfly- goodbye. C

--v4PNu18EjVGZOHIWsAzA.review_text: Poor service but good fun, nice place and the chef's visit was good. 200.00 for 3 people.

iiA_hP0YvseSLfwoi5mmZA.review_text: We went to this place after our trip to Alcatraz. We were hungry and stopped and looked at the menu and it looked good. A guy jogged by and yelled the food is good. And then I looked on Yelp and it had decent reviews. Well, another disappointing meal in SF. Our waiter was cocky and rude, we had to wait to get seated because the hostess was frantically fixing the menus. The food was just OK. The guy who delivered our food just dumped our food at the table and didn't ask us if we needed anything else like Ketchup. My burger was overcooked and dry. The place was also not so clean. There were tables that had not been cleaned and food crumps and leftovers sat on the floor in plain site while I was eating. The location is great, being close to the water is pretty cool. I can see this place being fun to go to with friends at night for drinks bu basically that's it. Not going back again though.

J2W5pb0_300Gmy-W7gZz6w.review_text: Here for Restaurant Week (aka Dine About Town, Winter 2015).  Fixed Menu @ $40 for 3 courses (and some surprise amuse bouches).  Ambiance is swanky cool but open and casual...noise level is medium (high ceilings and hard floors accetuate din of guests).   View of the bay through floor to ceiling windows can be enjoyed through the twilight hours.  Started off with a great cocktail - warm apple ginger cider (Belvedere vodka, tuaca, cider topped with 5-spice whipped cream).  Amuse bouches (3 each) followed of an oyster shooter (disguised as a mini bloody mary), ahi poke (wrapped in a minty leaf known as shiso,) and a Spam onigiri bite...which privided a perfect welcome and set the stage for the "local-style" Hawaiian-Asian fusion cuisine to come.  My appetizer selection was the Kahlua pig lettuce cups w/Housin sauce.  Coming from Hawaii, I can tell you the Kahlua pig was not as smokey as it could be and there was virtually no depth of flavor you wod normally expect from having it wrapped in Ti leaves...but it was pleasantly buttery against the brightness pf the hoisin and freshness f the butter lettice leaf wraps...and was a decent appetizer.  The garlic nooodles come w/choice of add-ons (shrimp, beef, kahua pig, "animal style" - which is the "combo" version)  and makes quite a filling entree if you are hungry.  The dish is good and comes topped with a poached egg.   The dessert choice was banana bread pudding with caramelized sauce and vanilla ice cream...let's just say its a very good (but rich!) ending to dinner.  I would like to come back and try some of their other menu items.   Overall  - a nice unpretentious fusion restaurant with a nice view of the Bay to boot.

q3MiCqCAALCrzzGunST0SQ.review_text: Yikes - don't bother eating here! Saw a review on Check Please Bay Area then saw the coupon and thought it was my lucky day! W-R-O-N-G!!! With all the fabulous options and choices here in the bay area - absolutely no reason why one would need to tolerate such mediocre cooking! Mediocre taste dish after dish. It's not even worth mentioning by the dish. After this I never believe in what the CPBA diners claim anymore. Research on yelp and read as many reviews as you can.  For those who are even thinking about buying this coupon? Try some other eatery.

HGUCnwpTKqQCEWKQIRtxiA.review_text: Went this past Saturday, for dinner for the first time. Ordered a beer, the duck confit spring rolls app, the clams and mussels app, and the filet mignon entree.   Duck confit spring rolls: i think it came with six rolls, and was served with mustard/honey sauce. Very tasty  Clams & mussels: served in a big bowl, with a type of thai (coconut/curry type) broth/sauce. Served with bruschetta, to sop up the broth. This was also very nice, although the large serving bowl made the amount of shellfish seem a bit small.  Filet mignon (bleu-cheese crust): served with mashed potatoes, and small vegetables (baby carrots, turnips, etc). The meat was cooked to my order of medium rare, and overall it was a solid dish. For an entree, portion was slightly small. Make sure to order an appetizer or salad to complement your entree, as you may not be filled with just the entree alone.  Service was great - waitstaff came frequently, to make sure I was doing ok, enjoying my meal, and to fill my water. They also brought me edamame to begin my meal, to snack on while I was waiting for my apps.  Total cost of my meal was $60, before tax/tip. The good location (overlooking the water at Pier 33), the nice interior, the tasty food, and the attentive service, I'd go back again.

L5lkchxCqj6b6uhUH0t28g.review_text: Didn't write a review after we went sometime in last November. We liked this place.  The happy hour menu is the way to go but be careful of the tricky parking rules on the streets in the tourist section of The City.  Read the signs.  Food was good.  The meat for the lettuce wrap was a bit too salty.  Maybe they want you to drink more.  The shooter was the best deal on the happy hour menu.  Not a lot of waterfront places serve good foods for a good value.  Service was nice, too.

_Dqq7dL9fyqGUvQhnTJS_w.review_text: After a long day at Alcatraz my friend and I walked over to Butterfly and had a great meal!   Ambiance:  There weren't that many people there.  The restaurant is on the water and the view is nice.  I am knocking 1 star off because I didn't really like the decor.  I don't know how to describe it exactly.  It was like a mixture of Japan and the 80s and it came out rather cold and strange.  Food: I had the American Kobe Beef Burger and she had a delicious red snapper dish.  The complimentary edamame at the beginning was to die for (had black and white sesame seeds and a special orange/red salt) and the delicious Caesar salad we split had the most delectable croutons.  We had banana bread pudding for dessert with vanilla ice cream and macadamia nut brittle.  Everything tasted spectacular!   A plus: they have an ATM machine on site!

Y_nZZsWogTbM_zKe9UDGqQ.review_text: Went on Friday night. Ordered the fried Thai Snapper $36, the fish was crispy, moist and very tasty, goes great with the fresh prepared kim chi, however the ho fun noodles that came with it was awful. My bf had the new york steak $32 it was good too. Well seasoned, and cooked perfectly, however all the sides that came with it was not good. Overall, the food took over an hour to come out. We go there at 8:30pm and didnt get our food till almost 10pm. The waiter was not that attentive, never check in with us to update us on what's going on in the kitchen or give us something to snack on while we waited and waited for our entree. With good food, you still want to ensure your customers leaves happy and not disappointed.

NppW9SFDMKioUAx_87QQhw.review_text: Nice decor and appetizing menu bring you to their slightly hidden and unadvertised door. Upon entering you arrive at the bar and are sat by the generous host.  The main dining area consists of 40-50 tables. They are open for lunch which we found rare in SF so that's a plus. There were many items to choose from but I went with the garlic noodles (chix add for $7) and the wife got the shaking beef Cobb salad. Her salad was very delicious and a must try. My noodles were just ok.....until I reached across table and grabbed the miso/soy dressing that came with the vegetarian sandwich. (Mushroom dip).  Once I added the sauce my dish was lifted to a real crowd pleaser. I would come back here for the pan-asian fare and overall laid back decor while having very good service. Overall good meal.

eqAtqnVnXgd4Mw-rR1LBWw.review_text: *This review is just for the "to go counter" on the side of the restaurant*  I'll make this short: don't waste your time; if you are dumb enough to wait in line, the staff will certainly waste yours. I stood in line today for 15 minutes and they took just one person's order (I didn't see anyone actually receive food). That one person ordered a cobb salad and the server immediately grabbed a fish fillet and took it somewhere I couldn't see. Needless to say, I didn't stick around to see what was going to happen next.

wbVhSGwcUppiv2aX6d1LmQ.review_text: We stumbled upon this place by accident the other night while walking down the Embarcadero. *Sigh* I'm really giving this place 3.5 stars but that may be because I walked there in the FREEZING COLD WIND and was slightly grumpy upon arrival. Granted, the second I walked in I was instantly seduced by the sea urchin-inspired lamps and amazing mirrors (side note: great view of the bay). Needless to say, I was slightly confused as to why this place wasn't more packed...   For dinner we ordered the calamari appetizer (yummy!) and my bf got the halibut in cream sauce and I the surf 'n turf. The steak was my favorite part but I could have done without the scallops and shrimp as they weren't done to my liking (ie lacked flavor and overall juiciness). The whole mix of beef and seafood was placed atop a bed of fried asian noodles and topped with a delicious mache salad. It came with a "veal reduction" that looked more like soy broth with green onions so I opted to not pour it all over my meal (although in retrospect maybe I should have).  Anyway, I'm rambling. But my martini (cherry blossom) was soooooo tasty I want to go back to this place and get drunk at the bar! (And ok fine I also want to go back when I'm not grumpy - that's always a downer!)

X8u30swWi-N58RjBHb8kiA.review_text: you get complementary edamame. Could be better.   My friend and I started with the duck confit spring rolls. superrrr delicious! It wasn't as spicy as I imagined, but i love the combination of flavors in the filling.   We both ordered the same thing... macadamia and blue cheese filet mignon. The portions was not bad. The veggies were fresh and tasty. They were a bit skimpy with the mashed potatoes, I admit. I devoured it pretty quickly   We couldn't decide on one dessert, so we decided to get two :) creme brulee and banana bread pudding with coconut ice cream. Both were really delicious. The bread pudding was soft and not too sweet. It was interesting to eat it with the coconut ice cream. Creme brulee was pretty standard  Ambiance was really dark at night. Every one is surrounded with a red glow bc of the candles they place on the tables.  It can either be romantic or creepy, depends on how you feel or who you're with.

t5AFrfee1pFSgVQ8Bb05Ug.review_text: Mmm...beef.  I ordered the filet with blue cheese and it was yummy. Cooked perfectly and accompanied by green beans, onions and mushrooms. I requested extra veggies intead of the potatoes it was offered with and the waittress didn't give me any weird looks or make a big deal of it. Unless I'm asking them to rarrange an entire menu item I think a request like that is fairly normal so I appreciated the accommdation. And the green beans were delicious. Not overcooked and very fresh tasting under my steak!  We also were given the edamame appetizer for free which was really yummy with sesame seeds and salt- and we finished with creme brulee which was also tasty. I liked that the creme brulee was in a wider, flatter dish- more burnt sugar area- and we all know that the burnt sugar is the best part!  I'd go back here again- it seemed like they were busy but not packed and they seemed to also accomodate a large party pretty easily.

2RFyJnbJ5AHT9hQp_tMeYw.review_text: We were in a slight panic because we were traveling all day and needed to board the boat to Alcatraz. We stumbled upon this restaurant (which seems to have more of a Vietnamese influence than American) and sat down for lunch.  It was a little before 12 and we thought "great, this place is gross" because no one was there. But, once the clock struck 12 people started piling in and the restaurant was about half full.  We told our waitress that we were in a little of a rush because we needed to catch the boat and she was fabulous. We were going to split two hamburgers but saw there was a $3 service charge for each item split so my sister opted to get the chicken salad sandwich.  While waiting for our entree, we were brought some delicious peanuty edamame while we waited for our entrees. The hamburgers were $18 and were delicious - the only complaint I had was the burger was slightly greasy and it appeared that they put a Kraft singles slice of cheese on top. The flavor of the meat and bun was to die for and I love how people in California put butter lettuce on everything.   I do have to say again - California's portions are way smaller than Louisiana's.

k0LL1-O6wRozWRCe_THiVA.review_text: Good happy hour specials! Though they tend to give you the oh, is that all you want look pretty frequently. (It might be becuase we were planning on hitting up three other places that night and didn't order that much) They are very much an asian fusion restaurant with a beautiful view. As others have noted, some of their foods have a bit of an identity crisis.   Their salmon and strawberry spring roll would be one such dish. Smoked salmon, vermicelli, strawberries, lettuce and cilantro are all wrapped in a really dry spring roll wrap. The flavors don't exactly seem to compliment each other, but aren't terrible offensive either. I don't think the spring rolls are a good choice becuase the dry skins probably mean that they have been sitting there for a long while. .   On the other hand, the Kahlua pork with buttercup lettuce cups and hoisin sauce was pretty good. Really flavorful and good. Though be careful, the pork will drip juice!  They also had a $5 chardonnay for happy hour which was not bad.   For $5 for each appetizer option, it's not a bad place to go to relax. But if you don't like fusion, stay well away.   Random note: guys bathroom is very dark. women's is very light. . . It's really embarrassing when you make assumptions about bathroom locations and go into the wrong door. .   I also agree with the person who commented about the getting money and making food without washing hands person in that I feel like Butterfly staff need to be a little more careful. I saw a waitress totally drop a credit card on the floor and she didn't notice until another waiter picked it up and handed it to her.

mp4jJPAl-lqpBP_-AA6ASg.review_text: It was a super convenient restaurant for what we were doing that day.  The food was good and the desert was great.  I wasn't confidant in the waiters understanding of my allergies so I played it super safe but ended up with a pretty ho-hum dinner.    I'd go back if someone really wanted to or it was, again, super convenient for what we were doing but I don't think I'd see it out.

s9U7Vx6YE3lvAR0Mu19B6Q.review_text: While the food was great the server was the absolutely horrible.   We get there 2 other table in the restaurant are in use.  Us being the 3rd. 15 minutes to say hi. Another to get our drinks. He forgets forgets our orders completely and double charges us for what he did get right.  You would think you can say excuse me and get some help no not even yelling excuse me got this guy's attention.  Our second time there and I am thinking next time we travel from Chicago we will not visit again.  But again the food was great.

ubHtxpOFkoAUulQmFbeeKw.review_text: went there on friday with husband and kid.  definitely impromptu visit.  The staff were totally accomodating and we didn't get any attitude about bringing a preschooler. To boot -we got the best window seat in the house.    Food was very good (especially the noodles and duck spring rolls).  Service was like clockwork and attentiveness and precision rivaled our last visit to Gary Danko.  I prefer butterfly to slanted door and would absolutely go there again

yH3s_PuWiHBkgh74iauN0A.review_text: We came here for lunch. I thought the restaurant was nice and had a lovely view. The service was slow. They were spending more time with the couple next to us. I think the guy was some big wig sports star, so we got ignored.  I ordered the Kalua pig lettuce wraps. I guess they've won awards for this but to be honest with you, I thought they were good/ok. The pork had fat on it so I got grossed out. My husband ordered the Kobe beef burger. It was really good. The beef was really tender and perfect!   So overal great place for a drink and/or an appetizer. Great views! Would I go back?....I don't think so.

wPfO0bhqtn-20K79nUICTA.review_text: I originally ate at Butterfly a few years ago and was super unimpressed. Because San Francisco is full of restaurants, I never bothered going back. My bf would mention it here and there and I would always refuse and go somewhere else. So one day, he bought some type of coupon (can't remember which but I think it may have been bloomspot) and we ended up going back. Wow, I was so pleasantly surprised! everything was delicious especially the edamame. My boyfriend practically licked the bowl clean. Drinks are delish too. We had the kumquat margarita, cherry blossom and lychee martini and they were all great. At the end when we were about to leave the chef came out and asked us what we thought. I told him everything was sooo good especially the edamame. I also told him mentioned that my bf practically licked the bowl clean and the chef replied, "Yeah, I saw that!" LOL My bf was a bit embarrassed but at least it was a compliment to the chef. I like this place so much that I invited a bunch of friends for dinner 5 days later and everyone seemed to enjoy it. I'm considering having a birthday party here in November. :)

yYfcdBqmEfpfaHIknMvN8A.review_text: Was intrigued that they had a few Vietnamese names such as Hanoi Snake River pork and nuoc cham but it's just American/ Asian fusion. We came here with a Groupon and had the Hanger Steak, Garlic Noodles with Shaking Beef, and the fish. It was not bad food but for around $28 for an entree I expected the food to taste better than your typical corner fusion restaurant.  There is a nice view during the day. But, for dinnertime, there is not much of a difference. The atmosphere was nice, brownie points for that.

OBZWID2s7E9c0pIkNqD1Ng.review_text: The Girlfriend and I went here last Thursday for our One Year Anniversary (woohoo!) after taking a Happy Hour cruise on the Blue and Gold Fleet (review is a 4 Star for them), and like Tony the Tiger used to (sort of) say, it was Grrrrreat! We went through opentable to make the reservation, and the day of our dinner I got a call just confirming the dinner. Pretty cool... though it was probably so that they could check if they were getting stiffed or not on the reservation. I still thought it was nice of them though. We asked for a table by the windows facing the water, which they did give us - it was one of the tables with the little couch which was ok... however I'm 6'3" and have giraffe legs... I didn't fit so well sitting with my legs under the little table. I was kind of hoping for a normal table, but eh. The Girlfriend enjoyed the snuggle couch, so that's really what matters, right? My aching legs took one for the team that night! Now comes the appetizers... the vodka and tequila shooters are really good... but be careful of the pricing! The menu says "shooter - 4 bucks" "Vodka shooter -5 bucks." This doesn't mean that the vodka shooter is five bucks as I naively thought. It means that the shooter AND the vodka is 9 bucks. Something to watch for next time! We then got a bottle of the Fappiano (I know my spelling is bad!) petit shiraz, and oh boy was it good! It went really well with the Duck (for me) and the Scallops (for The Girlfriend), which were both really really tasty! I've never had Duck before, and when I was ordering I was thinking back to the movie "LA Story" Where Steve Martin tries to order the Duck and the snooty waiter says "He cahn't have the duck!" and I was getting nervous that the waitress here was going to say that I can't have the duck... but then she asked how I wanted it cooked and I knew I was safe. Whew!  So After the duck and the scallops and the shooters and the wine... we go for dessert! Hey, Anniversaries only come once a year, right? It's ok to splurge sometimes! I have to say... try the cookie! They have this cookie that they make in a little skillet that has ice cream on top of it... so very good! I didn't really want to share it with The Girlfriend, but I kind of had to. We also got the Creme Brulee, which again, was nicely done and really tasty. All in all, we left there fat and happy(well, I was feeling fat and happy. The Girlfriend of course was feeling thin and happy) and it was a pretty good night!

QTghtKziGXyAoP2NobMTRw.review_text: -This review is for Butterfly as a club venue-  Decent venue (in terms of being non-janky) but SUPER tiny. Strong gin & tonics. Relatively easy parking. Will I be back? Depends on who's throwing the party/spinning, but definitely not on the never-going-again list haha.

D5uMny1pAVWhNGDvFDPp8g.review_text: straight up the food is 3 stars but this place get an extra star for location, decor and excellent service.  Having read the review and talked to folks we went there and decided to stick with the "appetizers". Most of them range from 9-14 dollars and for that price you expect some filling food and they delivered that.  We started with the salmon and strawberry spring rolls which were large and tasted wonderful. The sweetness of the strawberries was cut by the spicy and tang of the nuac mong sauce and the salmon was complimented by them both.   We then had the 1/2 dozen oysters with two dipping sauces, one a spicy Asian sauce and the other a more traditional  champagne based sauce. there was also a bloody Mary oyster shooter. While I know the beausoliel oyster do tend to be small and sweet, these were on the smaller size and I felt disappointed that they didn't pick larger oysters. The sauces were spot-on and brought out the sweetness and richness of the oysters.   Our third dish was a huge bowl of noodles that were coated in a lovely sauce and tossed with lots of small bites of veggies. This could have easily been a entree based on the size and how filling it was.  The final dish we had was the clam and mussels in tangy creamy Thai coconut curry sauce. The sauce again was wonderful and we enjoyed dipping the bread in it as much as eating the clams and mussels. There was a good serving of clam and mussels and again the portions were those of an entree not an appetizer. However the clams and the mussels were tiny and not at all what I would expect at an upscale restaurant on the west coast.  We ended our meal with two iced Vietnamese coffees and the banana bread pudding which was a wonder sweet but solid ending. It was served with coconut ice cream, two caramelized banana pieces and a  homemade nut brittle. All the components worked great together to create a subtle and rich dessert.  our meal came to around 70 dollars without tip or drinks.  Now on the decor, location and service. We went on a Monday night at 8:30 and had no problem scoring a window seat with a great view of the bay. The lighting was bright enough that my wife could read the menu, the noise level was low enough so we could enjoy our conversation and the servers were friendly and helpful without any attitude or intrusiveness.   This is a great place to take a date or out of town guests. I plan on going back and trying other things on the menu.

MsHH-CIQraaZ6suG6S5E9A.review_text: Went to butterfly with a couple of friends for drinks and apps with no reservation on a Saturday afternoon. We were seated within about 20 minutes.  The drinks were really great, a couple of us got the margarita by suggestion of the wait staff. The couple of apps we got included the edamame which was good but nothing special and overpriced since it didn't have anything to it.   Only thing worth remembering is the margarita type drink!   Oh and ask for a seat by the window, thanks definitely the ONLY saving grace to make this place at all interesting.

3reI_6iiU2od9BOzBrqxkg.review_text: Came here with no expectations and a BloomSpot voucher for $30 worth $60 of food and left with a satisfied, full belly. First, our cocktails: s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com… The Sumojito is a great idea! I think all cocktails should come in at least a one pint size! Also stole a sip of the Lycheetini and it tastes very good. It's hard to make a lychee drink taste bad. Could use more liquor in both though ;) Next, the Duck Confit Springrolls: s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… I was expecting fresh spring rolls and not deep fried ones. This resembled Chinese fried egg rolls. I couldn't really taste the duck, but it tasted good nonetheless. The dipping sauce tasted like it had wasabi in it. I approve. My entree, the Grilled Hangar Steak "Kalbi Style": s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… I believe hangar steak is a less fatty, more tough cut of beef, but I could be wrong. If it is, they did a wonderful job with this hangar steak. It was a bit chewy, but had tons of flavor and was still tender. I really loved the rice cakes as they were chewy and sweet and salty, especially paired with the bacon :) The peas and carrots though? Meh. That's more for color so the whole plate doesn't look brown lol My lady friend's entree, the Sesame Crusted Tombo Tuna: s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com… What's a Tombo tuna? No idea. But the tuna tasted very fresh and meaty. I only got a little taste and it was good! The shrimp stuffed mushrooms had sesame seeds roasted on top of it and the avocado chunks with the tuna gave it a very sushi feel. It was all very good. Didn't get to try the pepper, but Joy said it was bitter and tasty. Now that I've tried this place with a coupon, I can say I would come back here again even without the coupon. The only thing I would change is the lighting. A little too dark for me. After finishing the meal, I wanted to sit back in one of their group seating with the plush cushions and go to sleep ;)

VeuwCtfmB4VyXWuUYbZp8w.review_text: We came for a group dinner and the food was good but service was slightly lacking with long gaps in between courses.     Hubby and a friend each ordered the cowboy steak, that was ridiculous.  Other dishes were quite interesting in terms of combinations and flavor profiles.   I love when the chef takes the time to come by your table to see how everything was.  He was super friendly and it was great to talk food with him.

5S9fKZfSHEQ7qde2LyFTjw.review_text: Reasonably priced, perfect portions, gluten aware and great service!  They even left the dessert off out final bill because it was a little late...by their standards...absolutely recommend!

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: Overpriced.  lettuce wraps - ugh duck confit - weird strawberry springroll - the most decent noodle - stir fry panda express

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: It was a farewell dinner for a co-worker/friend of mine...but we had a lovely time!  They gave us a beautiful table tucked in the corner next to the window overlooking the Bay as the sky changed while the sun set.    We had a bunch of apps to start: eggs rolls, ribs, pork lettuce cups, salad, calamari - yum!  It was a feast from the beginning!  I had a lovely peachy martini and my main was the cripsy whole fish - wow, this was like a piece of art (see picture) with some kimchee tucked in the middle and noodles underneath.  If I hadn't had so much during the apps portion, I would've made a bigger dent in my fish - but of course, I had to leave a little room for dessert: vanilla creme brulee - yum!  It wasn't warm....but the vanilla taste sure came through and loved it still!  Our waitress took care of us nicely - a great all around experience!

0Fiw6jNkTBTF24uJskH3rw.review_text: amazing service,yummy food, w/ a view of the bay!  cant get better than that!  awesome happy hour :-D

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: I came here with two friends I hadn't seen in a long time. The ambiance inside is very nice, although typical of a restaurant that lies along the Embarcadero.   The appetizers we got - salad and clams/mussells were very good. For entree, I got the peking duck. My friend got the whole crispy fish and it was HUGE... I don't think she got close to finishing it. I honestly don't remember what my food tasted like - but it definitely did not feel like it was worth the $28 price tag. I guess that's the thing with "Asian fusion" and marking up the price more than what it's worth. I probably could have gotten an entire duck at a normal Chinese restaurant.  Anyway, it was good for one dining experience but I probably won't come back here again!

LdWIjNvjdaAoAfpQhT6F9w.review_text: Came here late on Friday evening after calling in 10 minutes beforehand to make a reservation, and they were able to accommodate the 6 of us! We sat by the DJ booth - very spacious set-up.    So begins my quest for soft foods in restaurants! I ordered the two softest items on the menu - at least by description. The waitress wasn't very helpful; she kept telling me how everything was good whenever I pointed at something on the menu inquiring about how SOFT it was. Well, thanks, but I just need to find whatever is soft enough. Where are your listening ears, lady? Maybe she couldn't really hear me because the music was so loud.  Seasoned Edamame - This came as a free appetizer, but was a little too tough on the teeth for me. Flavors were good, but after trying one, not again. OUCH!  Caramelized Maui Onion Soup - If my teeth were working, I would be able to gnaw through all that cheese. Very cheesy and flavorful. I really enjoyed this one, but it took forever to eat.    Risotto (not on the menu online, so I don't have the exact name) - it came with some garlic/tomato mini pizza, which was crispy and delicious. I had to cut them up into small pieces and eat like a toddler, but they were great. The risotto was a little heavy on some sort of foam.  Pretty to look at because it looked like a latte. Delicious, but heavy, so I couldn't finish it. Especially not after eating the soup beforehand.  My friends enjoyed the: Pan Fried Shanghai Noodles, House Smoked Salmon and Strawberry Rolls, the Ahi Tuna [again, no official name - my friend LOVED this one. She ordered it almost rare.]. I didn't hear any complaints on the food, so I'm guessing everything was okay.  Water was constantly refilled. They let us take our time. We ended up being the last table in the place, and they didn't even rush us to leave.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: I cannot agree MORE with the reviews I'm seeing now - see D d. for the cliff notes version of my review. I wish I had looked a little more carefully when I had so casually booked that 1000 point open table reservation for Sunday evening. Not worth the $20 in Opentable rewards I'm getting...  The lamb was the only good entree, and it wasn't anything special. I would've given 4 stars for this alone even though it was $38, but then I tried the other dishes...The macadamia blue cheese rubbed fillet was tolerable and the salmon was completely tasteless.   The best part of the meal was the puff pastry on top of my shrimp bisque (I'm guessing that was store bought), and the warm chocolate cake (pre-purchased) served with a delicious side of Mitchell's coffee ice cream (which is also obviously pre-purchased). Notice a pattern?  I feel kinda terrible giving two stars because the view was amazing and the hosts were so friendly, but the waitress was painfully slow and forgetful and the food was overpriced and mediocre (at best). Our waitress would turn towards   Come to think about it, besides the edamame appetizer I don't recall any Asian influence in my meal... for good Asian Fusion I'd recommend Ana Mandara. So 1 stars for a $50 meal that was extremely unoutstanding, and an extra star for the friendly hosts and the gorgeous venue.

UfRm6t31UuCJ8u50Sc24VQ.review_text: We went here for dinner last night for a girls' night out and it was delicious.  We each got a cocktail which were decent and then shared a bowl of garlic mussels and clams.  they were in a very delicious sauce and served with crostini.  yum!  I had the sonoma duck breast which was good.  the duck itself was good and the sauce was tasty, but there was also a bit of duck served in a scallion crepe which was unnecessary and not that good...the duck in the crepe was bordering on dry.  my friends both got the filet mignon which they both really enjoyed.  for dessert, we shared the banana pudding with macapuno ice cream and the iron skillet cookie with mint cookies and cream ice cream.  the pudding was good and the cookie was a little too oaty and not gooey enough.  i think ours was slightly overcooked.  for the location, the food and price was exactly what i expected.  the view is quite nice, too.

cG5l8teICW5NRtRJ0GpMww.review_text: I'm shocked I never reviewed Butterfly, one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Chef Rob Lam, Mike the manager and all the staff provide terrific customer service. I've never had a bad time here.  My favorites: Smoked Salmon Carpaccio, Kalua Pig with Lettuce Cups, Hoisin BBQ Baby Back Ribs, Crispy Fried Whole Fish ... and my number one dish -- the bacon wrapped Berkshire pork loin "Char Siu".  I read a lot of the critical reviews here. And my response for most of them: "Get over yourself"

UFH1DHBLw2ifnrqI5zJLRw.review_text: We have ordered the following: fried calamari shaking beef cobb salad  the kobe beef burger  The food are excellent, and nice presentation.  Will try this place again.

tV2uzfU3Gen-5pv3-ww97Q.review_text: Went here for brunch a few days ago. We had a reservation and got a table right by the window. The temperature was a little low, but not uncomfortable. Prices were reasonable for the quality of the food. The cheeseburger and fries I got was salty and delicious, and the shredded pork and lettuce appetizer tasted amazing (even though it looks a little off-putting at first.) For non-drinkers, there are a number of tasty virgin cocktails, although at $6 they were a little on the expensive side. I'll come back.

rNNcUshDXFaHDZeFwAkaOw.review_text: Service during my second visit was much better than my first so I'm bumping up the rating to a 4 star. I tried Butterfly because there was a LivingSocial special on. During my initial visit, the waiter declined my voucher because he said it couldn't be used for the 3-course special dinner (even though it doesn't exclude that on the voucher). After that visit, I returned and made reservations using yelp.   The service this time around was much better and our waitress and another person came to check on us several times throughout the meal. Since I made my reservations on yelp, not sure if they read about my not-so-good experience with poor service during my first visit. My  hubby and I ordered a cowboy steak with chirizo and sizzling veggies. The steak was huge weighing in at about 22oz! It was just enough for my husband and I to share. The lychee martini was just ok, a little bit too strong of an alcohol taste. Had had much better elsewhere.  For those trying this restaurant for the first time, recommend the $25.95  3-course special with the tumeric snapper as the entree choice. That's my favorite dish so far!

kSq6apUHB3UXRxw6sjNjfg.review_text: Food is delicious and something unexpected. The views are what make this place. Awesome spot for early evening as it ding nearly as great when the sun is down.

aPuZ1NOkqSn5WuPT5VJQlQ.review_text: The menu is asian fusion extensive. The flavors are sublime,  the entree accompaniments multilayered, the presentation creative and the service outstanding.   Best of all, same day reservations can be had. Why waste your time at the other Asian fusion "Door" down the Embarcadero?.

IXAYirFUR2Gs0zNkJi0rXA.review_text: This is a restaurant that is a almost  romantic spot on the water.  It's view is of piers and some water in between piers.  I like the bar area and the outside area when there is good weather.  It's food and service are fine. It's nice for the prom crowd.

8qfbFwB7UhcTOiskQr-orA.review_text: Great service!!!  Porter was really nice and informative and really took the time to help us choose the right wine and items on the menu!!

JwXtvqcaFEKr2MpNb_WiKw.review_text: Great space...Great Bartender...Dan!!   Had the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups for app...REALLY good and generous portion!  Hangar steak was ok...a bit chewy?? ..not the best i have had. Service was fantastic!

SIi_wQ9PEYvUfRRGo72Bkg.review_text: I think I might be becoming a Happy Hour junkie. I can't resist the cheap drinks and cheap food.   Butterfly did not disappoint for Happy Hour. $5 glasses of wine, though they choose the type, but it was good. We had a cute table right on the windows, though oddly they are set up to face into the bar rather than out to the water. So, I spent most of our time staring at the bar rather than out at Alcatraz. Butterfly- I'd do some rearranging. You're on Pier 33 and your guests should be able to soak in the view!  I felt like we had to order food, so the $2 edamame was the best option. Good, though a bit watery.  We also had three different servers in our hour and a half stay so never knew who to ask for more water or wine. It's possible Happy Hour is shift change time. Or, their staffing is a bit disorganized.

KVbz-QrdC8kVM4iDHZaexQ.review_text: Parking: Bf and I were soo soo lucky to find parking close by on a Saturday night because it was raining and I was sooo cold!  Drinks: Once we were seated by the host, she recommended us the 5 spice warm apple cider with rum and belvedere lemon vodka... That tasted soo good , and it was so perfect because It was pretty cold. I hope they keep this on the menu because I will come back for it!   Food: And then we got the Kahlua pork with lettuce wrap for the Appetizer which was really really good as well. For the entree we go the braised short ribs which I really love because the meat was sooo soft it almost melts in your mouth. Then to finish the night off, we had the banana bread, which of course, I wouldn't mind going back and getting again  It was really a good meal, I couldn't ask for more.  Food portion: The portion were perfect, it wasn't a lot, wasn't too little.  Service: On top of the awesome food, the service was really really good! Servers and the staffs were really professional and courteous.  Place: I am impressed by the layout... Only downside is its a little bit too dark. Other than that, the ocean view was pretty as it reflects the lights from the islands  Very romantic...

5UDpc2CMOgbf3GePS6SGVA.review_text: Best Asian-Fusion restaurant thus far; although Dine About Town hasn't ended.  I don't seem to have enough time to try them all.  I would suggest having DAT every season.  I ordered the calamari, shrimp/scrambled eggs avocado tostada, & warm chocolate cake w/ coffee ice cream.  Everything was delicious & good portions.  I'd go again for their regular brunch menu or dinner.  When the place started getting busy, the wait/kitchen staff couldn't hustle fast enough; therefore, causing a delay in service.  I'm glad I finally tried this place and found good parking on a weekend.  BTW, the guy who scares people behind bushes posted himself at Pier 33 instead of his usual spot at Pier 49.  He wanted everyone to pay a bill for their thrill (not).  There was no thrill...people almost had heart attacks, especially the joggers LOL!

K6aqORO_bhSLqLFZWWgTAg.review_text: Very friendly staff.  A potentially embarrassing moment was handled with aplomb and grace.  Really made the evening.  On the gastronomy side... All's well on the eastern front.  Drinks were perfectly assembled as advertised, virgin and otherwise.  Entrees were spot on, especially the whole fish done Korean fusion style.  Crab was not as good as going down to the other side of town and just cracking one open with an Anchorsteam beer, but it was alright.  Braised ribs were tender but a little heavy for me.  Others seemed ok with it.  All in all, aside from the pouring rain, a great night out.  I think you'd receive the same, so I'm saying go east young man (or woman) go east.

irFk4niiXe5iR-C7mgjy_w.review_text: This place earns a solid three stars.  Not exceptional, but decent.  The three star is a rare rating for me, because if I don't love it, I hated it, but in this case it's appropriate.  Ended up at Butterfly after schlepping over to Alcatraz for the umpteenth time, this time so my husband's parents could enjoy its dank cells and crumbling concrete.  We picked Butterfly because it was *rightthere*, and the price was reasonable for the ultra-premium-high-end-cost-but-the-food-still-­sucks quarter of Pier 39.  Interior is gorgeous, the view can't be beat.  Service was slooooooooooow -- not full at all and it took half an hour to get my drink from the waiter.  Hello!!  I'm here with in-laws!  Help a girl out!    I shared two appetizers and an entree with my hubby, the spring rolls (yay!), the oysters (acceptable), and the kobe burger (decent).  My in-laws procured the salmon/strawberry spring rolls (fan-freaking-tastic, order these if you're here), a bowl full of shell fish (acceptable), and onion soup (looked  intimidating, they liked it).    Not a fan of their lychee mimosa because some twat forgot the alcohol.  Husband and father-in-law ordered a beer from Belgium made by monks, and it was fantastic!    So, yeah, 3 stars.

t65JpzwvjqnsFYLfVn4nnA.review_text: After a dreadful experience with Jardinière the previous evening, Sheri and I were so excited that we had such a great meal at Butterfly. Our friend, Marie, knows the chef, but unfortunately, he wasn't there that evening. Even so, everything, including the service, was excellent.   Unlike the server the previous evening, our server at Butterfly poured the wine in the correct order: ladies first. Sheri scored the meal of the evening with the Pork Chop that tasted more like pork belly. I had the duck breast and it was prepared perfectly. Our friends ordered the Kalua Pig Wraps and, again, it was delicious.   The wine list was adequate and ordered a bottle of white to go along with the bottle of red that I brought. It was a pleasant surprise at the end of the evening to notice that they waived the corkage since we bought a bottle.   Good food, great service, great location. Why can't more restaurants be like this?

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: The decor & view inside this large restaurant is absolutely GORGEOUS.  To the wonderfully gothic black glass celestial mirror on the far right wall, to the circular mirrors all throughout the restaurant, and the huge sea urchin-esque lighting, it's a decorators dream.  The booths are nice, cushy and comfy.  There are select square boothstyle seatings that face right out to the water that are perfect for a romantic dinner for 2.  Plenty of bar seating as well.  Decor itself bumped my review up +1 star.   Service was slow.  I think I asked for my iced tea at least 3 times before I actually received it, and my friend also had to ask for a refill on her coke.  They serve these awesome edamame dipped in what tastes like sesame oil, sesame seeds, sea salt & pepper.  Really delicious, and you can ask for more.    I had the Fried Red Snapper Sandwich - Toasted Sweet French Baguette, Spicy Chili and Garlic Rouille, Pickled Onions and Cucumbers (also came with french fries)   The sandwich was HUGE, and it was delicious. I finished every last bite.  The fish was fresh & juicy, the breading was light and not too thick.    My girlfriend ordered the Sashimi Trio Salad 16 - Hamachi, Ahi Tuna, and Salmon with Avocado, Shiso and Teriyaki Glazed Eel.   The ahi was very tender & fresh, i didn't really taste much of hamachi or salmon to tell you the truth...and there was this weird black pasty thing that tasted like beans that really ruined the dish for her (and me too when i tasted it!)   2 other friends both ordered the American Kobe Beef Burger 14 - Carmelized Onion and Bacon Jam with Cabot New York Aged Cheddar, Norm's "Special Sauce" and Fries  They both said their burgers were made just right and were delicious. Juicy & they looked big too.   Oh. and a warning, refills on soda is NOT free. They will charge you full price for another soda. Lame.

A2NV_QGxd7CP1rGY0YaMfg.review_text: The food, the decor, drinks... all were delicious!!! The place can be a bit price-y tho.

p08F3g2_lSSdzyjnVcvt4w.review_text: Scallop was delicious as expected.  Halibut was okay.  The cookie came in a pan and was super sweet; It's good for taking pictures with.  Cocktails were strong and fruity.  Lots of old fat people eat here.  View of water front is nice and peaceful.  I left my computer here at night.  I came back in the morning and it was still there.  Awesomeness!

XgczxfTQzzwN62ciFn6Ysw.review_text: If it were'nt for Dine about I would have never had the chance to check this place out the first time. Well SF Dine about came around again, and caught it the second time. Met up with some friends and for $35 again, I got to enjoy some Kalua pork wraps for starters, Gnocchi tempura vegetarian goodness for my main entree' and the chocolate torte with housemade coffee ice cream, oh yea washed it down with that awesome Lycheetini! Friends were delighted with the restaurant and said they too would be back for a date night. Butterfly restaurant you really do give me butterflies in my stomach!

aMBkcgtRHVu2AnRczmtmAg.review_text: This place is a gem of a find. Don't let its location and surroundings fool you - they have some amazing dishes. Smack dab in the middle of Alcatraz landing, you wouldn't expect to find such great Asian fusion, but this place delivers with things like Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic Noodles (tip - get them with the Kalua Pig) and Five Spice Braised Beef Short Ribs. They also have a great brunch, and the view on the water isn't bad either.  I'm not sure why their are so many negative reviews, I've been here tons of different times and never had anything less then amazing service and great food.

LlC00M_0xp3CPOWlAYOKIw.review_text: Great food, right on the water, and exceptional service! When I asked about the rice noodles in the Pork Meatballs our server immediately got that I was gluten free and options. Will definitely be back!

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Ay, ay, ay, I'm your little butterfly Green, black and blue, Make the colors in the sky  Perfectly lovely little happy hour is to be found here.    Ay, ay, ay, I'm your little butterfly Green, black and blue, Make the colors in the sky  Based on my happy hour bar bites, this has made the my list to have dinner.    Ay, ay, ay, I'm your little butterfly Green, black and blue, Make the colors in the sky  I might have loved playing that song on the DDR machine...Which came first? Ayumi Hamsaki or Aqua?

LiTdGYd3g9-5TmjXXgWWug.review_text: Located at the Embarcadero, this place offers good food and great decor. The huge back wall of glass faced the water, although the view was so so. Had their Prix Fixe  Winter Special Menu had a first course, entree and desert for only $21. The food was good and well presented. Started with the Kalua Pig in Butter Lettuce Cups, then Lemongrass Braised Short Ribs and Classic Vanilla Creme Brulee. Metered parking was available on the street, but it is enforced until 11pm!

eQZQx7-gBFG_KY03Vdk2iQ.review_text: My girlfriend and I went for dinner just around sunset. We got - kalua pork lettuce cup. Pork had a really rich taste, after the bbq flavor dissipates while chewing there's a rich pork flavor underneath that's really good. - garlic noodles (animal style). Lot of stuff in it (shrimp, beef, other stuff I don't remember), and just a good bowl of noodles. - hanger steak: pretty heavily seasoned/sauced, but I really did like the sauce a lot, although it was definitely one of the saltier steaks I've eaten.  I don't have any complaints about the service or view either, everything just seemed very good at this place. Therefore 5 stars.

xM54EZxtxKehUN_YaWC7Rw.review_text: (I never thought I would be saying this) Attention SFers...get down to the waterfront. Like other locals I cringe at the thought of going within a half a mile of "The Wharf" .. but last night's dinner at Butterfly has made me a believer that creative and solid food can be a neighbor to the "shoulders up wincing when you look at them" tourist center. The views are outstanding. We ordered off the Price Fix menu which offers some different selections. Smoked Salmon on wontons... get them..trust me! Calamari - beautifully done and presented thoughfully (and really good portions). Now for the main course: Red Snapper (create a wrap with lettuce) - great and the Kalua pig with noodles (the top winner of the night). Creme brule finished off the night and we werew both stuffed. Really truly a solid dining experience and I hope to get back REAL soon.

ttc3_AtKQzrFlFdfsS0-zg.review_text: I visited this place years ago and can still remember it to this day. I recall seeing a kobe burger on the menu outside and I made it a must stop for me while I was in San Francisco. I'm glad I did.   The edamame had a nice spin to it with sesame oil and sesame seeds instead of the traditional sprinkle oif sea salt. Very nice touch. The salmon with strawberry spring roll was ok. I'm not a fan of spring rolls but the combination was nice. The Kobe burger didn't do much for me it was an item to check off my list!  I would stop in again if I'm ever in the area!

cvZMniF5d9qz7jTze9VP1Q.review_text: I went here last Saturday for the first of hopefully many birthday dinners to come this month.  I had been here before for lunch and it was only eh.  Dinner was significantly better.    I don't know if I was blinded by the good company, alcohol or the good looking people entering to hang out at the bar, but i had a very good experience here that night.  The only thing that initially sucked was the hostess.  She was nice, but seemed a little lost.  Because we had been seated a little late, we had a leisurely dinner, but had to finish up quick because the restaurant turns into a club around 10:30, but they compensated for it by giving us some free desserts.  Yes, I know,  my love can easily be bought.   The food was pretty good, for appetizers we had the kahula pig wraps, calamari and oysters, for dinner 2 of us had the salmon and the other 2 had the filet mignon (such variety!!). delish.   The wait staff was very friendly and not bothersome at all, and the managerial staff was very accommodating. Overall, good times and good food.

4c2RYnS2mdDSMwyY9xWBaQ.review_text: It seems as if 1000 dollar tables on OpenTable is where it's at these days and so without hesitation I booked one at Butterfly.  For approximately 100 dollars, I dined on an amazing fried rice appetizer with a lycheetini (which wasn't as good as I thought but it did taste like a lychee).   The grease-ridden Sizzlin' Cowboy Steak lived up to its name. As if having a lot of oil wasn't enough, it was topped with Fois Gras butter...wow...my coronaries just took one for the team.  The chicken roulade was excellent as well.  Okay so this place is overpriced - but you're paying for the location, view and acting like a tourist (sorry if you truly are a tourist).  Would I go again? Probably not on a whim but for a 1000 dollar table, maybe. The sad thing is, my RSVP was 10 minutes too late for a 1000 dollar table and I only got 100 points...doh.

omkfApPH9jKxg7PMWPPdyg.review_text: Beautiful view, delicious food, and even though very busy attentive and accommodating service. I wish I could remember my waiters name because he was above the board excellent! The ambiance was romantic and very modern bohemian. The food in itself was well done and tasty. Definitely try the mushroom Soup it was my favorite!

-JV_oFXKowWrDVANADJxqg.review_text: Came here for the Dine about Town.  Started off with the duck confit spring rolls and salmon carpaccio. The duck spring rolls came with chinese mustard dipping sauce which was a little different than what I'm normally used to. The salmon carpaccio tasted like smoked salmon rather than raw.
