Correct me if I'm wrong but carpaccio does mean raw right? Nonetheless, it was delicious.  Next was the hanger steak and grilled snapper. The hanger steak was flavorful and what was even better were the mushrooms on that plate. The steak was tough but taste wise was sufficient. The snapper was neat. It was served like vietnamese egg rolls. It had wrapping lettuce, nuoc mam, and vermicelli to compliment the fish. The smell of the fish was incredible when it comes out on its own sizzling platter.  For dessert, my dining mate and I went for both choices from the dat menu. The torte was awesome. The creme brulee .... typical creme  brulee.  I'd give Butterfly 5 stars if they had used a more tender beef for their steak. It was too tough for my liking.

XS7S3pa0btJ01E-Cth8QNw.review_text: Just visited Butterfly for the first time w/ two coworkers - allow me to share the pros and cons of our lunchtime experience:   PROS:  - Water view seating was available  - Restaurant offered free dessert (creme brulee) with each lunch entree ordered  - Complimentary edamame (no need to order an appetizer)  - My lunch entree (Shaking Beef Salad) was delicious, and just the right size for lunch.  - Service was polite, and water glasses remained filled throughout the meal   CONS:  - After previewing the lunch menu online, we arrived craving Iron Skillet Macaroni & Cheese. Server informed us that entree was removed from the menu almost a month ago - guess no one bothered to update the website.  - Service (although polite) was on the slow side. Had to rush out and catch a cab back to the office, instead of enjoying a post-meal walk.  - Coworker requested that her leftover food be packaged to go - never saw it again.  - $10 Cherry Blossom martini was disappointing...I'd only purchase again during happy hour, at a discount.   It was nice to finally give this place a try, but it's definitely too pricey to fit into the regular rotation. I'd consider coming back for happy hour or a special occasion.

UO4hgvOEFnerreHRAGFb1g.review_text: LOVED Butterfly -- great location and ambiance.  Terrific wine list.  The appetizers were all delicious -- hard to decide, but loved the mussels and the Kalua Pig in Lettuce Cups -- to die for!  As an entree I had the chicken in the clay pot and it was amazing -- best sticky rice I've had in a very long time.  The desserts were truly inspiring -- the Banana Bread Pudding with Coconut Ice Cream is one of the best things I've ever eaten!  The service was wonderful -- friendly, helpful, there when we needed them and not when we didn't ( so rare these days).  Run, don't walk to Butterfly!

dzeWGwGnYeNaO1vgBkh_lQ.review_text: Heard a lot of good things about this restaurant but we were actually quite disappointed.  Food is of average quality.  A bit noisy.  My steak was over cooked.   When the chef came around and asked me about it, I told him so and all he said was they had done this many times - without offering any apology or anything else!  I don't think any other smart business person would let it go at that!

Rop17Apd1lcEw39JiMp8Ug.review_text: I am still having dreams of the mussels I had here the other night. If you are a seafood fan, get them, I promise you will not be dissapointed. The oyster shooters are worth it as well! Don't be afraid to get some of the small plates and share, the portions are pretty hearty. This is a great date spot and really pretty!

pH3TbCQDl7m7EAThzJ5MkQ.review_text: San Francisco really did give me a great dining experience.  It was quite excellent -  especially here at Butterfly.  My friend Jen's bachelorette party was held here (gays were invited *hee hee*), and we had a delicious prix-fixe menu offered to us.  Served family style, we were offered 4 appetizers: Sesame coated edamame with Hawaiian sea salt, fire fried calamari with a tabasco remoulade and toasted garlic, duck confit spring rolls with chinese mustard and honey dipping sauce, and smoked salmon and strawberry salad rolls with spicy garlic and ginger dipping sauce.  All were really very good, especially the salad rolls.  As an entree, I chose the crab and mascarpone stuffed crispy chicken breast with shrimp and sweet corn ragout, shiitake mushrooms, and 20 year aged balsamic dressing over arugula.  That was an incredibly tasty entree dish that left me feeling very filled.  And finally... a vanilla creme brulee with fresh berries and an almond cookie for dessert.  An amazing end to an amazing meal.

IkoXyeNTHqpU24dHKmIcrw.review_text: I'm shocked I've never been here before this week because this place is great.  First, let's discuss the view: top notch. You walk in to the place and the whole back of the restaurant is a window in to The Bay and on a clear day it's beautiful. That seques very nicely in to the ambience. The decor of Butterfly is creative and fun but not overbearing. There's lots of light that comes in and this place is perfect for both a date and a business lunch. You can't go wrong with ambience.  The food was definitely top notch and I had no complaints about my Seared Ahi Tuna (which came with a very interesting array of vegetables). Even though I've had a bit of a falling out with vegetables in recent years (read: my whole life), these were delicious and I ate nearly every bit of it.   And last, but definitively not least, the cocktails were tasty and yet still strong enough to not disappoint the alcoholic in all of us.  I recommend it.

cj-Uk0Ek2bSsmuMl_jX8dw.review_text: I'm not sure why this place has such bad reviews. I went here on Friday with my Mom and boyfriend and it was a great experience. The venue is gorgeous. It's airy with high ceilings and floor to ceilings windows looking out over the water but is still very cozy. The portion sizes and very generous and the food was great! Plus they have 3 vegan options and many vegetarian options on the menu for picky eaters like me.   We started with 4 appetizers (between the 3 of us) - The noodles, the calamari, the shrimp dumplings and the ahi (plus they gave us some complementary soy beans.) It was amazing. We cleaned off every plate. Then we got our entrees- I got the short ribs vegan style i.e. with tofu and it was both filling and tasty. We finished with the creme brulee and warm cookie- both to die for.   The service was on point and the drinks were strong. I'll be coming back!

k-9shdCguXxefBeMcj4CRA.review_text: It's great to see a trendy spot like this that offers pricey selections to reward you with dishes that actually satisfy your appetite.  There's nothing spectacular about the menu, but the presentation and flavors were very good.  For the money, I came away with a full stomach something that typically eludes a lot of these trendy/pricey establishments.  The calamari appetizer is highly recommmended here as well as the kobe burger.  The chocolate torte desert was also great.  My only gripe about this place is that it took quite a long time for our main entrees to come out.  The overall decor is quite nice, but the selection of art on the walls is questionable.

GoFAZ8naBeG8Te2IhY61Iw.review_text: We went for brunch with a group of 5. The crab Benedict was very good, a combination of crab cake and crab louie.  Bottomless mimosa are always a hit. Our waiter, Porter, was super friendly and helpful.  I will definitely return.

IZ69bDkna2mmffvoTuyEUA.review_text: I came here for dine about town. The website listed it as californian when it was clearly asian fusion, tha began the beginning of my disappointment in this restaurant.  It was a prefix menu so that was decided for us.  We had the salmon spring roll with strawberry. I love raw fish but I've never had a worse pairing. It was a fresh strawberry and sashimi in a roll. The softness of the salmon didn't complement the sweetness of the strawberry which didn't go with dry veggies.  The dinner was not memorable. I had some fish dish. I say some fish because none of the characteristic tastes of the fish was accented. It was just fish. I would've enjoyed fish sticks from the supermarket more.  Only the dessert was decent. The chocolate mouse cake contraption was delicious.   I'm not a fan of asian fusion so I may be biased. But I wasn't into the flavors.

FmDYxYBosSb--euhJbHNMg.review_text: walked in we were barely acknowledged by the bored hostess.  told it would be about 20 minutes for a table.  we left. FYI the place was @ less than 40% capacity maybe they were short staffed it was 12 pm on a Friday

lob764Q-KEkrLFQONJzSvQ.review_text: My friend an I just came home from this place.  We love to eat out and try new places.   We aren't  the self important foodie types,  we are just big eaters who like delicious food.  Butterfly was an instant hit.  We arrived for happy hour.  The place was not loud or busy which is always  a plus in my book ( after 90 minuted across town on MUNI  the last thing I wanted was a loud crowded experience.)  The cocktails were great. I had a cherry blossom and a Pear martini.   Im a vodka drinker so these hit the spot.  The apps...  The sliders were so tasty.  Yummy beef flavor and served on texas toast.  They didn't really need any additional ecoutrement.  Also the fire calamari was fresh, hot, a touch of spice, and aioli.  Fab!  Then dinner.  Yikes I ordered the 22 oz ribeye cowboy steak served with melted butter of some kind, tomato, onion and jalepenos and steak fries.  It prefectly cooked on a serious sizzling platter.  Im sure it was a years supply of cholesterol but If im gonna die,  I want this in my casket with me. Mu friend the short ribs which were fall off the bone tender. For dessert we both had the  fried banana lumpia with coconut ice cream.  Afterwards we had to figure out who was going to help who get out of the booth first.  We had a great booth facing the water and the chef or manager or whoever he was visited the table a couple of times ( the asian guy) and was really friendly as was the rest of the staff.  Overall  everything was perfect.  if i had any criticism it would be that the dessert was hard to eat cuz the lumpia was hard to cut in the cup its served in.  I would serve it on a plate with the ice cream to the side.  The total for   4 signature cocktails,  2 apps   2 entrees and 2 desserts,  and 20 percent gratuity came to 150.      We will be going back.  Oh and that steak I head was so huge I have another meal leftover for tomorrow.

cVJGNJpAM3Ss4TEnRMGClg.review_text: I purchased a living social voucher for this restaurant. The atmosphere was great! Low lighting, tablecloths, and candlelight! Very romantic! The pricing is a bit steep but the food is delicious! I would recommend the calamari :)

b1Iu7lgKqMB6i-6-bXjmfQ.review_text: Great space and pretty good food. Nice views too.

TVDD7-Ub1gGgFfg4b-VFpQ.review_text: We love this place, and the service! We had brunch today and it was amazing!  Ask for Ross he is hands down the best waiter there!  The mushroom aus jus is a must try!! Love that they offer cakebread wines!!

UDrVdIeUNnmBT3__dJchCw.review_text: Love love LOVE Butterfly! Always a beautiful spot to enjoy a reasonably priced delicious dinner.  Our favorites: -kahlua pig lettuce cups (refreshing and flavorful all at the same time) -shanghai noodles with shaking beef (best damn noodles I've ever had) -cookie pie dessert with mint chip icecream (obviously amazing)  All are SPOT-ON and wonderfully flavored. Highly recommend this place for a nice and low-key but not crazy expensive/trendy meal out.   Street parking nearby is easy-peasy so you have no excuse not to try it.

CfRf3wHCJhDXCUoVHRL7Uw.review_text: last summer me, my friend becky who has autism and her parents paul and debbie all came for a great gourmet meal, me and her dad had a sashimi salad and it was delicious, but me and my friend becky really loved the kahula pork lettuce wraps and it was the best thing ever, i'll be coming back with my own parents carol and marty im going to make sure my dad tries their calamari dish soon, but i will come back for the kahula pork lettuce wraps and can i have the recipe for that lettuce wrap dish? or maybe i'll get the recipe next time i come, it was really great food!

pv7yUP2F4vN0WanV_kWWnw.review_text: Great place for a group, especially if you can get the corner booth/lounge area overlooking the water.  The food is interesting and tasty and the service is attentive and friendly.  Great spot for happy hour or dinner during the summer days and also a brunch favorite.

rGtYFE9uliZOLefeCsM12Q.review_text: This place has such a beautiful interior. It was a lot smaller than I had imagined but the set up is gorgeous. My girlfriends and I came here for brunch today and we were about ~30 minutes late for our reservations due to traffic (49ers vs Raiders). The host, I believe her name was Christine, was nothing but accommodating once we got there. The bartender, Trevor, was also very friendly.  We were seated at a table tucked away behind the bar by the window. The view was gorgeous and the area was semi-private. Our server, Ross, was phenomenal. He was attentive, friendly, didn't rush us, and just an overall great guy.  I can't remember everything we ordered but here are my recommendations: duck confit spring roll (it's fried), french onion soup (which was not sweet at all and it had applewood bacon), shanghai garlic noodles (toasted garlic = delicious), sizzling snapper (served with chilled noodles, nuoc mam/fish sauce, and butter lettuce wraps), and the vanilla bean creme brulee. Although I didn't try the oysters (gross,no thanks), my friends RAVED about the 1/2 dozen oyster shooters. They ordered 2 because it was so good.  Oh did I mention that they have bottomless mimosas for $18! Ross kept topping us off! I'm not going to share how many I had but let me just say it's worth it!  I would definitely recommend this place for a date, with your girlfriends, with your family, whomever! I can't wait to go back!!!!!

3at6Ex0otDvbwslgBLNPMA.review_text: Came here for lunch on a Sunday and this place was pretty busy. Great decor inside- sort of trendy Asian style. Waterfront views are a plus. The place was clean and the waitstaff gave great service.  The food! Really good! I ordered the Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic noodles and added on the shaking beef, it turned out so good! My boyfriend ordered the Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herbs and said it was a little complicated, but overall really good.  Oh and the edamame they serve while you wait are amaaazing!!

YTCvcLg0-_X35XEEIo2BkQ.review_text: This was my third time here and perhaps the best experience thus far. Part of it could have been that this time I was just with my husband and we were seated at a window table at sunset, after having had a wonderful massage experience at the Zen Project up the street on Bay.    First off, we tried the two cold sakis on the menu, which were really very good. We truly liked the calamari and then both of us loved our entrees.  I savored every bite of those short ribs (which I remembered having a bite of on a previous visit), and my husband relished his perfect hamburger and fries!  For dessert we shared the banana spring roll with ice cream. Yummy!  Service was good, too, but our waiter DID over use the term "cheers" when leaving our table. We'll see how he's doing with that on our next visit (hopefully in the not-too-distant future!!!

i_EhyJdhF_nC4zuHhBOnLg.review_text: Okay is about all I can say for this restaurant. Why was I given a Brunch menu on Saturday afternoon?  The Duck Confit Spring Rolls were great. But my burger that was supposed to be medium rare was almost raw.  Thank goodness for the bun.   But for the price you pay for the food...I have to say it is way, way overpriced and not worth the money.    I would not recommend this restaurant unless you have money to throw away.

DKwf3DBgF6o2qOv19vVqAw.review_text: Duck confit spring rolls, Chinese mustard and honey sauce  Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herbs                  Cold Rice Noodles, Vietnamese Herbs Salad, "Nuoc Cham" Dipping Sauce  Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups Hoisin Barbeque Dipping Sauce, Brunoise Peppers, Toasted Cashew  Everything was super delicious here. I've dined here twice, both with Groupons, and I love how accommodating they are and don't treat you differently because you're a coupon-bearing diner. The food is really rich. I remember the kalua pig exploding in my mouth.   That's right. Explosion of tender juicy pig with a crusty top with sweet hoisin, overpowering the innocent thin piece of butter lettuce.  We're usually lucky enough to always get a seat facing the water, so it's nice and romantic to sit back and enjoy a lychee martini. Parking's not bad either since there's usually street parking.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: I first went to Butterfly for drinks and immediately decided that my new favorite cocktail was a Lychee Martini. However I waited 4 years to come back.  This time I went for dinner (and had a deal for $50 worth of food), being that the bill came out to $80 ish, it definitely helped!  The food, service, and ambience were all perfect for a nice date with my bf.   The waiter recommended the Five Spiced Beef short ribs...and omg they were heavenly.  Seriously, get those if you go.

EwHUvegfeHNp_bkQG0veYA.review_text: Pleasant and tasty from start to finish.  My picks are the shrimp bisque, filet mignon and peking style duck.  Lycheetini was yummy, even got my kids the virgin version.  We were too full for dessert, but since it was my bday, they gave us the lychee granita thingy with a candle in it.  It was a perfectly light and tasty ending to a beautiful meal. Our server was top notch, as well was the whole team.  The chef even popped by and said whassup.

zRfDqjjeC1ydEYpNf5jaCQ.review_text: Wow!  if this was just an exercise on how much money we could spend... we win!    We were a party of 6, so were comfortably seated on the couch-table with a great view.  it took a bit to relax with fabulous drinks and settle into the couch... mostly as the distance made us shout across the table, and the table nearby vacated.  The atmosphere is industrial and cool (both style and temperature) as the entire back wall are windows facing the bay...  a beautiful view!    The Sumojito wasn't nearly as great as the Lycheetini - yum!  Their other specialty drinks had good reviews at the table too, but the Cherry Blossoms, Kumquat Margaritas, and Sailor's Punch flowed anyway.  Appetizers were a win too - especially the Vietnamese Caramelized Chicken Wings!!  Wild Mushroom Cappuccino Soup was tasty - not too rich.  Crispy Fried Calamari was good and not over battered or greasy. Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups were like sweet pulled pork - very tasty.  Shiso Cured Albacore Sashimi was good, but small portion... especially since i wanted more of the yummy Soy Poached Foie Gras!  we sent the Garlic Seared Mussels back - maybe not the right season for them but it seemed off.    Among the table, we tried most of the entrees... but only one standout rose above the others.  The Sizzling Cowboy Steak was *so good* on a bed of Chorizo and Jalapenos... (unfortunately we forgot to get the leftovers!)   The Duck and Short Ribs entrees were better than the whole fish.  Creme Brulee and Banana Lumpia Rolls were VERY GOOD - better than the Iron Skillet Cookies.    Service was EXCELLENT.  really, very very good.  Over all the experience was very nice.  It was a decadent event - but next time, i'll stick with drinks, appetizers and dessert!  Yes, i'll be back!

RfQPF-UMxyG0wjygenkfow.review_text: I always wanted to be a highschool cheerleader. Unfortunately, I went to a Liberal Arts private school (please pronounce that in an English accent so that it sounds fancy) that didn't have a football team, so alas...my dreams have gone unfulfilled.   So here is where you come in Yelp, ol buddy ol pal. I am going to write a cheer for Butterfly and you are going to like it. Good, I am glad it's settled then.   5,6,7,8.... B-U-T-T-E-R-F-L-Y (naturally the "-" represent claps) Your drinks are yum (clap clap)  I love your view (clap clap) Your food's too salty (clap clap) Into the convenient Bay I will spew (clap clap)  Okay, so it's a work in progress. But really, I like Asian Fusion as much as the next Jewish girl (that's a lot), but good grief, there are other flavors besides "salt". I really do like the wok-seared garlic noodles, but there was nothing SO uniquely special about them that I couldn't wok them myself. Are people using wok as a verb these days? Just go with it.

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: Holy cow, total drama? Or a meet up spot for drinks? Head over to Butterfly to get yourself a nice martini and let the waterside view calm your frazzled nerves.  I've never actually dined, but I've done a few happy hours here. The spring rolls were pretty tasty. The mojitos are delicious and the martinis are just what the doctor ordered. Stars for good bartenders.

ra3OzaxpILytSjHRRKoT8g.review_text: I ate at Butterfly in the Mission, but thought it was eh.  But I have a good friend who is friends with the owner, so he insisted on drinks and hors d'oeuvres there.  Excellent.  Liked it all.  Went to a party there too, and had the same experience:  delicious food, wines that paired well, fun, on the water = all good.  Update October 2007:  It's a great place to throw your own party.  Especially stand up cocktails and wine, and a plus if there's a band thrown in.  Cool venue, floor to ceiling windows on the water.  It all works.

7TR2HuPXpRMP3kJkMrultQ.review_text: Passed by Butterfly on the way to peer 39 in search of seafood.  This was my first time in San Fran and didn't do any research in advance.  A few blocks later we made it to the peer.  It was super crowded and I could tell right away it was tourist trap central (the big Bubba Gump sign gave that away).  We quickly turned back to Butterfly.  Very nice view of the bay.  Had the fried snapper sandwich was was pretty good, but the steak fries were HUGE and more like fried baked potato quarters.   Would have liked to have bloody marys/mimosas (it was Sunday) but couldn't justify the $18 price.  Definitely a good spot to stop if you don't feel like climbing through crowds to get a bread bowl with clam chowder on the peer (Butterfly has a bread/chowder dish btw).  Prices were very reasonable, nice clean, quite and spacious interior to relax.

08jfo0j-qbcs5yKefByVKQ.review_text: The short: FAIL.  The long: I know I have a strong bias against Asian Fusion cuisine but I always try to give it a chance, considering that Asian Fusion has created some great additions to gastronomy: Portuguese egg tarts, black pepper sauce teppan steak (Taiwanese style), Omu-raisu, Chinese chicken salad, Japanese beef curry udon... but, Butterfly, you DISAPPOINTED me by revealing that once again Asian Fusion is some throwaway term to refer to overly priced food too lazy to be truly innovative, but instead enticing the naive with the mystique associated the exotic name of "Fusion". I could have thrown my crap-tastic flavorless watery egg scramble stuffed with limp salmon and a jalapeno pepper halve that I swear was thrown in last minute because it was still slightly raw and obviously has no flavor contribution having been introduced so late in the cooking process. Then, to top it off and to complete what I can only assume is a half-ass check-off list for what qualifies as "Fusion", they sprinkled the dish with some flying fish roe. Really, did you really think that would SAVE the dish!? It didn't, it only reinforced memories of my scrappier eating days in college, when there was no Asian food around and I hashed together what preserved Asian condiments and cheap American ingredients I could find to sauce up some survival meal to fuel me for hours of dreaded studying. Seriously, no wonder this needed to be listed on DAT; they need as much short-term attention they can get. 2 out of 3 of the appetizers were great ideas but talk about failure in execution. Salmon carpaccio? I didn't know carpaccion meant THICK ASS slices of pre-packaged lox that was still pretty stiff and cold from refrigeration. And, how on earth were you supposed to eat it with the weird tater cream and greasy cold chip? Ugh. Oh, and don't get me started on the duck confit egg rolls... dry, hardly tasted like duck anymore, and it was accompanied by a dipping sauce that was like cough syrup mixed with a powdered mustard. The calamari I confess was pretty good, but it was nothing new, nothing memorable, not a strong enough point to justify Butterfly; it's nothing I would crave given the number of restaurants that have the dish on its menu. ...And main course? Wow. I mean wow, that was awful. I already digressed on the wrongs with the salmon scramble fiasco but... wow, I didn't know they could all be so... mediocre. Probably the only one that had a truly positive review was the club sandwich. After a dismal main course the DAT meal was slightly redeemed by desserts. Great molten lava cake and creme brulee, but again like the calamari, how normal! How uninventive! They were examples of what the dish should be, and didn't attempt to raise the bar beyond standard. Was not impressed.  My last gripe was the time... it took nearly an hour between each course for the dishes to be prepared and served, which is ridiculous especially for lunch. The wait staff was very nice and I did enjoy my time at the restaurant bar but in my mind: I will never come here again.

DBFThorME3rq1hrd_FQBWg.review_text: Usually, I try to stay away from restaurants close to Pier 39.  A few years ago, I came here for a Dine-About-Town lunch and I have been a fan ever since.  I come here a few times a year and I have never been disappointed.  Firstly, the view is great, especially if you can get a booth by the windows.    Secondly, the food is fantastic.  This is best described as pan-Asian fare.  My favorite is the grilled snapper.  The fish is buttery and comes with some tasty nuoc cham (fish sauce).  For appetizers, I recommend the house-smoked salmon, calamari, or Kahlua pork lettuce cups.  The drinks are also excellent. My favorite is their kiwi gimlet.  My aunt and I downed 3 of those a piece at a recent lunch.  Great spot!

RugiruRsLxooWa5aE5Z5lg.review_text: Dine About Town Review! 4-stars.  2 Prix Dinner Menus on a Friday night.  NOTE: very friendly and accommodating service.  Calamari - good, liked the sauce that it came with.. very nice touch compared to the traditional calamari Pork Lettuce Wraps - very good and very filling. the pork was extremely tender and well cooked `n seasoned Hanger Steak - tender, but too salty. also didn't like the dry noodle pairing. Grilled Snapper - can't see the fusion in this dish besides maybe in display; it tastes just the way my mom makes it, but at least that makes it really good. (= Lumpia & Banana - yummmmmm. and huge. but seriously yum! Creme Brulee - very smooooooth, nicely prepared  Pretty much the only thing holding me back from giving this place a perfect rating is the price. For the prices of these dishes (and this is even with DAT,) I wouldn't call these dishes worthy of a 5-star dining experience. The service was great though! Good place to try out, especially for the Asian fusion enthusiast.

gD9a4wXND51R3c9lpbf_Lg.review_text: My wife and I went here to us a Bloomspot certificate that was due to expire shortly.  We had to change our reservation because we were running late and they were able to accommodate our change on opentable.com.  We arrived a little earlier than our revised time and they were able to seat us at cute table especially for two back by the sea urchin lamps and windows.  The table was pretty cool because instead of sitting across from each other you're in a little booth where you sit next to each other.  Pretty cool and romantic I thought.  If it wasn't dark out we may have been able to see the bay. My wife ordered the Cherry Blossom, which was quite good and later the Peach Margarita, which was not very good.  Later we both ordered salads and they were both pretty good. I got the Field Greens and my wife got the Fig Salad.  My wife got a Bloody Mary Oyster Shooter too and thought it was pretty good.   For our mains I got the Cowboy Steak and my wife got the Surf and Turf.  My steak was cooked perfectly for me, but part of it had gristle hidden in it.  I managed to find most of the gristle and fat and trim it, but every once in a while I would find another section.  The fires that came with it were crispy outside, but the inside was kind of grainy and not very good.  One of the things I liked best about my dish was the truffle butter on top, which was great.  My wife said her Surf and Turf was good (they did her steak perfect, which is sometimes hard), but nothing special.  We ended up easily taking half of my steak home with us because it was so huge.  We decided not to do desert because we were so full even though the skillet cookie looked very good.   I was torn between a three and four star review and decided on the three because even though everything was OK, I'm not sure I would feel the need to go back.  Maybe I'd go to the bar and try the Lettuce Cups and some drinks if we got another deal.

Fk-bn7EmUienGYNAsUfEww.review_text: 2 stars for the happy hour prices (drinks are 5 bucks each, and 1 dollar oyster shots).  Aside from happy hour, this place is strictly for tourist who got lost at the pier and couldn't find anything else near. $45 fix menu with (not including tax and tip) potsticker appetizer, bok choy, chinese sausage, and rice entree, and a lava cake for dessert is pretty ridiculous to say the least. Go to Chinatown, and order these for 1/6 the price.  The owner likes to patrol around the restaurant as well, and not greet his customers.

qKRz0akpr_UVMa1ikTyXpw.review_text: This is a lovely restaurant with spectacular views of the bay. Service was very good- considering we ate there on 4th July and it was busy! Food was great too. Nice upbeat atmosphere. We were leaving to watch the fireworks after our entrees and the waiter invited us to watch them from the patio, which was awesome! We stayed on at the restaurant bar after the fireworks and sampled some of the yummy cocktails. It was a lovely experience overall!!

skar1XyXyjTKKUawy-NlyA.review_text: We had a baby shower brunch here and it was a perfect place to have it on a sunny day - it's a large open space, modern furnishings, with landscape windows facing the Embarcadero on one side and the water on the other.  They had great cocktails including mimosas and lycheetinis, and the food was standard fusion.  We had the braised kalua pork lettuce wraps, edamame, calamari for appetizers, and then poached egg with salmon/hollandaise, poached egg with braised kalua pork/hollandaise, cobb salad with shaking beef, and dessert included a chocolate torte with ice cream and creme brulee.  All of it was very good, and the service was very friendly given the size of our group (although it did take almost 3 hours even for limited menu service).

FaYNhM--R6ses-p5DSxAwQ.review_text: Not much for "touristy" type of restaurant, but that's about all you can get on the embarcadero, and my girlfriend and I were starving, it was 1 PM and we hadn't ate yet!   So, it was a Sunday afternoon, and Butterfly was serving from the Brunch Menu.  It was fairly empty when we went into the restaurant, and the Host/Manager asked if we had reservations.  We chuckled, and said "no" and he seated us facing the water, but in a table in the center of the place.  The view was  awesome with it being a clear day in the city.  As for the food:  Calamari Appetizer - nice light breading with a pickled chili - type sauce.  Very tasty, a bit salty.  Poached eggs with Smoked Salmon - Very Salty with non-descript hollandaise sauce.  Fresh tropical fruit Salad side. Poached eggs with Kahlua Pig - A little dry, nice smoky flavor, same hollandaise sauce and fruit salad.  The service was relatively slow, and again, it was not that busy.  Our appetizer came out quick, but probably about 20 minutes after they took away that before our entree.    So, all in all, better than expected.  Prices reasonable for the area.  Willing to give it a try maybe for some drinks and more appetizers, not quite ready to come back and try dinner.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: For years now, even before I started Yelping, Butterfly has been on my list of places to try.  However, like with so many other restaurants on my list, I've never gotten around to trying them since I've never had the impetus to go.  That is, until just recently; nothing gets a Yelper motivated like an expiring Living Social deal!  And the promise of free food... ;) As soon as I walked in, three things immediately leapt out at me - the huge bar, the windows looking out onto the bay, and the décor, which felt a little kitsch (for the lack of a better word) but gave the restaurant a casual, relaxed vibe.  Since my friend and I both wanted to try a few things, we decided to get several dishes to share: -- SAILOR'S PUNCH - Ron Zacapa's Rum, Shishito Pepper, Lime, Agave Nectar...$10 (yelp.com/biz_photos/butt…) I've been drinking more whiskey-based cocktails as of late, but this did a good job of satisfying my craving for something fruity.  While the first sip was pretty tart, it finshed quite refreshing -- WILD MUSHROOM CAPPUCCINO SOUP with Truffle Foam, and Porcini Powder...$9 (yelp.com/biz_photos/butt…) On the one hand, I liked the earthy, mushroom flavors and how well it blended with the truffle foam.  On the other hand, the soup was really, really salty.  Either they were heavy handed with the seasoning or it reduced down too much in the pot. -- GARLIC SEARED CLAMS & MUSSELS in a Lemongrass and Coconut Curry Broth with Cilantro and Fried Rice...$14 (yelp.com/biz_photos/butt…) The broth was really flavorful and both the clams and mussels were terrific.  However, while the rice added some crunch, slices of crusty/toasted bread would have been better.  It didn't help either that the $1 per bread roll we ordered were tasteless and barely larger than a golf ball.  Ugh. -- SWEET MISO ROASTED COD with Shrimp Shu Mai Dumplings, Miso Dashi Broth, XO Shrimp and Chili Sauce...$28 (yelp.com/biz_photos/butt…) Of the two entrées, I thought this one was better.  The cod was feathery and moist, and the miso worked well with the dashi broth.  The shu mais were pretty good as well - plump and tasty, though I thought the lemongrass was a bit too assertive. -- FIVE SPICE BRAISED ENGLISH SHORT RIBS with Butternut Squash, Scallion, and Pumpkin Seed Relish on Sizzling Rice Cakes...$26 (yelp.com/biz_photos/butt…) The flavors weren't bad, but not exactly compelling.  In short, the short ribs didn't taste any different than versions I've had in the past, and while the meat was tender, it was also a bit dry.  I did like the use of the rice cakes for texture though. -- BANANA LUMPIA ROLLS - Warm Bananas Foster and Coconut Ice Cream with Pomegranate...$8 (yelp.com/biz_photos/butt…) A pretty good spin on an otherwise non-Asian dessert.  The flavors were spot on and serving the bananas as lumpia (instead of battered) was a great call.  I was glad we split this one though, as the sauce made the dish a bit too sweet for me. Regardless of my opinion of our food, the real downer of the night was the service.  I don't know if it was just a bad night, but our server seemed cold and dismissive.  She replied with a somewhat curt "fine" to our request to split the soup into two bowls (it still came out in one), took away my not-yet-finished cocktail, and barely looked at us when passing by.  From beginning to end, she wasn't very hospitable. Since we were there for dinner on a somewhat foggy night, it's unfortunate we weren't able to fully enjoy the view of the bay while we were there.  I imagine it would have made for a rather picturesque backdrop.  What's worse, I can't really say I'll be back to check it out or not.   NOTE: If you are planning on coming here, parking on The Embarcadero can be tough since the meters run late.  A better bet is to park across the way on Bay, where there are less restrictions, especially on the side opposite the park/lawn.

jwuACxSEWWS0IxwRkME-tw.review_text: Hadn't been to Butterfly in a long time, and thought I'd try since I loved the view from it.  I was happily surprised by: - the decor - nice touch of modern and comfort - the jazzy music in the background - good service  Now, the wine list was good, and actually Wine Spectator gave them an award for it.  The food was great, had the following: - Heirloom tomatoes with Burrata mozzarella - yum! - Mesquite Pork - great meet with a mac & cheese with morel mushrooms, pistachios and cherries - yum! - peach & berry cobbler - pretty good one, not the best i had but good  Overall, i would say that it is a place to try again (if you haven't been to it in a while).   Of course - the view is great and that's why I will go back.   Enjoy!

b_d1QFNWBi3vlTt9y0cwsw.review_text: Came here today for lunch to take advantage of the Dine About Town deal and was not impressed with my menu selections.  I had the french onion soup, which should be renamed blue cheese soup.  Friends had the butter lettuce cups which were good but the pork had bell peppers mixed in, that killed it for me.  For my entree I selected the shaken beef cobb salad.  It had way too much going on so I ate the beef, the avocados and bacon bits.  Will not return for Dine About Town unless they change their menu selection.

QlZRh-SbAf1Onj_tgBlmYg.review_text: Do not spend your money here. We went for the New Years Eve party. My friends flew in from Alabama,Chicago and Los Angeles. We spent $725 for tickets. We waited in line for an hour and a half. There was no one explaining to us why it was going so late. When they finally let us in it was 11:20 pm. And at midnight we got soaked by a bartender who sprayed with champagne in the face. Not fun. More frustrating than anything else.

2gQdr2p9ducZMEwQdXYfRg.review_text: Just an odd food place I felt the taste was blah We ordered duck egg roles which were greasy and not flavorful BBQ pork lettuce wraps with sauce tasty and I  should have ordered this as main course Husband ordered Loco Moco which is a take off from a restaurant  in Hawaii called Fat  Boys " the Ali'l " The taste again was off just didn't get flavor right I had Vietnamese meatballs in a cast iron skillet but meatballs were flat and burnt so taste was non existent to much onion took away from dish and it looked like pulled pork was added and that was tasty , should have added a side of BBQ sauce from lettuce wraps to add flavor  I ordered a giblet and that was to off not sure who is cooking but mr lee needs to go back and reteach or tweek a few things

0utTMNND91ovvw6ATKP-Aw.review_text: My boyfriend and I didn't even try the food because the service was that horrible. The hostess told us we could not sit outside because it was very cold. Keep in mind that they have heaters and it was actually a gorgeous day. When we requested window seating, she sat us by the entrance and told us that the whole restaurant was considered "window seating." Don't advertise outdoor seating if you cannot accommodate! We walked out when we noticed the people next to us being served way before us when we arrived way before them.

uoMghsbmE-o4HMJWELZiwg.review_text: My friend and I were new to this restaurant and took advantage of the Dine About Town event for the lunch special on a Sunday afternoon last month. I really liked the Kalua pig lettuce wrap. It had so much flavor. The fried calamari was ok. Our entrees were not that memorable. The cocktail was a bit strong. We sat by the window looking out at the Bay. My only gripe is that window booth seating was awkward. Our view was of the behinds of the wait staff and bar. The restaurant should reconstruct the booths to face the bay instead. I will likely not return.

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: I came here for a Yelp event a while back and found the venue to be beautiful.   This time I returned for dinner.   The space is pretty breathtaking. If you arrive at sundown, it's a great view.   I had the smoked salmon, 5 spiced short rib and creme brulee.   Service was a 3 of 5.  Food was a 3.5 of 5 Venue was a 4.5 of 5  It was a bit on the pricey side. That was my only major gripe.   I disliked that the happy hour specials didn't apply to you if you weren't at the bar.

nIT4sGxCbiDhSuu-20fXuw.review_text: I really enjoyed having dinner here! The menu is really creative and fun. The cocktails were terrific. We had the whole fried fish and cowboy steak for main courses, and both were impressive and tasty. The fig salad as a starter was fantastic. As a long time server, I am really serious about good service and these guys were top notch. The restaurant itself was decorated beautifully as well. Overall a really good experience.

KUKxka_ZWM-9p0ci5JLOWg.review_text: Five stars, mostly as credit to our server, Porter, who made our meal and visit a very enjoyable one.  He was attentive, thoughtful and cared sincerely about our experience.  He noticed that we were not thrilled with our dessert and gave us another dessert, and offered us free coffee when he saw that the busboy had cleared the table, giving the impression that he was rushing us.  The food was solid, the decor was elegant, but Porter would be the reason for a return visit.

PvbWDAixsi_kFe7qV55cBg.review_text: Worst place ever.  Went here for New Years Eve.  Paid $100 per ticket and they were supposed to open at 9:30pm and have open bar.  They didn't empty the other patrons out of the restaurant on time and then had trouble figuring out how to scan tickets, so they kept 100 people in line outside until after 11:00pm.  We were wondering if we would make it in before midnight!  It was 11:15 before we even got a drink!  For my second drink I had to wait in line for 25 minutes.  Two guys in front of me got in a fist fight b/c the crowded and extended wait at the bar for drinks was creating too much tension and some guys were pushing each other around.  They understaffed the bar, oversold the tickets and let us in VERY late.  Completely mismanaged, very incompetent.  They should have given us at least a partial refund.  I will never go here again.

Sqk1SP4mcDdwm9ZnyDhuDA.review_text: The view here is great as it's right on the water.  I only went here for an event so had the appetizers which were interesting such as the mushroom soup in a shot glass.  The drinks are pretty good as well. Service is great both at the bar and the waiters, plus there's coat check.

u47K5gGtBM_VU77xcvBFmA.review_text: This place is nice. I will go back for sure. See details below.  Ambiance: 3/5     I found that it was rather quite at times, they should have either louder music or more upbeat music. Also, we may have gone at a quiet time (Friday at 8pm), but I doubt it. I am not sure why it was not busier... could be because it's further away from the main attractions.  Drinks: 5/5     I had a few martinis; those were tasty, refreshing, and hit the right way.  Appetizers: N/A     We had none; we went straight to the main dishes.  Main Dishes: 5/5     Everything we had was amazing. Tender, juicy, flavorful, done just the right way. We were 7, with various tastes, and we were all very satisfied. They also allowed us to replace items on our dishes that we did not like.  Desserts: 5/5     Simply mouth watering. We had at least one of each. they were great.  Overall: 5/5     It's definitely a place to go to. Great view of the bay. Great food, martini's and desserts.

3KYM1E7YBg8S2UzUV9893Q.review_text: I picked this place for our anniversary dinner based on reviews I read and for the location and am so glad I did. The hostess saved a cozy table for us which looks out directly at the water and is a bit secluded from the main part of the restaurant: major points for the ambiance and setting. She also recommended the kumquat margarita when I asked--deliciosa, but don't guzzle it down: it will sneak up on you.  Our waiter, Porter, really made our evening special. He was knowledgeable about the menu, efficient and simply charming. He didn't mind our numerous questions and we made our meal selection based on his recommendations. The whole fried fish was artfully prepared and so tasty. I wish we could have tried the soft shell crab, but that will have to wait for our next visit. The chef, Rob, has a creative touch in addition to his culinary skills, and Porter suggested that he doesn't do the same thing over and over--he mixes it up and keeps things fresh. We will be back for sure!

YLFCo2L9AkKwWre4DDhngg.review_text: I just moved to the area and decided to go in because it is close.  What a wonderful place.  I went for brunch and the service was excellent, the ambiance was great and the food was really really good.  They also make one heck of a bloody mary... highly recommended.  I can't wait to go here for dinner or happy hour.

8Lc3-TTHjExd79GSQIHnAw.review_text: The calamari is great.  The duck confit is a little dry.  The ribeye was undercooked.  The crab stuffed chicken sounds awesome but was AWFUL.  The desserts are AWESOME - creme brule and banana fosters.  $30/plate.  Service was good.  Food not so much.  I recommend this place for dessert only.

vsKRK50xBL8hy3Kb_dqGlg.review_text: I went there for lunch with a couple of friends during the 2006 Dine About Town.  We got a seat next to the water because they weren't that busy for lunch!  Food was good.  We had:  house smoked salmon carpaccio with whipped horseradish and wonton crackers  tumeric grilled snapper with rice noodles and a nuoc cham dipping sauce  warm chocolate torte with coffee ice cream and raspberries  That was the best chocolate torte I've ever had! It was nice a warm and rich (hee hee)!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: It's easy to write off Buttefly as a tourist trap considering its waterfront location and proximity to Pier 39 - I know I did for years. But all in all, it's actually a pretty good place to dine with good service, and hopefully plenty of sunshine to boot. Butterfly lets in a lot of light and it was quite glorious on the day we arrived for lunch. Having made reservations earlier, we were seated promptly and our server was right on top of things immediately. I started with the fried calamari (yelp.com/biz_photos/I793…) which were good but not great - could have used a little more salt but it was fresh and not too tough. I liked the creamy consistency of tabasco remoulade and the extra spice kick it brought. The generous sprinkling of cilantro really helped to brighten up the plate. I also stole a bite of the Kalua pig butter-lettuce cups - that was probably the highlight from the meal. Note to self on return visit. I had the turmeric grilled snapper (yelp.com/biz_photos/I793…) for my entree and I really liked the fish. It had a good char to it and the theatrics of a sizzling dish is always nice. I really didn't care for the cold rice noodles that came with it. I guess it's a play on Bun but I thought it was extraneous and took away from the fish. It's easy to see how I overlooked Butterfly in the past but easier to understand why I am coming back - decent food and tremendous service. On that note, our server offered us a free dessert to share because one of the appetizers (onion soup) came 5 minutes after the others were served. Yup... another check for Butterfly the next time I'm looking for a waterfront restaurant.

-2o_YGAbFLdylpyAiK37tw.review_text: My husband and I went to Butterfly for Thanksgiving dinner. I had high hopes for Butterfly, since they were well reviewed on Bay Area Check Please.  First off, the $50 price per person was fair for the amount of courses we received.   The starter was pretty good, we enjoyed the salmon although the crisp it was on was a little greasy. The oyster shooter was fresh, the oyster could have been larger. The grapefruit was nice and refreshing.   The second course for me was the soup. Nothing should be changed, the flavors are at once creamy with the creme fraiche, spicy with the ginger and curry and luscious with pumpkin base. Garnished with toasted pumpkin seeds and sprouts-I  loved it! My husband's salad and Hawaiian bread muffin was good, but not spectacular like my soup. The salad was a mix of pomegranite seeds, greens, goat cheese and candied pecans, it was average I could have put that together easily.  The main course, Turkey breast with hash really fell short for me, the Asian flavors didn't complement the turkey and instead tasted salty and metallic- it was not the flavor you want from your favorite comfort food. The small potato with cheese was a little stale and you could tell it sat around awhile,  the corn muffin with cranberry compote was good but wished it were crispy and warm.  Pumkie pie ended the meal, it was good but the standard stuff you get from the bakery.   I don't know if the automatic gratuity of 18% is standard, or just for the special Thanksgiving dinner but it would have been nice if our waiter had pointed it out. We found ourselves listening to another waiter not only describing the dishes he was serving but pointing out the gratuity- We did see it on the bill of course, but it's a nice touch when your waiter mentions it. He would not have gotten that 18% otherwise.  All in all, I would like to give Butterfly another chance on a day that we can order off the menu since it seeems to get good reviews.

zhTh0Hd8kiICozo8R46NYA.review_text: I'm not a real big fan of asian fusion food since I grew up believing in cheap, down and dirty asian food, but this place was a nice and pleasant surprise.   I went here for the lunch dine about town because after looking at all the other places, this one gives me more bang for my buck. Granted you get good view of the bay but you're also between two ilapidated buildings and there was a cruise ship blocking most of my view. However, they sat my friend and I in one of those couples seat facing the door. I actually kind of like it and I totally want that table now.   We started out with some local beers and oyster shooters sans the liquor. Although small, they taste good for $2. Then we had the duck confit spring roll. Sidenote: spring rolls give the connotation of the vietnamese spring rolls. These are more like egg rolls. They were actually good, but it could have been any meat. I couldn't taste the duck. Then we had the kahlua pork. These were actually really good and the meat was just super tender and the lettuce was fresh. For our entries we did the snapper and shanghai noodles. The snapper was definitely a good choice because it was tender and the portion was enough to feed two. They instructed us to make it like a wrap, but you can just do a vermicilli dish style with it. We alreayd did too much wrapping with the kahlua pork. The noodles were greasy though. It wasn't what I was expecting from a fusion place.   Overall the experience was lovely. It was a hit and miss with our meal, but the wait staff was super nice. I wouldn't go here unless it was lunch dine about town. Price was too much for the type of food they serve but they are in a prime tourist location so I can't blame the.

_8LRhrTaTaIpzWVmyE21Qw.review_text: My friends and I took a spontaneous trip to San Francisco and got super hungry while wandering around Fisherman's Wharf. We yelped this place and it was within walking distance so we dropped by for some drinks and food late in the afternoon. We ordered margaritas because the bartender recommended them and I'm so glad she did! They were literally the best margaritas I've ever tasted. It consisted of tequila, agave nectar, and fresh squeezed limes (we saw her do it right in front of us!) such simple ingredients! Then the head chef who is also the owner came out to say hi to his customers and he ordered a round for everyone at the bar! It was such a nice gesture, something you never see in nice restaurants like this! For food we ordered chicken wings, calamari, duck confit spring rolls, the chicken salad club sandwich, and the mushroom au jus. Needless to say, the chefs have it down with the food. There's a great touch of Asian spices and herbs that give it all a unique flavor. They turn simple plates into amazing ones! The place is located right on the water too and was so pretty. The dinner menu looked really good too so next time I'm here, I'll definitely be checking it out!

xRyztwboRJbaGUrMFGBfUg.review_text: Came here with a buddy of mine for dinner. The restaurant was pretty empty when we walked in at 7pm, but it could be that we went on a Tuesday night. Anyway, the views are amazing. I would like to try this place again when it's light outside, as the restaurant has huge windows that overlook the bay.   Food:  We started with the duck confit spring rolls, which were very good. They are fried spring rolls paired with a wasabi sweet sauce. This was by far my favorite dish of the night. For my main dish I had the short ribs. This dish was disappointing. The meat was not as tender as I would have liked it and the reduction was too salty. Over salting kills dishes, and this one was no exception. For dessert I had a the chocolate chip cookie with mint chip ice cream. This dish was good, the cookie was a little burnt. Nothing really special about this dessert; I could have created this myself at home for half the price.   This restaurant, has a prime view and decor that could allow it to be a top notch restaurant. Additionally, the food concept of Asian fusion, is definitely a big craze in the food world right now. Unfortunately, the food is not quite at high level standards.

dEdd2vd3VI0B2PjQOproXg.review_text: My family and I stopped here for a Happy Hour cocktail and appetizers before a tour to Alcatraz. We were greeted by a welcoming host and seated at a beautiful table near the window, overlooking the pier and water. Our server, Porter, was AMAZING. Not only did he have a great sense of humor, he offered advice and recommended some great appetizers, of which we all enjoyed. You can't go wrong with the oyster shooters for $1 a piece, they're fun and taste great too!  Not only did Porter make our dining experience that much better, he went above and beyond helping us after our tour on Alcatraz that evening. It was POURING rain, thundering, and lightening, and we had dinner reservations a few miles down the pier. Of course, we didn't have umbrellas, and no cabs were to be found. While running towards the oh-so-far-away restaurant to have dinner, we passed Butterfly and Porter was standing outside. He remembered us from before, and offered to take his personal vehicle and drive us to our restaurant so we wouldn't lose the reservations! What a nice gentleman!   The hospitality and ambiance of this restaurant are definitely something that everyone should experience, and definitely ask for PORTER as a server!!!

fIu12PuigcFDBbXxUUl_bA.review_text: I love this restaurant. Food is yummy, service is great, and atmosphere is great! It is on the pricier side and not all the food is created equal. However, they had my favorite salad there of all time (seasonal) - poached pear with blue cheese hawaian muffin with endives and prcans.

tC7-sL1mZ4sIZ7gP_MQ8SQ.review_text: I should've stayed home and had leftovers. The price is like Bouchon's, the calibre of food is like a Jack in the Box.   This is a very sour place. Everything was dry and sour. The appetizers were dry but still edible. The real failure was the onion soup that tasted like lime juice with some onions and cheese. I had one sip and physically cringed reflexively. The Ahi tuna was supposed to be medium rare, but was dry and about a tasty as plaster. The creme brulee came straight out of the freezer. I knew this cause the creme brulee plate had frost still on it!   The decor is stellar, the ambiance is nice, but don't expect your drink to come on time (the place was filled at half capacity). I would give this place half a star for ostentatiousness and another half for good location/ambiance. Zero for food. After being slapped for a hundred bucks for the most pompous sawdust in San Francisco, I left with a real sour taste in my mouth.

_KaWXWIFuucvaxhzRNuymQ.review_text: Stopped in for a lunch with a friend, The food choices were very nice, Some APPs were hit or miss, I don't remember specifics however I had o sort of hamburger app that was delightful , the steak was also good but overcooked from our request of medium rare.

GHNnA-mtFXomPILnAvuXmw.review_text: I had the fire fried calamari, kalua pig with butter lettuce cups, caramelized maui onion soup, scrambled eggs and shrimp tostada, shaking beef cobb salad, and chicken salad club sandwich  Pros: The portions were huge.  The kalua pig was tender and well flavored.  I really enjoyed the dressing on the salad.  Huge chunks of meat in the chicken salad club  Cons: The calamari could have been more tender.  The tostada was soaking in grease.  The steak fries were bland  Came here for Dine About Town and ordered the entire menu (minus the smoked salmon scramble).  While I enjoyed the food and atmosphere, none of the dishes were particularly memorable.  Would return if I was in the area but wouldn't make a special trip

4x7LmgcKW3ASIvxr2drHSQ.review_text: BEAUTIFUL.... simply beautiful.   Okay, it took me a long time to write this review, just because there is no perfect words to describe the experience. To begin with, I had low expectations upon coming here. My friend bought a groupon, so we decided to make a reservation! But wow, HUGE surprise.   I think I had the best seat in the house. Small little table, with cozy sofa seats, next to the bar, facing the water. It was near sunset, and even though WATER is the only view, it's so beautiful. I felt so serene. So if you are having dinner for two, I recommend you to request this table. Remember, the small table next to the bar facing water... It's at the corner with a bigger table that fits around six people. And if there's no party, you have the whole corner to yourself!   Okay, enough about the table. Now let's talk about FOOD. My conclusion for this place is.... Fresh equals to delicious! Butter lettuce cup so fresh that it's good on its own, but the Kalua Pig makes it even better! I also had the seared scallops with lemon risotto, DELISH! I seriously think that you should have lemon in your risotto all the time, it's so good! My friend had the pork chop which I thought was okay. The pork chop is too thick. When it comes to pork, I like it with more fat. The other thing that didn't impress me was the duck confit spring rolls. Every plate came out with great presentation, I feel bumped for not having my camera with me that night. But, there is no such amazing presentation in the spring rolls, which disappointed me.   Then, dessert...we were so full that we could only share a dessert. We had Banana Bread Pudding, and again great presentation with great taste. I also had Lychee Martini, which I loved!   Lastly, SERVICE was amazing. Chef. Robert Lam came out and greet tables every 15 minutes. I was there for about an hour, and he came by to my table at least two times. I am SO impressed!   I can't wait to come back and tried more things. Butterfly has a very casual ambiance and offers high quality food. It's somewhere in between casual and fine dining. 2 appetizers+ 2 entrees + 1 dessert + 1 drink is about $100 (not including tips).

VP5sp8r6uOYlBhOeMdbkMw.review_text: First restaurant experience in San Francisco in which the chef visited our table afterward to ask how we enjoyed his cooking. Expensive but scrumptious -- and the modest portions will please calorie counters.

kp1rM7DIgqI4j9vv7KN97w.review_text: Great food... loved the fried calamari and banana lumpias. Will go again.

TQOdHNVrhbvE5kgdnwZ1yw.review_text: Wow what a burger!!! Super fresh toppings and great bar service and wait staff! Seafood clam chowda was to die for.

4MJ7go3WJwIcak_17vWw9w.review_text: Make a reservation! We made one and was given a nice booth with a view of the waterfront even though there was plenty of free tables. =D 25 dollars gift certificate from restaurant.com for 12 bucks. We ordered: Garlic Seared Clams & Mussels - delicious. the sauce is scrumptious and goes well with bread that comes with it. Wish they provided a bigger disposal bowl. Crab & Mascrapone Stuffed Crispy Chicken Breast- WOW! They give a lot of food & there is a wide variety of stuff on the plate. There is chicken, crab, shrimp, corn, and mushrooms. I thought the crab sauce was a bit overwhelming but the BF liked it. One issue was there was a small piece of crab shell. =/ But overall great dish. Definitely worth the 25 dollars. Pan Seared Black Cod- I am not a huge fan of fish but the BF says it was cooked perfectly. I really enjoyed the dumpling. Spicy oil sauce comes with the dish. Ambiance is really nice. Restaurant is a bit small from what we imagined. Popular place for happy hour from what we saw since we had an early dinner. Two stalls in the women bathroom.

bM6k6K2i4nSI0kCzuXzOZA.review_text: Absolutely loved this place! The Hubby and I were looking to kill a few hours before heading home to Sacramento. I could not think of a better way to spend 2 hours than at this restaurant! We walked in and requested a seat by the water which we were hesitant would be hard to come by. We were immediately told they would make it happen, and they did. We were greeted by our server as soon as we sat down. Amazing food and my hubby enjoyed the mimosas. Our waiter, Ross, was extremely down to earth and actually cared enough to ask about our day, where we were coming from, and where we were heading. Such a great experience that I called my sister when we got home and told her we were going to take a day trip to SF just to eat here. This place definitely made up for my horrible experience at a pricey restaurant in the city, the night prior!

53ofQMI4TRDZtArWOZCelg.review_text: We went with a large party & were treated very well.  The chef came out & asked us if everything was okay. The staff was all so courteous & pleasant, which isn't always easy with a large party. The edamame that they give at the table is exceptionally yummy. I had the Heirloom Tomato Duo & it was soooo yummy, the broth on the tofu was to live for! Everyone else enjoyed their entrees as well + dessert.  All food was of exceptional quality,  flavors delicious & the presentation beautifully creative!  **Only one thing I would recommend to change is that we were at a table that had bench seating on one side & chairs on the other --- the bench seat was much too uncomfortably low & I felt like I needed a booster seat!**

52oH4DrRvzzl8wh5UXyU0A.review_text: Been here a couple of times. The first couple of times it was when it was late night and turned into a club. Good looking crowd and diverse, which is nice. I really had no complaints. The outdoor patio is a nice touch.   Then I went here for happy hour. I must admit, the bartender was sooooo sweet. BUT I'm the kind of person who if you ask me what drink i'd like to order, I'd say "surprise me". I told him to surprise me and he went a bit further and asked me if I like sweet, tart, sour... I said sweet and he gave me this strong ass tart drink... I asked him to surprise me 3 times and only 1 drink was sweet hahah He tried though =)   Great place, check it out! I like how diverse it is =)

BmxMhN-TPEcTOjpUF53WOw.review_text: LivingSocial cinched the deal. Butterfly had been on my radar since it was featured on Check Please Bay Area. The food lived up to the reviews on Check Please and the best of the reviews here on Yelp.  Great service (although I wish the waitress had remained aware of our time constraints - nothing to keep us from enjoying our visits but I had to keep her moving to wrap our visit) Chef came by to thank us for coming in.  The Happy Hour appetizers are a real bargin (not applicable to any LivingSocial offer) and the Fried Fish of the day was amazing. The Duck Confit Eggrolls were so good - we kept ordering them as we ran out. We also loved the Calamari and Salmon/Strawberry Spring Rolls.  We'll be back because we didn't try enough of the menu.

GDs7CqAIxnnAOP1PFrmbXw.review_text: Loved their garlic noodles. The atmosphere is awesome! It's on the water, so perfect restaurant to go to for the American Cup..   But the service is horrible. We set at the bar and the bartenders were.. I actually have no idea what they were doing. Well i know what they were NOT doing was attending customers. I have been to this restaurant twice before and sat at the dining area and yes the service was just as horrible.  the only reason i went there these many times, is because it was close to my previous work and the last time was because i had purchased a deal at livingsocial in 2011 and just rememebered to use it.. haha

gmvyxrr7T45vuZaHUUowgw.review_text: I've been here twice before. Once for dine about town and once when it was turned to a night club. I remember when I came for Dine about Town it wasn't that great. Maybe because of the fixed menu. As for the club it was nice. The outside area was really nice overlooking the pier. The decor is really modren with a hint of zenness.  I came again for brunch with my family and they said that they wanted to come here because they saw this place on Bay Area Check Please. I love that show. People stated that they have really good happy hour and brunch. Hence here we are.  I ordered their Waygu beef burger which was pretty tasty. Thier garlic noodle is a must get. My mom ordered thier fish which was really light and airy.  My dad got the spam dish which he couldn't stop raving about.   Their desert is quite delishious as well. All the ice cream came from Mitchelle's which is always a plus.   I would definately come back for brunch on a special occasion or something.   A must try if you have never gone.

jxs7SnriWMiLPXfEMft9nQ.review_text: This review is only for the HH.  I came to Butterfly on Friday after work with my friend.  The walk to get here from the FiDi was definitely a trek, so by the time we finally got to Butterfly, there was only 30 minutes left of HH (HH ends at 7 pm on Friday, but I think it reopens later on).  The cocktails were really delicious ($5, and I definitely left tipsy after only 2), as were the calamari ($5) & oyster shooters ($1), and the decor.  I thought the view of the water was okay, but nothing to write home about (maybe it's better at night?).   In terms of the crowd, Butterfly is very mellow for a Friday HH spot (it's probably the location, since the HH deals ARE good), but the crowds definitely started rolling in around dinner time.  Given the small amount of people there, I was a little surprised that the bartender still got my friend's and my drink mixed up.  There was a mixture of some old random tourist couples, some families and only one other group of younger folk.    Despite the mellow crowd, I think that the HH at Butterfly is a great place to go with one or two other friends.  Sometimes it's nice to venture a little further to the places not that many people go to ;)

_DsKjeIqxjoB_8C4cUdYRQ.review_text: Good drinks and appetizers.  Nice ambiance, a great place to grab a quick snack while walking around the Embarcadero.

O7gXf-gtFLFjFa92ozUH9w.review_text: As a native San Franciscan, who lives and eats in the city, I rarely ever head down to the Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf area when it comes to choosing a restaurant. We locals mostly think that area is catered just for the tourist. Well, the tourists may indeed be going to these establishments but that shouldn't stop us locals from heading down there as well. And Butterfly is the reason! After dining there 4 or 5 times, I finally decided to post a review.   I discovered the place when a group of work colleagues had an after-work dinner there, and since then, I've been back a few times to try out their menu. Honestly, I have yet to be disappointed. Is it Asian? Is it Asian-Fusion? Is it Asian-Californian? I don't know and I really don't care. What I do know is that all of the food is unique, flavorful, well-seasoned and definitely worth the trek down to the waterfront. Some of the popular dishes remain year round but they do change other things on a seasonal basis. On my last visit, I tried the mushroom cappuccino soup, which was so thick and decadent, it reminded me of what would be served as an amuse-bouche at a fancy/formal establishment...but double the portion. The plum salad (not on the current menu) was genius as it combined fruit and tangy fish sauce together, a first for me. The kalua pig lettuce cups are a great starter to share along with the wok seared noodles. As for the entrees, I've usually stuck to things with the 'asian flavors' in them, such as the fish but the filet mignon steak was really good. The short ribs were delicious as well. Always plenty of different desserts worth trying so be sure to save room.   Overall, Butterfly was a great place to discover and I'll continue to go back, especially to try out all the new dishes that are added. If parking is a challenge (there is a paid lot across the street), the F streetcar line stops right outside the door, so their easily accessible via the MUNI.

ObDd4t59rJYPycCq6pbqcg.review_text: Been waiting to eat here a long time and finally went for a family dinner. Ordered the whole fish fried, it was crispy, flaky and tasty but I've had better for less.   The calamari was really good. Liked the cilantro mix that came with it.   Dessert wasn't bad either, tried their version of a BJs pizookie. Service was good and the views probably would of been amazing if we had gone before sun down. Maybe that would have added another star? Lol

mATkJ62zp1Iobu8wxHmfeA.review_text: So the lady friend doesn't like to be called the lady friend and wants to be the girlfriend for a review.  Not a problem.  So my girlfriend and I decided to stop by Butterfly.  Almost didn't, thankfully we did.  It restored our faith in SF food.  Hurray!  Nice atmosphere, lots of buddahs and such fill the wall, with the strange scent of fish in the air (only thing I didn't like about the place).  The waiter was great, knew what he was talking about, could give great recommendations, was very patient with the 'girl friend' God knows you need to be.  I ordered the Tuna and the girl friend ordered the shrimp and papaya salad with a side of chicken wings.  Hilarious.  Oh, and for appetizer we had the lettuce cup pulled pork.  All were delicious!  yay!  Tuna was perfect.  Probably the best I've had.  Two large pieces of sushi grade Tuna atop a thck cut onion ring which devilishly hides a delightful little suprise underneath which you'll just have to find out for yourself.  (hint: it's shrimp).  Presentation was great with everything, and the shrimp salad, in the word of my girl friend was, 'everything it promised it would be."  Chicken wings was a bit of a wild card in this meal, but they weren't bad.  Too much honey, and I don't like bleu cheese, but hey, it told us what was on there right on the menu.  Can't blame the staff for the customer's brain fart.  Anyway, thank you Butterfly.  Your delish!

hrZmc_ySraDTJWzDf0Zzbw.review_text: I made a reservation weeks in advance for the occasion of celebrating somebody special's birthday and our new apartment. A week in advance, I received a call confirming the reservation. A few days before, something came up (I had won free tickets to a Warriors game) and I asked to reschedule for another time that same day. They told me all other time slots were full, so I would have to stay with my reservation time. Bummer, but oh well. I gave the tickets away. The next day, one day before my reservation, I get a call telling me my reservation is cancelled because a large party needs my space at that time. What?! You confirm with me for two weeks, even tell me my spot is final the day before so I have to give away free tickets, and THEN you tell me right before the day of my reservation that I'm getting bumped out because a party is more important than other customers? They tried to make it up with a gift certificate, but that really only helps so much. The gift certificate is less than the value of the tickets I gave away, and now I'm in a bit of a bind for taking my special someone out for a celebration. Just inexcusably poor customer service. And to make matters worse, I had just bought a living social deal to spend here :/ it's too bad you have to leave at least 1 star on these things, it really takes away from expressing my displeasure and disappointment.  UPDATE: 1 month later, still haven't received my gift certificate.  Ridiculous!

S4dBrFYINihRpoL7tlPqPw.review_text: I am desperately trying to think of positive things to say about my experience at Butterfly. Alas, I have come up with 2 things: -gorgeous views overlooking the water -attentive servers And those, combined, are going to merit my 1 star.   The food was decidedly BAD. Ok, well not terrible by normal standards, but when I go to this kind of place I expect the food to be at a certain level, and Butterfly's food didn't measure up to any standards. We came here for my birthday dinner, mostly at my mom's suggestion because she had a Living Social Deal.  We started with the calamari and a side of the garlic noodles. Now, my mom and I aren't mayonnaise lovers, so it came as no shock to us that we were not fond of the aioli that came with the calamari. However, we did not expect the aioli to be slopped on top of every piece of calamari that we received. The portion was small, the calamari was soggy, and I wish they had given us the sauce on the side (as is usually the case).  The garlic noodles were literally the same as any order of chow mein that you can get in any Chinese restaurant. I got no real sense of garlic and they, too, were full of oil. For our mains I had the Tombo Tuna and my mom had the Hanger Steak. The tombo tuna had very little flavor except for the dry rub that was on it (let me just say, the "dry rub" is really just furikake, which can be bout at any Japanese market for $4). There was no sauce, and I was left wondering what I would do with the rare pieces of tuna meat on the inside that had no dry rub flavor. The best part of the dish was 'calamari' purple rice. It was pretty flavorful, but I think that to be called 'calamari rice' the rice must actually have calamari in it. I think I counted about 6 itty bitty pieces or so. My mom's entrée was world's better than mine. Loads more flavor and she actually got sauce. Thank god they gave her a gigantic steak knife, though, because her meat was TOUGH. And I know hanger steak is a tough cut of meat, but she was chewing for the majority of the meal. For dessert, we had the 'chocolate torte.' Now, picture what a chocolate torte looks like in your mind. I'm guessing your thinking of something that looks a little like miniature pie. What we got was a molten chocolate cake. Which was good, but just not what we expected or wanted.   The service and ambiance is great, but the food was so disappointing that is detracted exponentially from the appeal of everything else. I will not be back, living social deal or not.

DF0u_AwcmZdvFQY10GWcHQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I had hoped to come here ourselves this summer, but didn't find the chance. Instead, we gifted his parents our LivingSocial coupon here. They had the chance to go here last night and this review is based on what they said afterwards.  TRAFFIC & PARKING: very poor "Traffic was very slow and parking difficult to find."  RESTAURANT DECOR: great "restaurant was easy to find, and the ambience sophisticated and friendly."  SERVICE: excellent "impressively excellent.  We had no problems using the Living Social coupon."  RECOMMENDED FOOD: Kahlua pig with butter lettuce cups appetizer "was scrumptious and more than sufficient for a dinner serving... was very good"  NOT RECOMMENDED FOOD: black cod with shrimp dumplings "tasty but small"  All in all a good time, but a hit-or-miss if you're not having it 50% off like they did. The excellent service that night, restaurant ambience, and excellent appetizer choice seemed to make up for the lack of consistent food quality and difficulty parking.

1hurMnFzAZAKlO0jYyvK_A.review_text: i haven't been to butterfly since they moved from their mission location to the embarcadero, so i thought it was time to give them a try after work today.  when we arrived,  i was definitely excited to see a happy hour menu as well as available seats at the bar.    both the hostess & bartender (this russian-esque girl with bangin' bangs) were polite & friendly, so that was a plus.  good happy hour menu selection - but not necessarily enjoyable.  however, what do you expect when you pay only $5 for a dish/drink?  anyways, i would skip their cherry blossom signature cocktail ($5) and opt for one of their wines ($5).  just say HELL NO! to their duck confit spring rolls ($5) - it was disgustingly gamey!  wouldn't really bother with their pork kalua lettuce wraps either ($5)...then again, they weren't thaaaaat bad, so why not?  i liked their burger sliders...but they were actually on a soft sliced, buttery bread, opposed to an actual burger bun ($7).  the calamari ($5) were decent so you should check that out.  overall...good happy hour selection...mediocre food (you do get what you pay for)....great location, with an amazing waterfront view...modern & chic interior. i love, love, love their spiky, sea urchin light fixture - it was hella hot!  not impressed with their restroom!

eCTrjLJrRgWaNkqpZxXbEA.review_text: Had New Year's Eve at this location. Promised Fireworks, Food, Party Favors and Bar. The only thing we got for $280.00 bucks is a couple of drinks. No view of any fireworks ... we got screwed. I do not recommend this venue for this type event...EVER...save your money for something better!

CX9Ho8E8GAPgjVSxfGLUHQ.review_text: Food was yummy. Service was great. They kept refilling our water which was extremely nice of them to keep checking up on us. Great interior and view of the water!!  All the food and desserts were yummy. Just need minor tweaks. My mango salad with sirarcha can use less dressing and spice. Creme brûlée was good but a bit too soft and the burnt layer of sugar on top could of been thinner than thicker.

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: Had a great party time here. This despite the venue's strength being more in the eating arena than the nightclub. The bartenders were hints of modelesque and served stiff drinks; the regular DJ spun house beats that got the room on its feet, and the crowd itself was a good looking bunch, dressed to impress. (The females being more successful at it than the guys that night, if that helps any readers.)  The views of the bay weren't too well employed, since it was pitch dark inside and outside, and obscured by all the tall bodies. There was an outhouse aroma that also seeped into the tiny dance floor area from the wharf outside... no wait, it's coming from the dance floor spill in the middle! Strange, I thought that pool was spilt drinks. Everyone escaped to the wharf for fresh-ish air, smokes, and intimate chats.  There was a $30 minimum to use the credit card on drinks, which (if you got it from the smaller bar) were small and served in the little dixie cups you'd get at the dentist. Boo.  But my biggest props go to the security staff that night. Buncha good guys that did their job well. They were on that weird spill in no time, with the bussers who wiped it up.
