Also friendly and witty, the lot of them. They kept on maintaining the peace, even after their hours were over: Helped my friends and me get some shady horndogs off our trail outside the door, and let us in on a very cool afterparty. Now that's earning your stars, boys.

zH_vpQpSy_FXkHBrHzh_Tg.review_text: i gave this a one star rating because this is one of the most overpriced restaurants in the city. The food was uninspiring, and the portions and prices were totally outrageous. For the same price, you could eat in an amazing restaurant in the city -- don't waste your money here

Hrt4onJXoVuYyD2jEmTMpQ.review_text: Normally, I avoid Asian fusion restaurants like the plague, mostly because the food is at best okay and it's full of people trying to see and be seen.  But there was a glowing review for Butterfly on KQED so I decided to give it a try.  We were going to try the prix fixe menu for 21 dollars, but alas we came too late.  (the prix fixe menu ends at 6 pm).    I ended up getting the black cod, it was absolutely delicious.  Came in a tom kha soup/sauce with a shrimp dumpling.  My friend got the pork tenderloin which was pretty darn good too.  Not dry at all.  For dessert, we got the banana bread pudding and banana lumpia.  The bread pudding was a bit too sweet for us, but the lumpia was amazing.  The total bill came to 100 bux, which ain't cheap, but is about right for this caliber restaurant.  highly recommended!

wfdktRlL6Kdka9N6Qe1NDQ.review_text: Located so close to my gym, I've always been curious about this place.  With all the word-of-mouth mixed reviews I was getting each time, I was hesitant and kept defaulting to an old favorite across the street.  That is, until last night.  We had arrived at 8:00 for an 8:45 reservation, but they had open tables and were able to seat us immediately.  We didn't get a table by the window overlooking the water, but at least we didn't have to wait an additional forty-five minutes in the cold.  The decor was... confusing.  They decorated an old warehouse-structured building with its old window pane with a large edgy black mirror & candle piece along the wall opposite the window, spiky sea urchin-looking black chandlers on one side of the room, and a brown bamboo room divider near the kitchen.  The bar, which was located across the room from the kitchen, looked classy, but the chairs reminded me of lawn chairs with their crisscrossed backs.  The bathroom had the type of stalls you'd find in a fast food joint, but the sinks were stone with high faucets and a pot of either incense or small flowers (I can't remember) on a shelf in front.   Our waiter was friendly and attentive and, with the exception of my companion's cappuccino coming out halfway into dessert, the timing of our entrees were spot on.    To begin, I had a glass of the Hangtime Pinot Noir, which was okay, but definitely not one that I would have again.  It was brought out, pre-poured in a stemless wine glass.    Out of curiosity we went with the Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic Noodles for our appetizer.  It was basically a bowl of chow mein they CALL an appetizer.  It was very good and I don't regret having had it, but it didn't quite seem like an appetizer, especially when there were main entrees like a 22 oz. Cowboy Steak on the menu.    I opted for the gnocchi for my main entree.  It was creative and very well done.  The presentation was lovely as well.  My companion chose the Filet Mignon, which was tender, juicy, and just the right portion size.    For dessert, we chose the banana bread pudding with Mitchell's macapuno ice cream.  It was rich and sweet and I loved the first few bites, but after a while it got a little too rich and sweet and we both gave up on finishing it.  The late-delivered cappuccino appeared to be overly frothy upon first glance, but it was actually well made.

Dz09X-zAe_tFh6Jq303Kuw.review_text: We went early on Saturday evening when it was almost empty, has a bare feeling since there are only hard surfaces and no view (waterfront was barely visible in the darkness).  I think it could use something like some rugs or something to soften the hard surfaces.  The food was fair - the 5-spiced braised beef ribs was okay - but the sauce was way too salty.  If you order this, ask for the sauce on the side.  The duck breast dish was cooked perfectly done (med rare) and tasty.  I had the curried pumpkin soup that was a special that night.  It was OK but also a bit heavy on the salt.  Appetizer Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups was okay - a bit too much fatty portions of pork.  Dessert and Wine menu seemed more reasonably priced than main menu.  Skip the coffee, flat flavor - not worth even the low price of $3.

h4YWVuPma6fDyUiEB1GJjA.review_text: Second time at Butterfly. Saturday night dinner.    Parking isn't too bad because there are meters outside (pay until 11pm).  It's a spacious restaurant with a nice view of the bay.  The food is okay but a little overpriced.    4 girls shared 3 appetizers, 2 entrees and 2 desserts.  The Fried Whole Fish was my favorite.  Flavorful, filling and a good combination of fish, noodles, chinese sausage and kimchi - interesting, right?  The only downside of this experience was the service.  The restaurant was full by 9:30pm but we had spotty service toward the end of our meal.

XhYfGrgDfQE87-IPj4t4Tw.review_text: It looks nice but it's really overrated. Food and service are barely up to par. I felt sick later that night. Of all the tourist traps, avoid this one.

vQWwTjPkuocPw7vXyj76hQ.review_text: Very nice interior and food was pretty good, but nothing here was super memorable.

rE6ILt6TLU3pqlzrgB9Ntw.review_text: Pricey, but the food was good.  Drinks weren't that special, but service was excellent and the chef was walking around talking to people to see if they liked their food.  I'd certainly come back here, but I think I'd try it out in a different capacity.....for the club environment.

HM7sabCmP0gLd6ECB8nfGw.review_text: Went to lunch there on a Fri afternoon and the service was not so great! Butterfly was half empty but it took multiple prompts to have the waitress bring our drinks and food. For a place this nice, having a more attentive wait staff would have way upped the rating!   However, snapper fish sandwich was delicious! Not greasy at all, and great fish. Kahlua pig lettuce wraps were also great! nice & smoky, great hoisin sauce. Pass on the lycheetini though---its just vodka with pureed lychee. You'd think it would taste good, but not so much....not for $9.   I'd go back if I was hanigng around the embarcadero---food was good, but wait staff is slow & somewhat inattentive, and parking can be a beast.

l8hEZt0GLFmX1iRzQeRenQ.review_text: Ended up here after taking a friend of mine from NYC to Alcatraz and popped in for a drink.  It's very touristy (yeah, consider the location!), but pretty good food. I had salmon strawberry sashimi and a Chimay and it was excellent.  Good place to stop when walking down the Embarcadero.

mobI9K3OfnCPvOxUxwq5TQ.review_text: The kalua pig in lettuce wraps is delicious.  Also the surf and turf dish works but I recommend getting a little bit of all the flavors on the fork together...then it works really well.   Also the strawberry,fig, cheese salad was fresh and tasty.   I liked that the chef came out to say hello as well.  The only reason it has one less star is that the place echos, it feels more warehousey than cozy.   Can't beat the views.

BdwzriguIryeCv0r7h_QKA.review_text: Excellent menu selection.   Ahi tuna rolls were fantastic. I had the cowboy cut steak which far exceeded my expectations. Tender, served on a piping hot iron skillet.   Service was fantastic.  Views of the bay are amazing!!

A0y_jp8vxK25oIpZdK5_FQ.review_text: Went for brunch. Great service. Bottomless Mimosas all day if ordered before 3pm, but not advertised. Great juice with the mimosas! The Calamari is great. Nice and spicy. The House Smoked Salmon Benedict was awesome. Hollandaise sauce was on point and not too salmony. Overall pretty good experience.

cmigDp6fscsz-6haPpTBjw.review_text: BBRRRR it was a cccold brunch....turn up the heat! or give each table a portable heater!  Why only two stars? Because we froze to death!  Instead of ordering 2 or 3 bottles of champagne or wine, we had free refills of HOT water...WTF!  A girls' brunch of laughter and socializing included a tight huddle around our glasses of hot water. Thanks goodness the company was great otherwise we would have high-tailed out of there!  Otherwise, the restaurant was fine.  Food: 3 stars (mediocre portions for the lunch prices) Duck Confit Spring Rolls Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups House Ground American Kobe Beef Burger Rack of Hoisin Glazed Baby Back Ribs Shaking Beef Cobb Salad  Dessert: 3 stars Iron Skillet Chocolate Cookie Vanilla Creme Brulee  Service: 4 stars Thank goodness they topped off our hot water every 15 minutes   View: 4 stars  View of the pier and the bay was beautiful  Parking: --5 stars Take the time to search the neighborhoods 1-2 short blocks away for free or metered parking. Otherwise, $25 dollars parking in the lot across the street!

YTkSdmMbEYeMwqGkuKh2Wg.review_text: Came here because of one of those 50% groupon type deals, thank goodness!  Wouldn't want to spend full price.  The place is nice with a waterfront view and the service was very good.  I'm only giving 2 stars because the food was not at all good.  The menu was pretty limited for dinner.  We decided to have appetizers for dinner so we can taste more variety.  We ordered ahi tuna - tasteless, calamari - tasteless, a little salt would've gone a long way, garlic noodles - too salty, kahlua pig lettuce cups - the only decent food out of all the ones we had!  It's good, but not enough for me to come back.

iErR7ivFW0fvvm_ImgNWlg.review_text: The food is delicious and the chocolate souffle is the best part of the meal! Definitely recommend it!!

WGO4YWRhsyDr3-Q6nCcJzw.review_text: First went to this restaurant by chance with my boyfriend, just for a little snack after walking the E all day during Saturday's Farmer's Market. Not only is the restaurant gorgeous (water front views....high ceilings, view of the kitchen, great decorations/lighting...especially loved the sea urchin chandeliers) but the prices were very reasonable considering its on the Embarcadero.   Things to try:  ****GO DURING BRUNCH ON THE WEEKENDS Butterfly offers a great 18dollar bottomless deal and its interchangeable between mimosas or bloody marys MMMM (regular price 10bucks a glass so you do the math!)  The fire fried calamari is AHMAZING...not too battery, always tender, and served with a great aioli sauce atop soy sauce/sesame oil cucumbers. Delicious and a huge portion!!  The eggs Benedict with kalu pulled pork...spiced up tradition with great flavors and a delicate sauce...eggs were poached to perfection and the pork was sweet and smokey  The kobe beef burger....what more do I have to say...its Kobe **NOTE--the meat is very very tender so order medium if you usually like medium rare or else it will fall apart on you (not to worry though, medium is still pink in the middle so the burger will still retain its flavor and tenderness)  Banana Bread Pudding....ORDER THIS! I don't even like bananas but I was blown away by this dessert....a bevy of textures and tastes, this dish was surprisingly complex and was delicious bite after bite. Totally worth it if you have room!  The staff was awesome, both our server and the manager gave us VIP treatment and were incredibly personable and fun. My boyfriend and I adore this place and its our go to restaurant to bring family and friends for a weekend brunch

_LDzv-lIz0BuR558zC16uA.review_text: I have been here 4 or 5 times now. Every time has been exceptional. I have also brought my family here for the past 2 Thanksgivings in a row.   The chef/owner Robert Lam is a really great guy. Every time that I have gone, he has come out and talked to us to see if we enjoyed the food. His menu is elegant and unique without being pretentious. Everything on the menu is great, but the whole fried fish is definitely my favorite. I have been eating this dish my entire life, and have never had one as good as the one at Butterfly.   The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable, and the pricing is very reasonable for a restaurant of this caliber. If you like Vietnamese food with a little San Francisco modern twist, check this place out. You will not be let down! I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant for any occasion.

yRFvZ-JrbpBE3vs0Kfpg5g.review_text: I really enjoyed my dinner with a friend here. The waiter was attentive and helpful. The food service was quick. The food was very nicely presented and tasty. We had a view of Treasure Island from our booth by the window. This was my second time eating here but last time was years ago. I'd go back.

NdX6UacaCOqqxfllgsxS0g.review_text: Just happened to be in the city this weekend so I went there with a group of friends as I had a restaurant.com coupon burning up my wallet.  The six of us strolled up at 6pm and got seated immediately.  The restaurant was almost entirely empty, quite odd for a Saturday night. We ordered off the drinks menu right away.  While the drinks were certainly pricy, I heard no positive comments about them.  We also ordered up some calamari and garlic noodles for appetizers.  The calamari was quite delicate and good at $1.25 per piece, while the garlic noodles were forgettable. As for the entrees, they were quite steep.  For $18, you could get some veggies and gnocchi.  If you wanted anything more, it's all about $28-39.  I ordered the black cod for $25.  It came out as a tiny wedge of fish that sat high on top of three clams.  I finished it in all of four bites.  The gnocchi dish consisted of a fried squash flower and exactly 5 pieces of odd-looking gnocchi.  About the only decent dish was the whole fish, but my friend got a terrible stomach ache afterwards.  Coincidence?  I hope so. While having the chef come by to check on us was a nice touch, it certainly didn't make up for the pathetically small portions or the lackluster food.  Maybe we were paying for the priviledge of the bay view, of which the restaurant had ample portions.  Otherwise, the six of us tabbed out at $295.50, including tax and the required 18% tip (service was quite good).  At nearly $50 each, we were all grumbling about being less than satisfied as we left, including even the light eaters.  Perhaps we operate under different economics than the locals, but that just seemed way too much for so little.  Then again, with the restaurant still mostly empty when we left at 7:30pm, the locals had probably already figured this place out.  Even with my $25 coupon, it hardly made a dent in our spirits and confirmed yet again that restaurant.com coupons are terrible Devil's bargains.

YlESJ0ZDTZAuQ6zfBXgzlQ.review_text: Every time I come into San Francisco for a visit, I always make sure I pay a visit to Butterfly Restaurant on Pier 33.    Whether it's for lunch, dinner or just a drink, Butterfly has everything I could ask for.  A great location with awesome views of the bay, the ambience inside the restaurant is always appropriate for the time of day and really sets the mood for a great sit-down meal.  The hostesses, waiters, waitresses and entire restaurant staff are more than accommodating--excellent service! And the food? Even better.  My favorites on the menu are the strawberry and smoked salmon summer rolls, shanghai garlic noodles, vegetarian bento box, and (for brunch on Saturdays and Sundays) the house smoked salmon Benedict.  At this point in time, I've tried nearly everything on the menu and everything has always been on point with flavor and presentation.  And don't even get me started on the dessert, it's absolutely amazing! My personal favorite on their dessert menu would have to be the banana lumpia rolls--they're to die for.    Can't wait to come back again, until next time!

LFf3GL9MIonoexGZB6yuZw.review_text: Great ambiance, had a small table right by the window. Lighting was great! We had the Kahlua pig - great flavors.. It almost melts in your mouth and goes great with the butter lettuce cups.. Also had the salmon n strawberry spring rolls.. They were ok. For entree we had the stuffed crab in the chicken- it was yummy but could have been better.   Overall great experience! We used a living social deal so our total was about $31 even!  Oh and loved the edamame!

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: We came early and ordered a bunch of stuff from the happy hour menu -- duck spring rolls, kalua pork lettuce cups, oyster shooters, smoked salmon wonton chips and sliders. All the items were very good. Their specialty cocktail on the HH menu was rather weak and very sweet. I think for happy hour, this place is great.

N0sNv0LFRGnwCr78Py5mAQ.review_text: Thankfully this place has a view and is near a tourist spot to draw in business because their food alone won't do it. We ordered: calamari appetizer, Kobe beef burger, French dip, and kid's chicken skewers.  The only thing we finished was the calamari and my Stella beer that was served in a low-ball vs. a pilsner (yikes).  Note- adding soy sauce to the dishes doesn't make it Asian.   A good place to grab a drink, but I'll pass on eating here again any time soon.

RUDEDsNp_uDV3KEXT-Eudg.review_text: Great Food,Great Service, Great Time. I would go to be there at sunset so you can appreciate the ambience. So many tasty choices to try. I want to go back to sample more! Thursday live band!

tCj3wFbLtnMcs3etQ9mW0A.review_text: I had heard Butterfly mentioned several times so I was under the impression that this place was going to be super awesome, unfortunately though it didn't quite meet my expectations.  First off, Friday evening and the place was pretty dead, and those who were there were that of an older crowd. There were plenty of open tables so we were seated right away. The restaurant itself was nice -  sophisticated decor and large bay windows on one whole side of the room that overlooked the bay. During the day or on a clear night the view is probably amazing.   There were an array of drinks on the cocktail menu, all of them sounded good and they ended up tasting as good as they sounded.   The menu is simple but had something for everyone especially since I was dining with seafood allergies, fish only, "i want steak!" kind of friends. I ordered the roasted duck 'peking style' and was satisfied. There were smaller pieces of duck topped with a crisp'd leg. The portions were generous. Friend had the short rib which was nicely cooked. Other friend had the ahi tuna yellow fish and it was a big hunk of fish stacked on top of a stuffed onion ring. For some reason the meal didn't feel special, the service was mediocre and because there weren't many people there it wasn't exciting.  Overall I concluded that this place is probably not the best for dinner but may make an ideal happy hour or lounge spot.

_xpivv6pnLim13KiaHBKqg.review_text: Decent place for dinner & drinks, not remarkable.  I started with a caesar salad & their signature bourbon cocktail.  The salad was overly salty and underdressed.  The cocktail was decently tasty, but the orange in it overwhelmed the whiskey.  For the main course, I got the blue cheese & macadamia crusted filet mignon.  The portion of steak was decent, to be expected for a filet, and the blue cheese was decadent.  I couldn't tell there were any macadamia nuts.  All in all, very pleased with the steak.    The potatoes were also very good, but the portion was meager.  I was not impressed with the vegetables.  Some were overcooked, some were almost raw.  The sauce was lackluster.  Along the course of the night, I also had a Bulleit manhattan (not well-crafted) and an Irish coffee (way too strong).    I'm not sure I'd go here again--the food was all over the place & the service was slow.  Seems like a good place if you want to spend your evening chatting, as there are long breaks between plates.  Not a good veggie place, there is only 1 vegetarian entree on the menu (gnocchi), and the portion is very small.

SJtlfwg6qoeowbLrwthErg.review_text: we happened to stop by this delicious place after a long day walking, seeing alcatraz and just being all around tourists.  all we needed were a few cold beers and a couple apps to hold us over till dinner.  butterfly was perfect.    they started us with chilled edamame and promptly took our drink orders.  we opted for one hot and one cold small plate...  Sanoma Liberty Duck Confit Spring Rolls Chinese Hot Mustard & Honey Dipping Sauce these were just okay...  Bread Stuffed Heirloom Tomato Salad Burrata Cheese, Pepperoncini and Olives, Chilled Tomato Gazpacho, Extra Virgin Olive Oil * this was INCREDIBLE (see uploaded pic).  i do believe i will be craving this/ attempting to make it on my own very soon!

1z4_hZDNI1qQE-RhsmxpTQ.review_text: Was here on a Saturday night for a party.  Had the prix fixe Spring dinner. Edamame, Calamari, Lox on Chips & Duck confit spring rolls. All very good.  sabrinasdad and I both had the tuna.  The "stuffed" mushroom didn't seem like it was stuffed with shrimp, calamari black rice was flavorful, but not visually appealing.  The tuna itself had a nice sear and was not overcooked.  Between the company and abundance of Lycheetinis - overall , I would recommend. (My only complaint - toasted sesame seeds on EVERYTHING.  A dinner mate  was allergic so she had to pass on a lot of things and even send her dinner back.  (Except for the edamame, nothing else on the menu specified that they contained sesame seeds).

cUeWKm-h0ndIZAAMs4SJMg.review_text: Good location...on the water...calamari pretty good...bloody Mary's ok...seating...weird...we got put in a semi-circle booth that faces the cashier instead of the water (there were at least three of these ridiculous seats...I am curious as to what the designer was thinking when they configured that layout), so we had to turn sideways to enjoy the view... ok but could be so much better...prob won't go back...but I can see it being a fun happy hour evening spot.

qeExqYrU10EbCChKHMQU3A.review_text: This place may be beautiful but I've experienced better.  I was expecting fabulous things from the reviews but I just got ok.  The food was alright.  Service was slow.  The only thing that impressed me was the ambiance & the mojito.  I will give it another chance but not anytime soon.

L7OWIIy-e_flDJxmJVSQgA.review_text: Went here today for lunch.  Nice ambience and the place looked clean.  Tres importantes.  My fiancee ordered the kobe beef burger and I ordered the salmon carpaccio and garlic seared clams and mussels.  We also ordered a red wine flight.    The kobe beef burger to me was ok but my fiancee said that it was very juicy and yummy.  I didn't think it was juicy.  He really seemed to enjoy it though.  He scarfed the first half in less than a minute, I swear.  I did enjoy the clams and mussels.  The lemongrass curry sauce that it was soaked in and the sesame grilled baguette slices that came with it was very good.  The clams and mussels didn't smell or taste ocean-y; It was very clean tasting, if that makes sense.  That part is mainly why this dish was so yummy!  I expected more from the salmon carpaccio though, thus taking away one star from my rating.  It was a smoked loch salmon and was served under a few sprouts, creme fraiche (with a touch of horseradish perhaps?), and triangle crisps.  I dunno what this dish needed to wow me, but I felt like it was missing something.  Maybe a hint of lemon?  Something.  The busboy seemed a bit toooo enthusiastic about cleaning the table.  Maybe they needed to get us out of there to prep for the NYE crowd but it pissed me off that he asked if he can take my plate away when I was only half-way through everything.  Give me some time to chill here!  I need to finish my wine anyway.    We were in and out, surprisingly, cause I like to linger and take the whole experience in.  Maybe it was the busboy who hurried me.    I wish the lunch menu was a little more extensive.  My fiancee thought it was a little pricey for lunch.  The ho-hum waitress needs a red bull.     I would give this place a three and a half if I could.  Overall, it was a slightly better-than-ok experience.

V5dipYFRtJYThwHnSUEPHQ.review_text: We had a loverly dinner at Butterfly. We chose the dinner special, good price and good food.  The fish was superb. The  service was wonderful. And it was great to look out the window and see  the Celbrity Millenium Cruise ship! And did I mention lovely music.  They had a great duo playing  jazz.  What a wonderful evening. I highly recommend this restaurant.

WexQJ1aXBNondXzytypq9Q.review_text: A perfect restaurant. The wait staff are truly the best around. The food, just wonderful!

1lh8p7T6j6GRJiQ00CzXEA.review_text: My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate our Valentines day at Butterfly. The first thing I noticed when we drove around to find parking is that there was no Valet. I was very disappointed since most fine dining restaurants have valet. It saves a lot of time and is very convenient. We were late 15 minutes because of the lack of a valet service.  As soon as we stepped in I fell in love with the place.  The restaurant is situated right on the San Francisco Bay and every window had a beautiful view of the ocean. The setting and ambiance was very romantic. Dim lighting and trendy and modern interior design set the mood.   Our reservations were set for 8 p.m., however we were late about 15 minutes. The maître d' told us to sit at the bar and assured us that we would be called when a table became available. Anywho, while at the bar my boyfriend and I were eyeing an empty table right next to the window. We were hoping that it would be our table since no one was being seated there. After about 15 minutes at the bar and 1 full glass of merlot and 1 jack and coke for my boyfriend we were still not seated. A much older couple arrived at the bar and were seated next to us. Much to my surprise they were quickly seated at a window table.   Anyways, there was a pre-set menu for Valentines Day. For appetizers we had :  - a bloody mary oyster shooter gremolata - seasame grilled scallop  escebeche with avocado puree and a wonton cracker - kobe beef puff and foire gras puffs with sweet soy reduction - vietnamese caramalized sweet shrimp on sugar cane  There are no complaints about the appetizers. However, I did not enjoy the bloody mary osyter shooter. I'm not a big fan of the cocktail.  For the first course I had the lemon risotto, seared diver scallop smoked salmon roe with a duo of oranges. My boyfriend had the House smoked Scottish Salmon and strawberry salad rolls with a spicy and ginger garlic sauce. I was very pleased with my scallop dish. It was cooked very well and it was very moist. The oranges complimented the scallop. However, the scottish salmon and strawberry salad rolls that my boyfriend had ordered were disgusting. The rolls had to much rice noodle with a small portion of salmon and strawberries.  For the entree I ordered the wood oven roasted rack of lamb and my boyfriend had the lobster skillet pot pie. Overall, we were both pleased with our entrees but I was a little upset about the portion of lamb I was given. My "rack of lamb" was a piece of lamb with 4 small pieces of meat surrounding the plate.  The lamb was also a bit dry for me. I ordered my lamb "rare" and I think they cooked it to be about " medium well."  For dessert we had assorted sweet and fruits. The portion size was very small but it was delicious.  Overall, I was very pleased with the food here. Their selection of Asian fusion food is much more appealing and tastier than Straits. I would have have given this place 5 stars if it had not been for the rude service while waiting for our table and the lack of valet.

Vdy219QdKTKmzTSy12FVnw.review_text: "dancing in the moonlight  everybody's feeling warm and bright  its such a fine and natural sight  everybody's dancing in the moonlight"  Although I had just played in two back-to-back soccer games, and had a fairly large strawberry on my upper thigh (for those who don't know, a strawberry=a rash like bruise, where skin  has been removed after hitting gravel and grass and its pink/red.) I wanted to still celebrate the second night of my birthday weekend dammit, so I turned faster then the blink of an eye from cleats and shorts to a skirt and stilettos ("wonder woman, wonder woman!") and promenaded with my three amigos over to the embarcadero and went to Butterfly.   It was a warm, wonderful night, and the host quickly seated us at a comfortable window side booth not just "next" to the water but literally above it (like those houses built on stilts to allow the water to flow underneath.) We had candles placed in front of us and the shine from the sliver of a silver moon.    The four of us shared 2 orders of their "famous" salmon and strawberry rolls (it was a strawberry kind of day.)  We called this appetizer "yummy unique." We also had the Caesar salad, which was lightly dressed and had just enough tang to it.   My amigas ordered the clams and the mussels and also the duck.  They all liked it, no complaints (one friend thought there was not enough spice or seasoning to the shellfish, the others disagreed.)  I had the Shanghai noodles. It was like a concoction of the typical tasty Vietnamese garlic noodles, but with a delightful sprinkle of fresh tomatoes, so it does not feel as heavy or greasy!   We lingered for a bit, when our waitress, who was so accommodating and beautiful, suggested (while keeping our indoor table!) we all have a champagne toast outside on their tiny little deck/dock (where it is very dark, like a spot where the kitchen staff might have a smoke break.)   Once outside, with a glass of champagne in hand, my girlfriends serenaded me with the "dancing in the moonlight song" and we did in fact do just that. Unfortunately, my boo-boo on my thigh began to bleed, and I went inside to use the ladies room. The host (manager?)noticed, and he quickly sat me down at the bar, retrieved his "tool box" and dosed a bandaged with antiseptic and carefully placed it on, and taped it up. He also gave me extra bandages and some Tylenol so that I could continue with my night!   This was not only a wonderful birthday night, but a night that will live as one of my most memorable in San Francisco.

GE64PcKGFWo_W49PWPb1JQ.review_text: The last time we were here, we used a gift certificate that we got courtesy of the restaurant (read my review).  This time, we were back for part 2 - using the other gift certificate we got.  We kept drinks dry that night & got an Acai berry lemonade & a Pomegranate spritz.  Both drinks were really good but the spritz was a little too sweet.  For appetizers we got the Kalua pig with butter lettuce cups & it was SO good!  The pork was juicy & super tender; the portion was big; & the hoi'sin/BBQ dipping sauce was just the right combination of sweet & spicy.  We also go the Sweet miso roasted oysters which were small.  The texture of the oysters was way off since they were cooked to he**.  There was no miso flavor or saffron flavor.  It was cool that they were served in a skillet of hot rocks.  I got the Roasted chicken roulade mainly so I could say the word "roo-laad."  The meat was moist but the skin was wicked crispy.  Beware of the piece of chili on top which was uber spicy but complemented the very Asian tasting sauce.  On the side, there was a thing of rice topped with coddled eggs that I broke & mixed.  I am not scared of Salmonella @ all & it tasted really good.  the boyfriend got the Macadamia & bleu cheese crusted filet mignon & he thought it was too bleu cheese'y...actually he said it was the worst steak he ever had.  Now, I tried the steak & it was quite bleu cheese'y (I don't like stink cheeses) but it was cooked nicely to medium rare.  However, the garnish was just meh.  While the meal hasn't been a total success, the dessert was what tipped the scale; & not in a good way.  We got the Lychee shaved ice which was super sweet.  The brandy cherries were too brandy.  The coconut & almond tofu didn't have any coconut flavor.  There wasn't any ginger candy.  And a huge chunk of ice was sitting there in the martini glass; unshaved.  It really was the worst dessert we've ever had.  Our meal this time came out to be about $95.00 after tax.  We felt bad that the gift certificate was able to cover more than the entire tab so we left a bigger than usual tip.  Now that we've used both gift certificates, I don't know if we'll make the special trip over again; especially since public transportation can be such a nightmare.  With that said...I am starting to feel a slight sense of attachment.

71xft7yal2vgslNVtSPECw.review_text: I originally visited Butterfly when they were located on Mission St. I enjoyed a delicious and delicate gnocchi that I still remember 12 years later. When they moved to Embarcadero, I invited my friends and husband, and it it has been a favorite spot ever since.

pR1zHvaWixOCPTEsbsRiRg.review_text: Their hamburgers are the best. I did not believe that review until I actually ate one. When my mouth caves a burger I go the Butterfly to get one. Sorry In and Out but I am spoiled!  They also have wonderful bar bites and such. Anything you order is fresh and tasty! My friend invited me to a party hosted by Yelp and they were very catering! I will be back again.

DOZ9inLpd04Ic0Mm1d9fbw.review_text: FINALLY.  I finally had a good Dine About Town 2009 experience.    Initially, I actually had low expectations for this place because of what I have heard and also from the other Yelp reviews.  However, after trying this place today, I would definitely come back.  This place is nice -- beautiful view, modern asian decor, and good service.    They started us off with complimentary edamame drizzled with sesame oil and sesame seeds.  Those complimentary starters are always appreciated even if its small.  We ordered Fried Calamari (w/ watercress?), Salmon Carpaccio with Wasabi Crackers for the appetizers.  They both come in generous portions.  The Fried Calamari is pretty standard, nothing too different here.  The Salmon Carpaccio was delicious.  Great balance of flavors when you spread the wasabi cream spread over the cracker and layer it with a slice of salmon.  On to the entrees... We both ordered the Young Turmeric Grilled Snapper.  It is served with rice noodles, and what I can only guess as chinese lettuce?  The method of consumption is Vietnamese and is similar to how one would eat eggrolls.  First you take a piece of lettuce, put on some   herb, green onions, carmelized onions.  Next, place on a little of the rice noodle.  Finally, place the little pieces of the snapper on it, drizzle on some of the fish sauce-based dipping sauce, and wrap it up.  Even though I've grown up on Vietnamese cuisine my whole life, this dish brought a refreshing different taste than I am used to.  Its nice that its grilled so its not too oily.    For dessert, we had the creme brulee and the chocolate torte with coffee ice cream.  The creme brulee was one of the best Ive had.  Usually I dont like how watery the custard is.  As my friend puts it, the watery ones remind her of egg tarts from Chinatown.  The creme brulee they serve at Butterfly has a thicker more solid texture.  The caramel top wasnt too thick or sweet.  Good balance.  Could use a little more fruit though, but I am guessing their non-DAT option probably has more.  The chocolate torte was nice and warm when it came out.  Although I am not much of a chocolate cake person, the coffee ice cream help balance out the richness.    Definitely would come again.  What a steal for DAT's $21.95 lunch.

y91OvASs_NRY7jfq6htngw.review_text: Our service during happy hour was simply amazing. To be fair, it wasn't very crowded, but we definitely enjoyed the ambiance - live music! - and certainly the service. My girlfriend wasn't satisfied with her drink (Arnold Daly iced tea - good but not the strongest) and asked our waiter (Porter, who is completely awesome) to switch it out with another drink (lycheetini) - he was more than happy to oblige and was actually glad she had spoken up rather than drink something she wasn't happy with! I had the strawberry sidecar and a kumquat margarita and both were excellent. For food we had the steak fries - a small portion but definitely delicious. Crispy on the outside and soft inside, they were some of the best fries I've had in a while. The Tabasco remoulade was good, a little rich and mayonnaise-y, but good overall. We also had the calamari, which was really nice - crispy and delicious - and the Kalua pig lettuce wraps were delicious with the butter lettuce. We caught an error in pricing on our receipt and our waiter couldn't have been nicer.  All in all, a really, really good experience. We'll definitely be back here for happy hour!

lYqxQuUONPux4oENsdek5A.review_text: Had lunch here before going onto our Alcatraz tour. This may become my favorite restaurant. Loved the view, the food & the service!

LEho8AFSA-H6M9SekKxb_A.review_text: I'm never going back again.  I came here for lunch with a bunch of my friends, expecting at least decent service for a restaurant that ask for 18% gratuity.  What I got was a waitress who took 3 hours to serve our meal, a need for several requests for our first glass of water, 2 entrees that were never cooked with the rest, and a bill TOSSED at our table.  And the food?  Not worth the price.  It was mediocre.  But then again, why would that matter?  The food took forever to get to our table.  I almost starved to death!  Never again.....

WIvkzH6KLrxcGSkx6UsmDg.review_text: I came with my family for lunch to celebrate my college graduation and I have to say the staff was very accommodating. We were seated where I had requested with a good view of the pier. I was excited to try this place because it had great reviews and was featured on Check Please.  In regards to the food, I have to say I was sadly unimpressed. for snacking they brought cold edamames (I think)  in what I think was sesame seed oil and it tasted horrible! They weren't out of the shell so they had to be taken out and it wasn't worth the effort. No one at my table enjoyed it. I ordered a chicken dish that came with noodles. The chicken was bland and the noodles weren't that great. No one else really cared for their food either but we were all so hungry we had to eat something. My husband had a burger which was probably the only decent dish. My son had the chicken nugget meal with veggies and he didn't like it either so he just ate the veggies. The chicken was basically chicken tenders cut up to bit size and I guess cooked on a griddle. Very plain.   For dessert I can't even tell you what we got, It was that memorable. They did bring my son a scoop of ice cream and a cookie which he dropped and they immediately brought out another one no question. We did have decent drinks that got my sister, friend and I feeling right which saved the lunch.  All in all overall we made the most of the experience. I had a great time with family, got a little tipsy, laughed our butt of and DID receive good service from the waitstaff. I just wished that the food matched the rest of my experience.

FcpQ7gqHJrW6Fy1QgEgaPQ.review_text: Food: Fantastic! My favorites were the appetizers and desserts. The calamari is a must. The best I've had in the Bay Area. So much so that we ordered two or three (lost counts of apps). Also, their bread pudding is great--warm and deliciouso.   We had a plethora of appetizers and drinks so I don't think we had entrees so I can't attest to their main course meals but this place is great considering it's in a touristy Wharf area.  Service: Awesome! He was a great server and very knowledgeable of the food. I think he started there went it first opened as Butterfly.  Ambiance: Very inviting. It's right by the water so it's a nice scenery.

2W-wcD6A-HZIC5CgPRZIFw.review_text: Contrary to a lot of the other reviews, I must say that I had a great dinner here this past weekend. I brought the fam, including my sister and her finance (can be a tough crowd sometimes), for a nice early dinner.  We were seated quickly after our whole party arrived. The decor is really bright, covered in primary colors, and the view of the Bay is nice to see when you have guests from out of town. Our food was all very good. I had an heirloom tomato risotto and the others all had various meat dishes, including a chicken with Marscapone cheese and crab, which the boy said was delicious.  The service was extremely friendly and very quick with drink replenishments, clearing plates, etc. After our desserts, the chef came by to say hello and ask us how everything was. I love when chefs do that - its so personal and considerate. Overall, great experience.

nLuNaKK2mXrqBM2M9ikXMg.review_text: I went to Butterfly with two friends on Chinese New Year day. The food was worth a 4 star but the service was extremely bad.   We especially reserved the window seat so that we could enjoy the water view. When we arrived, the host brought us to this extra big round table that could fit five and oddly located in the center of the restaurant. When I asked how come my reservation was not honored, she simply told me this table could have a better view of the water. The restaurant was not even crowded on a Monday afternoon. I doubt if they reserved a table for me by the window because none was available.   The host probably noticed my unwillingness when I was checking out the menu, she then put me in a small table by the window in the back which I could only notice the bar and where they stored utensils. No one came to our table until a long while later to get the drinks. Our server was very rude. She was bad mouthing with the host beside our table. After a long wait, another server brought us soy bean, water, and our drinks. I asked if I can place the order and our server was called back.   When I placed the order for me and my friends, our server asked in a very rough tone for me to be specific which order is for whom. We ordered two Dine About Town lunch and a Curry Chicken noodle. The appetizer Smoke Salmon was the best. Salmon was seasoned very well and they gave a good portion. The crackers were good and tasty with salmon and cream cheese. The duck spring roll was a good difference from the typical kind of spring roll. BEWARE of the dressing because it had mustard and I would like it better with sweet and sour sauce.   The curry chicken noodle was tasty and so was their chicken salad club sandwich. The grilled snapper with noodle was a steal and a lot of fun. Grilled Snapper was accompanied with caramelized onion, jalapeno and other spices. The meal came with vermicelli, lettuce, and vietnamese fish sauce that you can create your own lettuce wrap. For dessert, we ordered the cream brulee and it was so-so.   Although it was my only time at Butterfly, I could tell from all the dishes their signature favor is their special salt. I would come back for the food again, but I would advice for people who wanted to celebrate a special occasion maybe choose another place because of the service.

jJpFE3IpkXeZiDkWes8u0g.review_text: I've been there once for their happy hour, and just went back few nights ago for dinner. It was kind of disappointing. My hubby got the Chicken clay pot and I had the Five Spice Braised Beef Short Rib. The Chicken clay pot was not that bad, but the one I got was a disappointment. The appetizer, Duck Confit Spring Rolls, was good though, it has a spicy kick in the dipping sauce. The dessert, Banana Lumpia Rolls were also good, but it was too sweet for me. Seriously, I haven't had much luck with Asian Fusion type of food, and this one is just added to my list.

zSBlIa7ulGJ23TQLDfMHLg.review_text: I've been here twice and it's becoming one of my favorite restaurants.    Things I highly recommend:   Kalua Pork and Butter Lettuce Cups Wood Roasted Peking Duck  Five Spice Braised English Short Ribs  Wok Seared Shanghai Garlic Noodles  (i had this the first time. i don't remember it being bad)  All of their drinks are really good too

9TjdaN6tflxuTjrxqjPeLQ.review_text: Excellent food, beautiful view, and owner - Rob- is a gem!!!

XwNzc5koX7DcIe_aMdvKWQ.review_text: Beautiful ambiance and mellow feel.  Hospitable and kind staff. Made sure we were ok and taken care of. Chef, manager, host, and servers all came up to us and made small, nice conversation. Cool people.  Food was ok.   APPS: Sonoma Libery Duck Confit Spring Rolls were decent, just like your average deep fried spring rolls, nothing really special. Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups were simple but yummy.  COCKTAILS: Lycheetini was way too strong. Friend had to ask for more syrup to make it sweeter.  ENTREES: I had the Five Spice Braised Angus English Short Rib. Meat was INCREDIBLY tender but the sauce was too salty and didn't enjoy the rice cakes with them. I would have preferred steamed rice. 4 people from my party wanted the Free Range Rocky Jr. Chicken Clay Pot but they 'just ran out' when we began to order so that totally changed the mood. Supposedly, they ran out of chicken but it was only 7:00 pm on a Saturday and the restaurant wasn't EVEN close to a full house. Friends who resorted to the Loco Moco Burger thought it was dry and needed gravy, and would've preferred going to Ono's Hawaiian BBQ instead. Friends who ordered the Sesame Crusted Ahi Bros. Yellowfin Tuna thought it was alright, as well.  DESSERT: Best part! I had the Chocolate Chip & Almond Cookies which came with a creme brulee and chilled Vietnamese coffee. The coffee came with a chocolate straw, the creme brulee was delicous, and the cookies were perfect. Friend got the Banana Lumpia Rolls (aka Turon in Tagalog), they seemed a little soggy since they were covered in ice cream. Other friends got Banana Bread Pudding and they seemed to enjoy it a lot. Another friend got the Warm Chocolate Torte, pretty simple, just like any other.  Overall, good experience. Kind of disappointing that half of my party couldn't get the clay pot that they wanted. Food was decent but excellent service, for sure! MIGHT come back here, MIGHT NOT.

YUP31CYNNuQe-7KR1bCMiA.review_text: this reveiw is about the club venue at night i really like this place when its a club venue something about here i really like the soutside where the smoking area is, is really nice take a smoke and just stare out into the water, also they have really good music there when i was there

HjFejwki0-Clyp3VVdIOQQ.review_text: I came here with a friend today to use a Living Social coupon that was expiring.  I actually tried coming yesterday, but it was completely booked for the night and even the bar was packed.  So I pretty much came right when it opened today, and they let us sit at a large communal table.  I think everyone at my table used Living Social, lol.    To start, they served us edamame on the house.  It was seasoned with salt, sesame oil,and some other spices.  Mmm, it was a great way to start our meal.   As an appetizer, we got the crispy fried calamari, which was drizzled with a creamy ranch-like sauce.  It was yummy and I recommend it.  We also got the Lycheetini and the Ruby Rose.  Both drinks were sweet and refreshing.  For our entrees, I got the Grilled Kalbi Skirt Steak "Surf and Turf" and my friend got the Hoisin Glazed Rack of Baby Back Pork Ribs.  The steak dish is amazing! In addition to 2 decently sized pieces of perfectly cooked and flavored steak (I got it medium rare),you get 2 pieces of shrimp, 2 jumbo scallops, baby bok choy, and some tasty crispy egg noodles.  This dish deserves 5 stars.  The ribs, on the other hand, were too salty and a bit dry and hard.  I think my mom makes better rib... and that's not a compliment.  I would give the ribs 2 stars, and it's a hefty $29.  Finally, the service was phenomenal.  They refilled our water multiple times and would check up on us to make sure that we were ok.  In summary, with the exception of the ribs, I think the food and service here is wonderful.  It is fairly pricey though, even with the Living Social coupon.  I would return here, but probably only for a special occasion, or if they have another coupon.

-34NV3A5a5gcL-s8UH4KbA.review_text: Sad to have missed the Kobe beef burgers!   The new space is fabulous! This is a perfect spot for a romantic evening. Floor to ceiling windows on the bay facing wall with low light emanating from uni inspired ceiling lamps and a lovely curved bar. I really love the plushness of the booths. The back wall's mirror mosaic with a wood framed LCD was a nice touch. I want that to be my living room... like now.   Have had dinner there in the past and while I always enjoyed eating there, I will definitely enjoy spending time there :)

DXvKH3KBsNCW9DXA3Xu1qA.review_text: My wife and I, along with three out of town guests arrived for a late lunch this past weekend after The America's Cup" races.  We were greeting and seated as requested by a a delightful hostess.  Our waiter Danny appeared after an appropriate amount of time and handed us menus and arranged for our water.  It was obvious at that time he was stressed, and in a hurry. He later returned to take our order.  As we were trying to decide and were asking him questions, he suddenly bolted saying abruptly "I'll be back".  When he finally came back he continued to show his impatience as he took our orders.  When the bill arrived we paid and provided him a 14% tip.  In hindsight it should have been less.  Danny picked up the check only to return within moments to say "was there a problem?"  We indicated he must have had too many tables to cover that day.  His response was "I told you I had five tables' meals coming out!"  If he did no one at our table heard him.  Frankly, everything would have been fine if he would have shown a little patience, and apologized for his curtness.  We weren't in any hurry and would have understood that  things were a bit crazy for him at that time.    Perhaps Danny thought we were all tourists.  If that was the case, his behavior is even more inexcusable.  On the bright side, the setting, the food, the bartender, the hostess and the busboy were great.

vj0aKnemOa2BTi27Ood_5g.review_text: It was alright.  Food wasn't particularly delicious but good, seasonal cocktails were a little underwhelming, and the service was solid.

0mkHqKMyWOsxoywkBM8Grg.review_text: Went here for their dine about town special lunch. I have to say I am impressed at their servings sizes. Some places trim their servings down to minuscule sizes for dine about town, which hardly makes them the deal one hopes them to be. Here however we had a good sampling of three of their courses while feeling that they were not skimping on the portions.   We had the firecracker calamari to start, which was good, although not spectacular. I like it when calamari is crispy and not chewy, and this place got one for two, because it wasn't that crispy. The spicy mayo sauce was good, as was the diced veggies that surrounded it. All in all probably above average calamari, I'd say B+   Also had the Duck Spring Rolls. Let me tell you, we didn't expect them to be deep fried. Usually I understand spring rolls to *usually* refer to "fresh" rather than the deep fried. Deep fried usually comes under the moniker, "Imperial Rolls" or "Egg Rolls", so I was a bit taken aback. Still they were OK, although not as generous a portion as the calamari (just four small pieces and the wicked mustard dip).   For the main course we had the garlic noodles as one, and the snapper as another.   The snapper was good, although I always find it a pain to make my own wraps as things get all over the place. All you single folks out there, be advised I wouldn't recommend trying to juggle a lettuce wrap concoction on a first date, stick to the easier to eat items!   The garlic noodles were OK, they were obviously the token vegetarian option. In retrospect it was probably a waste of an item choice to go with such a low budget item, but alas, what is done is done.   Dessert was good, the chocolate lava cake was good enough to rival Roy's and the creme brulle was not too bad and a fair sized portion (although they over burnt the top portion and I prefer a bit more natural vanilla flavor to the creme).

PSJ9LP_U3jF5K9avjvPPRw.review_text: The food was above average and priced OK. However, it took over 30 minutes to be served our main course, then we had only 10-15 minutes to finish our desserts, as the after-hours entertainment crowd starting to slowly enter into the place.  The $5 bottle beers were a pleasant surprise.

tMDdvtDNkTCKMZ_Odb_VQw.review_text: I went here for the second time yesterday evening for dinner and had a great experience. I made a reservation a day earlier requesting a table with a waterfront view and I was completely pleased. Following the other Yelpers, I would agree that it is not the best view of the Bay since you will see yourself in-between two piers, but nevertheless it is a very peaceful view. Additionally, I highly recommend coming here by the end afternoon when there is still sunlight. It is very relaxing after work/school with good company.  The ambiance is really nice! The decor is a mixture of modern art (metal/steel) and natural materials (wood/bamboo). Many people gathered around the full bar for the happy hour. Lounge jazz music. It gives somewhat a moderate noise level. Fun and lively, but still allows conversation if you get a good table (you can request it upon reservation).  I would disagree with other reviews underating the food quality. I was pretty impressed with the flavors and presentation. After seating we were promptly served water and edamame. We started with (virgin) lycheetinis and an order of the duck confiti spring rolls. Very nicely fried and served with a wasabi based sauce. Some might find it spicy, but if you like wasabi you will be fine.  For entrees, I ordered the braised short ribs with jasmine rice cakes and pumpkin pesto. The meat was perfectly cooked and literally melted when cutting with the knife, and the jasmine rice cake worked like a rice cracker, adding a surprising crunchiness as a combination to the meat. The waiter brought the beef broth separately and added to the plate upon serving. It was warm and you can hear the meat sizzling whilst pouring it. Very cool experience. My companion ordered the vegetarian bento box - good combination of tempura, tofu and a bowl of curry. We both really enjoyed our orders.  After the dinner, we were full and no room for dessert. But I would definitely come back to try those.  Bottom line: great decor, lively yet relaxing ambiance, very attentive service (A++), good (but not excellent view), great Asian fusion food!

_pA9ZexeidZMm9WdrLbXrA.review_text: My boyfriend and I ended up here really tired and wind-swept after an evening visit to Alcatraz. We chose it because it was the closest place to the pier and it turned out to be a great choice. I was a little worried that it looked like a nice place and we were looking our usual scruffy selves but that didn't turn out to be a problem.   The service was fine and friendly enough.  It was about 9pm on Saturday evening and it was fairly quiet in there. The complimentary edamame beans were gorgeous (they don't sound it, I know!), as was my Cherry Blossom cocktail -cherry vodka, lemon, brandied cherry.  Food-wise as a veggie I had very few options so went with the vegetarian bento box (the ONLY veggie entree) and was so glad I did.  I'm fairly greedy and when it arrived I didn't think it would be enough to fill me up but it did without leaving me feeling over-stuffed.  It contained veggie tempura, seared rice noodle, tofu and bok choy stir fry and sweet potato curry which was gorgeous but would have been better with more 'stuff' and less sauce.  It was all lovely but if I had one suggestion it would be that it needed rice to soak up some of the sauces. Nothing too spicy, just really, really tasty.   If they had more veggie options and maybe added rice to the bento box I'd have considered giving them a five.  If I was a local I'd definitely be returning although couldnt go too often as would soon get tired of the same meal every time!

YlYgRIV6zPhuN_c338G5UQ.review_text: Went here for happy hour The bar has an amazing view The bartenders are skilled mixologist , fun friendly atmosphere  The spring rolls and mussels generous portions and delicious Cant wait to go back

HIRhSnS_DdcvSvwe5KChdA.review_text: My husband and I went to Butterfly before our tour of Alcatraz.  It was conveniently located close to the Alcatraz pier.  Overall, it wasn't bad.  I had the wok seared garlic noodles with shaking beef.  It was very heavy, and it was only supposed to be an appetizer!  I thought $19 was a little too expensive for what it was.  I had a tasty nonalcoholic pomegranate spritzer, which was good, but was around $8, which I thought was expensive considering there wasn't any alcohol in it.  My husband enjoyed his meal more than I did.  He had a Caesar salad with the shaking beef, which was also expensive.  We ended up spending close to $60 for lunch for the two entrees, one nonalcoholic drink, and one cocktail.  It was overpriced for the quality, but was conveniently located.

CrzrNJq2Nq247riq9ImguA.review_text: Short version: Pretty darn good.  Long version: Came with a small business group on a Monday night. The place was deserted so we had a great service. Great views of the bay at night and a nice atmosphere. A few items: - Ruby Rose (or something like that) cocktail sounds much better than it actually is, disappointing, it's to acidic (not just personal taste, others agreed with me). - My sirloin with blue cheese and macademia nuts was fantastic. Those who had the rib (yes, rib, not ribS as the menu says) enjoyed their meal, although it was small. - Ginger and Apple Cobbler = mind blowing-ly awesome! Soooo good.

nOk5ERmYcHlJ9jff994VBQ.review_text: I was impressed by everything but the food.  Location, decor, ambiance, female DJ, cocktails, appetizers, and after dinner coffee ALL deserve high marks.  The entrees were just average.  I ordered the braised short ribs.....thinking i was going to get an american cut short rib thats fork tender and braised for at least 8 hours plus......little did i know they were talking about a Korean BBQ Short Rib with some salty seasonings.....I should've saw that one comming from a mile away.. :D  Anyhow....stick with Any and all apps as well as the cocktails and you should be fine.  Definitely not kid friendly, but we went early enough were we didnt bother the young and hip 20somethings and their singles scene.....  Great date place.....and props to the asian american chef for a good effort.....perhaps a menu upgrade and a few more kitchen hands to help you out to speed up the service???  Just a suggestion...

-TvEPQo2e-0fHfQLKMTcwQ.review_text: I cannot say enough good things about butterfly!  My boyfriend and I came for dinner tonight and just decided to do a bunch of apps because they all looked amazing and the entrees were a little pricey- which by the way wasn't the case, I saw that steak come out and it looked like it was worth every cent!  We had the shrimp papaya salad, pulled pork, garlic noodles w/ shrimp and steak (our favorite!) and calamari.  The food was all perfect but the service was by far the best service we've had in a while. Christine was our server and the sweetest ever! She was fun to talk to, had great suggestions and was just overall wonderful :) It was also really nice that rob the owner/chef? came through to make sure we loved everything and that the manager was actually on the floor helping the rest of the staff. Just a great night And get the banana bread pudding! Thanks Christine!

xkwOeuBaeBzVOAW3fOVpVw.review_text: I booked a table for 4 people, then I got stuck in a bad traffic in PaloAlto and did not think I could make it on time. I called the restaurant twice half an hour before the reservation time to ask for chance of holding the table or maybe canceling but no one answered.   Then around reservation time I received a phone call from them, I told them I tried to reach them couple times earlier but no one answered and canceled the reservation. 20minutes later, a young lady from Butterfly called me, literally yelled at me, and accused me of not showing up like a criminal. She rudely told me that she will charge $300 as a fine for me "canceling reservation the last minute" ($75/each), from the credit card info I put in during reservation, with extremely AGGRESSIVE tone. Then I asked her about the restaurant policy of canceling reservation to understand more about the situation. All she said was "what you are exactly doing right now is violating the restaurant policy", and she kept repeating that more then 10 times then hung up.   I had to call my credit card company immediately to report unauthorized charge, such a fraud. Still can not believe they want to rob $300 - THREE HUNDRED DOLLARS (A WHOLE LOT especially for NOTHING)  from my pocket bc they did not answer my phone canceling table, very shocked.    A CAUTION EVERYONE!!!!! Everyone should be careful with them when you reserve the table there, dont let them trick you to rob your money, because once they can, its way too expensive.   It was the worst of worst service experience I have ever received from such "fine-dining" restaurant. I am not sure if this has the best chef, location or is the best spot in town or not, what happened to me say it all about customer service, about how they value us, with very LOW respect.   Obviously, I will never never and ever put my feet in here. Ofcourse, my friends too!

PWt0MYTZPAJcpBua8jjDrQ.review_text: Went on a Saturday on a lark.   Con - Advertised as a waterfront bar...needless to say it is waterfront but the view is of the pier and warehouses...not to appealing.  Dark interior.  A bit pricey.  Menu could use some work.  Wait staff is very good.  Pro -  great seafood...try the mussels.  Large plates...appetizers are enough for an entree.  Kid friendly - chef came out and was holding one the customers baby.

LBv9_JP7mGoR6zewxy2SVg.review_text: Went here for New Years brunch. The restaurant sits on the water, with great views of the Bay (an indoor view -so not cold and windy). Got the kobe burger which was good ($14). Jess got the snapper sandwich ($12)which wasn't  very good. Will definitely return again for the awesome views.

VlEMX7rRuyeYWcOcXvqsKQ.review_text: I saw this restaurant on my way to Alcatraz. I wasn't particularly hungry but I had some time to spare before my tour so I decided to stop in. I figured, I could have a cup of coffee or a small snack while I waited and watch the pier. I walked in and asked for a table. The restaurant itself was empty but after stopping to think a little bit the hostess decided to tell me that if I just wanted a coffee there were several places nearby that I could one. I couldn't believe that she would say that to a paying customer, but apparently I wasn't a valuable enough customer for her. I walked out immediately after such a rude response. Definitely won't be trying this place and if you want good customer service I suggest you try one of the other wonderful restaurants that San Francisco offers.

MO8Oloxlghq2cg-76f1yWA.review_text: We enjoyed our first visit to Butterfly last night, and will definitely be back. The ambiance is perfect: modern chic, with bits of whimsy (sea urchin-looking chandeliers) and Asian details. Our party of 5 had THE best table in the house, literally feet away from the water. Service was excellent, and the manager came by to say hello.   Food was excellent. Even the free edamame was perfectly seasoned! Calamari was fresh-tasting, and the Kalua pork in lettuce cups was a treat, as well. My filet mignon was cooked to perfe4ction and served with some very tasty sides and sauces.   Cocktails were unique and compared to other places in the tourist zone, they were not outrageously priced. A little light on the alcohol however.  The only VERY MINOR negative I can share is that it can be rather noisy. Our awesome-view corner table was so large that conversation was difficult at times. But with so much good food keeping your mouth full, who needs to talk?  :-)

GVMgrUlf4wubGDfpqX2sZQ.review_text: The food was delicious, fish was freshest, presentation was gorgeous, and service was outstanding.  Chef Rob brought us Wild Mushroom Cappucino, the most spectacular soup I've ever eaten.  I will go back again and again.  Among 7 of us, we tried almost every dish on the menu.  Every plate was a winner.

z-B2V4bwwA828smEjRVMcQ.review_text: Great, high quality food with nice presentation and creative flavor combinations.  Their chicken wings are to die for, I highly recommend them.  Service is also excellent...very courteous, attentive and friendly (at least the waiters I've had the last 3 times were).  It's on the Embarcadero so the restaurant looks out onto the water - quite nice.  It's a little dark and the food is a bit pricey but I would say it's a perfect date restaurant for a good overall experience as it has a nice ambiance to it.  Oh, and the menu is kind of small but if you're not picky, every dish/appetizer is worth trying.  Very tasty food.

xoUB7E4AO8zr5WRYN1SOdg.review_text: I ate at Butterfly for the first time this past Sunday and was really impressed with their presentation and food quality. It's a cute little Asian fusion restaurant, tastefully decorated and right on the water on Embarcadero. There is seating along the far wall with gorgeous views of the bay. My girlfriends and I were lucky enough to snag one of the booths facing the water. For $18 per person, we got to try their Dine About Town brunch menu which included an appetizer and entrée. I loved the mushroom cappuccino soup! Not only was the presentation adorable (large cappuccino cup with white foam and sprinkles) but it tasted heavenly! For my entrée, I had the shaking beef cob salad. Again, I was  very impressed. Not many fusion places get the shaking beef right. I find that a lot of places serve it dry and over-cooked or way too greasy. Butterfly served it up just right! Each bite was tender and juicy and NO GREASE!! They were also very generous with the portions! I look forward to checking out their regular dinner menu soon!

1cHMe44Z8RG_Skrr6jQb3g.review_text: What a delight. At Butterfly our plates were touched by an Angel, literally! Our server, Angel, was phenomenal in making us feel welcome, and with a professional demeanor he helped us navigate through the menu mentioning best seller items and his favorites.  Allergic to soy, any Asian cuisine presents its challenges, but I have learned to scan the menu for deadly and safe choices. Luckily the fusion aspect of the concept kept it easy, and Butterfly offered (soy free) salmon and strawberry spring roll that tasted just like that - spring :0) The rolls were light, and the rice paper moistened just right. The Kalua Pig served up with butter lettuce and Hoisin sauce was delicious too. Of course I had to indulge without the Hoisin, but the choice of butter lettuce over the traditional iceberg deserves mention. It works!  Predicting that I would be full of food at this point, I made an entree out of the Seafood minestrone which turned out to be a smart move. Even though the dish is listed as a starter, the generous bowl was more than me' tummy could handle. Especially since I also had to leave room to fork into Eric's irresistible pick; the crab stuffed chicken. Wow, was that delicious! Think Cordon Bleau (breaded pan-fried chicken, stuffed with ham and cheese), and you're headed in the right direction. Yet, this version is full of crab and much lighter than the traditional Cordon. Additionally, the accompanying spinach and balsamic vinaigrette prevents it from becoming overwhelming. So, yeah, that explains what really happened, why Eric's plate wound up clean while I still had soup left over (thanks for putting up with it Tiger :-).  At this point I don't know how we fitted the apple and ginger cobbler, á la mode, but we went right through it. The coffee and espresso was good too.  The only less than applaudable experience was the sumojito, but I've read so many good reviews on it that I'm sure mine was the odd mishap. The drink came out full of mint leaves, and what a waste of mint that could have sent my buds into heaven, had the leaves just been muddled. Oh well, maybe next time.  Somewhere between the sweet hostess, the phenomenal view, our Angel, the good food, and the stylish decor I definitely became a fan. Ergo, may this Butterfly last.

eHNP_CtIPjp_pZeh6DtukA.review_text: Stir fried Gnocchi. Definitely interesting! Four stuffed/fried zucchini flowers and a curry style pan fried gnocchi with cheese and a sauce. Adorned with edible flowers, the presentation was great. Open space with views of the water closer to Pier 39.

5LUfQF-uhCLEeJdv1q01ig.review_text: Great atmosphere and view of the bay.  Had the vegetarian Bento box and it was yummy.  Friend had the Loco Moco Burger and it was to die for.  You also have to try the mushroom soup.  It is made like you're having a latte, however it is a soup. YUM.

ke-qJKKJnU85021Zk27Mng.review_text: 9 of us came in and had a few minutes to have a drink before seeing Alcatraz ... We ordered quickly a round of drinks .. which took almost 15 minutes to get even though they were not busy.. the bartender had the personality mix or Castro and Elmer Fudd .. which was an odd combination.. in other words he didnt seem happy and not a friendly sort you expect being a bartender.. the drinks were finally served and we had to drink them in haste to make the boat.. we get the bill and the waiter conveniently added gratuity to our drink bill of around $18 bucks.. 9 drinks ... $120.00 .. wow .. never again.. due to many levels ..

0j3tlj2GGMdTL0Zg5cmTUw.review_text: Our friends made a reservation here because she loves their drinks and their happy hour menu. We were seated by the water, which was awesome, but the heavy rain sort of kill the beauty of it.   Their non-alcoholic cocktails are indeed delightful. I also love their interior modern decor, but sadly, their customer service is not serving up to the hype and their food does not taste as nice as how the restaurant looks.   Oyster Shooter (bloody mary sauce, garlic and cilantro gremolata). Even for $1, the oyster didn't excite any taste buds. It was not fresh at all.   Duck Confit Spring Rolls was not a good dish either. I think their mustard and honey dipping sauce did not complement the Chinese egg rolls. The sauce was too spicy, it made all of us almost choke to death.   Fire Fried Calamari was another disappointment. The outer shell was not crispy as the calamari was half soaked in tabasco remoulade sauce. Besides, the fired fried calamari was not "fire" hot inside and it did not taste fresh either.   The only thing that stood out from our dinner that night was the grilled-12-oz-New York steak, which we had to wait for almost 40 minutes after we ordered and finished all the appetizers. The steak was ordered medium rare, but came out as much well done as it could be. However, the steak was surprisingly flavorful.

vTgEQSP4BzD-xtnEo1hjkw.review_text: Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cup were so refreshing and flavorful the perfect start off to a meal. We followed it up with Macadamia and Blue Cheese Crusted Filet Mignon, which was perfectly cooked with Whipped Potatoes, Mushroom Jus de Veau, Asparagus and Carrots, Port Wine Demi Glace. I just don't really care for Blue Cheese so I ordered Roasted "Peking" Duck!                                                                                                                                                                                            Roasted Duck Breast, Duck Confit and Scallion Crépe, Pineapple and Kumquat, Hoisin Sauce cooked to the Chefs preference.  And for desert Banana Lumpia Rolls: WarmBanana'sFostertopped with Coconut Ice Cream!  We were the last to leave the establishment and the Chef was darling enough to come out and join us for a drink.   An absolutely lovely over all experience with the food company and of course the ocean view! Of course I will be back.

U9ciIH-fVumyWXMVBMFWVg.review_text: One of the best burgers and steak fries I've ever had! Got take out at the bar and it was juicy, tasteful and wonderful!

Hrowr7l4XrLP_Gkgwo82Rw.review_text: Great Food. Reasonable Prices. My husband and I shared 4 appetizers,  one dessert  and one non-alcoholic beverage  for total cost of $77 including tax and tip - and had leftovers to bring home.  Excellent Service. Depending on where you are sitting it can be noisier than we prefer for conversation but 5L30 seating on edge of room was fine.

u_WZavcZZXyBT4TOrzgwuA.review_text: This place is over priced. You pay too much for not a lot of flavor.   The bad... Calamari needed salt and pepper in the batter. The sauce added flavor but the calamari should stand on its own.  The pork lettuce cups. The sauce and the pork was too heavy for the delicate lettuce you. Wrapped it in.  I tasted the short rib and it lacked flavor.   My shrimp added to the garlic noodles were plentiful but they didn't have enough flavor. Oddly enough, there were random pieces of red and green pepper in the noodles. They didn't really fit with the dish as they didn't add texture or a lot of flavor.  No beer on tap and the bottles were too $$$  The good... The trailer park sliders were unbelievable! The toast of the bread was perfect.the beef was perfectly cooked and the cheese, oh the cheese was melty goodness!  The skillet cookie with mint ice cream tasted like a thin mint cookie. Delish!  The staff was attentive until the end of the night when I could barely get attention to refill my water.   Would I go back? For the sliders and cookie, yes but it's not worth the long walk to get there from my office for the prices you pay to eat there.

3IVpfFP65ZBOso6im188SQ.review_text: Came here for happy hour and it did not disappoint! The place is gorgeous-- high ceilings and simple, classy decor. It is also located along the pier so the view overlooking the ocean was great!  We had: Kalua pig with butter lettuce wraps: like nothing I had ever tried before, good. Duck confit spring rolls: the dipping sauce had a nice kick to it. Chili chicken wings: my favorite.  Viet pork and scallion meatballs: interesting flavor, but not for me. Sesame coated edamame: edamame is always good in my book.  Prices were very reasonable and the server was very attentive toward our large party. I would recommend this to people who are into that "Asian fusion" type of flavor.

dh2s6ay5WCHO83zw3jVehA.review_text: I went there for lunch with my friends on July 4th (last year, hmm sorry a belated review), and we got seated next to the window where we got glimpses of an acrobatic air show beyond the pier while eating yummy dishes: snapper, steak, sashimi salad and loco-moco burger. The snapper was juicy and tender, the salad was refreshing, and the loco-moco is some concoction. It will fall apart on you as soon as your teeth sink in, but it's definitely special. I would come here again. The interior is modern, open with high sealing and modern without being snobby.

AnzRwYsQ_rfcOe0EIs8oFw.review_text: We had the calamari appetizer. Tasty and beautiful presentation. Just wanted more of it! The sizzling red snapper had the best smokey flavor from the cast iron skillet full of scallions greens and wonderful-ness. The atmosphere here is just lovely - day or night

fjEukWsKu9k8E0gJuRwf7w.review_text: came here for lunch..dine about town! i had the mushroom truffle soup...OMG the besttttttttttt ever! It was so creamy and looked like a cappuccino..i ordered the shakin beef salad..n i usually dont like beef bc it was med-well down.but it was good..the salad was nicely dressed..and the egg..it was sorta poached, but still..i dont do raw eggs like that.but it was good.. prosciutto was not too salty and worked well with the green. i have to say i finished all my food. the other dishes looked great as well, especially the snapper and the lettuce wrap..   though their menu isn't huge, the service was nice. I don't think it's toally AMAZING to go there a million times, but it's just a nice chill place to have lunch.

3fWRgb3uOpnU_GS_dbnEGw.review_text: Treated royally because friend knows the chef.  Sadly, even with the special attention from the chef and staff, the cuisine totally missed the mark.  Food was salty, overcooked and the rice was burnt and dry.  Our meal was on the house and I still don't have anything positive to say about the food.    Great location, wonderful decor, and incredible service.  I'd consider the space for a private party, drinks, and maybe dessert.

0FUp_4coC1MxoyujWhDdIA.review_text: I came here for an Xmas Party that was hosted here.  Great location: It's along the Embarcadero, and because it's just a few blocks from the oh-so-touristy Pier 39, there's plenty of parking on the streets and by garages. After dinner, you can walk down by the bay.   Mediocre food: I'm a huge fan of the kobe sliders here. But, the rest of the food here like the wok seared shanghai garlic noodles and duck confit spring rolls weren't all that creative or tasty.   Above-Average Ambiance: Layout is interesting. There's two sides of this restaurant, and it's worth the walk to go outside onto the terrace to see the view of the bay and *ahem*...Oakland. Haters gonna hate. Dark and ambient lighting makes it difficult to see what your dish is or make out the person 20 feet away from you.  Drinks: Surprisingly, pack a good punch. The ladies working the bar were very cute.

BLmRIoETvx6ZiegiIWh0tw.review_text: "Well since we're at the embarcadero we have 2 choices for food," I said as we began walking north along the bay. "We have the 'Food is okay but you totally pay for the view' restaurants and we have the 'Food is great but this place is a hole and questionably hygienic' restaurant. Which do you prefer tonight?"  "I think tonight we could go for a great view and good food," my friend responded.   The food is overpriced for the quality and portions. I had the salmon with risotto, which was well prepared (they obliged my request for medium rare) but a bit on the salty side. Flavors mingled well together, but again, it wasn't anything special. My friend had the seared ahi which was dreadfully overcooked past the point of rare. So sad, though well flavored and beautifully presented.  Food is probably 2 stars, maybe 3 at best.  Now the decor is quite special. It has that chic, nouveau rich feel incorporated with the pan asian influences. The view of the bay out the restaurant's enormous windows was spectacular as we knew it would be at Pier 33. But alas, it was not worth the markup on mediocre food.  Service was lacking and inattentive. I should have known it was a bad sign when we could walk right in for a table at 6:45 (even if it was a Monday night). But again, you're paying for the view, as I knew we would be.  Great location to catch the tourists who wander from Pier 39 and a great place for them to go and get a taste of the city, but it was mediocre to okay at best. Probably will not be coming back.
