FKyQWTe-yrm1tRTRveurkA.review_text: First of all, I would like to say this is going to be a lonnnnnng review...considering how much food we chowed down on...alright so here goes (my fingers are quivering in scared anticipation of how hard they're going to have to work....)  We had the following food:  Carpaccio - This was okay...for some reason I thought carpaccio was the smoked ham thing...!? I guess i should stop drinking so much :)  Overall it was okay, the cream sauce was nice though, not too heavy...  Shortribs - soooo good...the meat was tender and straight fell off the bone!  Hangar Grilled Ponzu Steak w. potatoes au gratin - this was my actual entree, and shit it was GOOOD...the meat was done very well and wasn't overcooked like normal restaurants do when i say "MEDIUM" YES!!!  Seafood Crepe Special - looked pretty damn good and the crepe was good, but nothing screaming out at me..  Half a Dozen Oysters - small oysters but a very clean, fresh taste, and the hot sauce they gave you with it really put a nice kick in it, pretty good  Chicken Claypot - meh.  but the chicken was tender...if i want claypot probably would go to the crazy chinatown cafe thats all crapped out and dirty... hahaha  Poke Appetizer Field Greens Salad - These two were pretty standard, nothing too much to rave about!  Banana Lumpia with Coconut Ice Cream - I don't know how I feel about this one, only because I've had the same dessert @ PF Chang's (I KNOW...) and compared to that one this one fell a little short.  The ice cream was all melted by the time it came out because the banana lumpia was so hot, and they should have cut it in half cuz those suckers were HOT....I like PF Chang's version better - They have real coconut in the ice cream and everything is cut up in half and the ice cream is separated so it doesnt MELT!  Still good, but hey, a foodie ALWAYS has gripes. Ignore me. haha  Drinks:  Lychee Martini Pom Cosmo Ruby and Red  Jazzy Dragon  Cherry Blossom - ALL THEIR DRINKS WERE SOOOOO GOOD.  These are their cocktail specials, and I drank and loved every single one.  DYL for life? :)   Overall, I'm ready to return here for the filet mignon and more drinks! Nice location, view was kinda overrated but whatever... a nice ambiance, very nice server, and pretty much easy on the wallet (considering the amount of food we had!)  WOOT! 4 staaaars

tgPYeR0AWCHXdinazQjZyA.review_text: In SF for the week but not on biz this time, with wife and 4 boys doing the tourist thing. Arrived early for Alcatraz night cruise so we ducked into Butterfly for a quick bite to hold the kids over until after the cruise. What an unexpected surprise!  Huge banquette table on the water, tasty happy hour tapas-like specials that our moderately adventurous eaters tried and enjoyed, and mom and dad got to enjoy the specialty vodka cocktail in a hip and lively setting. Porter,our waiter, took it from good to great with quick, friendly attentive service, mindful of the clock as we nipped one more cocktail before leaving in time for the boat.  Sometimes your best meals are the ones not planned.

M_v6XSNkDOnPDQTzxrpXOQ.review_text: I first went to Butterfly when it was still located on Mission and Duboce. This was my first time at this waterfront location, having just seen it featured on Check Please Bay Area.   The space is beautiful - tall ceilings, excellent views; however the booth seats by the window face the restaurant and not the water. Odd. There was a normal table at the window that does face the water, but apparently that was specifically reserved by someone who probably knew about that table.   There was plenty on the menu that sounded delicious. Seeing the appetizers pass by, I realized the orders were huge. Luckily, my waitress told me I could order a small portion from the bar menu...and at happy hour prices! The Fire Fried Calamari were wonderful, especially with the ponzu marinated cucumbers. I also tried the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups which were OK. I still like my mom's home-cooked version better. For entrees, we had the Crispy Fried Thai Snapper and the Roasted Duck. I debated getting the Cowboy Steak, but there was no way I could eat 22 oz of meat. I'll have to save that for next time. The fried fish was a sight - the entire fish curled up and fried, filled with kimchee and served over chow fun and chinese sausage. The duck was tender and cooked perfectly.   For dessert, I had to try the Banana Bread Pudding and it was quickly devoured once it arrived on our table. All in all, I was totally satisfied with my meal and would definitely come back to try some of the other items on the menu.

4P8EDoVkcSLJs2XP5DJIPg.review_text: Sometimes unusual circumstances lead you to a great find. From the outside this place looked modern and kinda like a club or something so we weren't so sure of the quality of their "Asian fusion" cuisine after looking through the menu posted outside, but what the heck... I needed to pee!   We were seated at a comfortable booth next to the glass windows looking over the pier. (.... hmmm.. not bad)   Then a small dish of Edamame smothered with Sesame oil and back & white sesame seeds was brought to our table. (Ohhh yum! Maybe this place is good)   Then I saw a huge, thick cut steak on a sizzling plate passing by... (Darn, that looked good!)   By the time we saw the stake, we've already ordered fire fried calamari, garlic seared clam & mussels and classic Caesar salad. I have never had fried calamari like this one before. Lightly fried and crispy, and not oily. Combination of the ponzu, thinly sliced cucumber, cilantro and the fried calamari were just perfect.   Soup of the mussels and clam dish was coconut based with hint of curry and it went perfectly with the seafood. Don't forget to soak your bread into the soup! It was very tasty dish.   Service was good too. The guy kept refilling my soda as I was very thirsty after watching a Giants' game in the hot sun. I was extra crispy just like their fire fried calamari :) After all, this place turned out to be a great place to sit down, looking over the pier, have some cocktails over yummy Asian fusion dishes.

Bgkp-mQtDnyzucofROqakQ.review_text: I really agreed with the concept of an Asian fusion theme. I thought that the honey glaze with what seemed to be a sweet teriyaki hint was received well. My wife didnt care for the real blue cheese crumbles, but, I agreed with the layers of taste, and the homage to the authentic buffalo via hanoi feel to the homage. The Calamari had a chipolte dressing that really worked. I thought that eating it would be easier with chopsticks, and, then I realized they were always on the table, I am a dufus. The view was impeccable. I had a living social coupon/dealio, and they welcomed it knowingly. Alcohol and food cost me 10 dollars with tip on my wife's birthday, bravo!

Y2dCUA5yPos9CrGX_kMaSg.review_text: I was suspect of Butterfly given its location along Embarcadero by the cruise ship piers.  But I was pleasantly surprised by the diverse selections and combinations of flavors that work (thanks chef Robert Lam!).  Kahlua pork with butter lettuce leaves, fried fish stuffed with kimchee on chow fun, and kalbi clay pot were very savory.  Service was attentive and not overbearing.

5mtQdkBNA_cHmeHJqu1Vug.review_text: Learned of Butterfly through TV show called Check Please. Planned my dining experience based on show's recommendation of 3 course $27 menu. First glance of the menu left me feeling I could order anything on it. And then I realized that the 3 course menu described on Check Please, was curiously missing.  Upon further inquiry, learned that you needed to 'ask' for it.  Hmm.  Really?  Less than transparent.  Strike 1.  Calamari batter was bland, lettuce-cup pork was good, Hangar Steak ok but the 'rice cakes' that came with it were gummy and unappetizing.  Strike 2.  The Lo Mein was Strike 3.  First, it was not obvious that adding the Shaking Beef to the Lo Mein increased the price an additional $9.  Okay, not a big deal - assuming the protein you add is fresh, but the Shaking Beef was gamy.  At first, I thought perhaps it was a flavoring in the sauce.  My guest also experienced the same thing but we were being polite and didn't comment.  My friend spent the evening in the loo and I woke up nauseous the next morning which lasted the better part of the next day.

1RjKBxtHGYEbY1cngdbn3A.review_text: Visited for happy hour before a tour of Alcatraz. Good happy hour specials on both food and drinks. The food was good and the view was excellent. I checked out the full menu while sitting at the bar and I'm not sure i would have enjoyed a full meal. Great before our tour!

BVCSugR_ttcg45lSK_4AVg.review_text: I LOVE COMING HERE!  Here's what we usually get:  Everything shared! Ahi Tuna Tempura Roll - the THAI black sticky rice is delicious!!  / Caramelized Shrimp & Green Papaya Salad - by far the best green papaya salad for me / Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups - so good! the butter lettuce were super amazingly fresh! / Duck Confit Spring Rolls - this is my old standby - I always get this.  Main: Macadamia & Blue Cheese Crusted Filot Mignon - the only thing I have to say about this is I wish I had ordered it ALL for me. =)  Chef and wait staff are very friendly.

qu5jGZlh4n1r2-Fempkvvw.review_text: Yo! It's like they fused asian food with awesome! Even the vegetables were delicious and I fucking hate those things!

O48Zm9ZWPxG4yiouRtdOeQ.review_text: I was very pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Its in the middle of the tourist district, right next to the Alcatraz Ferry. My mom was in town and loves Alcatraz so we wanted to grab a quick bite. I ordered the Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herbs. And my mouth is still watering. It was a little too fancy shmance for a lunch but the views were lovely. The snapper sandwich was also great. The only fair option was the pork cups. good but not great. Definitely want to try it again.

786qFXEeAIWsGgUEPkHEYA.review_text: FIRST OFF LET ME START BY SAYING I WAS ON VACATION,  My cousin and I seen this place on the way to the night alcatraz tour and wanted to go for kobe beef burgers ... sadly when we went they only had them during lunch hours.   HOWEVER porter our waiter was super fun, attentive and helpful I couldnt have asked for a better server he will definitely entertain you when he heard i was from L.A. he was like really ? you so dont have the attitude lol which i didnt know whether that was a compliment or not lol ..   So we ordered : the calamari ( a friend that lives in sf said they had the best ) it was THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD !!we ended up with two orders  HUMONGOUS FRIES ! - HUGE ! KAHLUA PORK WRAPS:) - SOOO GOOD IF YOU LIKE PULLED PORK  Noodles too !  THEIR EDAMAME ( SOY BEANS) were the best i have ever had ! Omg .... i had two orders and took some home and i have had lots to decide from with my eating experience .....   the lycheetinis were to die for they really had a bite ! ;) soooo yummy our bill was 80$ but for two drinks lots of food i had a good time hell i was on vacation thats what you do spend money   I cant wait to go back and eat some more :)  even though we got there at 9pm after the tour the view was still incredible considering the rain was clearing up .... it was definitely a st patricks wknd i will never forget !

vCBvs2ZRnjy0me8bD8YzfQ.review_text: I've been here a few times for both brunch and lunch and I'm finally writing a review. My last visit was before a tour of Alcatraz with family and friends. Yes, it was only noon but we decided to have cocktails. I ordered the Kiwi cucumber gimlet which is made with Hendricks cucumber infused gin. Highly recommended. So good, that I had to duplicate the cocktail at home, successfully I might add. Tip: use English cucumber. We enjoyed the fried calamari appetizer with spicy aioli. For lunch I ordered the American Kobe beef hamburger with bacon jam and imported cheese (can't recall type) with steak fries. I don't think, I could be wrong, the beef is imported from Japan but it was delicious nonetheless. My wife had the garlic noodles which she has had on several occasions. They must be good. After a second round of drinks we had to skip dessert (try banana lumpia I've had before. delicious) and catch the ferry to the Rock. Great service, nice ambiance and view. Definitely recommend.

nAbwXrHgJx5BshmOcCRCZQ.review_text: I'm rounding-up my 4.5 stars to a 5star - great value when coupled with a restaurant.com coupon! Scene: on water, nice bar, comfy window seating and view of water life i.e. random seals and ducks Service: Absolutely 1st class!  We took our time reviewing the menu, and felt very welcomed and relaxed.  Thomas, our waiter, has great taste in wine (and he knows it)!  He recommended a smooth and light Pinot Noir at $12 a glass - slid down my throat like velvet!  I'd go back just to learn more from him about their wine list!   Food:   - Ribs: sucking meat off a bone in public makes me feel primitive (I'm a reformed vegetarian); however, sucking meat off a bone dripping with amazing BBQ sauce makes me feel like I'm home.    Lil cashew crunch with the pineapple garnish made me feel like I was at my Caribbean vacation home (ok, if I had a vacay home). - Whole Fried Fish: savory fish curled head to toe, then stuffed with spicy kimchee (which I usually hate, but loved the combo) laid out over a bed of soft -sweet and spicy soba noodles - garnished with some chewy chorizo.  As a whole, the flavor and texture combo was ON POINT!  Beautiful presentation! $32 - Calamari - It tasted tempura inspired (dipping sauce anyway) - interesting take on fried calamari! - Duck Spring Rolls (not so good) - I really would remove the .5 star for these alone - I hated that we ordered these at the request of the birthday girl, and she wouldn't eat them after the first bite.  I usually send stuff like that back, but the leechi martini and awesome waiter had me distracted. - Garden Salad - tasted pretty delicate with the roasted beets and light dressing - maybe because the manchego was at the bottom of the plate, but I like that, because I could control the amount of fat I could spread on my butt that night - ya know.   Drink: again, wine was perfect.  I also enjoyed the leechi martini with Belevedere.  I'm  a Grey Goose Martini - extra dry - up - with olives type of gal, but every once in a while I go fruity - lil sweet for my palate but TASTY! Dessert: Banana Foster - I never eat this much fried food but this wasn't my pick.  I know we should have got the bread pudding or chocolate torte instead, but next time!   What I loved the ABSOLUTE MOST is that I saved a ton of money on this meal using my restaurant.com coupon - which I bought for $8 - and the $100 min for the $50 coupon actually COVERED drinks!  I'll be back next month - and maybe a month after that - for the fish, ribs, salad and drinks! Yup, I'm a fan!

wkklbFK50TTkd1GJXXAntA.review_text: The bf and I went for Happy Hour after they were featured on Check Please, Bay Area.  Definitely not the cheapest HH out there, we spent $70, but I'd go back.  We had oysters, calamari, Kobe beef sliders.  Most of the dishes were done well.

2_1YJigBXrIll1fjVDS30w.review_text: Such an amazing restaurant! Food is delicious. Came here on a Sunday night. Make sure to call to make a reservation, this place fills up quick. Service here is great. We were greeted inches we walked in and was seated right away. We tried a couple of their hot appetizer dishes, I wanted to try a little bit if everything. We had the calamari, duck confit spring rolls, and garlic noodles animal style and for dessert we had the banana lumpia rolls with vanilla ice cream. Everything tasted fantastic. This restaurant is pricey so be prepared to pay a pretty penny for your meal.

ipoJv9uuT3WgjeVozKUx8A.review_text: We had a LivingSocial deal for this place, so we decided to give it a try.  After reviewing the menu, we ordered all the appetizers on the menu instead of ordering entrees.  LITERALLY.  We ordered every single one.  Our favorites? The garlic noodles, chicken wings, and kalua lettuce cups.  All very good!!!  Everyone keeps complaining about the view, ummm...it's FINE.  If you want a better one, you can take a romantic stroll on the embarcadero after walking off the delicious food served here.  I had the pomegranate tea concoction, which wasn't great, but the lychee martini was delish! Good service too.  5 stars for the lovely live classical Christmas music!  There's nothing better than live musicians playing during a lovely dinner with friends!

rkgknAjN2O7DGu-lLCrovw.review_text: I have always really enjoyed eating at Butterfly. It's tasty and creative Asian fusion, and if you get there before sunset, you can get a beautiful view of the water off the pier. It is also one of those restaurants you can hit up for multiple purposes: it's intimate and trendy and you could just as easily invite a date, a client or out-of-town guests.  I recommend the Pan Fried Shanghai Noodles and the Fire Fried Shrimp for apps. And in fact, I have been known to order only appetizers tappas-style for my whole meal because there are so many enticing options. Not that the entrée options aren't wonderful as well. The cocktail menu is fun too, and their edamame with sesame seeds is my favorite in the city.  Lastly, I have to give them a callout for their service. Remembering that there is a large parking lot across the street, I called them recently when I was in a bind and needed to find last-minute parking for a very large trailer (a very difficult task in San Francisco). Despite the fact that I was not making a reservation, Heather went outside and searched the lot for the lot name, phone number and attendee while I waited on the phone. That's great customer service. Thanks Butterfly!

HNSXc4Mjz9Dg4fAWiUDwcg.review_text: I went there about two weeks ago to have dinner with my brother, we ordered two drinks, two entrees and one appetizer. Of course the spending over $100 as for dinner at that restaurant, but to my surprise, the restaurant added 20% for the tips on bill. We are only two persons not over 6 persons, what about the 20% automatically add tips? I didn't wanna argue with the waiter to ruin the mood, so I paid.   I won't back to this restaurant and the food is not that good either.

HHxkcUhkbDc7Gaw8PK70lA.review_text: Checked this place after i saw "check please" but i'm not sure if there review were bias... the favors were there but it's nothing i haven't had in the pass from other places...the views of the bay are nice,maybe it was a off night..i'll come back and try it again...

4kZfCsKnD4NZkIaZ0uojqw.review_text: Sorry, I just don't see what is so great about this place and I do know how much work a restaurant is so I am not saying this lightly. We wanted to like it and it sounded great, plus I really like Asian fusion food.  To begin with the room is dark and depressing, very utilitarian, no soul. Our server was very sweet but either completely inexperienced or should just be in a different line of work. My St Germaine elderberry martini was simply bad, just a shot of vodka with a splash of liquor, incorrect proportions and no mixing. Try Skates in Berkeley if you want to taste how it should be done, no comparison. The food was the most disappointing. We started with chicken wings that were good but not spectacular. Then came the Mirin glazed black cod, very disappointing and at a cost of $28.  It was a bland soupy sloppy dish, nothing like the glazed cod you get at some of the good Chinese restaurants. I ordered garlic noodles with kalua pig and was really looking forward to this dish. The noodles were fine, but the pork was probably added at the end and was barely warm. Basically we spent over $100 for chicken wings and some garlic noodles. We skipped desert. It's just another expensive, mediocre restaurant with a nice view.

vBKsaJgxwyQLxkNQXXBvRA.review_text: I love this place. Absolutely. Always.   It's perfect for friends, for a date, for your parents, I've even hosted a bachelorette brunch there! The service staff is friendly, attentive and can offer useful suggestions about the menu. The ambiance inside is clean, classy and elegantly understated. The prices are affordable, especially for Happy Hour. And most importantly, the food is amazing. The least impressive is the calamari and when your deep fried dishes are the least appealing you know you have a great menu on your hands. My personal go-to's are the sliders, the kahlua pig and the molten chocolate cake.  I have not a single bad thing to say about Butterfly and HIGHLY recommend it for ANY occasion.

kv9Vg5FbJiFgcNQ_FOJ2Ng.review_text: 3.5  Came here for Happy Hour so the place was crackin' and we barely found a seat.  Good thing someone was leaving the bar area and we quickly swooped!   Despite the busyness, good service.  They still took our order even though it was past the happy hour.   Good cocktails!  Don't remember what we got... but had to hang out outside to get some air since we felt like it hit us.    On to the food, calamari good but Kalua pork was ok.  I guess it just wasn't my thing.    This place has nice view.  Food is so-so, but good happy hour spot.

0ENyKZB_Z1O4dDzHiv-uqQ.review_text: I'd like to know what happened to this place?  It seems like ever since they moved to this location on The Embarcadero, the quality of their food has moved also...SOUTH.    When they were located on Mission in a much smaller space, the food was actually pretty good.  But at this location, the food is barely edible.  The service isn't the greatest either.

iqyZM9N3wDZppU2lIX-n7A.review_text: Disappointed!!! I went here almost a month ago w/ a group of 15 close friends to celebrate a milestone for a girlfriend of mine. The food was okay, thought it would be better. After spending close to $1,000 in food & drinks we were the last table to leave. Little did I know...I left my wallet w/ $400 cash in it. I called the next day & they said don't worry it's in the safe you can pick it up when it's convenient for you. I get there the next day & my wallet is emptied out. I spoke w/ the Manager John who till this day has NOT called me back!!! He said he'll get to the bottom of it. I asked if there's camera's etc. he said sometimes they work, sometimes they don't. What a joke. He also said he really trust his employee's & night crew & offered me a gift card!!! ABSOLUTELY NOT! I work so hard for my money & this business clearly doesn't care. So unfortunate, but they just lost 15 customers & their family & friends! Next time Butterfly management....FOLLOW THROUGH! Not very professional at all

xvKvpxSSgiCIqjm7H3qPXQ.review_text: My friend Dolly and I really enjoyed our dinner at Butterfly tonight.  I hope you get our server, PORTER, he was fabulous--service was attentive, he has a great personality and a sense of humor.  He kept us entertained & the evening was festive.    Everything was delicious: Starter:  Salmon & strawberry rolls - yum Entrees:  Crab stuffed crispy chicken--lots of crab & really crispy and a large portion. Tomba tuna--so much going on with this dish--lots of little surprises on the plate, calamari black sticky rice, shrimp stuffed mushrooms, peppers, avocado. Desserts:  banana bread pudding & chocolate molten cake.  Both with ice cream!

vM6XjusAMrKhrcH0jbsBxg.review_text: Price a little too high but other than that, They're foods really good. Edmame, Ribs, and cocktails awesome

z72bj7TDPCi0Sovmsm4KOw.review_text: Made reservations here for Sunday around 11:45.  The place was busy- but not crowded.  The decor is modern and there is a large bar to sit at.  We had a couple drinks at the bar before the rest of our party arrived.  I had the passion fruit drink- really yummy and then I had the cucumber kiwi gimlet- I really did not enjoy that at all.  It was way too sour for my taste.  My husband had something with bourbon or whisky in it- i forget.  Once seated we ordered the duck confit spring rolls.  These were really good.  I liked the sauce that was served with them- all the flavors worked really well together.  They also brought out a small thing of edaname which was tasty.   For our meals we had the loco moco and the grilled snapper.  The grilled snapper was my favorite- it was a nice light meal. It came as almost lettuce wraps with noodles.  The loco moco was a large and heavy dish- but very good.  The only reason I gave this place 3 stars instead of 4 was the service.  Like i mentioned before the place was not busy- yet it took probably 10 minutes to have a server come to us..another 10-15 for water!  We asked for seperate checks and then he brought the check all put together.  Again, not a huge deal.  Also the place was freezing, they were not sitting people outside because it was too cold but yet they had the doors wide open and some windows.  I had to wearr my sweater, jacket, and scarf the whole time through dinner.

R54qNnHAqYLT93G3erxKZg.review_text: Very nicely decorated restaurant. We ordered the short ribs ( ok just like slowed cooked beef) a whole fried fish ( that was good) and the banana bread ( the best best).  Was a nice splurge but if you want a lot of good for your money go to china town.  Went more for the experience.

-fHgrt4ussZxM6SdwtHVtw.review_text: We squeezed  a group of eight into a fun booth section, with a water view.  Loved the garlic noodles & fantastic cocktails!

Bm0ASL6b3_fsiHYZ3jBW5Q.review_text: I was here at the same birthday party as lovetoeat a. :) I can't comment on pricing since we were guests, but as a guest I must say this was a lovely location aside from the $15-$25 parking fees at the nearby lots. The food was great and service pretty good as well, and all in all a fun time was had!  Appetizers: edamame, duck confit spring rolls, calamari, kalua pig with butter lettuce cups. The edamame was about as dressed up as I can imagine edamame being. The duck confit spring rolls were nifty once I learned to stay clear of the spicy mustard sauce (lesson learned: read the menu). The kalua pig lettuce cups were great, but the real winner, the calamari, was DELISH. I could eat an entire meal of just that calamari. Had I not been there celebrating someone's 80th birthday, I would have licked that plate clean. It was meaty, it was salty-sweet with garlic/sesame/soy sauce goodness, and well, it was fried.   Lunch: I had the "shaking beef" cobb salad which was decent. I think this dish is definitely more western than Asian-inspired. I was expecting the latter, and was disappointed. I had a few bites of the snapper which filled me with order-envy. I also sampled the pan fried noodles, but there was also something distinctly... western about them.  Servers sometimes forgot our orders for sodas but in their defense we were a large party, and they were extremely patient and professional with our nagging seniors so kudos to them.

ewl04mv6iPX6cKDUEtHEYQ.review_text: First time here, food was excellent , drinks are awesome and the service first class. Will definitely be back!!!

1dGqnlSqG6VHc4tZ3X7edQ.review_text: This is a trendy place close to Pier 33 for the Alcatraz cruises. We were actually looking for street food, but didn't have time before our Alcatraz tour so we stopped in here.  The menu was creative and the hostess and watiress were able to accomodate us with a full lunch in less than 30 minutes.  The prices were a little high ($17 for a spam sandwich!), but not too high that it was OK since we were kinda stuck.   I had the Vietnamese fried fish sandwich (bahn-mi style) - good flavors, but the roll was a little too bready for my tastes. My husbad got the wing appetizer which was a little small, but had a good sweet-hot chilli sauce. You get cold edamame tossed with sesame seeds and Himalayan sea salt as your table munchies and they were tasty.   I don't know if there was anything about our meal that would drive me to choose this place again over other places, but our experience was pleasant and the food was fast and tasty.

DLsrlcMlCXYpTElqJ856-A.review_text: I went here aroud lunch time to grab something quick to eat before my Alcatraz trip. I was kind of iffy about going here because it looked a bit pricey.  When I got inside and looked at the menu it wasn't as bad as I thought. But, they didn't have much choices on the menu on the take out side. My friend and I ordered the clam chowder and a chocolate chip walnut cookie. The clam chowder was actually really good..it was freshly made with corn, potatos, clams, and BACON..yumO! The soup itself wasn't too thick or too thin just right! It was pretty funny as I opened my container of soup I put my spoon inside and lifted up a big A55 sourdough roll! hahaha I was like WTH?! That sourdough roll was pretty darn good with the soup. As for the cookie....it was AITE!   I think I would come back here again just for the chowder :)

aIupIvnPUe3ressaYe704Q.review_text: Went to Butterfly on Saturday for lunch to celebrate Marg's bday. I went here once before, but it was for a friend's bday and they had closed the restaurant into a lounge/ club- no food. Drinks were yummy though! And of course beautiful view.   This time, Dine about Town!! =) $21.95 for a 3 course menu. Woot! Since there were four of us, we each ordered a different dish and shared everything. The apetizers were SOOOOOOOOOOO good!!! I liked the calamari and the duck spring roll. The salmon carpaccio was also really fresh and really good. Two of my friends don't eat raw- yay more food for me! haha =) The duck roll had a hint of wasabi inside but I wonder why they used that sauce for the spring rolls (it didn't compliment, tasted funky), but the spring rolls were yummy! The calamari wasn't like any other I've had- probably one of the best I've had!   For entree we shared the shaking beef cobb salad (my favorite!), the sandwich (it was huge!), smoked salmon salad on toasted bread (eh), and this breakfast/ brunch egg thing (too much egg, yuck!). Entree wasn't as yummy as their appetizer. I was dissapointed. For dessert we had the creme brule (it was ok) and warm chocolate torte with coffee ice cream. That was delicious! =) Mmmm!  All in all, I give Butterfly a 3.5-4 star. It was a pretty good experience over all but I would only go back for the appetizer and dessert, probably not for the entree. I was very stuffed after Lunch though, worth the $21.95/ person. Oh, the waiters are dumb! They kept on messing up our orders when it was really simple (one of everything on the DAT menu).  Don't forget to ask for your free edamame!

2bFJ_32zzj7w84-HAwc3lw.review_text: When I went to dine with some people at Butterfly, I thought I was in for a special treat because of the great location and the classy decor.  Perhaps it was the items that I ordered off the menu, or maybe they were just having an off-kilter day - but my reaction to the food was simply: "eh."  I kick-started off my somewhat hum-drum experience with the onion soup.  The plus - I love cheese.  And this thing was definitely a nirvana for dairy lovers.  The whole top of the soup was basically a thick slice of cheese, paired with a pretty good soup underneath.    I ordered the ahi tuna as my main entree, and it was just rather...bland.  The furikake didn't add as much flavor as I would have liked, and the pairing with the dark rice and citrus fruits didn't do it for me.  The only good thing was that it was tender.  Another dinner companion ordered the market fish - and it was basically a fish balled up and deep fried.  Apart from the fleeting entertainment value of picking at a balled up and deep-fried fish, the taste was so-so.  For the prices and the ambience, I thought there would be a lot more coming, and I was as disappointed as a kid with a pretty packaged Christmas present that turned out to be a pair of socks.  And not very fancy socks, either.

vCQYaTZI18PoyDIYilHiUg.review_text: This review is for the club (after hours) portion of butterfly. First of all they have the best bouncers i have ever met. We actually had a convo about asparagus. This never happens. At any rate, we were there for my gfs bro whom was throwing an event. We got in quick, inside was just a big room with a bar when you first enter. The place was pretty empty and the drinks were watered down. The crowed was mostly Asian and the music was ok.  But i would like to try out the restaurant.   Would i recommend this place?....ehhhh. My favorite thing about this place was the smoking area right by the water. Other than that there are so many other places id rather go.

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED (2 stars)  Disappointed. Read my novel below!!!!  Inventive idea for the food items, terrible service from the waiter, spent hard earnings on small portions, and left hungry. The only nice thing about the palce is that the SouChef/KitchenManager (some asian dude) uses his creativity to make the dishes (read my food descirption below) and he came out to talk to us when our waiter complete ignores us. He was kind enough to give us a description of our dish, how we liked it, are we okay, etc.   - FOOD, it was okay - PRICES, expensive and not worth it - SERVICE, waiter sucked but other kitchen staff were great - AMBIANCE, cute  Eat by obligation. Came here to use my livingsocial deal to spend $50 dollars worth of food. I don't know why I even bought that livingsocial deal. Let me tell, that deal wasn't even worth it, it either just covers a few appetizers. If we didnt have that voucher to use, the bill would have been around $100 and we left the place HUNGRY.  OUR SERVER SUCKED. We came on 6/20/12 around 7:45pm and was seated near the kitchen. We were given the menus and we starred at the menus for about 15 minutes already having an idea of what we wanted, menus closed and held in hand to give a hint "we are ready to order". Since we were by the kitchen we saw our server walk by us a gazillion times and kept saying to us "will be right there" and then finally came and took our drink and food order. And that's also when he decides to tell us about the specials. Shouldn't you tell us about the "specials" when you give us the menus so we can think about it. He dropped off two (small) glasses of water and shortly after appetizers. After our appetizers were done, our empty plates were just sitting on our table along side with our empty water. Nobody bothered to fill our drinks. I look around and EVERY table a bottle of water so i then asked "Can we get a refill on our water? And can we get a bottle of water like everybody else?" MUST WE ASK FOR SERVICE. Throughout dinner, he never bothered to swing by the table and see how we're doing and only came back to drop off the bill. FYI, other wait staff were the ones coming by and cleaning out table.  HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.  OYSTER SHOOTERS ($2 each) - We ordered two. Forgot to ask what kind of oyster it was. It was okay but prefer to eat the oyster by itself.  CALAMARI ($12) - very yummy. loved the presentation and paired will witht he sauce and veggies.  SOFT-SHELL CRABS ($18) - it was one of the specials. i knew in the back of my mind it is not going to be worth it. I WAS RIGHT. In my mind, this was worth maybe $6 bucks, not $18. the plate came out and it was pretty looking, it was two small soft shell crab cut in half (2 crabs/4 pieces) in some sauce and peaches. Was it good? the crab was kind of drenched in some saltiness that killed the taste of tasting the crab themselves.  ROASTED CHICKEN ROULADE ($22) - portions were kind of small. three pieces smaller then your palm of chicken roulade to your left and a small bowl of "something" to your right. chicken roulade was kind of on the salty side but the chicken meat was tender and packed with flavor. on the right the bowl of "something" had a poached egg, some green stuff, and some brown stuff ontop of broken rice. The broken rice tasted like coconut, they used coconut shavings or extracts to get that flavor. the pouched egg was cold and the brown stuff was fried chicken skin. It was interesting. I actually liked it more then the chicken roulade in a weird kind of way.  THAI SNAPPER ($37) - this was one of the specials. theh presentation was actually lovely. it's a fried whole fish and they bent the fish so when you unravel it there's noodles and vegetables. the fish itself was tasty BUT... way too many bones. every bite had like 3 bones. The experience of plucking bones out of your mouth just takes away from enjoying the taste of your fish.   Will I be back? NOPE.  Until the next review....

-eVlHbM2KRZQnBqfTXtDvw.review_text: Great experience from beginning to end.  After a challenging day at work, I was running about an hour late to meet the guys.  Out of breath, I rushed in to Butterfly and sank into my seat.  I was greeted by a beautiful view of the waterfront and  the modern decor and clean lines immediately inspired calm.  Then out of nowhere appears Tom, "Can I get you something to drink?"  Finally.  Someone asking to get ME something.  I started the evening with my go to Dirty Goose and just took a minute to catch up with everyone while I perused the reasonably priced HH menu.    7$ for kobe beef sliders, calamari, and steamed shrimp siu mai; $5 for Kennebec fries and garlic noodles.  4 of us shared 2 orders of each and everything was great.  The standout of the night was the garlic noodles--sweet, garlicky and very flavorful.  The Kennebec fries were of the steak variety, thickly cut with a side of tabasco remoulade,   The remoulade was weak, no hint of tabasco at all and was the disappointment of the night.  Fried calamari had the same side of remoulade but was inexplicably bolder and spicier.  Siu mai was excellent, a little on the greasy side doused with the chili oil but went perfectly with my refreshing Dirty Goose.  Kobe beef sliders were served Texas toast style and not with the expected slider buns, perfectly toasted and melted with Cabot cheese.    Great food, excellent setting and wonderful wait staff--I can't wait to go back to try the duck confit spring rolls and inhale more of those garlic noodles.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Restaurants along the piers seem to get extra love because of their gorgeous settings but Butterfly deserves it. Not only is it a great venue with great service but also it has very good Asian fusion food. I came by for a DAT lunch and the 2 courses were fantastic. Calamari was fried to nicely, lined-up beautifully on a narrow rectangular plate with a sauce. The Kalua pig lettuce wraps were refreshing yet richly flavorful. The fish entree was excellent as well, cooked perfectly. Seating is a little unorthodox to try to take advantage of the ocean view but very good place for long lunches.

J9HamWsxKorlPGUAXy-M9Q.review_text: An upscale Asian Fusion restaurant on the pier.  I'm not a big fan of the whole Asian Fusion genre and Butterfly didn't quite convince me that Asian Fusion is the greatest invention out there.  Maybe I grew up eating Asian food at cheaper price points which may explain why I grit my teeth looking at the prices for the same items although Butterfly presents it like a michelin star restaurant.  In addition, I found the kalua pig slightly salty along with their fish.  I do give them props for their duck confit spring rolls.  If you were to go here, please try the spring rolls!

Dj6VgyUQE6W6g-TcuXHvvQ.review_text: This place was a very pleasant surprise. Asian fusion is probably one of my favorite genres. Butterfly does a great job of combining flavors and offering some unique dishes that I have not experienced at other restaurants.    We generally try to avoid tourist trap restaurants that can be pricey for the quality of food you get. Because of its proximity to the touristy attractions we had low expectations. We had taken our kids to the Marine Center and were returning to Hotel Vitale. Everyone was starving and we really needed a break.  The menu looked great and we took a chance. I am glad we did.  The decor was attractive and luxurious. The staff was friendly and accommodating. They sat us at a table with a view but off to ourselves,  since we had small children with us this made me feel comfortable and better able to enjoy the experience. The wok seared Shanghai wok seared garlic noodles were delicious and great for the kids. The Kalua Pig, and the fried snapper sandwich were also fantastic. We also enjoyed a deliciously fresh rare ahi.  The bar also looked lively and well stocked, this is a place that I enjoyed with my children and it was apparent that I could enjoy it while on a date with my husband or with girlfriends for cocktails and appetizers.

AlkyPPgOxL3Emn-4Y6N5zw.review_text: I had the Mushroom Dip, the Au jus is quite salty, but I had it with the Snap Dragon, so it kind of mellowed it out. I sat on the back deck, great view of the water and Alcatraz, the birds were insane though. I will definitely be going back next time I'm up there.

3S2x4OCP5s_R739JRwpYdw.review_text: I'm not normally a huge fan of the restaurants on the Embarcadero.  They generally cater to tourists, which means they can charge large prices and serve mediocre food.  What made this visit special was our waiter, Porter.  He made us feel incredibly welcome, joked with us as we made our selections, and helped us select some of the best items on the menu.  We were not sure about desert, but he wouldn't hear about it - and somehow we ended up with a Creme Brulee.  Amazing night -- thanks Porter!

OKxCva-Ww9CP9Olgatw79Q.review_text: Kind of in a cheesy location (being so close to the wharf) but we had a great experience here. In particular their appetizers were really good (we had the salmon chips and shrimp bisque) and the entrees were decent (macadamia crusted filet and the roast duck). Its a big place with a nice water view and live jazz music - and was a good place to bring a baby since it was pretty loud. Solid food and fun environment, good choice for baby parents.

KefUBALHuiwaPLiGQrCe4g.review_text: For appetizers we ordered Oyster Shooters and the Calamari.  The Oyster Shooters were OK, but it took a long time to get a flavor from it, and even still, it felt very subtle.  We didn't know what to make of it.  It took a long time to decide a thumbs up/down, and ended up deciding, "its OK", but still couldn't tell you what it tastes like.  Probably won't order the shooters again.  The calamari though was incredibly tasty, served with a light sauce that complimented it perfectly.  We WILL be ordering the calamari next time (and every time) we dine here.  I ordered the cowboy steak which looked very exciting as it was served to me on sizzling skillet with chorizo, jalapeno's and other goodies.  My first few bites were "eh".  It tasted just like any other steak I've had.  I started scooping up the other items on my plate with the steak on my fork and it tasted good, but not amazing.  Probably on the 5th or 6th bites there were enough juices on the skillet to sop up with the steak which added to the flavor, but didn't really do it for me.  It felt like steak with chorizo (separate items) not steak AND chorizo (something blended into a single unifed dish).  I'll be trying something else next time we come here.  I don't plan on returning here soon (unless I get a craving for their awesome calamari), but I wouldn't say no if someone else wanted to try it out.  I do think it's worth a return visit to try something else, but I'll most likely be trying out other places.

GpRuJJgaM7LkU9A5PV0SQA.review_text: We were here last night with a living social coupon and the service was really A++.  The waiter kept refilling our water and made sure we were doing ok.  We ordered all appetizers cuz we were not really hungry (we had a big lunch!) Oyster Trio - oysters were fresh but the taste of the dish does not wow us, we'd say skip it. Oyster shooters - the bloody mary mix was GREAT, oyster is fresh but kind of small, so when you shoot it with the mix, the mix overpowers the little oyster. Garlic noodles - the noodles texture suggest freshly made noodles, but the taste is very plain..The squash is a bit too crunchy to me.. I'd say skip it. Fried Calamaris - great presentation but it's not crunchy.  I'd say skip it, my friend liked it though. Curry Mussels - best dish for me.  The mussels are huge and NOT overcooked which is very important to me.. lol..  the sauce is great and the toasted bread are nice!!  Only bad thing is there are 2 mussels that did not open up and we are not supposed to eat it... wish they would check it before serving... (this is supposed to be a nice restaurant, right?! not a big deal for me but just wondering) Baby field green salad - very good.  big portion too.  Probably won't come back for dinner or the food, but it's a nice place to hang out.  It has a great ocean view so maybe I'll come back for lunch or happy hour.

WjEmMLDWoKZMXes-h_Hg4A.review_text: I've never been to the restaurant only the takeout window. Food is very good (chicken bun=yummy) and reasonably priced.  The service can take a little long since it gets pretty busy with tourists and local office workers alike.  Everyone has always been exceedingly polite and friendly.  Certainly recommend.

uKtpvZIBvthTFFntso1eAQ.review_text: Not by choice, I had to dine out for Thanksgiving this year. I decided to head here for the holiday dinner and was very satisfied by the service and meal we received. Located at Pier 33, the restaurant has large windows that look directly out at the waterfront. We were seated promptly and explained how the special holiday menu worked and what our different options were.   To start they brought out a nice amuse plate with an oyster shooter, kumamoto oyster with miso foam, a beet, chevre, and tangerine bite, and a cracker with horseradish and smoked salmon. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have any bread brought to the table to accompany dinner. I understand that normally they do not serve this at the restaurant, but I feel for a holiday like Thanksgiving dinner rolls seem appropriate.  For first course we had the option of a curried pumpkin soup or an endive and pear salad with walnuts and pomegranate seeds. Both were excellent. The soup was thick, rich, and absolutely delicious and the salad was light, crisp, and the cheese muffin on the side was a great addition.   The main course didn't have any other options than turkey with a ton of different sides. The meat itself was succulent. They gave a generous portion as well. There were a bunch of sides that I can't remember them all, but I do remember that the rice side was definitely the worst. It didn't have much flavor at all. The hash beneath the turkey was very good as was the mushroom sauce served over it. One of my dining companions dish was served a bit cold and the server made sure to correct this immediately.  For dessert there were three options: Apple Pie, Pecan Pie, and Pumpkin pie. We all got either the apple or pecan and neither of those were any good. They tasted and looked like store bought desserts.   There were a few minor misses over the course of the meal, but overall I was quite pleased with our holiday dinner. I would definitely love to come back and try out Butterfly's regular menu.

o8D4dcWduwem_penAnERTg.review_text: Went to Butterfly last night with my family to celebrate my daughters 16th birthday.   Everything was wonderful.  The GM Johnny was very inviting and accommodating.  My girls commented how "happy" he is.  Our server, Porter, was the absolute best.   He was highly attentive, professional and helpful.   He gave wonderful recommendations from the menu.   He was great!!!  Additionally the other staff (who helped clear the table) were all friendly and courteous, especially the young French gentleman (sorry, did not get his name).  The food was excellent as well.  We had the calamari for appetizers.  Perfect.  Dinner included the 24 oz cowboy steaks that tow of us shared.  It was huge and delicious.    Dessert was wonderful.  Would highly recommend this place.   Great atmosphere as well.   We were there for dinner so the bay view was limited but I can imagine that during the daytime, the views would be spectacular!   Thanks to all at Butterfly for making our night out very special!

umxyAla7ZctZzxEcExe3ww.review_text: This place is totally worth it. Take friends/dates to impress, and they will be impressed, especially if you sit by the glass wall facing the water.   They  deserve a sixth star for presentation. I caught myself staring at a big fish head presentation at the table next to mine, there was something about the way those beady fish eyes stared looked at me.

wM5qc88o1WeqHIbNh3ubEA.review_text: This review is for the happy hour -- which is excellent. Porter, our waiter was fun, funny, and super helpful. The appetizers are all delicious and such great deals. Fun drink of the day, and great wine of the day too. There aren't very many happy hour options for those of us who work down by Pier 39, I am so happy we at least have Butterfly.

NqVTQJLRjarENt4O5vdL-Q.review_text: I went here with my girlfriend the other day because she wanted the 22oz steak. I came in with nothing but negative opinions about the place. However the chef came multiple times throughout our meal and t urned my opinions around.   Since we were there to try new food, We got the Acai lemonade, Lychetinni for drinks. Shrimp Bisque and Onion soup for appetizers, The gf's 22oz steak and the yellowfin tuna for the main. The lemonade came and gave quite a kick of sour flavor as the lemon and acai flavors mixed. The lychetinni also had a small kick while drinking and seemed to be more like finely blended lychee. Either way, both drinks were quite amazing concoctions  by the bartender.  The appetizers, French onion soup & Shrimp bisque. The Onion soup arrived as a bowl with a layer of cheese ontop that had melted over and seeping along the sides. Looking kind of odd, we pierced through the cheesy layer and tasted the soup. oddly enough, the layer of cheese accented the soup nicely. The Shrimp bisque on the other hand came as a puff pastry in a small dish. We were somewhat unsure about what this exactly was. attacking the dish, it ended up having the shrimp bisque right below. I believe there was about 9 pieces of shrimp included which is a lot more than i had expected. overall, the Shrimp  Bisque was the better of the two in my opinion.   onto the main course(s)! The 22oz steak came on a sizzling plate and well... its steak. Was pretty good and there was quite a bit left over. 22oz is a lot of meat. As for the Yellowfin, it was a very different experience than  the steak. the yellowfin came ontop of black rice with calamari hidden inside. There were also two stuffed mushrooms which were placed on top of a neon green sauce. i asked for the yellowfin to be pan seared and it came out perfectly so. The rice was delicious and the calamari inside was a nice surprise within every other bite. As for the stuffed mushrooms, i was a little confused on how the chef was able to bring out the bright neon color and the weird taste (in a good way!). After the chef visited our table a few times, he revealed that it was his own creation mixing wasabi and lime as the primary ingredients.   Setting = great  (i mean its waterfront, how could it not?) food = excellent Chef & waiters = amazingly kind

G4UrUJhfyQK0JV3GVw0r6w.review_text: Good location. Touristy - yes!  The food is really tasty. Each dish has good presentation. A treat to the eyes.  People who takes reservation is not doing a good job. I asked for a table near the window but got a table far away from it. So we didn't even get a chance to know if they have good view or not. Very disappointed.  Our server was very sweet and friendly. However, she's always so busy and didn't come to our table soon enough so we decided to skip the dessert after long wait.

Jhu6EKPtblDu6FzmRJ4l7w.review_text: Went to Butterfly with some colleagues.  Being on the pier, the ambiance was decent with a nice view of the waters.   The food could be a lot better I think.  I had the "surf and turf" and something about it quite didn't fit right.  They recommended the steak strips medium and that is how I ordered, but beef was not very appetizing.  Mixed in where some scallops and shrimp with asian sprouts.   I'm not too sure about his Asian Fusion.  My colleagues plates looked a lot better and my review might have been better had I ordered something else.  Their calamari appetizers were very good, but is is not that difficult to get fried calamari to taste good.  Expensive, but you're paying for the venue.

UySLQuZU6SOuuMO4J74x7w.review_text: Happy Hour Review.  Eat/Drink at the bar = Free Edamame.  Lemon grass Curry Mussels - These were winners.  They serve huge mussels here.  Kobe Sliders - It is one burger between texas toast sized bread cut into fourths.  Everyone i was with loved it.  It was pretty good, and it tasted how it looked: a decent burger between thick butter bread.  I've never been wow'd by a kobe burger before, i can only tell a huge difference when it is in steak form.  Oyster Shooters - It is a shot of bloody mary mix with like a fourth of an oyster in it.  I like bloody mary's so i liked it.  Just wish there was more oyster in it.  If you want $1 oysters you may want to venture elsewhere such as waterbar.  Duck Confit Spring Rolls - Better than your average egg roll.  Kalua Pig Lettuce Wraps - Good as any other lettuce wraps.  Garlic Noodles - Good as any other garlic noodles.

kCy9y_hQGtNc-NHrcbdaCQ.review_text: Kahlua pig spring rolls and braised beef dishes were amazing!  The view was awesome and the service was even better.  Chef really knows how to hook it up!

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: I wanted to like this place-I really did. Met up with 15 of my nearest and not so dearest for a Monday night dinner party. I've heard some awesome things about this place so maybe I had higher expectations for this place and in their defense, the entire table was industry people so we nit pick everything I suppose.   I walked in an hour late (cab issues) to a near empty dining room and we got the tables by the windows. Our crew already finished 3 rounds of black cherry martinis and were quite anxious to get the party going so we moved right into appetizers.  Duck confit were not impressive at all. It tasted like a freeze dried taquito with a sticky syrupy sweet and sour sauce. The french onion soup was more like a thick blanket of cheese and beef broth flavored bread. No offense, it's suppose to be soup-not french onion flavored bread pudding.   Our hangar steak was way too stringy and cold! Medium rare means a little pink, not blood on the plate either. I understand there were 16 of us which was about half the clientele that night but having cold steak is not palatable and I picked on my friend's red snapper. He ended up picking at the snapper and eating the butter lettuce cups and veggies separately. From the description, he didn't think it was a lettuce wrap and the sight of him dropping food all over himself was priceless though.   Dessert was yet another disappointment. The creme brulee was suppose to be the highlight of our meal and upon the inaugural "crack" of the top, the spoon just stuck to the slightly burned sugar. Mmmm...not cool. I was disappointed yet again. I understand they might have been trying to save time and chilled for much longer than expected after torching.   The service was phenomenal though so I can't really knock down too many stars. Our one server did a spectacular job delivering round after round of martinis, water, and silverware replacements. She even put up with the one loud mouths drunken spewings. God bless her for putting up with us. I almost wanted to apologize for their displays of barbaric alpha male posturing. But she remained poised throughout the 3 hour service.   Overall, I wouldn't come back. Service was excellent but the food couldn't  save this review for them.

9xiWRjXpLMvD1AIpupJskg.review_text: Came here for their prix fixe Thanksgiving menu. Romantic location with a view of the water, dim lighting. Everyone was really friendly and attentive and the food was brought out in good time. Good portion sizes. Loved the amuse and salad. The oysters tasted fresh and were very flavorful. Turkey was juicy. Apple pie at the end was superb, not too sweet with some body to the apples. Would love to come back and try their regular menu. Pricey drinks menu though.

pgHydP7mJBryEw5_Ldp36Q.review_text: I love the ambiance of this place and the intimate vibe is great for a date. Since they are right next to multiple tourist attractions, they are never busy. I walked in at 8pm on a Friday night and was able to score a booth seat.   I enjoyed their Caesar salad and duck confit spring roll very much and besides being a bit too salty, their garlic noodle was very satisfying. I find their entree to be on the pricey side so I will stick to drinks with appetizers.   Can't wait to try their version of LocoMoco during weekend brunch.....

x7UTU6DEn-TclGjhXQfmwA.review_text: New years eve party was a total scam. They sell you $100 tickets for open bar that starts at 930, then don't let you in til 11. Long lines prevent you from actually getting drinks, and there must have been twice as many people there as the room could safely hold.

l28f_T6cOuzQOZv-ag6y6Q.review_text: This review is for lunch.  I find people's complaints to be unfounded for a lovely Tuesday afternoon lunch.  This is an upscale wine-driven restaurant that i heard about from their owners at Reverie winery in Calistoga.  We got a table tucked away, overlooking the water, it wasn't very noisy (but there is a bit of the tourist set here).  We ordered a couple of fantastic glasses of wine (one called Daydream from their winery that was a Bordeaux/Cab and another Cab from St. Justin (?)).  For an appetizer we enjoyed the Kobe beef foie gras with a crispy outside that made it fantastic.  For the main, a lobster/shrimp bisque on the special list that was served with a pastry crown like you find in French restaurants, and the sashimi trio over thai black sticky rice.  The latter came with a sesame and black sesame soy and a wasabi cream that was heavenly.  Both were absolutely lovely.    For dessert we shared the banana lumpia with pineapple coconut ice cream: a fabulous dessert to be sure.  Wait staff was *super* attentive and polite, and responsive.  I had barely finished my glass of wine before i noticed our waitress check our table to see how we were doing with our wine mid-meal.    The price at this point, ceased to be lunchish.  But it was well worth a fancy way to enjoy an any-day.

Qq7j8H3-VuaBzF8qxBZysQ.review_text: Ordered: APPETIZER -Fire Fried Calamari: With Ponzu Cucumbers, Toasted Garlic, Micro Cilantro and Tabasco Remoulade: I thought there was too much going on that I couldn't really taste the actual squid.   -Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups:  Comes with Hoisin Barbeque Dipping Sauce, Brunoise Peppers and Toasted Cashews. The kalua pig was tender with a bit of crunch from the cashews. It was savory, yet refreshing. You know its good when you hog a whole appetizer to yourself.   ENTREE -Turmeric Grilled Snapper with Sizzling Onions and Herb: Mixed with Cold Rice Noodles, Vietnamese Herbs Salad,  and "Nuoc Cham" Dipping Sauce was scrumptious. The fish was moist, but also crispy on the edges due to the cast iron serving dish. The herb salad and the dipping sauce added a fresh and tanginess to the dish. The turmeric seasoning was just right so that you can taste the freshness and sweetness of the fish.   In addition, not only was the food delicious, so was the view. They sat us by the window. :) A+++++

XrycmeUFBq_r2vT4ggD6oQ.review_text: Best part: the view. We had seating along the window, and basically over the water. Sunset and evening - it was beautiful.   The service was good, not memorable but good. The food was also good. It wasn't the best I've had for the price, but it's "good enough." The prix fixe menu is actually a great deal. Pass over the spring rolls for the summer rolls. The spring rolls seemed a bit heavy, but the summer rolls were light and summery. The gnocchi, red snapper, and hanger steak as main dishes are solid choices. But they won't leave you itching to come back immediately. By the time you reach dessert, you'll be stuffed. But the chocolate cake with coffee ice cream will still sound appetizing. It's good, but I've had better.  For drinks, the Cherry Blossom, Palm Cosmo, and White Sake Sangria are extremely sweet so be prepared for a sugar rush. The Sumojito is refreshing though.  Overall, Butterfly is a nice restaurant, but it won't knock your socks off.

2HUQjb9aOyFdkJTe-yyCig.review_text: Certainly the best restaurant on the Embarcadero.  Really love the Kahlua pig lettuce cups and the ahi salad are divine.

aYEqNwqF-YsB9g7lmrAJvQ.review_text: Came here a couple months back. It had always been a restaurant I wanted to try, but browsing through the menu, I was never too eager. Finally came and the food was alright. They had a mushroom cappuccino soup that was definitely unique. It was delicious in a way, yet I didn't want to finish the whole thing. Everything else was good, but not great. Our server was decent, but the bussers very tentative. The decor was amazing, and so was the night view of the bay.

bhEjRdfsxbRTIfwQhMNsbw.review_text: The best calamari I have ever had. Also had an ahi sashimi salad with avocado, etc, which was to die for. The the duo of clam chowders was BAD, but the other stuff was just that good, I can over look it. My 6 year old loved sitting on the water. He said they had the best fries and mint ice cream...

RlCDYV9tOQ4EfaVnecX4UA.review_text: A very nice interior with beautiful views.  We parked right outside at a meter on a Saturday night.  The staff was very friendly and checked our coats.  The bathroom was clean and modern.  Ordered the filet with blue cheese and ate every drop, it was amazing.  The chef stopped by to ask how our dinner was.  He came off as very thoughtful and of course we had great things to say about it.  The waiter was very strange to say the least and that's why I'm giving it 4 stars.  I'm surprised such a nice place would allow for that type of employee.  That was the only down side.  We had a lovely dinner with great food and will definitely be back.  Hopefully that waiter is gone!

EsbKVP-eBkThZ4XqrOppJA.review_text: Romantic, great drinks, great appetizer, perfect to bring friends here for small plates.   The embarcadero is a great place to hang out and enjoy the weather and views. If you are in the area and want to grab some drinks and small plates, you will enjoy it here. The decor is modern and romantic. The view is pretty and this is a great place to get your romance on!   It is quite expensive here. Their entree is not totally amazing- but their appetizers are. In fact, they have a wider selection of appetizer than they do entree.   We had oyster shoot for appetizer: good but the oyster doesn't seem too fresh.   Pulled pork with butter lettuce: it was ok. I think the pulled pork was a bit bland and not really the best cut of meat in general. The hoisin sauce helped, and if you like pulled pork, then you should try this.   I had the duck for the entree and it was very good. I would recommend this if you come here. The cuts are small but enough. It was very tender and cooked medium rare. It was paired with the cherry sauce and other berries that gave the duck more dimensions.  My bf had the fillet mignon and he thought it was ok. Nothing very amazing.   If you are feeling extra good- you should try their desserts too. Their creme brulee is wonderful!!

NQOpETEWOzcn3suIUmEmjA.review_text: I am a bonified foody, and this place fits the bill. there are steak houses in SF that are well , lacking , the Cowboy Ribeye is off the hook, aged 22oz bone in ribeye seared on an oak charcoal grill, the grill has a stack of charcoal a foot thick!. Rob, Chef and co-owner then places scallions, tomatoes, onions , and house made chorizo on a cast iron plate, the ribeye is then placed onto the cast iron plate and topped with foiegras butter and brought out sizzling, amazing flavor, my favorite. The cocktails , go old school and try the old standards, the staff and bartenders are fantastic. The best part is you will find a great mix of San Franciscans in this eatery.

YgU1vtsxuZUMoUC_dVMdVA.review_text: Based on a number of reviews - I decided to try butterfly last night. I made reservations several days in advance & had requested a table with a nice view as we are hosting good friends from london. When we arrived it took several minutes for the hostess to even greet us. Then she said "I know u asked for a view, but we don't have one available right now would you mind waiting for a little bit we have a table that is very close to being done." we were fine to wait a bit no worries. We then go to wait at the bar & figured we would get cocktails. This is when things went from ok to really poor service. The bartender did not even acknowledge our presence. The longer we waited the more frustrated we got. After 15 minutes we were calling other restaurants to check for availability. The bartender still had not made an attempt to even pretend to acknowledge us - not even a simple "hi I'll get to u as soon as I can"... Finally the hostess came to check on us & we asked - does this end of the bar not get service? The hostess looked surprised & at that time the bartender came over to us as if she hadn't just ignored us for 20 minutes & asked what we would like to have. At that point we walked out. Which was the best decision of the night.   We decided to try Waterfront which we have been to several times. As soon as we walked in we knew it was the right decision. The service was fantastic & they were able to accommodate right away. The food was superb! All in all we ended up having a wonderful evening & dinner.   We will never go to butterfly again. We are very big on service and if the place misses the mark esp like last night - we cross it off our list.

WB7yrm93ZaTk8RaGro8v6g.review_text: I came here for the Mothers Day brunch tasting menu.  The entire tasting menu was delicious.  Absolutely nothing to complain about here.  The view is nice and right on the water.  The price, although a tiny bit pricey for brunch (~$50 per person), the portions were large and dinner size for sure.  The only downside was the service.  They automatically add gratuity for the tasting menu and I felt the service was very spotty.  The drinks, although pretty tasty, took a very long time to get, and that is even after waiting quite awhile for the server to even greet us.  In addition- my husbands and my meal came out at different times.  I think it must have been unusually bad service because the chef came out to apologize, as well as the server buying us a drink and not automatically charging us gratuity.  Because they tried so hard to make up for the lack of service, I give them 4 stars (vs 3) without.  But on food alone, 4 stars for sure. Not 100% sure I would go back for a special outing, but I would recommend this for a bar night though.  The drinks are tasty and the view seems like it would make it pretty fun.

L5rgOg0CI-VoVpW49jZX-g.review_text: I came here for a work function and thought this place was nice.  I really liked the location of this restaurant.  Its off the pier, and had a nice floor to ceiling window facing the water.  One of the chiefs came out and introduced himself, which I really liked.  The waiters were very attentive and came over whenever someone new joined our table.  Throughout the night I got to try the calamari, kalua pork lettuce wrap, duck confit spring rolls, oyster shooters, flat iron steak, chocolate tort, and creme brulee.  The oyster shooters were my favorite.  I thought the flat iron steak was good, but it came with Korean rice cakes which I did not like very much.  I think the best part of the night were the desserts.  If all else fails, at least get their dessert.    As for the drinks, I wouldn't recommend them.  They almost mixed my coworkers non-virgin with my regular cocktail.  Then when I tried mine, it tasted like they poured her alcohol into mine.  Generous, but I was trying to function at my work function so I couldn't drink it.

WeqgQe9guUGzWmbbshn1Ow.review_text: Kill 'em with kindness.   How can you give a place a bad review if everyone that works there is so damn nice?   I can't...just bad karma. I feel the 3.5 star rating is spot on.   Food was decent but not memorable. Setting was great with an unobstructed view looking out over the bay. Might go back and sit at the bar and have an appetizer; not sure I'd rush back for the dinner.

ziEKrqIQxz-npzAFZZrdSg.review_text: We had dinner for 4 on a Saturday night. It wasn't very busy. Our waiter Porter was very attentive, accomodating and funny. An excellent dining experience. The food was delicious and well prepared with a varied menu so everyone was satisfied. I would recommend Butterfly.

7AUE-LJTlByV2TTQOTnLIA.review_text: I made lunch reservations for 8 ppl at the start of this summer's "Dine about town" to celebrate my parent's 39th anniversary . Overall we had a great experience and everyone had a good time. The staff seated us promptly at a large table/booth next to the open kitchen. We ate, drank, talked and laughed for almost 2.5 hours and did not feel rushed at all by the staff.   We took advantage of the dine about town menu, which included an appetizer, main course and desert for about $22. My sis had been here before, so she recommended we all choose our appetizer and share it. This way we could try all 3 apps. Of the 3, the fried calamari and duck spring rolls were the best, while the fresh salmon roll w/strawberries was okay (it was an interesting combo). The portions are very generous and fresh. I also had a lychee mimosa that was okay too. Also, ordered a couple bottles of vino, which were very good. Not a drop left.  I ordered the shaking beef salad. It was good, but I wasn't in love with it. There were only 3 bite-sized cubes of beef (a bit tough) over greens with bits of bacon, a poached egg, cherry tomatoes, bleu cheese chunks, ham, etc. I could've just eaten the appetizers and been satisfied. I could not finish my salad, which has never been a problem for me. I did try a bite of the shrimp and scrambled eggs tostada. WOW! I wished I had ordered that, it was piping hot and tasty. My mom had the chicken salad club w/fries, it was huge! They used texas toast, so the bread was about 2 inches thick w/ a filling stuffed full of chicken chunks.  My little niece ordered from the children's menu and had a mini cheese pizza and a bowl of hot, crispy fries along with cranberry juice and vanilla ice cream for desert. She was in heaven!   Lastly, for desert there were 2 selections, creme brulee and molten chocolate cake w/coffee ice cream. By this time, I was so full I just skimmed the crunchy brown sugar layer from the top of the brulee (my favorite part) and ate only a bit of the custard.   I will go back for the duck spring rolls and to try other dishes. The dine about town special ends on June 15th, so if you're in the area I recommend checking this place out. Even when that special ends, it is still worthwhile to stop in for the food. Even better if you can get a seat next to windows with a gorgeous view (better for smaller groups). Afterwards, you can take a stroll down to pier 39 to take in the fresh air.

EmbgRODOF5pI875AzLJeTQ.review_text: Wow! Way to stay classy Butterfly. I wrote a review Back in February, about how me and my new bride were totally discriminated against through out our entire lunch that should of been an hour tops but took 1 hr and 45 mins due to piss poor service and continually being ignored by our server! This stop still leaves a poor taste in my mouth due to the fact we were on our honeymoon and it basically ruined that last two days of the most important trip of our lives. I stated way to stay classy because not only did we not recieve a sorry or any gesture of apology but they deleted our post and it's no longer available to see! No worries, I have to review saved on my computer and will repost daily, not only on here but on my Facebook, twitter, instagram, etc. nothing in the world is worse then the feeling of being discriminated against be it race, sex, age.

WkBSBfRRloP6QFH7O8I5dg.review_text: After a long hiatus from Butterfly, we just stopped in for dinner tonight.  Some things worked out well & some things were just okay.  PLUSES: +Modern Decor & Nice Bay View +Good Service +Well-made Cocktails +Tasty Oyster Shooters +Macadamia-crusted Filet Mignon  MINUSES: -Duck Confit Spring Rolls & Shrimp/Green Papaya Salad were lackluster. -Portions are not Hungry-Man sized by any means. -CPB (Cost Per Bite) Ratio subsequently on the high side.  All things factored, Butterfly is a solid 3.5 Stars. Not bad, but given the stiff competition in SF...nuff said.

bClyeK_pNdCyJ52gPQw_5w.review_text: We had a wonderful time tonight!  All the food we had was very well prepared and absolutely delicious.  We had their lobster pot-pie special which was amazing with chunks of lobsters.  For appetizer, we had Kailua pig lettuce wrap, calamari fries & garlic noddles.  Loved them all especially the garlic noodle which was light on the garlic but absolutly flavorful! We ended with their bread pudding coconut ice cream dessert which was the best bread pudding ever!!   Our waitstaff was very knowledgeable about their menu which was very helpful.  We are definitely coming back to Butterfly whenever we visit SF.

UinsZLIpvZPYiJBQ78qvnw.review_text: Great place to com and have lunch. Got a seat where we had a view of the ocean. Great food. Will come back again.

wVyaKfDO9jpbx_EyYI5snw.review_text: Went with a large group on Saturday night. The staff was attentive and friendly. Nice selection of wines and mixed drinks.  The food: I had the seared diver scallops with curry, orange, risotto. It was beautifully presented and tasted great. The scallops were cooked perfectly and the curry was subtle enough. The risotto was creamy and had a bite to it, which I like. For dessert I had the chocolate torte with coffee ice cream. It was decadent, the middle basically warm dark chocolate batter...yes. Overall, a great experience.   The view makes it even better; the restaurant is right on the pier, so going during sunset is ideal!

23uNDGcWp1o0BTbBTWDhHA.review_text: I don't get any pleasure out of writing a bad review and rarely do it.  However, I do have an issue with this restaurant.  We had heard they had oyster shooters at $1.00 per shooter.  We ordered the shooters and were asked if we wanted anything alcoholic to go with them.  I was very surprised.  I have ordered oyster shooters at other establishments and this was never an issue.  I said of course, and of course I had to pay for the additional vodka I ordered.    When I got home, I looked up the Wiki def for oyster shooter and it said it was an alcoholic drink, bloody mary mix, raw oyster, and vodka or something else with alcohol content mixed in.    You have a view of the water from this restaurant, but you cannot sit outside, and the windows either do not open or were not opened on that day.  The service was good, but we were not impressed with the appetizers we ordered.  One of them was supposed to come with caviar and had none, although when we asked where it was, they put it in a separate dish for us.  Apparently the appetizer, although it has the same name as the menu item, does not come with caviar.    Lacklluster experience and feel ripped off.

A9wmLW8c0dHMkCcwjik1Sg.review_text: Cocktails and wine selection were great. Quite loud dining room. NY strip was cooked to medium rare perfection. The duck was amazing. Kalua pork app was average. Endive salad was tart and tangy, but didn't have much endive in it. The calamari app was excellent.  Nice view of Oakland across the bay.  Also, pleasant soft jazz duo, although loud for the room.

xuMoiqpQA_B3Kk77QryInQ.review_text: I came to Butterfly for their Halloween party also. Not only did I have to pay for admission (despite their flier saying admission was free for females in costume), but I was denied re-entry, which was curious to me because my wrist was stamped when I walked in for the first time(why stamp my wrist if reentry wasn't allowed?). Also, I saw them letting other people back in so I don't know what to say...  All I know is, I will be spending next year's halloween at another club.

_EK6XZx4vUlPjwHtigBRAA.review_text: Really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Would rate it 5 stars but I found the booth with my back to the water uncomfortable. The service was excellent. Highly recommend Shanghai Noodles, large serving and great flavor. I will go again and request any table no booth when I make my res. And I agree with the other review better than Slanted Door, nicer portions quieter and better atmosphere.

yLMtYXwfFOtpeLJTI6gObA.review_text: We love this place!!! Great location and right by the water; close to the LV Americas' Cup location as well. Great starter options and whilst we're not fans of truck diver portions, they were a good size. Everything was tasty, and above all, fresh!!!! Service was good but not out of this world, partly because they seemed very busy, ambience was good and the ambience seemed to festive and jovial.  Recommend for a night out, with friends or people visiting from out of town, I'd pick this spot, (if you can get a table)

-x1516ZG5GllZiBjDQlRkA.review_text: I hate edamames and now I love them. The free edamames at Butterfly are so freakin good. They are slathered with peanut oil, sprinkled with black and white sesame seeds, and salted with tiny Hawaiian Pink Salt. Fancy!  Butterfly is a nice waterfront restaurant on Embarcadero. The glass window wall is really quite impressive. We got a nice window seat for dinner but since it was night all we could see was darkness, maybe a twinkling boat under the moon, feather debris, lost birds, and water below. Since I'm not a swimmer, it was scary and enigmatic at the same time. But pretty cool overall. Butterfly has an array of mixed matched lighting (all the colors of the rainbow!), flat screen tvs, an open kitchen and a tiny bar. Buddha greets you at the door and the smell of incense from I don't know where is really quite powerful.  Service is slow and cold at Butterfly. From the time we sat down to the time we got glasses of water, it took Butterfly 24 minutes. In that 24 minutes, we had been feasting on salty delicious edamames and I had already been served a lycheetini (which was just okay- Dragon Rouge lychee drinks are so much better). Water should have been carried out with my bar drink. Instead, I had something to quench my thirst while my friend did not.  The fire fried calamari was just okay. It was served in a small bowl and not too oily. Our main dishes were the ahi tuna plates. The tuna was a decent portion of fish, perfectly cooked medium rare. It was sitting on the perfect onion ring IMO. The onion ring was so tasty and it served as a container for baby scallops, bean sprouts, carrots, and celery. The reduction sauce sprinkled with micro greens glazing the plate was so delicious and was a great pairing to the tuna. The presentation of this dish was really fantastic.  Dessert was banana bread pudding and we each had our own. It was totally not what I expected but surprisingly out of this world.
