The banana bread which was more like a warm muffin was served on a triangular plate sprinkled with powdered sugar and dotted with flambeed bananas and a crumble of macadamia brittle. The banana bread was topped with macapuno ice cream and together it was so so good. It was warm too.  I want to give Butterfly 4 stars but I just feel they didn't care to be on their A game. With prices this high and all the SF competition, Butterfly needs to brush up on their service if they want to be considered a top contender. Based on the location alone, Butterfly vs. Houstons, Houstons wins TKO.

Pd8V0-QBsaMwg7z0dqk7nQ.review_text: Friday night dinner.  7:30 reservations. Surprisingly empty. I was expecting more filled tables.  Service was good- maybe due to the lack of customers at that hour. The food was a little pricey, but everything came out as expected and was quite tasty. I was full and satisfied at the end of the evening.  The atmosphere and view was worth it.

LSb9yxhTrP399hGriNcIMQ.review_text: ehhhh...straight crap! 1. service is HORRIBLE...the waitresses hav a permenant smirk on their faces  2. the food was mediocre.... 3. the manager was unprofessional and how no managerial or customer service skills what so ever 4. we called a day ahead for reservations and somehow managed to get the crappiest seat in the house....  over all horrible experience...looking back on it it was a shame i was so excited to come here...dont waste your time

uy1lqpYWe0DVZaTM2wcsCw.review_text: My husband and I went for dinner. I like the decor which gives the place a club feeling, but without the noise.    We tried tuna tartar and garlic noodle for appetizer. I thought the flavor of the tuna tartar was not distinct enough, a bit too much sesame oil, and a few bites tasted funny, I couldn't say the tuna was not fresh because I didn't get sick but, the thought of tuna being not so fresh definitely was there. We liked the garlic noodle, it was tasty and not too greasy, light, in fact, I wish they used bokchoy instead of  broccoli.  I had whole crispy red snapper as main course, it was beautifully presented, and the fish was done right. But it tasted bland, it would've been better if it had been marinated or brushed some sauce on it, it came with chowfun and some vegetables in a thin sauce that the flavor was hard to identify other than being sweet. My dish cost $36, although the fish was big. My husband order pork loin, I had only 1 bite so all I could say was it was tender.  We order creme brulee for dessert, the caramel on the top was burnt so it tasted very bitter. We regretted not sending it back.  Overall I think the place is overpriced for its quality , but of course it's on Embarcodero right on the water, you pay for that.

n655Y5-hBLaO5Ra3_ejfeQ.review_text: I'm giving a blended rate of 3.5.   I've been coming to Butterfly for years, I've always had a different experience each time -- and it always centered around the hostess upon check-in (not so good). This is a big contrast from the bar experience where the Manager appeared welcoming, friendly and attentive (thank you for offering us drinks!) The hostess:  Not so much!   We had reservations set for a specific time, and because one of our guests arrived a few moments late, she gave our window table to another group WITHOUT a reservation.  45 minutes later, she made up for it by giving us the best table in the house next to the water.  Okay, so it was a nice spot, but we had to wait an awful long time.     Our Rating:   - Hostess: 1 - Advice:  Please brush up on your host skills, and be mindful of your paying customers. It is not okay to keep giving one excuse after the next.  You lost me after the 1st, 2nd and 3rd excuse on why we had to wait 45 mins when we had a reservation.  - Food Service:  2 - Slow, slow, slow! Some dishes came out faster than others.   - Entree:  3.5 - The kitchen kept us waiting for quite some time, so by the time the  food came, it was just an "okay experience".  They haven't changed up the menu over the years. - Dessert:  3 -  For a first timer, it would rate a 4-5, but a repeat over a 5-year period -- ehhh, just okay since the selections have not changed much :( - Bar Manager / Ambience:  5 - I should have stayed at the bar!!  Blended Rate:  3.5

6b-kXgqmyTtC4xtQNFrQ8w.review_text: Memorial Day Weekend 5/29/10  We always passed by Butterfly Lounge in our night outings. So this time time we made sure to beat the line for their nightlife. We arrived their around 9:30PM or so...yes a bit early :P  Decided to go inside since it was cold outside. The promoters allowed us to go inside early yay... and we chilled by the bar, had a few drinks like  3 Wisemen, Beautiful, Don Julio shots :)  They were fast moving people out of the dinner scene to clean up. By 10PM it was empty. Dance floor was small bout they do have an outside smoking area that views the pier.  Overall, good time. Would recommend for the nightlife. Not sure about the restaurant scene. Azn fusion food usually not up to my standards and overpriced...no thanks :)   [Positivies]: attractive interior, clean bathrooms at first (after a few hours nope lol), great view of the pier, outdoor smoking area,   [Negatives]: Small dance floor, there was a white girl bartender who didn't give good service lol, 2 stalls in women's bathroom,

JUDK3oQCINsatzWjorVc9g.review_text: Came here because I bought the Living Social Deal.  Customer service: 5/5  Our waiter was awesome! I don't remember his name but he chit-chatted throughout the entire dinner service and was HILARIOUS. Also really honest in his menu recommendations.  Food: 4/5 I had the chicken clay pot, my mom had the steak (not the gigantic 22 oz one, the other one), and my sister had the caesar salad and steamed mussels. Of course, we all tried each other's dishes. They were all excellent, I think mine might've been my favorite. The complementary edamame are done well too, they're non-traditional in that they're cold and marinated in sesame oil but I liked them.  Coming back for the lettuce wraps!  Ambiance: 5/5 We went for dinner but my next visit will be during the day because the restaurant is located right on the water. We were seated at the window and could only see shadows of the water since it was pretty dark outside by the time we sat down. I can only imagine how the view must be. Bar also looks pretty sweet, and I hear their HH is great.

bkqHiFz-sOmjPxjYYDiO1A.review_text: This place is awesome!  The service was great and the food was sooooooo delish!  We ordered: Calimari: great presentation, and a wonderfull asian sauce on the bottom with sliced cucumbers.  Pan Seared Black Cod w. clams and shrimp: The tomato-y sauce was so yumm along with the clams the shrimp was wrapped in like a gyoza like pouch with the tail out for easy eating.  Its amazing how the cod stays crisp while sitting in the broth. Crab & Mascarpone Stuffed Crispy Chicken Breast: The presentation of this dish was so cool, it was a ball of breaded chicken filled with crab and mascarpone surrounded with corn and veggies with a balsamic sauce.   Creme Brulee: I prefer my creme brulee with just a light shell of sugar, and their's had a very thick sugar shell was imo too sweet, however the actual creame part was good, it was just too much sugar for me.   All in all, a great experience, nothiing I can really complain about...all smiles :)

q0HDybhT0V9dXrs63_WqWQ.review_text: This place is absolutely FABULOUS  for Mother's Day Brunch! I loved their menu, they had a few different selections for the courses and they were all light and flavorful. The lychee mimosas were delicious! My mother and I had the fresh mango salad with prawns, strawberry and salmon sushi rolls, and it was all fabulous. It was a great little place with a view to the bay, great laidback music and incredibly nice wait staff. This is one my mom and I will cherish for a long time!

jSDMCyKevYThQTn0VIKM9g.review_text: Went for dinner and the food was excellent as always.  I go here maybe twice a year and every time the menu is different.  Great to see they are always making new dishes.  One new thing i noticed this time was that the actual chef brings out the main dish to our table.  While at first it looked very odd as the staff is very well dressed while the cooks have the apron but it gave a very personable feel to the presentation.  Always enjoy going here.

o_BgH_RBwEou_pC_-0A02g.review_text: What an incredible experience!!  I met some friends for dinner last night and since I was coming from San Mateo I was 30 minutes late for our reservations.  The hostess was so nice and extremely accommodating. Once I got there she allowed us all to unwind and socialize and when we were ready she sat us down.  The food was amazing!!  We decided to share a poached pear & endive  salad with a warm hawaiian bread & blue cheese muffin (yummy).  Then we proceeded with appetizers Kalua Pig with butter lettuce cups (heaven) and the Fire Fried Calamari (OMG but ask for extra Tabasco Remoulade). We were 3 women and we had more than enough of the calamari, they give you a generous amount.  For our entre we all shared the Angus Cowboy Steak (22 oz) which was so tender & juicy. It was more than enough for the 3 of us. I took home the leftover steak. You'd think that after all of this there would not be any room for dessert - HA!  We SHARED the Warm Chocolate Torte with coffee ice cream (Mitchell's no less), oh was that good!!  Definitely Fabulous restaurant will have to come back for Brunch.  A definite destination for out of town guests!! The server and Chef were extremely nice and welcoming to the wonderful restaurant.

5V1azKNKRbnmxu2bXDy95g.review_text: so i really love fancy brunch.  i'm a sucker for a benedict and the one i had sunday was sooo good.  they really do a killer hollandaise, which is harder than you might think.  porter, our super awesome server, said it was great and he wasn't wrong.  it's a really nice place to eat, you're on the water, just watching sf happen, the service is amazing (ask for porter, he's the man)...you'll be stoked.

wbrEDJYa9tkjUKOhIXeydA.review_text: WOW! This place is awesome! How many restaurants have you been to where the owner/chef, Robert Lam, takes the time to meet his guests? Not very many for me but you throw this on top of excellent food...my goodness, Butterfly is one of a kind in the most incredible way! On to the food...  OYSTER SHOOTERS: Best I've ever had! - 5 STARS  DUCK CONFIT SPRING ROLLS - Pretty good. I like that the wrapper is very thin so you can taste more of the filling!  - 4.5 STARS  CLAMS & MUSSELLS - Delicious! This was probably one of my favs! If you're a fan of lemongrass, this is a must order! You will not be disappointed. - 5 STARS  KAHLUA PORK & BUTTER LETTUCE: Like everyone says, this is their signature dish and one of the main reasons why many customers return!  - 5 STARS  CALAMARI: Many people raved about the calamari and although it's very good, it wasn't mind blowing; nevertheless, the ponzu sauce and cucumbers layered beneath it does give it an unique AZN flair of palette goodness!  4.5 STARS  SASHIMI: This was my other fav b/c it's so unique. Salmon; tuna; shaped avocado nuggets, wedges of grapefruit, wasabi cream sauce along w/ fried wonton skins! If you like sashimi, this is a must order b/c it's really terrific!  - 5 STARS  BANANA BREAD PUDDING:  I first thought...how good can banana bread pudding be?! Order one to end your meal and you'll get to know the answer first hand!!! I had major foodgasm!!  -  5 STARS  LYCHEETINI:  The best lychee martini I've ever had. How many places you know use fresh lychee puree?!  - 5 STARS  This place exceeded my expectations in every way possible. San Francisco is fortunate to have a restaurant like Butterfly so do yourself a favor and try this place out!

_lL2I1HeO36JruliuAJM5Q.review_text: Expectations were high as everyone of Check Please Bay Area loved it.  I liked it, especially for the affordable pre-fixe - just $21! I began with the pork in lettuce cups which was tasty, but not fabulous.  They get points for being interesting and creative though!  The steak entree was good as was the brulee dessert.  The decor was attractive and they had a nice jazz band playing in the background so it was a very nice evening.

DVl3OFrEf_3dTMN1tCRwxQ.review_text: wonderful food, incredible service.  We continue to be impressed and will be back again soon.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: I haven't been here in a while.  But it is a great compination of cool cocktails, delicious food and cool location. The best were the duck eggrolls.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Walking along the Embarcadero on a gorgeous Sunday afternoon, my friend and I were scoping out the perfect spot to grab a bloody mary.  All signs pointed to Butterfly: good location, great views, great decor, seats right next to the water... unfortunately those signs should have read something like, "WARNING Bad Bloody Mary's on Board," or, "Watch Your Step, You are Entering a Bad Bloody Mary Zone."  It was really not good. It was watery and flavorless. I kept sipping up chunks of something that I couldn't quite identify. From that we decided we couldn't stay for anything else; it just wouldn't have been right.

8N8q9mjdJ_MzQuMOyCPmrQ.review_text: I came here with a bunch of friends(6 tot) for dinner and we all loved it.  Btw come early for dinner because this place gets packed also make a reservation. We sat by the window so we had a nice view of the waterfront.   The food was very good. For appetizers we had the Calamari, Shrimp Papaya Salad and Garlic Noodles. All very good but the Garlic Noodles was just ok, I've had better. For dinner I had the Chicken Breast stuffed with Crab meat and my friends had the Filet Mignon, we all loved it. I must say though the dessert was the most memorable for me. I had the Banana Bread Pudding, it was AWESOME. The service was fine, they were nice enough to take many pictures of our group with 6 different cameras.  I highly recommend this place. I will be back again and of course will be ordering the same dessert.

dHLL7SVGJw5uM6IEp_wb4Q.review_text: Came here for their lunch DAT menu which looked pretty good. Unfortunately, I think it was just alright, expected a bit more from them.  Edamame with Sesame Oil topped with Sesame Seeds. This came while we were awaiting our courses. I thought it was alright, not really a fan since I felt like it was drenched in oil and a bit on the heavy side.  Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups, Hoisin Barbeque Dipping Sauce, Brunoise Peppers and Toasted Cashews. Appetizer from prix fixe. I thought this was alright, but a bit oversalted. The texture of the pork was alright kind of reminded me of moist pork sung though. The butter lettuce was fresh and delicious, it definitely helped to lighten the oversalting of the pork a bit. The portion size was pretty good as I ended up taking about half of it home.   Shaking Beef Cobb Salad with Poached Egg, Prosciutto, Maytag Blue Cheese and Bacon. The beef was similar to the Korean style BBQ short rib meat, so it was pretty good. I wished the poached egg was a bit more runny, it was too overcooked for me. I did like the addition of the prosciutto to the salad but overall, I don't think it was anything special. The portion size for it was pretty decent though since I also took about half of this home.   I also had some of my friends' Fire Fried Calamari and Scrambled Egg and Shrimp Tostada. The calamari was alright but nothing to write home about. The tostada, from the taste that I had, I did not like at all and I am glad that I didn't order that. I don't think my friend liked it either since he didn't finish it. Him and my other friend ended up sharing the Chicken Salad Club Sandwich that she ordered which from what I heard was pretty good, but it looked a bit on the dry side to me.   I must admit the service for this restaurant was very subpar, I definitely expected better of a restaurant of this caliber. The service was worst out of all the restaurants I've been to on the Embarcadero. We waited about 10-15min after sitting down to receive waters and recognition from our server. Not cool, I say. Also, my server didn't get my appetizer and entree boxed up for me. I ended up boxing them myself at my table, I'm sorry if I expected a bit more from a restaurant with these prices on the Embarcadero, especially since the food isn't THAT great.  -1 star for service.

EuGwpkukxBY6AzWvDO4jIg.review_text: We had a good experience here.  Good view over the water, our meals were very nice and our server made sure we had everything we needed.  The edamame while you read the menu was a nice touch.  We were here for the lunch service before a trip to Alcatraz.  The burger was delicious.

AlYIEu1PdV3af0GfgUbNng.review_text: This is a place full of surprises.  We didn't know about this place.  We went because we purchased one of those LivingSocial or Groupon deals.  I love the interior laid out.  If you get a seat close to the window, you could watch the sun set.    The food was delicious!  We ordered the following items:  Food Ahi tuna Duck Peking Shrimp papaya salad Calamari  Drinks Pinot noir Honey bourbon sour  The server was attentive and friendly.  We definitely will come back!

f1ZCctdvraOsutD7TH7IjQ.review_text: trendy, modern fusion styled cuisine.   we had the perfect seats in the restaurant. since this place turns into a lounge/club at night, our dinner table was like a lounge styled couch. i was soo excited to eat here because this restaurant sits right on the edge of the pier, where if you looked out the window... you were literally right on the water    i had the grilled angus filet mignon and was pleasantly surprised that they were very willing to help alternate and cook upon the style of my request for my dish. the steak was good. but not great. i was able to get stir fried chinese broccoli and mushrooms in replacement of carrots. YUMMYY!  since this restaurant does not specialize in steaks, i'll let this one slide. my bf had some other kind of steak that i can't remember, but it was really good. he really liked his dish.   anyway, if you want to come to butterfly. come early so you can see the water. have an early dinner. its really worth it for the view.

J1Rre3VkRbhfu2BnBOcZZQ.review_text: Service is not the best but the food was pretty good.   We ordered the Khalua pork spring rolls, garlic noodles and calamari for appetizers.  I'd recommend passing on the calamari.. The pieces are pretty small and flimsy and nothing outstanding.   My table had the burger, more garlic noodles, chicken salad bacon sandwich, salmon salad and I had the shaking beef salad.   Burger/chicken bacon sandwich were both good. Garlic noodles had the perfect amount of garlic but a bit on the oily side. The salmon salad was not good.. Fish was dry and the lettuce was drenched in dressing. The best thing IMO was my dish, the shaking beef salad. It had the perfect proportions of beef to lettuce and avo.. The beef was tender and seasoned well with an awesome vinaigrette.   Good food, nice view and lighting but the service really caused me angst.

TDTGixIKjDv0ZSmp7znk0A.review_text: Came here for last minute change of plans around 9 on a Friday.  I was kinda hesitant giving this place a 4 star, but the food made up for everything. I'll explain later why...  Walking up towards this place and not knowing that it was an asian fusion restaurant. I noticed the sign that read " Kids Menu" I thought to myself... "wtheezy?" What on earth does this place have in store for little ol' me? The minute we walked in we were greeted with ......  A.) Hi, how are you guys doing? How many? B.) Can i help you? hand on the hip gesture*  Can you guess?   So the answer was B). So of course immediately, i thought it was closed for some private party but then later we were asked after we blankly stood there. After seating us down, the host kindly told us that we had an hour to eat. why?.... because this place turns into an after-hour lounge/club.   What a good way to ease some tension than a glass of Schrambergs Mirabelle. To start off, we had the half shell oysters that i thought was okay. For the entree i had the "kal bi" which was the pork chops. Where i thought it was delish! My friend who had the kobe steak medium rare was even better. I would definitely recommend both.   To top everything off we had the chocolate molten cake with a side of cinnamon ice cream. Now that was definitely my favorite!!   I can't wait to come back here and try everything on the menu. The next time i come here i'm going to order "two" of that chocolate molten cake because that was definitely the "ish."   Overall, the great food compensated for the rude host but then again our server was tremendously nice. The ambiance was also sweet with the view of the pier. Although, i came during the night time. I'm anxious to see how it would look like during the day time.

m0dgIHWg8M8C5GAZQHK6rw.review_text: This restaurant is in my neighborhood and been here countless times.  The menu does not seem to change very much and I wish they would.  Although the main stays should always be their duck confit spring rolls, calamari & tuna tartar.  These apps are simply delicious and cooked to perfection every time!  Cocktails are quite pricey because they are in small martini glasses so I always feel short changed.  This is something butterfly can improve on!  The entrees are ok (it would been fantastic if I haven't been here a thousand times) - I've had the ahi tuna, clay pot, cod - my husband always orders the filet mignon which he says is always reliable and undercooked just how he likes it.  The ambiance is very nice, parking is easy (across the street), service is always wonderful (not over bearing), desserts are reasonably priced and big enough to share, wine list is extensive and also within reason.  If you visit the Wharf area, this is where you should go to dinner!

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: I came here for New Year's one year with a group of people.  Let's just say thank goodness I had apps at home beforehand.  It was a set menu, and the portions were really small (and I don't even eat that much).  THe best thing about the menu was the bloody mary oyster shooters.  So good.  Anyhow, we had a fabulous time here that night.  We drank champagne, acted stupid, met a guy who claimed he was a bo-flex model (yet he didn't look like one AT ALL), and danced, danced, danced. Fun times, wonderful memories.

hfxzyscGteh763NasK-BaQ.review_text: **This review is for the club, not the restaurant**  I was a little disappointed to see that Butterfly was a little less classy on the inside than it is on the outside.  I think I had pretty high expectations, especially because I always think how pretty it must be every time we drive by.  But maybe it's because I had just gone to Vegas the weekend before, so everything else may not have looked as impressive.   Red booths lined the side perimeter of the club and the huge windows at the opposite end had a spectacular view of the ocean.  I looked closely at the water and noticed how disgusting it looked but that doesn't really have anything to do with the club.  There's a huge smoking section out in the balcony, which is also overlooking the water.  I definitely appreciated that!    The crowd was a bit....dare I say...TRAMPY?  Like, I didn't get the memo that it was dress-slutty-enough-where-you-can-practically-see-­ALL-your-goods night.  Honestly.  These girls were practically about to get on the stripper poles - donned in mini dresses that barely covered their ASSets and feet clad in fuck-me platform heels.  Men, if you are looking for a little one night stand action, come to Butterfly Lounge!!    I received a blue drink when I asked for a Tokyo tea (which should've been a lime green color) but before I started thinking about how unknowledgable the bartenders were, I became pretty tipsy after inhaling two of them.  I can't complain about bartenders who have heavy hands, even if they did mess up my drinks.  Loved it!  All in all, not a bad place to go dancing!  And definitely go when Rules of Entertainment is promoting - they play great music!!

c_yt1gjlYKWrfwCw7PhmRg.review_text: For the after hour event, the drinks were bad. We all got headache the day after. The atmosphere is okay.

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: I've been here a few times.  It's weird...but some nights, their food was great.  Other times...it was craptacular.     They make great drinks, and their service is decent.  Their ambience is a bit noisy though...with the music and when the place gets packed, which it usually does after 5 p.m.  Nice view for some of the seats too.  Price is typical of this area.  I can't say don't go...but you've been warned, that they seriously have 'off-days'!!

NjLFiLNPF_zMikba3ERdRA.review_text: Been here several times, and though the menu has changed of late the food is still fantastic.  In the past I was a big fan of the sashimi bowl with black rice - tons of fresh fish (varied selection too, hamachi, salmon, tuna) served on a warm bed of rice, lightly dressed with a soy-based sauce and some vegetables, but I haven't seen it on the menu lately - hope they bring this one back.  The kahlua pig with butter lettuce is always a hit, as the pork is perfectly tender, well seasoned and served with a nice spicy hoisin sauce.  Also tried some vietnamese-inspired chicken wings this past time, which are served with the drumstick still connected to the wing - my favorite way.  They have great flavor, a good amount of heat for the casual wing enjoyer (I prefer tons of heat but for a nice restaurant, that stuff doesn't really fly) and balanced with some sweetness in the glaze, served with some pickled vegetables akin to that in bahn mi, and bleu cheese crumbled on top - and that's my one critique of the dish.  The bleu cheese didn't add anything for me except an unnecessary heaviness; just takes away from the flavors and is fairly out of place in the dish.  My comrades thought differently of it however so try with and without, thankfully it's just crumbled so you can brush it aside.  For the mains I've tried many things, and never been disappointed.  The duck is great, always well prepared and flavorful, as is the chicken roulade (i avoid ordering chicken like the plague, but this one was pretty solid) served with lap chong, some rice, a fried egg (perfectly cooked - love it runny), some bak choy and other veggies.  Very strong, earthy flavors in the dish, and though I'm not too big on those bold earthy dishes generally, this one was nice, and the egg really balanced it out.  We also tried the whole fried fish of the day which, to our luck, was snapper (thai snapper i believe).  Usually when we ask they have some non-fry-friendly beast, but this time we won.  It was sort of a pan-asian dish, with kim chee, lap chong, and some roasted peppers in a soy/chili sauce.  The fish was well cooked, tail/fins crispy, and plenty of meat on them bones.  One problem with it - there was a bit too much flour used so the result was a bit powdery/chalky texture in some parts.  Overall a great place - some very minor critiques here and there but for the money it's well worth it.  Fantastic (strong) cocktails and a great setting/ambiance really round this place out.

O95TkCceMoFKXOKa97-xqA.review_text: Been here 3 or 4 times. Other than odd hours on Sunday, it's a great place and the food is always great. Kalua Pig with butter lettuce is a fave.  You can make a meal out of happy hour at great prices.

BhFwQZ52dPyNR6O9tG1e0Q.review_text: No matter how often I come here, I'm always pleasantly surprised by the great-tasting food.  I tend to try something different every time I'm here, and everything I've tried has been excellent.  The parking completely sucks here, but it's the Embarcadero, what can you do.  The ambiance of this place is top-notch, I've even been trying to buy a few decorations for my home, but to no avail :)  Overall, great place to eat!

d1ZxMYrgFTSMfa0pARbjkA.review_text: So this review is for my visit to their bar.  I have been a regular customer of Butterfly for many years and I have referred many people to their establishment.  Unfortunately, my last visit for happy hour was ridiculous.  I was ignored for 10 minutes by TWO bartenders.  They did not say one word to me.  I had to look at another customer's menu and then I had to ask the hostess for a menu.  After literally ten minutes of being ignored I left and my friend and I ate elsewhere.  I emailed the manager and he apologized.  It still did not feel right thus I am posting this review.  When you can get service or someone to even say "hello" to you, the food is delicious.

B0hHReh4tYTNIB7Po8mxtQ.review_text: Oh Butterfly, how could you disappoint and embarrass me so? I told my family who were visiting out of town that you guys had the best banana bread pudding dessert and that it was one of my favorite dessert of SF.  But then it came out cold, hard and STALE.  In fact, I'm pretty sure it was made the day before.  I was so sad because I was looking forward to it and I was so embarrassed because I recommended it to my family.  Granted, it was 3 pm on a Saturday afternoon, but that's no excuse for serving old food.  I won't be coming back :(

8p4w0obQ4tBStWw13omWig.review_text: Meh...I've had better. I have to give this 2.5 stars. I really wanted to like this place, it has soooo much going for it. It's absolutely amazing inside. Probably one of the the best interiors of a restaurant in the city. The staff was attentive, gave great service, and were generally interested in providing a high level of service.   What fell short here was the food. The presentation of the food was visually right on-I really really really wanted to like it alto.   1) Ahi Tuna Tempura Roll-this was the star of the night. It was good, good value at $10. Not the best Ive had but good, solid.  2) Garlic Noodles-they weren't bad, they just weren't great. Not a $9 noodle plate.  3) Duck Spring Rolls-meh. Holy Wasabi!!! Nothing mentioned wasabi on the menu.  4) Macadamia crusted Blue Cheese Filet-this was the big disappointment of the night. $28-I would expect something really friggin good! It was nicely presented. I so wanted to like it. But the mash potatoes were grainy(suspect under cooked potatoes), Ordered the steak medium rare. The steak was near REALLY rare (which was ok just not what I ordered). The blue cheese was overwhelming but the meat was bland, no seasoning gave it's life for the steak!, and the macadamia nuts were floating in the blue cheese(not crusty, browned, or cooked) and could NOT be tasted over the blue cheese. The veggies had there own sauce and were actually quite good. Over all this dish was the super disappointment of the night. Blahhhhh   The only other thing was our table had gum under it...beautiful restaurant, good staff, very average food for high prices, gum under the table...   We had a living social coupon so it was for sure worth the effort but probably not worth a return visit.

NE1edqG0EMyzevbgfU6FDA.review_text: This is going to sound harsh, but its because I really enjoyed this restaurant and I think they have so much potential to be great if they fixed a few small areas.  We had their 4-course set menu. First dish: Spring rolls with salmon, strawberry and nouc mam?!? Its an odd combination but it was delicious and refreshing. Then the flavored edamame, calamari, and another fried roll. All were very very good.   I ordered the snapper for entree. It took over 45 mins after the last appetizer was served.  By this time I was no longer hungry. Their appetizer portions are big! The entree came out, and it looked very good. I understand they want to be generous with their food, but no way could someone finish all this. It makes it almost less appetizing when you serve in such large portions, especially when your restaurants concept is fine dining. Then came desert, creme brulee very nicely done, not too sweet and perfect sugar crust on top.  Service is top notch. They are so attentive and willing to make your experience memorable. The waitress overheard our conversation and catered to us immediately.   The chef needs to portion and pace the guests stomachs. After sending 4 appetizers you get pretty full. Then hitting you with french onion soup, your entree, AND dessert will burst you. Also has to work on his timing. However, his flavor combinations are great. So $40 for a brunch? Its alright, better save it for dinner when you are really hungry.

pZDQSy-tMqrl2rOKtAHNbw.review_text: Good, not great. Definitely "not bad." A solid meh.

u8sT3aophVgbWOeFAhGuBA.review_text: This was actually my second time here.  First time was in a group but this time I just went with my girlfriend. We got the garlic seared clams and mussels as an appetizer and I got the Sweet Miso Roasted Cod and my girlfreind got the Five Spice Braised English Short Ribs but we shared everything.  Both were excellent.

nH3gqpoJyNqCgqPxFOziEA.review_text: Tried out Butterfly with my girlfriend for the first time. Ask for and got a great table with a nice window view. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Food and drinks were very good. Only complaint was some of the seats looked worn out. But was a good experience.

eSlDbkIXnPhJB1NH553zUg.review_text: Sometimes you need to go to a restaurant more then once to give a honest/better review. This is how I feel about Butterfly. I would give it another try and also try the happy hour menu. We had the calamari, duck spring rolls, garlic noodles, steak and snapper dish. Highlights were the, calamari, spring rolls and snapper. Garlic noodles were over rated. Steak was ok. Beautiful, stylish restaurant with a view of the bay!

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I really don't think Butterfly should be categorized under "Vietnamese" at all. It's definitely Asian-Fusion... and sometimes not even Asian. Whatever.   The location itself is beautiful. The interior probably looked super cool and modern when it first opened, but now it seems a little tacky. Still, there are dim lights at dinner time and feels like a nice hotel bar, which isn't the worst. If you're lucky enough, try and get a seat by the large windows! You'll get a great view of the Bay, even at night.  Soooo onto food! I got the Roasted Chicken Roulade, which was a decent sized portion. Sometimes at restaurants like these, I really just expect a sliver of meat or something snack-sized. Not at Butterfly! I couldn't finish my chicken.  The Ahi Poke Rice was also sooo good and bigger than I had expected. You could probably only split it with like four people max, though.  Ummm that's it. They were really good about refilling waters. Yes.

hCyGy0XVGF--OsoTP522ZQ.review_text: Searching for a last minute Mother's Day brunch place (her change of plans, not my procrastination, btw), I was scrambling through Open Table and remembered this place from a lunch thing a couple of years back.   Service was good, but leisurely - we felt that we had time to enjoy each others' company. Some people would call it slow, but really, it was nicely paced for a Sunday brunch. Food was very good. The "Amusement" (or "amuse en bouche" I think the Frenchies say) was great, and my oysters, salmon scrambled eggs and creme brulee, all very tasty. Mumsy seemed to enjoy her "en croute" appetizer and seafood curry cioppino very much. The restaurant gave me my requested window seat, and the pricing was clear (though a little pricey, but hey, it's Mother's Day, right?).   I wouldn't mind going back here, but wouldn't make a special trip, necessarily. It's a place to be remembered if I need a place to go to in the area.

NFQkgj8AJtCZW_In48f3cw.review_text: I came here last night for the AABA holiday party.  I've never eaten here before, but drive by it often when I want to take the scenic view home to Marin.  Man!  Aside from the crab appetizer competition (8 chefs - 8 yummy creations), we also had calamari, mini kobe burgers, mushroom pizza and a couple of other somethings served on spoons.  It was all so good!  I ate too much.  It didn't help that there was an open bar and I probably had one too many.  I didn't pay too much attention to the decor, but the wait staff provided excellent service.  I will definitely come back to experience regular dining.

QNCY-u47oi9T4xht4_LgfQ.review_text: Had a great dinner Saturday evening.  Me and mine sat at the bar and enjoyed the view and great service from Lauren and Jake!   On our way out had a chance to speak with the chef who was more than happy to answer any questions.  Getting to this location was painless as we took the trolley there and back to the hotel.  Great for a romantic date or just enjoying a drink with a view!

rXxY-02UsZH6tWJrW5rGeA.review_text: We LOVED Butterfly!  We come here on a Friday night and got seated at wrap-around booth table right next to the window with a view of the water...score.  The service was absolutely wonderful.  Hubby had beef and I had the duck, both were very delicious.  The kids menu I thought was good and our little one got two little bowls, one with noodles the other of veggies, and she got to eat with chopsticks.  This was a great spontaneous place to come after a very long hard work week.  It felt like we were celebrating a special ocassion, but weren't.  Would love to come back.

OPYN6_4oMKP5v_smeilcUw.review_text: First time at this place. Minus one star because they didn't have a huge menu selection and I tend to be very picky when it comes to deciding what to eat. I decided to get the Dungeness crab stuffed crispy chicken breast. It wasn't my favorite dish. I wish I could've stuck to my original order which was the Mesquite grilled pork. My bf had ordered that dish and it tasted exquisite.   For dessert we had the warm chocolate torte omg it was insanely good. It definitely satisfied my sweet tooth. The warm chocolate lava filled cake with the cold coffee ice cream tasted to rich and sweet and was a great combination together. My mouth waters just thinking about it.  Our server Cody was fantastic. He was super nice and kept checking on us to see if we needed anything! It was a great experience

knWVBY2aessaXrB3UZc0eA.review_text: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!! We went here on Saturday for a girls birthday brunch. Two of us in the group are gluten free, NOT BY CHOICE.  We called ahead to ENSURE we would be ok, and was reassured that they have at least 3 items on the "gf menu" and take food allergies "very serious". Feeling content with that reassurance, especially given there was NO INDICATION online that they cater to GF peeps, we went ahead with the reservation. We get there Saturday and immediately encountered two problems...the menu was NOTHING like it was online and there was no real GF menu, more just "items on the menu that didn't have gluten"....ummmm, NOT THE SAME, and def not what were told when we phoned in.  Not wanting to ruin my gf's birthday, I ordered the item the waiter suggested with a swap in one ingredient. hmmmm, see where this is going? Gluten free items and preparing a dish to be GF is not the same, trust me on this.  In any event, we brought cupcakes, a lot of them, but 4 were in a smaller separate box......okay so being someone that waited tables FOR YEARS let me ask you a question....you are waiting on table with Gluten allergies....you have two boxes of cupcakes, ask for one to kept separate....what do you do?? quick...whats the right answer??? well you put them ALL ON ONE PLATTER AND THEN DONT REMEMBER WHICH 4 WERE SUPPOSED TO BE SEPARATE.  So yea, no cupcakes for us either, which we paid for and brought on our own.  sweet. Wont be going here again, ever.  One star for ambiance, since its on the water.

D3zzBdZDs4qH3sChk3k9_Q.review_text: We went in for lunch, and were promptly asked if we were there for lunch (since it was 12:15pm, I'm not sure what else we'd be there for!), were given menus and quickly sat down at a table.  When we looked at the menu, it was a brunch menu, so we were confused at first, and then figured they must be still having brunch. As a vegetarian, there are SLIM pickings here for me, but there was a scrambled egg dish on the menu that was pretty much the only meat-free item, so I chose that. When we ordered, I was then informed that they aren't serving brunch anymore and we were given the wrong menu. We weren't then offered a lunch menu from the waiter, who was still waiting to take our order, so we had to ask what the lunch menu consisted of. He told us "pretty much the same thing as the brunch menu, except for the item you ordered isn't available." So I then asked for one of the sandwich items on the menu, and was told it also wasn't available because it had a fried egg on it. "So there are no eggs offered anymore?" (since there were at least 5 dishes on the brunch menu that contained eggs). "Well, we can make poached egg dish but that's it." Seems bizarre, since you'd have to crack the egg to poach it, but can't make a fried egg, and also can't show us a lunch menu so we know what we can actually order?   I ended up getting the mushroom sandwich that wasn't all that great at all. My friend had a sandwich that contained probably half a jar of mayonnaise in it. We didn't finish either of our lunches and probably won't be back :(

--4q8EyqThydQm-eKZpS-A.review_text: So underrated! What's wrong with you fellow foodies?! You're sleeping on this place.   The service was great! Example, husband ordered a glass of wine and the waiter recommended that he buy something else. Love that. Also the host asked if we minded waiting 10 mins more for a better table. Thanks! Bartenders were also friendly. free edamame at the bar.  Good fancy stiff drinks for under $10. What! What! :)   On to the food. Husband's cowboy steak was huge and delicious and huge :) I really liked my duck dish although after awhile the flavor of the confit crepe became too intense.  We were so stuffed that we didn't get a chance to try dessert. Can't wait to return for the duck lettuce wraps and the garlic noodle. So yum!

EVaW-GGDEbYrYhgGUmO0DQ.review_text: i was really surprised by this place. my expectations were pretty low because of all the mix reviews i have heard from my friends.  Caramelized Shrimp and Green Papaya Salad-very refreshing for a hot day. it isn't shreded up papaya. It's big pieces with mango and shrimp.  Fried Calamari Ponzu Cucumbers, Toasted Garlic, Micro Cilantro, Tabasco Remoulade-this was one of my favorite dishes. fried to perfection and full of flavor  Garlic noodles-very good, but needs a lil more garlic and came with alot of veges. didn't really match with the noodles, but was still very tasty  Duck Confit Spring Rolls-u can really taste the duck and it was yummy, but it was not spicy at all. Not even the sauce so i'm not sure why they everyone says it's so spicy.   Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups Hoisin Barbeque Dipping Sauce, Pepper Brunoise, Toasted Cashews, Minced Green Onions-this was pretty refreshing too, but i wasn't wow by it.   Orange and Curry Spiced Diver Scallops Lemon Risotto" Jook," Pea Tendrils, Tobiko Caviar, XO Shrimp and Chili Sauce, Sea Urchin Roe-this was interesting. the lemo risotto was just the right touch of lemon and the scallops u can really taste the curry, but doesn't over power it.   dessert-bread pudding. sooo good because there were no raisins (hate them)  would def come back here.

RaSq7WPbxH7Dm5yfVBAgYw.review_text: The smell that welcomes you is not so welcoming, but then you get used to it while you're there. The service is really great, which makes the price seem cheap. Between every course, they gave us new utensils and plates. We started off with the khalua pig wrap in butter cup lettuce, peking duck  spring roll, calamari, and the tuna poke. According to the waiter, the poke was a poke contest winner in the bay area(?). Everything was really good. The tuna poke, wasn't really that impressive, but they put a wasabi pancake on top of it which makes it interesting. However this makes the wasabi taste inconsistent since you get a small hint of it or a BIG surprise. The pig was very tender, like pulled pork actually. For entree we got the hangar steak kalbi style, seared ahi tuna, rack of lamb and a fish. The food was definitely delicious and everything came out really well, but I'm still not a fan of asian fusion (being asian myself). I do have very high standards for asian fusion food. Although everything was good, it wasn't super delicious. Some of the flavors they blended together just doesn't go right together like the hangar steak kalbi style. The sauce actually didn't have much flavor to it, but to keep my steak nice and juicy.

3y55vZxLjIbjvWrba6Catw.review_text: We had such an amazing experience at Butterfly last night. I made a reservation for my birthday on OpenTable and included in the notes that we were celebrating a birthday and would love a table with a view. Not only did we get a view, but the best seats in the house. We ordered cocktails, three appetizers and a burger to share. Particular highlights for me were the Tuna Tartare and the pork lettuce cups. The burger was also cooked perfectly on a bun that I would have eaten on its own. We ended the night with a creme brûlée topped with a raspberry, lychee fruit and a candle. Everything was delicious.  Thank you so much to Butterfly for the excellent service and for making my birthday super special! I will definitely be back!

_cgMxW4qPbEJTKt7R-wWEQ.review_text: Not sure why this place doesn't have a better star rating - it's really good! Came here with a friend for dine about town. I had the duck confit rolls, hangar steak and creme brûlée. All of it was delicious. The atmosphere and service were really good too - the chef even came to our table to see how we were enjoying the food! It is on the pricey side when it's not done about town time, but it's worth it for a date or special occasion, especially considering the views and location. Would definitely recommend it and come back again sometime!

uITchHEf6E_Mupzj83P8ZQ.review_text: We had dinner at Butterfly on Friday night to celebrate a birthday.  The food was wonderful.  The Peking Duck was the single best thing I have eaten in years.  The duck was a delicious balance of tangy, savory / umami, with just hints of sweetness.  Well done.  The service was excellent - attentive and yet casual.  They remembered it was a birthday and dessert came with a candle.

P5xMu2IP7CTzMAa3KakBBw.review_text: Came here for Dine about Town.  3 1/2 stars.   Great waiter, friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable.   Nice ambiance, though I wish we could have been there during the day or at sunset, as, with the dark, we didn't get to appreciate the great location.   Food was good but didn't cross the line to greatness.  Generous portions without being obnoxious.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: Are you looking for a place to take out of towners?  The waterfront view is exceptional. There is a full view  of the bay from almost every table. The location is situated in the heart of the Embarcadero. The inside is open and colorful.   It is great for lunch and happy hour. Food portions are small, but if you share you can try a variety of unique Asian and American dishes.   There are a few things I would change in regards to decor. It seems out dated and it is missing a touch of flare.  Cheers!

VOYvD-kerR204k0WrR0J3A.review_text: First of all, this should really get 3.5 stars....  We booked our reservation on opentable. We received a nice table with a view.  The service was solid... The atmosphere is nice.... They have an open bar.. The happy hour looks enjoyable.  We had a great chicken dish.. It was really tender... The sticky rice wasn't great...  Overall, it was a good meal.. Seemed a little pricey.  We might go back for happy hour...

_4ZJ9f3LE2lmRAUX3_F-MQ.review_text: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday prix fix menu for $21! The menu is wonderful. Price is right. Love the atmosphere and we were lucky with parking. This is the place for happy hour. So many great inexpensive food choices in the early evening. My new waterfront favorite.

yvnRiqX6iK0quUDsGGRIaw.review_text: My friends told me some good things about this place so I put them on the spot and we all went to check it out together.  First of all the place is Dance Club meets fine food.  The staff is really friendly and I was surprised how packed this place was in this economy because it's not cheap.  I started off with a flight of Pinot Noir.  Which went from light to bold...I save the bold one for dinner.  Our food affair started with the Kalua Pork lettuce cups, the Papaya Salad with Shrimp and Clams & Mussels.  They were all great.  I especially liked the Papaya Salad.  Next up with the entre....I chose the Pan Seared Alaskan Salmon with Rossoto.  Yummy!  I also tried some of the Sesame crusted Ahi Tuna...very good.    Ok, so we couldn't decide on dessert and ended up ordering the Warm Chocolate Torte and the Banana Lumpia...Sweet!...in a good way.  All in all the experience was tres manifique.  Down sides are that the place is too noisy for my taste (DJ playing music on Saturday evenings) and the clientele we were sitting across from were definitely rowdy.  One guy had a bit much and looked like he was about to hurl.  I think I might try this place for lunch so I can enjoy the bay view during the daytime.

mxqrheXTe9Z5Md5lKbgYig.review_text: Best. Dinner. Ever. at Butterfly. Every bite was exceptional.   If you're coming to SF for a visit, stop in at lunch or for drinks and take in the view (it's near Fisherman's Wharf). If you're local, treat yourself to dinner. Lost track of what we ordered (tip: pace yourself), so can't make specific recommendations, but it doesn't matter because it was all amazing.  Also, if Chef Robert Lam is in, pay your compliments. He is a great guy who is passionate about what he creates and serves. I'd give him six stars if I could.

XWqMmDx8Bn2oLMwkN3Eipw.review_text: Good service, Average food, Pretty pricy for the kind of flavours you get, hardly any choices for vegetarians, Limited cocktail menu, decent view but nothing wow. Need I say more?  I suggest go there for a early early dinner around 6pm on a weekday. The 3 course menu is only for $25 which makes it worth a visit

Ufug0ofE20FqP5RepEeD6A.review_text: I love most of the food there and you have to try the Happy Hour out its perfect before getting your boogie on at a club. They had live music when I was there which was jammin and you can hear and see the cooks sweatin in the kitchen.  I recommend the Kahlua Pork w/ butter lettuce and some of their signature drinks are quite a sensation for the taste buds. Also the Kobe Beef Sliders are fun and tasty. Oyster shooters are a must at $1 a shot.  Their main menu is great too and the ambiance is perfect with windows looking out to the ocean. Oh and worth a mention they have some beautiful Asian girls working there too.

2r440W55zPn5nLbeMgDK3A.review_text: I've been here several times in the last two years.   I came here for my birthday celebration and we had the steak I believe. It tasted dry and really chewy. I honestly expected a lot more from a restaurant like this! I felt that that appetizers tasted much better! We had the Duct confit spring rolls and the Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups.  The second time I came here was for Happy Hour with my BFF. The drink tasted horrible but the appetizers were at a decent price. Check out their menu on their website.  And lastly, I was here a couple of weeks ago for DAT brunch special. I had the Scrambled Egg and Shrimp Tostada and my date had the Shaking Beef Cobb Salad with Poached Egg. It wasn't too bad and it was a great date environment but I wouldn't go back anytime soon.

7NFp3Ub-AjcNEdBiTtmgcA.review_text: I had the black cod in broth along with a few appetizers. The entree was excellent and the appetizers were quite good. Highly recommend it.

OV3XtMrMFovWJVb0zR21uA.review_text: Went before the Sting concert at the America's Cup Pavilion - no tables available only a "community table". That's fine, but the couch part sags so low that I needed a pillow. Martini and a beer - ok.  Kahlua pig lettuce wraps -good, better than average. Ahi sashimi plate - hubby said tasted good but it looked like slabs of Ahi on a plate. Lacked finesse in plating.  Vegetarian bento box - huh? black underdone sticky rice with some fresh peas, rubbery mushrooms and asparagus stalk (not even a tip to be found) and the egg custard was watery and tasteless. Where was the bok choy?  Steak - hubby said it was dry and not very flavorful.   It seemed to take forever to get our mains - the couple next to us ordered at the same time and were done before we got our food.   Our server disappeared right after taking our order and we weren't asked if we wanted additional drinks. The person actually serving the food was nice and knowledgeable. The table was too wide to carry on a conversation and the place is very very loud!!  If I go back, it would only be for appetizers.

7ErDqJNuoW2_Wzz9xRTW4A.review_text: A gem on the harbor! The food is beautiful and tasty, and the view of the water is amazing.  The spring rolls and fries are the best I have ever had, and  the drinks are art themselves.

8NC-ZsZzMWK1XXQN6hq3Qw.review_text: Asian fusion still tends to be very hit-or-miss for me as I tend to prefer authentic, but Butterfly made the cut. Love the ambiance and decor here, it's one of the better restaurants along the waterfront, and one of the few where the food actually measures up to the view.   After a lycheetini (yummy) and a nice salmon carpaccio chip appetizer with wonton crackers, I had what I still consider one of the better appetizers I've had in an Asian fusion restaurant or anywhere for that matter - shiso-cured albacore sashimi, soy-poached foie gras, yuzu kosho, pomelo grapefruit and avocado. I could have sat there all night eating that and been a happy little pig. The albacore was beautifully fresh, the foie gras added just the hint of richness it needed and there was that unmistakable scent and flavor of shiso. I wanted so much to come back and have this but with the foie ban that dream's been dashed. Oh well.  We also had poached pear salad with endive (very good). The service was excellent.

7lKuXLnk1_fXJX7eOAD3iQ.review_text: Kalua pig lettuce wraps, wok noodles w shaking beef fantastic

_KDcEM6RnguD80t_S167zg.review_text: I have nothing but amazing things to say about my experience at Butterfly. My boyfriend and I went there for our 2 year anniversary and when I called to make a very last minute reservation, they not only squeezed us in for a busy Friday night but they also apparently remembered my mention of the special occasion. We were greeted by our fabulous waitress, Erin, with a Happy Anniversary! and things only got better from there.  The food was absolutely incredible. Every dish was a spectacular mix of unexpected flavors, from our appetizers (strawberry and ahi roll and salmon tempura roll) to our entrees (crab stuffed chicken marsala and scallops/steak surfNturf). The cocktails were also delicious, even my non-alcoholic lemonade spritzer concoction.   And an extra special surprise, the waitress gave us a delicious dessert on the house with a candle for our anniversary. Even the host came by to check in and say congrats. Really this place made our night so special, I dont usually yelp so enthusiastically but I felt they deserved the accolades for their spectacular service and amazing food.

yfG8hiLv0mA0ltTNXERuYQ.review_text: So, I know this is Fisherman's Wharf area and they can charge outrageous prices because of the tourists, but come on. I walked in, saw a "special" that was a rum and coke mix for $11....turned around and walked right back out.

7gACmvYmyPeziSP9EaK9-Q.review_text: Trendy Asian fusion restaurant that becomes a night club with a high price.   Type:  Asian-American fusion type menu with a high class touch.  Menu:  Limited menu perhaps its whats in season. By the way the menu is printed it appears that the menu changes often but I forgot to ask to confirm. The menu was only two pages long. The menu was primarly seafood dishes with a few meat dishes. Items like skirt steak in a soy marinade, sword fish fish, and shellfish.  Drinks:  Full bar, extensive wine menu with some rare ($1000+ bottles), and house cocktail. Wine can be purchased by the glass or by the bottle. Cocktails examples were  Lychee martin and sake moijto.  Price:  Cocktails ranged from $6 up to $12 (rather high for a cocktail). Wine by the glass ranged from $9 to $17 which was also a bit steep. Main entrees ranged from $18 to $30. All in all I found the price to be on the high side for the portion and the quality.   Food:   I ordered the scallops which nicely cooked. Nicely seared with a , served on top of a creamy risotto. The risotto was a bit bland need a some salt or maybe a touch of cheese for saltiness. I tried some of my friends hanger stake and it was tough (over cooked) and bland as well. I was way more impressed by the shrimp and green papaya salad appetizer. The papaya salad was similar to a Cambodian papaya salad served with warm beautifully seasoned shrimp that brought out the sweetness.  I'd say overall the food was under seasoned, under salted, over cooked, and over priced.  On a positive note, the chef did come by and ask how our food was. I have him my honest opinion and hopefully he took the suggestion.   Location:  Easy to find as it was right off of Emarcadero st, but parking was hard.   Service:  Overall the service was not so great. It was slow - taking forever for the waiter to come and take our order, bring us our food, and ask how we were doing. Our waiter was too knowledgeable on the wines. I asked him for a suggestion on a bottle of white that was not too Oaky and slightly crisp and fruity and he and to ask his manager.   Ambiance:  There's a beautiful view of the bay as half the had a open feel with over sized windows over looking the bay. The overall feel was casual with a class touch and a high price. No need to dress up for this place. The decor was quite interesting with large urchin looking light fixtures.

G75mPlQaUY-0S5ye5DTZ6g.review_text: 4 stars are just for the Happy Hour. They have great selection of appetizers for $5-7. The Kobe beef sliders were perfectly cooked. The duck rolls were pretty good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the wrapper. The Kalhua pork in lettuce cups lacked flavor. You definitely need to eat it with the hoisin sauce. The drinks however were tasty and strong.  Overall I think it's a great deal. We had two drinks and 3 appetizers all for $30. The appetizers are a decent portion too.

vAfCCm-sJ-fZCi6PrC38Uw.review_text: Went here for a small farewell lunch for a coworker today. Environment and staff were friendly and attentive. Our individual server was good but unfortunately his tone came off a little snooty. Not overbearingly so, it was just slightly noticeable.  We ordered: Acai Berry Lemonade-DELICIOUS Lychee Martini-Delicious Pomegranate Spritzer: Not a favorite at the table, a little bitter, kind of an odd taste  Calamari: Pretty good calamari. Fresh, tender, light, not oily or greasy. Shanghai Noodles: Delicious, excellent flavor, filled with veggies too. (some in our party complained there was not enough soy sauce, and that the taste was too light, but I thought that was the good part about it. Good flavor without being overwhelming) Strawberry Salmon Spring Roll: Nice and fresh, very light and tasty.  Grilled Snapper: Excellent dish! The fish almost melted in your mouth, comes with sauce and cold vermicelli to mix up and put in butter lettuce cups Loco Moco: Delicious but huge and heavy. Probably good to share with 1 or more peeps. Kobe Burger got great reviews from our table.  Classic Creme Brulee got thumbs up Banana Lumpia with Coconut Ice Cream!!!! OMG I'm dead. It was amazingly delicious and surprisingly light for being fried food.

OPoUR6nKMow0Wk23emHPew.review_text: Although it has been a while since I've been here... all i can remember is that the place was gorgeous, romantic, and DELICIOUS. This place would be my ideal date spot where i could dress up and look good while eating amazing food.   Their presentation for the food is amazing and most of all, i felt like such a grown up while eating here:) -- Mind you, i was 19/20 at that time..   I loved it~ take me there againnnn

Byo0hbnRlg0pRTUpZDYJfQ.review_text: Food was OK. Nothing too orgasmic, but nothing to dislike either. They sort of take a page from the Houli-Benni-han and Co. book and try to make menu items fit the widest number of people possible. This probably isn't a bad business decision given where they are in relationship to touristville. For a place to take some out of towners to that doesn't bring them too far off the wharf, I would probably go back.  I got the sashimi salad - I thought it was super salty near the bottom, and a little bland at the top. Fish was fresh, but the unagi was a little weak. I'd give it something middle of the road, you know, like 3 stars?  Neat ambiance, sort of trendy, beautiful bay views...except all booths point INWARD thus ensuring that at least 50% or more of your table won't have an ocean view! Not so good if you are bringing tourists. Waaay too much wacky tabacky for that interior designer.   Interesting drink menu though! I liked my lychee-tini. Maybe this place hops a bit more as a nightclub...

KcEfVfc5nTPBDonYjJ3wOw.review_text: Made a reservation for Butterfly several weeks ago for a Friday night dinner.  Located at the Embarcadero, my boyfriend was lucky to find any parking in the area for Friday evening. Surprisingly, he found it quickly and close by. It was still a bit odd as to why the streets were so empty that night.  Anyways, we were seated immediately upon entering with a water front! Lucky us! The view was quite the breath taker.  The menu was quite short and was definitely Asian Fusion. My boyfriend ordered the Kalua pig with butter lettuce cups and the sizzling cowboy steak while I ordered the grilled hanger steak "kalbi style". The lettuce cups were quite delicious, the consistency of the pig seemed like pate but way more delicious. The cowboy steak was ..not so good, tasted very charred and came with a cup of wedge potato fries which were good until I bit into an uncooked one. My Kalbi style hanger steak was okay.  Our server was nice and quite funny actually.

P4yX6Jj8cEkokYRRIAxpOA.review_text: Great location, great ambiance, great food!  I went here for a friend's birthday and it really was a great experience. The decor was perfectly San Francisco, and was one of the few places in the city that actually had a lot of space. Plus, there are large windows with views of the water.  I ordered the whole fried fish, and not only did it look like a piece of art, it was DELICIOUS! The cocktails were great as well!  Perfect spot for special occasions!

Tyu8q8eWjSf8Fk6FqtOUZw.review_text: Went there for dinner a few weeks ago and really enjoyed the food.  I ordered the cowboy steak which was delicious.  My wife had the garlic noodles and she really enjoyed them.  The service was friendly and attentive, and the ambiance was pleasant.  I'd definitely go back for more.

8TamMN4wgncGG3nVRK-MIQ.review_text: We had our wedding anniversary dinner here and it did not disappoint.  The wife had booked a table looking out into the Bay, but when we got there it was pitched black outside so we requested for a sofa seat for two and the hostess was nice enough to let us change our mind.  Needless to say it was a very romantic setting.  After looking over the menu, what caught my eyes were the kalua pork appetizer in lettuce cups, the duck confit spring rolls, the Shanghai garlic noodles animal style, and the whole fish over rice cakes and kimchee sauce.  We were leaning with ordering two apps and two entrees with one of the apps as the garlic noodles dish, and we asked our waiter for his recommendations.  Our waiter was very honest and told us the portions were large especially if we were thinking of getting the whole fish so he talked us into getting just one app and have the garlic noodles animal style (meaning pile it on with all the meats) with the whole fish as entrees.  His suggestions were spot on, and the wine he recommended was perfect.  We had the kalua pork for appetizer and it was delicious.  We were very impressed with the garlic noodles mixed with kalua pork, shrimp, and shaking beef; the flavors were perfectly blended and savory.  The whole fish is good but not great, and I would have to say not worth the whopping $39, but we can say we tried it.    For dessert our waiter even put candles on our cakes to commemorate our special date, and they were excellent as well.  Overall I would definitely come back here again.

WaQ7KcZd3wVozXiDFWIDVA.review_text: I ate here for Dine About Town, with 7 friends.  The kahlua pig appetizer is very substantial -- it is more than a full meal in itself.  The shrimp with scrambled eggs was good, but not amazing.    The mimosa is good, and the coffee is decent.  The view is also good.

Z7PaVxobw44iejw3hR0UoQ.review_text: I used to work across the street from Butterfly, but I had never been there until last week.  Given the opinion I had formed about Butterfly, it really is no surprise.  For whatever reason, most people told me that Butterfly was a good place to get a drink, but not a great dinner place.  Having finally visited the restaurant, I respectfully disagree.  The interior decor is true to its San Francisco chic design.  I liked the spacious restaurant floor, the curved bar, the plush booths, the mosaic inlays and the industrial type windows opening onto the pier.  The lighting fixtures that look like gigantic eyes with chopsticks for eyelashes complete the picture.  Yep, cool place.  I am old enough to enjoy an early bird special every once in a while, and dining at 5 pm has its undeniable perks.  One of said perks, of course, is the ability to enjoy a three-course meal for $21.  Yep, you heard it right.  $21 for a three-course meal (view of the Bay included).  I started with their specialty, the Kalua Pig Butter Lettuce Wraps.  It's basically pulled pork with peanuts and BBQ sauce that you wrap in lettuce leaves.  It's delicious, but very messy.  Still, meat appetizer - gotta love that.   For my entree, I had the hanger steak with crispy noodles.  Due to my inattention to detail, I completely missed the part where my steak also came with shrimp.  I carefully set the shrimp aside and enjoyed the tender slices of beef.  For dessert, I indulged in a tiny slice chocolate cake with a generous scoop of coffee ice cream.  Yum!  While the food wasn't particularly memorable or creative, it was a tremendous value.  Our waiter was wonderful, too.  He seemed genuinely concerned that I got the shrimp with my steak, and he offered to replace the dish even though it was totally my mistake.  My friend even complimented the waiter on the job well done.  He made the whole experience even better.  If you're looking for an early dinner, Butterfly might just be the spot!  Check it out.

A4jdVe8Cm84Ul4lCqhYRgQ.review_text: The venue is pretty, however, why are all the seats facing the opposite direction of the bay?    The food was ok, had better asian fusion but, it was a real nice place to have a lite snack (appetizers were good) and share a bottle of wine.  Just think simplicity here and you'll be ok.  It can get pricey for the value.

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: my friends and i (5 in total)  came here on a saturday night where our reservations were at 845. we figured 'wow this place must be nuts for that late of a reservation' when we got in like 1/2 the room was filled and we were thinking like 'i guess we came after the rush'.  anyways, we sat down and with not many people left in the place we got pretty good service. we ordered 3 appetizers.. the kahlua pork, fried calamari, and the mussels. all three were really good. the pork said 'hoisin' sauce.. im chinese and that wasnt hoisin sauce man, that was like bbq sauce. i think it was specially seasoned or something but still tasty. calamari was good and so were the mussels. for entree i got myself the chicken clay pot w/ sticky rice. this was quite tasty as the chicken was made juicy and the stick rice was not burnt at all (minus the edges) from the claypot. it reminded me a lot of a 'law my gai' at dimsum. one of my friends got the bacon wrapper chasiu pork and it was quite juicy and tender as well. the view of the bay (even thought at night) was nice as there was a cruise ship right outside all lit up so it was still nice. the price was no joke. i think i paid liked $45 including drinks, tax, and tip.  the atmosphere is dim but not TOO dim so u cant even read the menu unless u're like near blind. not sure if there is a dress code for dinner but overall everyone in there was dressed nicely so if u came in shorts and tshirt u'd look kinda ridiculous and might feel out of place. id come here again

kqDUn12zJJ1jh30LcOcYLg.review_text: Met friends for Dine About Town lunch.  Excellent!    We shared appetizers and all were plentiful and delicious.  All four of us zeroed in on the snapper for main course.  We all loved it.  It was severed in a hot skillet with noodles, lettuce cups, and sauce  on a plate.  We were encouraged to try the various methods of putting this together and we all went our separate ways.  Lovely, tastey!!  Dessert was wonderful even thought it was a little on the small side - that was just fine the first two courses we generous which is nice as some Dine about places seem to cut back on portion size.  We'll be back!

VcfeYS5htpmtWwDwndkbqg.review_text: Came here with my friend because it was one of the restaurants participating in the dine about SF week!   The service was awesome. We showed up 30 minutes earlier than our schedule reservation but the hostess sat us right away. We were also greeted by the owner who is super friendly. Gave us a complimentary appetizer! I'll get to that in just a little bit. Overall the staff was great the whole night! Super friendly and attentive.   40 bucks for the prix fixe menu wasn't bad at all. We started out with 3 mini appetizers that come with the prix fixe menu. Oyster shooters, fried spam masubi, and a tuna sashimi type of dish. Anyway, the owner came buy to ask us how our meal was going and noticed we left the mint leaf on our plate. He told us we ate the tuna sashimi dish all wrong and told us he'd bring out another order and made sure we ate it the right way. Then we got the duck confit spring rolls and kalua pork lettuce wraps for appetizers. They're both so good and probably my favorite dishes. For our main course we ordered the catfish and the steak hangers. Both were really good but I wish I had read reviews before I ordered! Read that the garlic noodles are amazing so I'll have to come back and try it. For dessert we got the creme brûlée and banana bread pudding. Overall great dinner and I'll be returning for those garlic noodles!

VFo_TVoFKE_M25woNmCUKg.review_text: Didn't visit for the food but for cocktails and attended their Halloween party while visiting San Francisco for the first time. Had an amazing time, the drinks were mixed good, and the view out their window overlooking the beautiful san francisco bay is absolutely amazing. The dance floor was filled with a lot of young people that looked 21 and 22, so they were a little roudy, but I found a dip off area that was for the more mature crowd who wanted to have a good time without being bumped into every second.

bpNI5D5-om3PnKhDLzppXA.review_text: After reading the Yelp reviews we anticipated a very good dining experience here. We arrived at 5:45 for an early Friday night dinner. As we entered, the full window backdrop and interesting urban decor was quite impressive. Our server Danielle was friendly and attentive and recommended a perfectly thirst quenching Mojito on this hot summer night. That's about as positive as it gets at Butterfly.   We ordered two appetizers to start. They were ok to good but overpriced as expected in this location. We continued to read the entrees on the menu when the party next to us was served Kobe Sliders that looked very tasty. Having not seen them on the menu, we asked our server about them and mentioned we'd like to order them. She stated that they weren't on the menu and would ask the manager about it. Now what could be the problem with that? Silly me...  I observed a stern looking man walking with purpose approaching our table. There was no "hello" or welcoming smile. Instead with surly tone and attitude we were told that we could not have the Kobe Sliders, they were only on the lunch menu and that ended at 3:30pm. Now, mind you it is close to 6:30pm. When pointing out the obvious, that the people next to us were served the sacred burgers his only reply was that they had been here since lunchtime and were entitled and he stomped off to attend to higher matters. You know, I'm normally pretty easy going, but was in total disbelief. Shocked at his manner and attitude, we decided to eat our entree elsewhere. Thanked our excellent server, leaving her a generous tip, sympathetic to the fact that she had to work with this lout. This is definitely not the Nordstrom of the food industry. It is a shame that one bad manager can leave a virtual bad taste in your mouth forever.

Ah4eKpJjMho3PMA0PQu_jQ.review_text: I wish I had the chance to take my time here. I was in a huge rush and grabbed a salad at the bar. The service was friendly and they got me in and out on my tight time frame. The food and drinks I did have were all very good. I thought it was a tad pricey but I guess it's to be expected given the location.

I-0Be1dHEacp293TeRUDpw.review_text: Came here for a work holiday party and I ordered the mushroom risotto, which was very good. I shared a few appetizers with my co workers and they were pretty good. Finished off with an amazing dessert.   The staff was GREAT- gave us all (20+) a shot to finish off the meal. Decor= A+.  One of the best places on the Embarcadero!! THE best I have been on the Embarcadero.

JbQnuMvo0NdlKVWIn-3wIA.review_text: One of my fav places to come for some decent food. Cocktails are a bit pricey, but I did like the lychee martini. ;)  Ambience is great as you could see the ocean.

SuNzS3beAgAAMu8cwk8UIw.review_text: I actually came here expecting to pay close to an arm and leg. My friends and I made reservations for a Sunday brunch to celebrate one of our birthdays. First of all, street parking was actually quite easy. (Several spaces on the other side of Embarcadero/ although they are mostly one way streets, it may be hard to get to the parking space, but it's extremely close to Butterfly) The brunch menu was just delightful!! We must have ordered almost one of everything and shared family style. Every single thing we ordered was absolutely delicious! The staff was very friendly, attentive, and kind. The prices were extremely reasonable! (just average brunch prices for a  nice restaurant) The view you get while eating during the day is quite breath taking! I highly suggest coming here especially for brunch!

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: So I've avoided this place for several reasons.  1. Bridge and tunnel crowd on weekend nights when it apparently turns into a nightclub.  2. Tourist crowd during the week.  3.Tacky decor, trying too hard to be "classy".  I was wrong, I was wrong, mea culpa, mea maxima culpa.  Food was delicious, although slightly overpriced even for waterfront real estate.  Drinks were strong and served quickly.  We got an awesome U shaped booth which felt like a private room.  Highlights include this pork thing appetizer, cowboy steak and a passable creme brulee.

I1_5n3j2veqOh9ILBDCcTA.review_text: The food was bland and unappealing.  I had the duck confit which turned out to be extremely dry and close to inedible.  The surf and turn and salmon entrees weren't much better, edible at least but nothing to rave about.  The highlight of the evening was the oyster appetizer, something they didn't have to cook.   The service was horrible, our waitress was nowhere to be found when we needed her.  It took her over 20 minutes to come take our orders after we got our drinks and almost as long for her to come get the check at the end of the meal.  She was juggling two other large parties while the wait staff in the other sections of the restaurant were standing idle.   Note that this was a late dinner on a Friday night, so the restaurant was not even that busy.    Sub par food, terrible service for a high price pretty much sums up the Butterfly experience.  The same food can be had elsewhere for a fraction of the cost.  I suggest that anyone in that area looking for a place to dine skip Butterfly and instead head across the street to Houston's for a much more enjoyable meal.

uegfIBVqiRrrc8D37CL_Rg.review_text: I am a bay area jazz musician - and I play here from time to time with Terrence Brewer.    The food at this restaurant is amazing!   Robbie - the chef - is truly gifted with his inventiveness with the cuisine and the blending of flavors.   Quite unique to my taste - and delicious.   I have tried quite a few of the dishes and they are excellent.   I have not had anything yet - that I didn't care for.    I can hardly wait to be back - and get the next food adventure on the menu!!!   Scrumptious!    He changes the menu around from time to time - which always keeps it fresh.   Cool ambience too ... plus you get great jazz (thursday evenings 6-9)  (plug)

4qsVIa8wP0EDk86VogIs1Q.review_text: Monday's Columbus Day was a gorgeous day in the city and I thought touring the Navy vessels as the latter part of [URL=http://fleetweek.us/fleetweek]Fleet Week[/URL] might be fun. Sadly, there isn't much I'll do that involve standing in a queue for two hours so finding myself near [b][URL=butterflysf.com/]Butterly[/URL][/b] [Pier 33 @ Bay Street, the Embarcadero, San Francisco = 415.864.8999] for a light lunch. Despite an interesting cocktail menu, I was drawn to a three-glass Riesling sampler, what they call the Butterfly flight; Domaines Schlumberger "Les Princes Abbes" Alsace 2004, Gainey Vineyard Santa Ynes Valley 2003, and Saint M Dr. Loosen Pfaltz Germany 2005. These went reasonably well with the two appetizers I ordered; Duck Confit Spring Rolls served with a Chinese hot mustard & honey dipping sauce and Kahlua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups served with hoisin sauce and toasted cashews with green onions. For Asian-inspired bar food, the spring rolls were quite good - very light, crispy wrappers, perfectly fried. Honestly, the meat inside could have been duck confit or pork or chicken. It really didn't matter. The sauce was interesting in that accompanied with the rolls, there was an obvious sweetness which I thought might overwhelm upon entry, but which expanded in the mouth to a pretty decent mustard spice. The Kahlua Pig with lettuce cups was very ample and between the two dishes, far more food than one person could possibly eat. The butter lettuce was a nice change from the classic head lettuce used in lettuce cup offerings. The pork was riddled with a fine dice of assorted bell peppers; orange, yellow, and red. both the pork and the hoisin was topped with toasted cashews which were so finely chopped as to actually look like finely grated cheese or Brazilian yucca powder.
