Not bad for an afternoon interpose because I stumbled on it, but hardly a destination restaurant for me.

RR6chkvedisFnKmo8eu65g.review_text: I've been there on two occasions. Date and a friends bday party. View is great it overlooks the pier. But it can get windy and can smell clammy sometimes. I've tried their regular menu and the calamari is great, the spring rolls were alright. Now for my friends bday party. He had the whole restaurant to himself and serves hor duerves. Food was your average party types. But one thing that got me all goo goo gah gah was their Kobe beef grilled cheese sandwich. It was so good I actually stole the other half I was pushing to give away. It was juicy and the the bread was just thick enough to hold it and it was toasty. Yum!! Lol. The restaurant isn't big but it is nice.

rxtUuGNCk3W6xPWtUwvyDg.review_text: Despite its location, this place is frequented by locals, which is awesome! If you're down after not being able to get tickets to Alcatraz, go there, grab a seat at the bar, try some of their fantastic $5 happy hour cocktails, converse with an amazingly cute bartender as well as locals just getting off work. Oh, and make sure you try the oyster shooter with bloody Mary sauce!  To the two local ladies that happened to be there and took me on a wild night in a limo to some fantastic bars in SF, you rock!

bmOsKiulnHFvl3KAeAzTng.review_text: omg this place the food is great. my favor is their duck dish. Their services is also good.

_piDlvveZEliJsgHFRzFZw.review_text: We didn't eat at the Butterfly Restaurant, but we did have drinks, lots of them. This restaurant is located right next to Pier 33. We stopped in here for a few drinks before the Alcatraz Island tour and couldn't have been more pleased.   This place allowed us to escape the maddness that is tourist-central and have a nice relaxing drink (or 2-3, ok maybe 4 or 5). The vibe of the place was very clean and upscale. I felt like it was a world of its own compared to the Pier. The bartender was funny and very conversational.   Next time I am in San Francisco and stuck doing the tourist thing I will come back to this place for drinks and maybe even food next time to escape the reality of ten billion people walking around aimlessly not knowing what they're doing. If you're looking for an escape, visit here. It'll be worth it.

ff51KRF-qAfQ9T28mUVhJw.review_text: Butterfly was  the best! Jan 1, I was looking for a fun restaurant with interesting food so that my mom, sister and I could enjoy S.F.  Kristine, our waitress, was friendly and offered excellent service! The food was amazing - a variety of menu items - We chose to have two appetizers, Mighty Leaf tea, then snapper for lunch... So fun...   Kristine suggested the chocolate chip cookie with mint ice cream... Yummmmy!  Will definitely be back.   Thx, Butterfly, for offering excellent wait staff, menu, and atmosphere!

0pXXCD3lq3DwpYpKFFGxMw.review_text: This review is for Butterfly Lounge, not the restaurant. Pure Entertainment was hosting a party there last night (partywithpure.com) so I went with about 15 people for my birthday. Reserved a table/bottle service beforehand. What does bottle service get you and your guests at this place? You get to... 1. Freeze your ass off outside for 30 minutes while they kick the restaurant patrons out. Sorry, can't go in, not even to stand at the bar or I don't know...the bathroom? 2. Finally your "hostess" comes out. Her first words were, "I need your credit card." Really? No "how are you doing tonight"? Or "sorry these punk Fast and Furious-looking promoters made your party wait so long"? Nope. Takes your card. Walks you to your table. Tells you that her gratuity will automatically be added to the bill. Thanks. That walk from the door to the table was really tiring, wasn't it? Go ahead and give yourself $50. You earned it. By the way, didn't see her again for the rest of the night. 3. Once you're in, you can't go outside, not even by yourself so you can bring your friends in. Some of them had to pay cover even though they were on my guest list. My friends and I did have a good time once we were all situated, but that had more to do with the drinks and the music, and nothing to do with your service. So you get 0 stars for the shitty service + 1 star for the location + 1 star for the atmosphere/ambiance = 2 stars. Butterfly Restaurant - if you don't want your ratings to go down, maybe you shouldn't let shitty promoters like Pure host events at your place anymore.

xY3ownXim-r405C-SquKRw.review_text: Two of my closest friends since high school brought me here last month for my birthday (Thanks again D.A. and R.C.).  Why it's taken me so long to review is a "shame on me" moment.  Here is what I had.  To drink: White Sake Sangria ($9) - gekkeikan sake, skyy berry vodka, acai juice  I don't drink, but I wanted to try something besides water or soda.  The drink was very good.  I would order again.  To snack on: Kalua Pig with Butter Lettuce Cups ($12) - Hoisin Barbeque Dipping Sauce, Pepper Brunoise, Toasted Cashews, Minced Green Onions  I like lettuce, but I got reminded that night that butter lettuce is soooo good.  But seriously, when is pork not good?  Very good appetizer and nice hint that the food is good at this location.  Definitely would recommend.  The main dish: Bacon Wrapped Pork Loin "Char Siu" ($26) - Grits and Goat Cheese Popover, Curried Apple Slices Upland Cress, Szechuan Numbing Peppercorn Sauce.  It was too good!  I had to take the rest home.  The flavors worked so well with each other.  Talk about "good to the last bite"!  And for dessert...: Warm Chocolate Torte with Mitchell's Coffee Ice Cream ($7)  Chocolate and Coffee Ice Cream.  Sinfully delicious.  Really, do I need I say more?  I'm ashamed to say I forgot the server's name (worked on 2/9/11), but he was fantastic.  Never had to ask for our glasses to be refilled.  Kept us updated on when the food would be ready.  Always pleasant when speaking to us and never made us feel rushed.  Looking forward to taking the wife here in the future.

9fFKbfh4ElPdStd3x6ShVg.review_text: Ordered: House Smoked Salmon and Strawberry rolls (this was different but interesting with a taste of strawberry in a spring roll), garlic noodles with shaking beef (this was delicious and flavorful), sesame crusted tombo tuna (this was very fresh and the black rice and stuffed mushrooms were a good compliment), and chocolate torte with ice cream (a great way to end the meal.)  Service: The waiters were very attentive and checked in with us several times to see if we needed anything else. I did feel a bit rushed though as they came several times to try to take away one of the plates which was not completely finished yet.  Cost: The place was pricey as to be expected for the area, but we had a Living Social coupon so it was the perfect opportunity to try the place.  The view of the water was very nice. Unfortunately, the setup of the booths next to the windows had our backs facing the water.   We really liked the place, but we probably will not go back, due to the price. The amount we paid was definitely a deal. It probably would not have been worthwhile at the standard price.

l36ud3agBxzBJ88zIeNVfA.review_text: I'm a fan of any restaurant on the water and Butterfly's winning wharf side spot made for a great time Saturday night.   The Asian fusion restaurant offers a delicious menu in an appealing and attractive atmosphere. Cozy wooden booths sit by large windows with an expansive view of the Bay. Butterfly is a perfect place to bring a date or enjoy a cocktail before a night out. The drink list is creative - we sampled the brandied cherry Cosmo and the tasty kumquat margarita. We only stopped in for drinks, but I'll be back for more of  their menu and  view!

tcXbDFbFKrEA3Bks_zAm0Q.review_text: Went for brunch after making reservation on Open Table. They forgot to mark that we made it and I didn't get points for the reservation. It was empty anyway so I guess no reservation needed. Was pretty upset they tried to pass off store bought orange juice when it says fresh squeezed and then when it was clear it wasn't I asked and he first said yes but then came back and apologized and said it was Odwalla because they ran out from the night before. It didn't taste at all like odwalla. It tasted like from concentrate minute maid or something similar. I didn't even drink it because I really dislike that kind of orange juice and wouldn't have ordered if it I'd known it wasn't fresh squeezed. He didn't offer to take it away or off the bill. The food was just okay. He was a nice server otherwise.

zpT7HWE3o77YVfG4S07H9A.review_text: After being seated at the table our waitress quickly gave us our menu and water. POOF, then she was gone and we were neglected for the rest of the evening.   A year later, she came back to take our order.   A decade passed and our food came. (DISGUSTING, HORRIBLE, BLAND, UGHHH....) EXCEPT for the oysters. I will never complain about raw oysters.   Check please.   A century rolled by and the check was finally brought to our table.  I'm serious, we only saw our waitress 3 times the entire night.

7-3hVAMj42uAyc3oiVIlQA.review_text: Great location on the water with a beautiful view.  The food, which we opted to order from the prix fixe menu, was fair--nothing special.    Herein lies the rub:  my friend made reservations for 15 and said we might scale down.  They said no problem, but then ended up charging our party of 10 for 15 dinners at $55 a pop.  They also added a 21% gratuity on top of that.  We did convince them to charge only for the actual number of people who were in our party, but they acted like they were doing us a big favor.    Three stars instead of two just cuz it's pretty, and the service was quite good before they tried to screw us.    Also, note that they have a door leading out to some outdoor pub tables where people smoke, so the cigarette smoke wafts into the restaurant.

iChrn349gyWB-8UGyn8a6Q.review_text: I've heard so many things about this restaurant, and met one of the owners while working at a bank.   Originally our reservation was at 8:30pm, and we kept calling to downsize our group size, and changing our reservation time. Thank God they were nice about it, and actually put up with our annoying phone calls. When we got there it was about 9:30pm, so there was a lot of parking around, when we got in the guy greeted us and showed us to our table. We wanted to sit at the table that had the view of the water, but that table didn't fit our group size.   By the time we ordered it was already 10pm, and the kitchen is suppose to close at 10! Sorry guys!! Our server was super nice and friendly, and politely told us that the kitchen is suppose to close at 10, they even waited for some of our other friends to get there. Thanks!  Our bill came out to about $630, 2 bottles of wine, 12 entrees, and 3 appetizers, not too bad! I had the mesquite grilled angus new york steak, and garlic seared clams and mussels, yummy!! The mussels and clams were really good, and the steak was pretty good too, I can't say it was the best I ever had, but it was pretty good!

Rdnna6TsExe6C3mQ-X0Pwg.review_text: Ate at Butterfly for the second time with my partner on New Year's Eve. Fantastic menu with each dish prepared with flavors that complemented perfectly. Loved the Lobster Pie! The chef came out to greet us, which was. Really nice.

Xir5rbzK3SHurnL2xiSuGg.review_text: Memorable evening at Butterfly. Fabulous and beautifully prepared food, excellent service that was the right amount of friendly, professional and attentive. Breathtaking views. Such a wonderful evening. Thank you Butterfly, we'll be back!!

IpoGA0tOeCXlDEyNH8RuhQ.review_text: It's a great place to eat if you're starving after your Alcatraz tour, as I was this past weekend when I had a friend in town.  The views are great, the service was AWESOME (the managers and all waitstaff were very chatty and friendly), but the food was - egh.  Well, at least what I had.  They start you off with edamame, but it's DOUSED in sea salt, vinegar and pepper.  Who can eat edamame that way?  It's way too messy, and the sea salt was overpowering.  I ordered the sashimi trio salad, and if you like sashimi, don't do it!  It was just too many flavors going on at once - smoked salmon, fried unagi, hamachi, and i think magoro?  Then there's avocado, blackened rice, some sort of vinagrette, AND ponzu sauce!  All of that together just made me kind of sick.    My friend had the fried egg sandwich, though, and thought it was okay, so it's of course possible that the rest of the menu was good.  I had some of her fries, though, and didn't care for those either.  Basically, the only way I'd go back is if I had another tourist in town, and wanted a view with a drink.

1yeS87Cj8DhbLXSLYxzIzw.review_text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Butterfly before. We're fairly regular diners there; it's just steps from our apartment.   I had become a creature of habit, ordering the encrusted filet of ahi tuna, time after time. So it goes without saying that I found that wonderful. But last night I ventured to try the braised short ribs. I espcially liked the vegetables it was served with.

EOOKjbhFULW25Nu-WDNKOQ.review_text: This review is for lunch during Dine About Town. My family and I dined here and had a wonderful experience.  Appetizers: I started with the duck spring rolls. I was thinking they'd be like Vietnamese spring rolls (cold with the white wrapper), but they were fried more like egg rolls. Still good, just not what I was expecting. My sister had the salad which was very large and came with edible flowers in it!  Entrees: The meatballs came on a sizzling hot platter with meet cooked three ways. It also came with noodles and lettuce so that I could make lettuce wraps. Everything about this dish was delicious! Definitely my favorite of our meal. We also had the garlic noodles. They are very generous with their portions. They were a bit on the salty side for me, but good overall. The meat in the shaking beef salad was very soft and tender.  Dessert: When they say mini creme brulee, they mean mini. I enjoyed the small size because I was pretty full, but it was nice to have a taste of something sweet.  I enjoyed the set up of the restaurant with nice decorations and a view of the water. The chef was very nice. He came around to greet us and check to make sure our meal was going well :)

C-xIof26EjDwaiicQFz9mg.review_text: i was being a tourist with my friends from out of town and decided to have dinner at Butterfly. I never really thought much of this place because i try not to be a tourist on a daily basis. very impressive- great service and ambiance. the specials were excellent! i changed my mind about being a tourist. there are some great places here at the pier.

HDkhweDstguTl-RCFleGrA.review_text: After avoiding this restaurant for several years, we decided to return for Sunday brunch with a group of friends.  We walked into the restaurant and asked to be seated at a booth near the window.  We were told that the seats were reserved for "larger groups."  Needless to say, the table remained empty. If the restaurant was busy, maximizing seating would be understandable. However, this is definitely not a hot brunch spot.  The lack of customer focus from the start tainted the experience.

COOkF0Kyvsz-BL5b96Js0A.review_text: Overall great experience. Excellent food coupled with excellent service. We ordered the calamari (excellent), the wagyu burger (ok), the braised short ribs with bok choy and butternut squash puree (delicious), and finished with the bread pudding with coconut icecream and bruleed bananas (wow). They really go the extra mile in terms of plating, taste, and service although we requested a window seat in our reservation but none were available. A little bit on the pricier side although not bad at all. We would definitely come back but maybe for lunch when we can enjoy the view.

AozkMkgw6hgLELaksn6V0g.review_text: I see this place as a potentially good choice for a private event. The space can accommodate a large crowd while still remaining intimate. The ambiance and the location make for a great venue to set up a private party.  As a restaurant on the other hand- mehhh. The view here is great- it IS on the water, blah blah. There are better choices in the area to choose from for the price. Dishes at Butterfly aren't unpleasant, but they are also in no way unique in flavor or presentation. The live music is a plus for late-night dining, but other than that- and the view of the water- there just wasn't anything extraordinary about this restaurant.

S1UfaWG22oLVqVxZJkTLxg.review_text: went there for thanksgiving dinner.....good stuff.  traditional ingredients with modern cooking.  nice dining room w high ceilings in the ferry building.

uw0SaD8sBZ4ZvLR1vCd2IQ.review_text: What a great place. wish we had gone there a long time ago. Finally got there. Enjoyed everything from great happy hour drinks and appetizers to special delicious meals that were vegetarian for my husband and a crab delight for me. The best array of crab dishes ever. Wonderful food and service. Enjoyed the entire time and the perfect bay views.

2UnlEnEURLgFTTd8YmB5-g.review_text: First time here.  We were waiting for the ferry to alcatraz and this spot did not disappoint.  I ordered the Sailor's Punch which is a house specialty.  Although I enjoyed it I didn't care for the initial taste of jalapeños as this is made with fresh crushed ones.  We orders several appetizers and the were delicious.  The pork and scallion meatballs and the spoons sampler were my favorite.

DvArWwFCs_7zRL8dy297wQ.review_text: Exciting presentation, yummy flavored, and love the ambiance. Friendly staff and very accommodating.

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: We came in for dinner on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. We had a reservation and were seated promptly.  We brought our own bottle of wine (next time I will come when the sun is still up and try their cocktails, view is amazing and the bar area is beautiful!)  We started with the ahi poki app which i adored.  It was a fun and creative spin on a classic.  We also tried the kahlua pork lettuce wraps which were tasty.  We decided to split the miso cod entree which was the only disappointment of the night.  The cod was tough and dry.    Because he asked, we did mention this to our waiter. We were really not looking for any kind of bill adjustment, but not only did our waiter comp the entire dish, he passed along our feedback to the chef who came to chat with us.  Both the server and chef were warm, friendly, and genuinely interested in our feedback.    We so appreciated the strides made in an effort to provide us with a pleasant experience. I would love to come back and try more dishes and the cocktails, and hopefully upgrade my review!

416uX1dOkO0kj8tkCfhnCw.review_text: (+) - wok seared garlic noodles (10) w/ shaking beef (9) - banana bread pudding  (-) - duck confit springrolls - small menu selection  First time I ate here for lunch I was severely dissapointed with the duck confit springrolls. Duck is my favorite but I couldn't taste it at all, was just a deep fried mass of stuff. I was ready to write this place off after that.  Luckily I came here again for dinner and had a much better experience. The wok seared garlic noodles with shaking beef (19 bucks total) was amazing, beef was tender and flavorful (a heavy entree, will cause naptime). I also ordered the banana bread pudding for dessert which was yummy, not too sweet. Only complaint was that though it wasn't very packed that night service seemed extremely slow, food took long to come out, and waiters took forever to get us the check.  Entrees are mostly $12+, prices typical of the area.  Pass on the duck springrolls but anything + shaking beef is probably a good bet.

Aus32SljWq-cUghdmWYWMQ.review_text: Well i was lucky enough to come here and eat for free  since it was my moms birthday so everything was paid for, We ended up juggling every dish onto smaller dishes so everyone share everything  its much better this way as i got to try almost everything. We had 5 people and all choose one appetizer and one entrée.   The most memorable of the appetizers was the pig =P oohh it came in a small potion you would spoon into balls of butter lettuce and then pour a little bit of this (delicious) house barbecue sauce on top... it was killer. The duck rolls were good, father said it was a lil dry. The spicy edabame was only decent nothing special.  We also got a round of their mixed drinks and 2 desserts the best drink was the pear martini i got the lychee-tini it was okay..(came with actual lychee fruit which was a plus)   And the best dessert was the chocolate cake (with warm choloate filling) and ice cream come here on a special occasion when its okay to go for the exotic stuff.  Oh yea and we got the best table in the house it was almost too big to hear each other talk its located in the back corner we got it with 5 people somehow!  (seats at least 8) yelp on

Ioza-vgFDboStUukytZlnQ.review_text: For our first dinner together in SF, my girlfriend's and I ate here because we were able to get a last minute reservations on 2-12-2011.  We didn't the window, but the decor and ambiance of the restaurant was nice.  The service was great!  For appetizers, we ordered the Garlic Noodles and Garlic Seared Clams and Mussels.  I had the Vegetarian Bento Box because I was not really hungry.  We ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir to share.    The clams and mussels were great, but the Asian dishes were OK.  I guess if you eat a lot of Asian food like I do, I did not see anything special except for the presentation. Sorry, I had to be honest.

wc6LipnriqtHZOcV8LXzLg.review_text: My family and I used to go up to San Francisco once a year to visit my cousins up north and every time we'd stop by this beautiful restaurant. They're located on Pier 33 overlooking the water. It's more of a romantic, intimate restaurant, but my parents and little brothers love the food so we've always come with family! The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. They even made virgin cocktails (the lycheetini is my favorite!) for my little brothers so they could fit in with the adults! The duck spring rolls are amazing and the cowboy steak is to die for! These are dishes that we always order when coming here. It's the perfect place if you want just a touch of asian spices! It's also conveniently located near Fisherman's Wharf, so after eating a large meal you can walk it off and explore SF! If you're in the area, I highly recommend you try this place at least once!

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: I'll start by saying I was here recently as part of a company party - so my experience doesn't necessarily reflect a typical dining experience.  Also, I had no say in what food was served - maybe that's a good thing because I enjoyed the food much better than last time around.  * garlic noodles - filling but typical and uninteresting * edamame - a little limp and overcooked, i thought they were supposed to be just blanched? * tuna tartare on a spoon - yum * kobe beef sliders - wow, great beef and on grilled/toasted bread slices, much better than hamburger buns * french fries - nothing special * fried calamari - done pretty well, nice small slices just lightly fried * kalua pig with butter lettuce Cups - nice twist on the squab w/ lettuce  Above average food for company party and nice cocktails too.  The staff were also very nice and helpful and didn't even seem to mind when we had an impromptu dance party.  Is it enough to inspire me to return on my own?  The jury is still out on that one.

1MZlM1TfOv0zs96dw3S8sA.review_text: Not too many choices of entrees and mostly none for vegetarians. ..wasn't too impressed with the spread not the pricing. ..wouldn't recommend if you like regular south Asian food. ..

MXKFD4S60KHoGogOwDR3Sw.review_text: It was a cool weary November evening. We were seated by the window the lighting was perfect there were candles lit, dim spotlights and a dark cloudy forecast. I think it was that moment when I was sipping my glass of Pinot Noir and I looked over to him I realize I loved him.  We order the Kahlua pig which is now one of our favorite dishes and it never goes unordered. I had my clams and mussels because I like the tomato sauce. I've tried almost everything on the menu and I love them all. Now that we are trying to save money we come during happy hour.  They offer a cocktail for $5 and most of our favorite appetizers are only $5 (the portion are smaller) some larger dishes like the ribs and kobe sliders are $7. My husband and I would sit at the bar and order a storm (quiet like the storm the day I fell in love)

SLOmbZq9IlzNHgXr6p-ZdQ.review_text: I really enjoyed the decor and feel of this restaurant.  I have to say our server was a tad prefentious, but I had emailed them about my girlfriend and I coming for an anniversary, so they put us at the most romantic table in my opinion and they brought out a little coconut ice cream with a candle after dinner.  The drinks were costly but well prepared, and the view was spectacular.

59taFywC94rseFrt6J5c3A.review_text: Saw the Check Please Bay Area segment on Butterfly, bought a Bloomspot coupon and went out to celebrate a job promotion.   The location is very tourist-y and the exterior looks rundown, but the service was good and the food was fantastic: wonderful taste combinations, really good quality ingredients, artful presentations. The menu has only a small number of entree choices, but a good variety.  I had a warm appetizer of peas, kale, mushrooms and a barely poached egg: it managed to taste healthy and luxurious. The salt and pepper calamari was tender and crispy coated. The creme brulee and coffee were also really good.  We plan to return and bring friends.

NiiTQLAnJnCa7eV1bMsRpA.review_text: SO good! Went there for lunch and the calamari is delicious!! Had tumeric grilled snapper and it was awesome! Totally recommend this restaurant!!

dRhlKLrcxO3vtsACNhb2eg.review_text: Beautiful location. Amazing decor.   I tried the miso glazed cod. It was soaked in some liquid so it lost it's miso flavor.   We also got the fried whole fish which was amazing. Great sauce that accompanied it.   Food is. 3.5 Ambience is a 5 Location a 4

TVJoa1isoHj02_iToGaXcA.review_text: If you don't want to take any chances and go somewhere where you know you're going to get a great meal, come here. I've been here at least half a dozen times and have yet to taste something I didn't like. In case you're wondering, I'm not one of those people that likes everything.   Anyway, come here for solid food, good service and well made drinks. The space is hit or miss I think. I'm not big on the decorated warehouse look though I know some are. If you go, go on a clear night and request a seat next to the windows. They have wall to wall windows that can offer a great view. This is a good place to go for a romantic date or in a group. But, either way, it's a place you should definitely keep on your list to check out at some point.

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: I went to Butterfly for Easter Brunch and I was really pleased with the whole experience.  We were seated quickly and given a quiet table with a decent view of the bay (from between two piers).  Our server was a really nice kid who maintained friendly banter until the place got busy and then continued to be friendly, if not quicker in his coming and going.  The banana waffles were great and the salmon scramble with asparagus and tobiko was superb.  I especially liked the kick of wasabi tobiko and the thick slices of toast.  However, the desserts are the reason I will likely revisit Butterfly.  We only had enough room to split the chocolate torte with coffee ice cream and raspberry compote (although, by my definition, three whole and seemingly untouched raspberries does not a compote make), and it was absolutely perfect.  The rest of the list looked just as appetizing and I hope to sample all of them at some point.  If you ever want to befuddle the staff at Butterfly, just have your whole table order their coffee black.  Our first server told us how "hard core" he thought we were, and a later filler (I think he was management) looked at our table with shock and asked if he could please get cream and sugar for us, as though we must have been deprived for 45 minutes, but had not managed to rectify the situation with our server.    Aside coming across a little bit daft, the people at Butterfly were great.  The service waned as the brunch rush progressed, my companion's coffee being refilled the first time after two small sips, but later my cup sat empty for five or ten minutes.  I think the server caught himself though, and even at the end of the meal offered to keep the refills coming as long as we wanted to stay.  I'm not sure I would go so far out of my way for brunch in the future, but if I wanted dessert and a drink in a stylish, peaceful environment, or if I found myself hungry on the Embarcadero on a Sunday afternoon, I would certainly return to Butterfly.

dz2SfpRYthqq_GFf2kku-A.review_text: Parking - easy Bartender - fantastic Drinks - tasty  ...and now on to the food...  Calamari appetizer - some of the BEST calamari I've ever had Salmon carpaccio - equally delicious Duck rolls - not bad, but the sauce did not match the taste of the rolls whatsoever Hanger steak - absolutely HORRIBLE. I seriously could not chew through this thing. I ordered medium and it seemed like it was well done. I know hanger steak is generally a tougher cut, but dear god - BLEGH Creme brulee - simple, effective, tasty Chocolate cake with coffee ice cream - the ice cream was delish!  Overall the service was good, but the steak REALLY killed the whole experience. No way am I coming back for dinner. Drinks and appetizers, MAYBE.

5tMQhkczZzwfnSa8jBXP4w.review_text: Butterfly continues to be great, outstanding flavor in cocktails & food.  Very attentive & friendly staff, reasonable prices, unusual menu, beautiful presentation.

dHK2Tp9LzNyns-G15uX2wg.review_text: We went there on a Saturday afternoon and were seated right away. Ordered a couple cocktails (really good), the calamari for an appetizer ( really good) and a couple entrees (not so great). The decor and view are beautiful and the full bar has a lot to offer, though they only have bottled beers. Price-wise, I was expecting more from the entrees. The two we had, kobe beef burger (it was bland and dry! Implies they don't know the right way to cook it) and a Vietnamese sandwich, left a lot to be desired. Additionally, there were "fries" served with our entrees that were more like massive chunks of potato...but, hey, some people probably love that. Overall, I'd recommend this place as a good place to share some drinks and appetizers.

HYLKemqNWx054sBNn4mUUQ.review_text: Restaurant = 4 stars Lounge/Club = 3 stars  Went here for my friend's bday dinner on a Saturday night (Happy Bday Rachelle!).   Good food, friendly waitress, nice ambiance, and the chef even came out to chat with us (shake 'em Jenny).  If you are with a group of 10 or more people, the menu will be prix fixe and i think its around $45 per person.  Stayed for the after-hours lounge thing and partied till it closed. Got a booth/table and the chick refilled our drinks often and cleared the empty cups with lightning speed. The place is pretty small but it didnt matter that night cuz it was all about the company.  I've been here when it's really crowded and can't really see past all the people when stumbling around with my hair in my face =P

Ha4mOL_9JtmYgn7NvrAu6A.review_text: Generally a place like this would probably get three stars from me. I was not overly impressed with the place in general. Nice interior and good view but yeah not some place I would make a special trip to because it is quite expensive. Oppressively so.  BUT the salmon-strawberry spring rolls are ROCKIN. There really is no other choice.  Their happy hour is pretty good to. Put the salmon rolls on the happy hour menu and you get another star. Because THAT I would make the trip for.

YgUm2M0O9dUCM4MKXjqr5g.review_text: We went there on a Saturday night with a large party for a 40th birthday. We selected a fixed price menu with "family style" appetizers and a choice of several entrees and desserts. Appetizers were great. While everyone at the table who ordered the fish was very happy, I happened to order the filet mignon. It was a complete disaster. It is very difficult to mess up a filet mignon. It was overcooked. Also, the sauce was gross with melted blue cheese on top which did not blend with the sauce at all.  What upset me the most was the gratuity. An 18% gratuity was included since we a large party, which is standard and I was okay with. However, there was an additional 3% tip included as a "booking fee". Apparently calling up the restaurant and making reservations via a manager incurs this fee. I think this is pure garbage to be charged extra for what should just be good customer service. The restaurant was not even busy on a Saturday night and we could have just walked in which seemed a little scary to me.  The view looked fantastic but we couldn't really tell since it was dark. I am not in a hurry to rush back to Butterfly.

9unlBkftcCxEuOzPliukQw.review_text: Butterfly has great ambiance with excellent location if you want a view of the waters. However, the restaurant is dimmed and you can't see the waters at night. Our server took forever to get our order and when she finally came by our table, she says "I heard you're in a hurry." Hmmm...I guess we were since we've been waiting over half an hour. The food was nothing impressive and very pricey. Not a surprise for a fancy restaurant by the Piers. We decided to order drinks and appetizers. The duck confit spring rolls weren't that great. Our rolls came out super hot and burned my tongue as I took my first bite. I barely tasted duck, mainly mushrooms. The rolls wouldn't have been as good if it weren't for the spicy hot mustard & honey dipping sauce. The ahi poke nom nom wraps surprisingly had more tuna than expected. They tasted great and refreshing. However, I'd rather have them wrapped in seaweed than mint leaves. Lastly, we ordered the kalua pork and butter lettuce cups. Probably my favorite app of the night. They gave out more pork than expected and we had leftover pork after going through all the lettuce. We decided to put some hot mustard sauce from the duck rolls and it gave a good kick to it.  Overall, pricey and mediocre food. Probably won't return.

Q0lVWuGEjmy9btWhmjlJ8Q.review_text: I want to like if not love this place but I simply can't.  Butterfly is a really nice restaurant and is very well decorated creating such a romantic ambiance.  I came here along with a party of 20 for my friend's birthday party in June 2009.  Hmm, where to start?  They took reservations which was nice since we had such a big group and wouldn't want to wait, would you?  The birthday girl had a set menu with a list of entrees everyone get to choose from.  Appetizers were shared and everyone had their individual fix of creme brulee or chocolate molten lava cake for dessert.    I had the chicken and my boyfriend had the swordfish for our entree.  The food definitely did not scream and was such a disappointment.  From the chicken to the fish, it was dry and the rest of the party agreed.  For $60+ per person, this was definitely not worth it.  Feels like a lot of meals are prepared and served with such poor quality maybe because I'm with such a huge group.  But if a restaurant cares about quality a whole lot, no mistakes should be made - at least not all the dishes served for the party.  My boyfriend and I were both very disappointed and could not enjoy our meal for the price of over $120 total!  It's very hard for me to give restaurants a second chance if the prices are fairly high because like I said, I would much rather spend this amount to try out another high end restaurant.  If the food and service wowed me, of course I would love to come back and recommend the restaurant to my friends, family, and peers.    Butterfly is definitely a nice restaurant to take a date.  I don't want to say much about the quality of the foods because I read both good and bad reviews but it's up to YOU to determine if this is your liking and your kind of dinning experience.  For me, it could have been the big party that lacked the quality of the foods but still, there shouldn't be any excuses for any restaurant establishments.  If you dine here late, Butterfly restaurant turns into a lounge!  It was pretty cool since we were there till the music started pumping up the romantic atmosphere to a party scene.  We actually thought of just staying here to party all night than to leave and find parking in downtown to party!

PWMRXCXdOG6B_FXe-Lj-JA.review_text: Expensive restaurant / bar that's actually worth it. Views , ambiance , service , presentation , yup it's all there. Deep, unfinished, raw beam ceilings, a wall of windows looking over the water , decadent frosted glass bar with eerie blue glow, stainless steel, exposed kitchen, hip bathrooms. The space was amazing, is it for rent and when can we move in?  Another thing to note is that the servers know the right amount of involvement, not too much, not too little, know when to shoo those indecisive folks at your table.  We dropped about 80 pp on a DINE OUT FOR LIFE charity event in which Levis participated and my SO volunteered made the bill impact more palpable Probably the best high-end dining experience I've had so far in my 1+ years living in SF by way of NYC  TIP:  you can street park with easy after 6ish during the weeknights and there's a paid lot right next door for those wearing heels or other encumbrances that make walking a block or two difficult.  Taxis are a snap to grab there too (unlike Polk street  / North Beach on a weekend/frat boy/bridge and tunnel night)

Kfu1ysXIJj1IxeFpAvZiAA.review_text: My fiance and I tried Butterfly for the first time last week and we both left extremely full, very satisfied, and committed to coming back again given how much we enjoyed the restaurant. Below is a summary of our dining experience:  Appetizers: First, Butterfly serves bottomless edimame instead of bread, which made me feel less guilty given the quantity I ate. We ordered the Kalua Pig lettuce wraps, which were mouth watering tender and flavorful, and an asparagus dish served with a semi-cooked egg, flat rice noodles, and a few other fixings. This was was by far one of the most unique and delicious creations I've had in recent memory. We'll definitely be ordering these two appetizers again the next time we're here.  We were also treated to the bloody mary oyster shooters, which was tasty despite my dislike for oysters, and a couple of rolls, which were really good but not "blow your mind" spectacular.  Entrees: I ordered the 24 oz sizzling cowboy steak, a bone-in ribeye masterpiece surpassing my expectations for quality and quantity! The steak was cooked to order (medium rare), was very tender and had great flavor. My fiance ordered a fish dish, though I don't recall specifically which one since I was busy battling my 24 oz steak. However, she did tell me that she LOVED it, so I'll just have to take her word for it that it was good.  Dessert: By the time we finished our entrees, we were beyond stuffed. But our server hooked it up with the lychee shaved ice, which was perfect. The shaved ice had great flavor as the lychee is literally infused into the liquid used to make the ice. The dish was also very light which was perfect.  Service: I can't forget to mention the service. Our server, Cody, was awesome. He knew the menu like the back of his hand, and checked in with us at regular intervals, such that we weren't neglected nor were we annoyed.  Overall, we had a wonderful experience at Butterfly and will certainly be back again soon!

YblGdDKZFqf45jKNDm4sqQ.review_text: I have come here with friends and family quite a few times and from our first experience to the last, it has  always been enjoyable.   The restaurant has a unique take on food and has a romantic and comfortable atmosphere; but it does get loud on some nights, especially when there is live music. Service is also always attentive and informative on the menu.   When it comes to the food, I go for their happy hour, since it is a lot less expensive than their actual menu and has some good bites. Their calamari is a must have! Super tasty and hardly greasy. Another go to dish is their steak fries and pork lettuce wraps. Yum!   Their main menu has some yummy dishes as well; I once tried a gnocchi dish with stuffed squash blossoms. Another time during Christmas, the chef, who is one of the nicest people I have met, praised us for trying the stuffed crab. Super messy but awesome.   Their dessert is quite nice too. My favorites are the chocolate ganache, banana pudding, and creme brulee.   What is a little disappointing about this place is that because their food is seasonal, some of their epic dishes disappeared :(.

R15bbL8vNMvnseSB3FrCpA.review_text: By far, one of the best options when you're in the fisherman's warf area. A great mix of environment (a sharp interior situated on the water with sweeping views), creative food, and great cocktails too.  Don't be intimidated by the prices here - you can have a reasonably priced, low-key meal with the appetizers menu fi you want. Entrees are $30/each, but they seemed boring compared to the appetizers, which average $10 and are on the large side. We wanted a light meal so we split 2 appetizers which was plenty of food.  We loved the duck confeit spring rolls (with a delicious Wasabi sauce), and the garlic noodles that seemed to be on everyone's table but ours looked amazing.  Enjoy!

FlWVOSfv9k7FKPo4j_C1dw.review_text: Kristine is the best bartender in San Fran! If you're down by the piers, be sure to stop in for amazing martinis and cocktails.  Try the gimlet, the lycheetini, or the cherry blossom.

uxJPQd5Ro4OjVjVmHKRdjA.review_text: My BF and I were having an intimate dinner there and they sat us in these unusually, contemporary booths that were NOT facing the water when there were booths that were facing the water and were clearly FREE. Well I can't complain about the food because we enjoyed the whole meal.  For Appetizers: We only tried the hot appetizers. So, we ordered the Duck Confit Spring Rolls & the Fire Fried Calamari. They were both very delicious!! The Calamari, along with the dipping sauce, was the BEST calamari I've had, so far.  I shared the entree and we had the Free range Rocky Jr. Chicken Clay Pot and that, also with the sauce, was pretty decent.  The horrible part of our night was when the server poured my BF water. He drank it and felt some weird texture in his mouth. He took it out, thought it was a piece of black rice, put it down on the table, and it started MOVING. IT WAS A DISGUSTING BUG!!!!   To compensate for the whole meal, management kindly offered to pay for the meal AND add a complimentary dessert.   Dessert was a warm bananas foster on top of coconut pineapple ice cream. That was just alright.  Overall, The atmosphere, service, and food were good. They just have to watch out for their sanitation and pest control.

WQgG6mB6hSWv91ypHcUeXA.review_text: We just came back from a great night at Butterfly - the fourth time we've been and we're sure to be going back again.   Butterfly is reliable. You can always expect a number of great food options, a diverse wine list and attentive service.  This time I enjoyed the tuna tartar with sesame for starters and a medium rare angus skirt steak with cab/sauv sauce for entree.  We managed to finish off the evening with a (shared, thankfully) molten chocolate torte with coffee ice cream.  Yum.   One thing to note - everything on the menu sounds and tastes great, which can make it an expensive night out (if you want to try everything like we do)!  PS - this would've been a 5 star review but tonight was the second time we've been left waiting at the door after arriving.  Not something that stops us coming back, just something that doesn't leave a good first impression...

qjeHt5g-S9QxUxRvzrBirg.review_text: First time I came to this restaurant Bob Saget was eating 6 feet away from me.  Last night, our party of seven pretty much ordered every item on the menu. The whole fish was so unique and amazing we ordered two for the table. The fig salad was the most immaculate creation bestowed upon the human palate. Crab stuffed chicken was delicious. The list goes on.  The chef came out and personally greeted our table with a generous glass of champagne for each of us, and a free dessert (we had a 21st birthday).  Amazingly personal service food and drink.

6e_-Q6MZtV0HVb29ETACrQ.review_text: Came here for dine about town SF with my parents and boyfriend this past weekend and we had a total blast! The bottomless mimosa/bloody mary option for 18$ certainly did the trick. We had:  appetizers: duck confit spring rolls (gross) and calamari (excellent) entrees: shaking beef cobb salad (excellent), salmon eggs benny (excellent), chicken wings (good) and the kobe beef burger (good).  Other than the duck rolls, I thought everything was really delicious. The service was excellent because we rarely did see the bottoms of our glasses! Good location with plenty of options for parking and sightseeing.

XMmAJfiKPkXTZGs5QIwycA.review_text: When: February 14, 2011-Valentine's Day Dinner Location: The Embarcadero at Bay St in SF Company: My boyfriend, Christopher planned our date..  Crowd: When we went on Valentine's Day, it seemed like a romantic environment for couples. Vibe: Quiet and Romantic Decor: Unique tables, love the bamboo on the wall.  Cuisine: Asian Fushion Loved: The company of my boyfriend, their lychee martini, Lemon Risotto, and Lobster Pot Pie Hate: Mandatory Prix Fixe Menu for Valentine's Day Service: Great Total: $200  Side note: Was not aware of the prix fixe menu just for Valentine's Day. Was not able to order anything on the regular menu. I was limited to the selections because of my nut allergy. Overall, the food I had was delish!

LaCr6FqS0H8NlsK0hfhENw.review_text: I live in SF and have walked by here many times, but I finally went in on a Friday around 5:45 pm.  Because it was one of those strange SF evenings that was gorgeous and really warm out, Butterfly was relatively empty.  Everyone was hanging out at any restaurant that had an outdoors.  It definitely got busier as the sun went down.  My friend and I sat at the bar.  There's probably 10 bar seats, comfortable with plenty of space and hooks for your purse or bag.  And, it's still a nice view of the outside from the bar.  No TV.   The two bartenders were really cool and chatted with us when it wasn't too busy.  I got a house made bourbon and honey cocktail, it was good and right in the normal SF price range.  They gave us some edamame with it, the flavor was really good.   My friend got the cod, I got the filet.  The cod was really good, light and sweet.  The filet was cooked to my perfect medium rare and came with wasabi mashed potatoes and some veggies.  It was all really good and a perfect size for a good price. Yelp shows this to be located at Broadway, it's not, it's at Bay at Pier 33.  It's a great location, and even though it's close to touristy area, it seems to have a variety of people.  I'm sure it gets busy during prime hours, so a reservation is probably a good idea. I'd like to go back and try happy hour, it's only Tuesday - Thursday.  The menu for it looks good.  Good spot, I'll be back!

U1pkdhtmiFGyKjVdfvY1rg.review_text: i went there on a Sunday night and there was hardly anyone there, which was nice because of the low noise level, which makes for good conversations with friends.  The interior design of the restaurant was beauteous with mirrors hanging on the wall and a million dollar view of the water.  If I had the money, I would covert the place into my own personal loft!  The service was superb because the waitress kept an eye of my libation as she refreshed it each time it was low, of course with my consent.  I wish I had friends like her at social parties.... hehe.   As for the food, it was "asi asi" (ok), I wouldn't come back for the food per se, but definitely for the ambiance.  I ordered the Mesquite Grilled Hawaiian Swordfish.  The presentation of the food was fine, unlike the fish itself.  The fish was a bit tough and dry alone, but when complemented with the corn chowder, it was decent.   Great ambiance but the food was "so so."

NkiuFLP1Z6fcAW30Pmqksw.review_text: Butterfly is a nicely appointed restaurant for the Pier district.  The wait staff was attentive but not intrusive, and the cocktails were perfectly over-poured!  We stopped in for a quick appetizer and went with the duck rolls.  The duck was tender and plentiful throughout. There was a nice blending of fresh and sautéd veg as well. The dipping sauce was amazing! The spice was just right.  The only potential criticism would be too much residual oil from the Fry-O-Lator.

eDM8U8zM1FYS_7X-yBtcdA.review_text: I "LOVE" everything about this place... the location, the views, the décor, the food and especially the staff.  If you go to a place with all of the above and if the staff is not up to par, then that just ruins your dining experience... doesn't it???  We went with a Groupon deal in hand.  Most places snob Groupon holders, but the trick is to slip the Groupon in when the bill comes instead of telling them you have a Groupon right when you get there.  We were only going to have drinks and apps, but after looking at all the yummy entrees on the tables, we were so going to have a full blown meal from drinks to desserts.  Everything on menu sounds so delish, but when you actually see the full blown presentation, your eyes will just bug out!  We always ask for recommendation (just to see if the server knows what he is talking about) and our server was very knowledgeable and his recommendations were all great!  Overall:  We went on a cold rainy night, thinking that the place would not be crowded.  Wrong... the place with packed.  Goes to show that rain or shine this place holds its own!  We really enjoyed our dining experience here and we have another Groupon that we plan to use really soon.  Enjoy!

OGPRBJDRtn6RRo7NSwya3w.review_text: Top notch SF location for dinner. Great view of the bay, better service, and fantastic food. Try it, you'll love it!

q_cYc9EJN1fzV7zwzc6MkA.review_text: I like Butterfly so I bought a Living Social deal for them. Funny enough, we had the same server as 4 years ago (last time we were there) and as usual he was super sweet.   We ordered the duck confit spring rolls (because duck confit always sounds good to me), Kalua Pig with butter lettuce cups, asparagus, and two other things I honestly can't remember the name of and they're not on the online menu. I know one came with fake flowers and was good. But the asparagus was the best part of the meal (yes, the appetizer meal) and the pig in butter lettuce was the next best thing. I could have done without the fancy sounding duck confit spring rolls because they were just deep fried and I couldn't actually taste the meat.  I'll be back again one day, there are just too many yummy places in the city to try.

Desi-Wiz2gwPLWMXP10Bvw.review_text: Been a butterfly fan for 12 years - back before they moved. Tasty fresh food and great service. Patio dining is the best and superKID FRIENDLY!

VK0bI-bc2o_oXMRXczPunQ.review_text: This review is not based on food since I never got the chance to dine here. Why not? Because the hostess was so rude to my hubby that we walked out and vowed never to return.  In most cases I believe in second chances...but not for this place.  Update:   A partner from Butterfly got in touch with me about my issue and offered to comp a future meal. I appreciated his message and offer. It is also my understanding that the hostess and manager that we had dealt with at the time no longer work there. I plan on giving Butterfly another try when I get the chance.

b3dc870WPXagsJLW9zlsgw.review_text: The service was very good. Nice view but kinda of small. The food is average but not many choices. the price is little bit high due to the location. The worst thing is the restroom. They try to be a nice restaurant, but the restroom is horrible.

c97usVB2ScFGUAhZon3IKg.review_text: I like that the the menu items are so different. Recently I had the fig salad with brie...SO delicious!!!  Don't forget to try the BLOOD ORANGE oyster shooters! These are only $1 on happy hour ;)  Garlic noodles are also a must and can be paired on the side of ANY dish.   I can't wait to go back!  TIP: Parking lot across the street ($15). All the meters in the area end at freakin' 11PM!!! grrrrr

VEeR7URUcuoS4aJeHkwQwA.review_text: I still haven't eaten at butterfly, but I hear its lovely. I only came for happy hour drinks which turned out to be a great afternoon. The view of the bay is amazing and the restaurant is a short walk from fisherman's wharf if you'd like to do a little people/tourist watching.   There are a couple of drink specials to choose from but they were all well made and original. There are also appetizer specials which are a plus. but, best was the $1 oyster shooters, a yummy steal. The bartender was very polite and accommodating and I have no complaints. Unfortunately, its not walking distance (well at least not in heels) from the financial district so either hop in a cab or take the cable car.

3Kh9GKnsuhD3jE1H2tG3ew.review_text: I initially searched for parking, fortunately near this restaurant at 10-31-14 9:30pm'sh (parking meter which accepted my debit card, 50 cent per hour,ends 11pm).  As I went to butterfly, door was locked (I guess they had to move all the tables, and prepare).  My friends showed up at 9:40pm'sh, we took some pics outside. Got in 10:10pm'sh with a pass, and bought 2 midori sours $8 each, corona $6, and red wine $11.  Cups were somewhat small, prices moderately expensive. DJ played mostly current music,few old school, it was packed/noisy.  I had to go to the smoking area in the rear, since there were no ins/outs.

FgpBFa5ujm7jGClp7rLHlQ.review_text: The food presentation is excellent but he food itself was not so much.  Very surprising to get dishes with almost no seasoning in a place like this.  Gnocchi was awesome but tiny (think four nickel-sized pieces) and surrounded by bland vegetables.  The tempura mix has no seasoning.  Similarly, the pork chop is delicious but the braised cabbage and beans were not seasoned at all.  And the same with the hanger steak - steak was great (if small) but the sides were tasteless.  There's not even salt and pepper on the tables to rescue the sides.  Bottom line is the featured dishes get lots of attention but the sides are boring.  And, as other reviewers have pointed out, the portions are small.  We noticed many locals getting drinks and appetizers then moving on for dinner. Wonderful decor and location.  Just a little short of expectations especially given the price point ($130 for three of us with no alcohol or dessert).

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: Went twice last year (and wrote a stellar review) and headed back again on Friday afternoon and was seriously disappointed.  First, their happy hour does not apply to Friday afternoons. A bummer, but I guess more my fault for assuming that happy hours should be for every working day.  Secondly, they changed their menu. And literally took out all the best stuff.  The to-die-for mushroom cappuccino got replaced by an onion soup.  No more Shiso Leaves, and no more smoked salmon chips (instead smoked salmon and strawberry rolls? do those even go together?).  Parking is still easy but wouldn't return unless they get their mushroom cappuccino back! Also not worth going outside of happy hour.

ZQmuja5RKhZE7PEWwB1t0Q.review_text: This was a very good restaurant! it gave just enough food so you just full. I highly recommend this restaurant to all ages.

60MruXHMXQZ19UbBtKWpBg.review_text: We found a great LivingSocial deal for Butterfly and was glad to finally try it! We got the Kalua pig lettuce cups, duck confit spring rolls, the fish of the day, and the banana bread pudding. Everything was awesome! I was pleasantly surprised with how flavorful each dish was. The fish was especially surprising, since whole fish are usually more trouble to eat than it's worth. But this one had an excellent meat-to-bone ratio, so two of us were able to split it. We were also really happy with our server, and the manager came by to check in on us several times throughout the meal. Definitely a place worth trying!

ceowV9LSKZEb397yVDqdgA.review_text: I had a restaurant.com voucher for this place and the menu sounded really good so we finally went to use it. We had a reservation for Sat night and then called mid-day on Friday to switch to that night and they were able to accommodate. Well, sort of. When we arrived, we were sat at a table right by the door, so every time someone came in, there was a terrible draft. We were no where near the water view, but instead, staied right at a wood pillar. At that point we almost left, but decided we were already there and practically decided right then that we wouldn't be back. Then onto the service, some of the worst I've had in the city. We were given menus by the hostess immediately, but didn't see our waitress for at least 10 minutes. Then we ordered drinks and they actually came after our appetizer, which was by no means fast. We had ordered 2 appetizers and only one came and I really wanted to try the duck confit springrolls (which are warned to be spicy, they really aren't). They were fine, but definitely not worth waiting for. We also ordered a sushi appetizer. At this point we so didn't want to like the food since everything else had been so bad, but surprise, surprise, the food was actually pretty good. I had scallops, which were okay, not cooked to perfect, but the risotto was good and my husband really liked his (I think he got the steak). Even with a $50 restaurant.com voucher (min spend of $100), we still ended up paying about $120. Overall, it's a great location and food is much better than expected, but the service is just awful and the atmosphere was a bit weird. We also felt bad b/c our waitress was quite pregnant so even when she said she'd pay for the missed appetizer, we just let it be.

P0wENWX4LNg84G-nsqcGFg.review_text: We walked in just 15 minutes ago....it was crowded. Hostess comes up to us. "Can I help you?" My friend says "Yes, we're here to get some drinks." Hostess says, "Yeah. And so are all these other people." And she walks off. What a bitch! We left and we won't be back.

mpC7JUJxP8_J5J0zfcZjPw.review_text: Good location, easy parking, fresh ingredients, new take on traditional dishes, reasonable prices, courteous waiters....  They even have a kids menu for my little ones.  What's not to like?

hkgQip_P93q-nVzOa3LJdA.review_text: We took Mom here for a Sunday brunch in late May.  My overall impression is that Asian fusion executed by Butterfly basically equals Hawaiian.    The staff was super nice.  We enjoyed the decor/style of the place.  We were a party of 6.  They were kind enough to give us the big corner table with a great view.  Funny note:  salt on the table is in diminutive bowl which my Mom tried to pass by push sliding across the table and that didn't quite work out but our waiter was understanding and graciously cleaned up our mess.    I started with a pomegranate spritz, and Tawnya and Mom both had the acai berry lemonade.  We thought these non alcoholic beverages were delicious.  The lemonade was more sweet.  Appetizers: we ordered the fire fried calamari and the kalua pig.  We loved theses and would not let them be cleared from our table until we were done.    Entrees our party ordered:  Shaking beef cobb salad, a duo of white and red chowders, Kobe beef burger, chicken salad club sandwich.   I had the Loco Moco Burger.  Wrong choice for me, and I should have known.  So I don't put that on the restaurant.  Egg and a burger and spam is very very very rich.  If I go back for brunch, I will try poached eggs with smoked salmon, or shaking beef cobb salad.    I'm not really a dessert person, but the dessert was the absolute highlight of our meal.  We ordered and shared the bread pudding and banana lumpia.  We all raved.    Highlights for us were the appetizers and the desserts.  The price was relatively inexpensive.  I almost expect higher prices for the location and decor.  (I hope no one reads that and decides to charge more :)  ).  It's a great location for walking around after your done eating, etc.  Parking was easy as well; we went to the garages across the street.

8oFZEpX00zZS1Dku2aKfcQ.review_text: Went here one random Fri afternoon for Happy Hour with friends.  We were looking for fresh oysters, so we ended up going to this location who had $1 OYSTER SHOTS--best thing ever. Among 3 of us, I think over time we ordered about 30. Perfect mix between the bloody mary mix, garlic, and fresh oyster in a shot glass. I asked for lemon slices to add a small squirt of lemon juice which absolutely solidified the taste.   Butterfly's drinks were also great, wonderful array of wines and beers. In addition they had some fun inventive drinks. HAppy Hours specials were definitely awesome.  We also got classic Calamari, which was good except company I was with was not a fan of the mayo, and the server/restaurant was more than fine with giving us a new batch.  Classy small intimate restaurant, and we actually sat outside on this random sliver of deck that runs along the side of the pier.  Didn't really have a full meal so I can't comment on that; however, I thoroughly enjoyed the apps (specifically the oysters), the atmosphere, and the drinks I had. Great experience.

xtQ7VOogeNwoaogGOvas9g.review_text: The person I made reservations with seemed distracted and I had to repeat myself many times...that should have been a red flag.  The hostess kept our party waiting past our reservations time...  The food was cold and we had slow & generally poor service.  I can't believe they AUTOMATICALLY charge your tip.  They must have had a problem with poor tips...so this seems like an odd strategy.  I'll never go again or let anyone else I know.

LgT0KCtFvqWU-f0chxtWkg.review_text: I took my BF to Butterfly to celebrate our 5 year anniversary.They sat us at a nice little booth facing the water. We actually spotted 2 seals swimming by during out dinner! Anyway, now on to the food/drinks.  Drinks: We ordered the Lychee Martini and the Lotus Potion. The Lotus Potion was amazing! One of the best drinks I have had.   Food: We ordered the calamari appetizer. It was good, but had a little too much sauce on the top. In the future I would ask for it on the side. For the entrees we ordered the sesame crusted ahi tuna- RARE. And the NY strip steak. They were both very tasty. The flavors of the sauces and veggies that accompanied the tuna/steak were perfect.   Dessert:  Warm Chocolate Torte with coffee ice cream- YUMM!  To top off the evening, they gave us complimentary glasses of champagne. The service was excellent. The server made sure everything was perfect for us. I will definitely go back. The prices were a little high, but the location is beautiful.

MYiB84kka40xshkV8_GW4Q.review_text: I came here for dinner last week, and it was amazing! Having lived in the Bay Area for my entire life, I have gone to several restaurants in San Francisco, but this definitely has been my best dining experience so far.  For drinks, we ordered lycheetinis and acai lemonades, definitely the refreshing treat on a hot summer night. Then, we ordered garlic noodles, duck spring rolls, and strawberry and salmon summer rolls. They were absolutely delicious and the portion sizes were perfect. For my entree, I ordered the Peking Duck Crepes, and I tried my friends' Seared Ahi Tuna. Both were extremely flavorful, and I highly recommend them!  And of course, dessert. For the table, we ordered banana lumpia rolls with coconut ice cream, the chocolate tarte with coffee ice cream, the banana bread pudding, and the lychee shaved ice. Absolutely amazing!  To top off an impressive meal, the service was top-notch. The waiters were extremely friendly and helpful in giving us suggestions. The food also came relatively quickly. Additionally, the owner of the restaurant, Rob, came by to ask us how we liked the food and what we thought of the place. Definitely an extremely personable manager.   This was the perfect conclusion to a day well spent in San Francisco. I will be back!

dOC79P6DASlD9CECLStgpg.review_text: Love this place. The drinks are sexy, the food is exotic, and the vibe is hip.  i have been here several times since they opened and always bring only my best of friends to enjoy such a divine place.  The last time I was here I walked miles and miles with my girlfriend to get here since we were spending a few days in the city only to find out they had just stopped serving entree's as soon as we walked in.  They were open, but have specific times for appetizers/drinks vs full menu.  We were still going to find a place at the bar and stick around but the owner happen to be at the front and made sure a table was set for us and a full menu was available....5 STARS just for that extra customer service.  As soon as Rob welcomed us and greeted us, we were taken to a cozy table with a view of cruise ships and sea otters, PERFECT.  There is a DJ booth in the middle of the restaurant for late night transitions from restaurant to nightclub, I presume.  I go here for the food, the ambiance, the waterfront view, decor, and so far it has not been crowded so I have easily found a table.  Otherwise, please reserve ahead of time since I am sure this place can be busy.  I had a birthday here years ago and remember great drinks and lots of late night dancing.  Other times I come here for long conversations with good friends and world class entree's. To the owner, Rob Lam, you made our day and filled our belly's the day before the Nike Marathon! Thank you

pPGUKs9rP1eMdwhnzJhUkg.review_text: My girlfriend and I choose this restaurant because we were waiting for our time slot on the Alcatraz ferry.  We did not know what to expect, but some other people were eating take out near us and it looked dripping good.  They sat us in a booth by the water but you face the other tables.  After we sat, we noticed a small line forming at the hostess stand and felt comfortable with our decision.  I ordered a Newcastle and my girlfriend got a mimosa.  Since it was lunch, I order the Kobe Beef Burger and a Caesar Salad while my girlfriend ordered a sashimi salad dish.  We were both very happy with the meal and the experience.

HmLITYSf4KRoojRyckyGbw.review_text: Went for lunch this past Friday. Had the Kobe beef burger and it arrived with 15 minutes of me sitting down. It was one of the best burgers I've ever had!!

PJhX_wdn6CTWuPS5jhqsTQ.review_text: Service was incredible, and the other patrons were incredible.....But.... I don't feel for the hype or for what I was served that the prices was justifiable or something I would do again.  I had the butter lettuce cups and the scallops.  Both were good, but not worth the price.  My friend got the pork chop, which was large enough to feed two people and absolutely exquisite.  I saw a couple next to us who got the shangai noodle bowl and they said they were incredible and plenty of them.  So, I guess just be aware of what you order, as some of the dishes play more off the location and the name of the place than the quality and quantity.

ZSqMkleQk2l1_KRhSlYnfA.review_text: We stopped in here to get drinks and decided to eat dinner once we saw the menu.  It was a quite night during the week so we easily got a window-side table. We ordered the Calamari starter and the Cowboy Steak to share.   First, the Calamari... oh my goodness... the goodness.  It was served almost as a salad and it was quite possibly one of the best calamari dishes we have ever tasted. We both loved it, we almost ordered a second. The main, Cowboy Steak.  Very intimidating looking on it's iron skillet when it is brought table-side.  It's a huge ribeye on top of veggies and chorizo- and it is sizzlin.  Ok, I grew up in steak country so I don't often order steaks out here as they are usually overpriced for what you get.  But this steak is so frickin good we both ate the fatty pieces too.  My bf apologized to me as a piece he had cut for me had a fair amount of fat on it, and I said "It's ok, even the fat is delicious." sheepishly.  He looked at me from over his plate and said "I know, it's really good."  We saw a whole fish go out of the kitchen and it looked amazing, I might try it next time.  It is Asian/California fusion that I would say is heavier on the California than Asian- so for me that's great.  Asian cuisine is usually my least sought out dining experience. I also had the bloody Mary served Animal style- it had this amazing piece of candied bacon in it. I can't say it was the right compliment for my dinner, but I ordered it with no recommendation. The room is large and comfortable and the server we had that evening was very knowledgeable without being stuffy or overly showy. Oh, yeah.  And we got the banana bread pudding to go.  It was delicious at home with the coconut ice cream!   If you are near the wharf or Embarcadero, definitely check this place out. I will be back.
